text: This Vitamin C includes bioflavonoids and rose hips.  Bioflavonoids are polyphenolic compounds found in plants. They are widely used in Europe to treat diseases of the blood vessels and lymph system, including hemorrhoids , chronic venous insufficiency , leg ulcers, easy bruising , nosebleeds , and lymphedema following breast cancer surgery.  Although it's been claimed that combining Vitamin C with bioflavonoids increases the vitamin's bioavailability, the clinincal studies don't offer much support for this.  Rose hips are the fruit of the rose plant. Although rose hips are high in Vitamin C, much of that is lost when it's processed and added to a supplement.  Rose hip powders may work with Vitamin C supplements to reduce the symptoms of arthritis. Compounds in rose hips called galactolipids may help to prevent cartilage breakdown in your joints. The benefits of rose hips in arthritis may also be linked with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects of rose hip flavonoids and polyphenols, according to a 2011 study published in "Complementary and Alternative Medicine."While these added ingredients may or may not offer additional benefits--my view is that they certainly don't hurt--this product, unlike most synthetic Vitamin C, also is not made with genetically engineered ingredients, is made in Scotland rather than China if that matters to you, and is reasonably priced when compared to almost any form of Vitamin C.  So all in all, it's a good deal

This first aid kit seems at first blush to be a great item to have around.  "78 pieces"--wow, that's a lot, isn't it?  Not really.  Band-aids account for almost half of that, and they're of marginal quality (you may not realize that poor quality band-aids exist until you try these). Throw in some antiseptic wipes and a few gauze pads and you're almost there.  The tweezers are plastic and won't be of much use to remove a splinter.  The scissors, while metal, are the cheapest possible.  There are a lot of first aid kits on Amazon alone, so I'd shop around, or just find a container and fill it with items yourself.

I'm finding this Samsung Scanner-Copier-Fax adequate, but not exceptional.  It handles every task I've given it well enough, and although the set-up instructions aren't clear and the touch screen could also be more intuitive, it does get the jobs done pretty well.  However, I have two different Epson inkjet printers that both cost much less than the Samsung and will do almost everything the Samsung does, and one of them does more, since it will print double-sided copies while the Samsung, oddly, does not.  The quality of photo printing is noticeably better with the inkjets.  The cost of toner cartridges for the Samsung is quite high, and although they last longer than the inkjet cartridges the cost per page is higher.  The Samsung does have an eco setting to conserve toner.It's often said that the biggest advantage of any laser printer over inkjets is speed, if you do a lot of black and white text printing and don't need high-quality photos.  However, these days inkjets can print almost as many pages per minute as the Samsung (19 ppm).  Lasers also can be more durable than inkjets, so for an office, this might be a good choice.  But for lighter duty, and especially where cost is a factor, I'd look carefully at inkjets.

Although I live in a small home without a lot of obvious obstructions to my wi-fi signal from my router, there are dead zones.  I hooked up this Netgear range extender, which was a simple task that took about fifteen minutes, and I now have a strong signal everywhere in my house and in my yard.  I'm pleased.

Like most of the other reviewers I received this device through the Amazon Vine program and there hasn't been enough time to fully test it before my initial review is due, so I'll have to follow up later.  But I've used it three times since receiving it and have noticed the hair is growing back more slowly.As others have noted, and as is described on the box, this device is designed for use only by a limited number of people--blonds, red-heads, African-Americans, anyone with a dark complexion, anyone with freckles--in short, anyone who doesn't have relatively pale skin and dark hair, shouldn't use it and it likely won't work for them.  The reason is simple.  The device works on the principle that the intense light it emits will be absorbed by dark material, just as a black object will absorb more heat from sunlight than a white object.  To use the device, you shave your hair first, and the heat from the light is absorbed by the dark roots.  Over time with repeated use, the hair root will die (or so it is claimed).  If your hair is light, not enough absorption, and if your skin is dark, your skin will absorb it instead.  For the same reason, even if you have pale skin and dark hair you can't use it on moles.That said, in my preliminary experience it seems to be doing what it claims.  You place the unit on your skin, it emits a flash of bright light, you may feel a sensation (there are 5 levels of intensity, and you'll feel more if you use the higher levels), and then you move to the next area of your skin.  Repeat after a couple of weeks.  Over time you supposedly won't have to use it as frequently, and in theory, eventually the hair won't grow back.  I'm not there yet, but as I said, hair growth has slowed.The burst of light is quite bright, and if you look directly at it you'll have an afterimage and possibly damage your retinas, so you really should invest in some good safety glasses.

This Frigidaire a/c is about as easy (or difficult) to install into a window as most units.  It requires about 23" horizontal clearance, or maybe a little less, and if your window is wider than that, it comes with louvers to fill the excess space as well as brackets and other installation hardware to secure it in the window.  (It weighs over 60 pounds, so better get a little help to hoist it into place unless you've got a strong back.)  It's surprisingly quiet, at least on low speed, and it turns itself off when the room hits the selected temperature, so unless the room is getting a lot of sun, the unit will do nothing quite a bit, which is great for keeping costs down.  The temperature sensor is on the remote, so you can place the remote where you want it, and the unit will keep cooling until the temperature is reached wherever the remote is, rather than right next to the unit. (Unless, of course, you leave the remote right next to the unit.)  The unit is supposed to keep a 550 sq. ft. room cool, but it works well in the space I've got which is closer to 700 sq. ft.; it just has to work a little harder.

There's one thing this stroller isn't good for, and that, oddly enough, is jogging.  It's not designed for it (for that you need the Summit X3 model), so the brand name is confusing.  That aside, it does just about anything else you'd want a stroller to do, and it does it well.It has to be assembled, but that's relatively easy.  The straps are a little tricky to install correctly and require some patience, but the wheels, the seat, the sun shade all just snap in place.The design is extremely versatile.  The seat reclines at different angles.  The canopy adjusts to different angles.  The seat can be placed to allow you to look at your child, or to allow the child to face where you're going.  The handlebar and foot well are adjustable.  If you want to purchase additional items you can add another whole seat (which can be mounted facing either direction),a bassinet, cup holders, bags, canopies, and so on.  Yes, the cost of the base stroller is high, and adding options makes it even higher, but this stroller will last a long time--it's designed to hold kids up to 45 pounds (per seat), which should take you through the first four years and can be passed on or sold.The fabric is durable and wipes clean easily.The stroller maneuvers smoothly in all directions, without any rickety jiggling.  If you're petite you may find folding it a little more difficult than others might, since you have to reach mechanisms on both sides of the stroller at the same time as you pull, but it's very doable, and it folds up flat if you remove the seat.

As so many other reviews have noted, these so-called coffee mugs are really best used for soup or cereal, unless you're an avid cafe au lait drinker.  I use mine for soup and I like them a lot.  They're solid, attractive, well-made (no obvious flaws), and hold a full serving of soup, which I can comfortably sip wherever I happen to be instead of having to eat it with a spoon.  A little harder to store than stackable bowls, but you don't have to carefully avoid spilling soup when you carry it.  Makes a good gift, too.

This is a short (6 feet long) and narrow (1 foot wide) putting mat that comes with two balls.  The cup holds only two balls, and the bulge across the back of the mat keeps missed balls sitting near the cup and blocks incoming putts, so you'll be doing a lot of walking back and forth to retrieve the balls.  It's adequate, but just barely. More of a novelty or casual gift than something really useful for practicing your putting.

I hate to seem to be shilling for a laundry detergent, particularly since I received this bottle for free (although if you check my other reviews you'll see that's no guarantee of a positive review), but in my experience using many different detergents, including most of the big brand names and a number of the supposedly more environmentally friendly ones, Tide cleans the best.  Simple as that.  It generally costs more, but in this case, you do get what you pay for.  As for this particular version of Tide, I can't honestly say it's any different from the others in terms of cleaning power--I usually wash in cold water, and any of the Tide products do a good job.  For some reason many of the reviews on this page discuss the Tide with Febreeze, but that's not this product, and the scent of this one is typical of laundry detergents.  I prefer as little scent as possible, but this one's not offensive.

I love these things! I can never use ice in my sodas because I hate how they get all watery and lose their bubbles but with these cubes you get a cold drink that is still fizzy. The trays also feel really durable, which is probably why they give you a lifetime guarantee on these. The silicone also makes it so much easier to get the cubes out without shattering them into a thousand pieces. Adding to all this, it just looks so cool to have a cube this big in your drink, it's guaranteed to get some comments from your guests. I received a free sample in exchange for my honest review.

These look and feel great, I just wish they would fit me a little better. I wear a size 6/6.5 shoe and I just can’t get it to fit right. It’s too loose on my big toe and then my last 3 toes are pretty close together and my pinky toe is pretty much nonexistent it’s so small, so they last hole covers my toe almost completely. I thought I could use these for manicures. I love doing my nails and I do my toes less often just because I have a harder time and the foam toe separators don’t work for me. I can make it work though if I mess with it and make sure it’s pushed all the way back but I’m not sure I’ll want to deal with that either just because I have back/shoulder issues and fidgeting with it trying to push it further back causes some pain. I will still give the Vive toe gel separators 4 stars because they are great quality and would work wonderfully if my toes were just a tad longer. A free sample was given to me in exchange for my honest review.

I like this set a lot! There are so many useful colors for your eyes and lips and they apply so smoothly. You can definitely get creative with a set like this and I’m sure you can use some of the lovely pinks on your cheeks as well; they are so creamy they will blend nicely. I’ve used these great chunky sticks so far on my lips and eyes. I didn't have any issues with tugging or pulling; these apply really well, feel silky smooth and are very pigmented too. I added some pictures with swatches of all the colors on my arm but it really doesn't do them justice, you can get an idea for the colors but some of the eye shadow sticks have a really pretty shimmer that you can't really see in the pictures either. A sample was given to me in exchange for my honest review.

I absolutely love these types of pillows! I had surgery on my lower back a couple years ago and I still have some pain, especially if I sit too long. I try to get out of my chair often throughout the day but I still need a little more help to be comfortable. I keep this orthopedic memory foam seat cushion in my office chair and it really has made a difference in how long I can handle staying seated and I actually don’t wiggle around as much so I’m definitely more comfortable. Anyone with back pain knows how frustrating it is to deal with, all these little things you do to deal with the pain will add up to make a difference in your comfort level. I’d recommend this pillow to anyone with low back pain.

These gloves are so useful! My husband and I love to cook and we like to barbecue or use our cast iron pan and these gloves make it so much easier to handle these things. With an oven mitt I have a hard time grabbing something heavier, so these are definitely replacing my old mitt. I also like that they are long so it protects more of my arm, we got the large/x-large and they are very big on me but I still have good control and heat protection and it fits my husband fine. I see him getting a lot of use from these this coming summer! I was given this product in exchange for an honest review.

I am in love with this stuff! The smell is so nice, light and citrusy. I love vitamin c serums and I always use one. I haven’t found too many that I like and right now I was using Ole Henrikson’s version. There is always something wrong though, either the smell is unpleasant or it leaves my skin feeling tacky or too wet, well you get the point, I’m picky. This one has honestly been amazing; I have no issues with it. It smells amazing, it absorbs well, and it feels smooth and creamy. I actually like the fact that it’s a little creamier than most serums out there, makes it easier to apply and it feels nice on my skin. My skin is so soft right after I apply it. I’m looking forward to seeing the long term effects of this serum.One thing I like about the formula is that I was reading about Qsomes that is a patented ingredient for them and it helps more active ingredients absorb into your skin. I also use a Clarisonic brush to wash my face which is supposed to help your skincare products absorb better as well so I’m hoping for a great result with the combo! This product was given to me in exchange for an honest review.

I absolutely love this set! I had surgery on my back in 2012 and I've been keeping up with my physical therapy, trying to get my core stronger, keep it strong and also be sure not to gain any weight since that could impact my back a lot. I had a band that my physical trainer gave to me but it was just a light one so I went looking for a band set like this. I like this style of band so that I can wrap it on my ankles or my wrists. I love that they give you 4 too, all color coded and clearly marked from light to x-heavy. I definitely recommend this set! Great for beginners too since you have the light one included and when you progress you can switch. These are also nice because they are latex free and a little wider than other bands I've tried, really gives me a good work out without me having to lift weights.Couple of exercises I want to recommend to the ladies; put one of the bands around your ankles (hold something for balance if you need to) stand straight, you will keep one foot on the ground and the other foot you will lift to the side, kind of like a side kick I guess but you stand still and only your leg lifts off the ground to the side. Another great one is the when you're down on all 4's you put the band around your knees/right under your knees and then do those side leg lifts. That is already a popular exercise but when it starts getting too easy and you feel like you can be on all 4's for hours, add the resistance band and you'll have an awesome butt exercise.  These are a great combo for your butt and outer thighs.

I absolutely love this backseat organizer! I have a Honda accord and there isn't a ton of space in the back for everyone to safely store their things and still be able to reach them when they need to. We drive to Florida a lot to visit my parents and it’s been great having this in the back for the tablet, snacks and our Sudoku books etc. I definitely need to get another one for the other seat at some point, this product was given to me in exchange for an unbiased review and I definitely recommend it.  My favorite part is the fact that you can put your tablet in the top slot with the clear cover, definitely cheaper than getting built in tablets/tv’s that would need to  be taken out and updated at some point.

I really am liking this stuff, I was a little nervous because the smell was a bit chemically and my skin is sensitive but I tried it on my wrist and it was fine. Then when I tried it on my face it was ok too, I felt some tingling and that's it, no burning or anything more serious. I have to tell you though I was scared and left it on for maybe 30 seconds and rinsed it off, I couldn't believe it make a difference in that short of a time. I was going to build up to 1min. but I just went for it the next time I used the pads which was like 3 days later since I had used it for such a short time before. It's really making a difference with my skin, I have dry flakey skin and this just smooths all my dry patches away. Makes my skin new again, that's what it feels like. I'd definitely recommend trying this!

First off I want to say that this product works like a charm. I'm a believer ever since I felt the extra energy it gave me and the increase in B12 levels. Secondly, I was extremely impressed with the customer service. I had a couple of questions before I ordered and they were very prompt about replying and are extremely helpful, as I assume they would be for anything! Will be buying again once I run out.

I’ve been using this fantabulous garlic press for a couple weeks now and it’s (you guessed it) fantabulous! My family loves garlic, and no they won’t settle for the premade garlic spices, it has to be fresh, which is understandable because it does give a better flavor. I’ve wanted one of these for a while too, not sure why it took me so long to get one! This garlic press is very good quality and you can tell since they back their product with a lifetime guarantee. It’s dishwasher safe and easy to clean, I haven’t needed to put it in my dishwasher, I just rinse it after I’m done using it, nice and simple. It also comes with a garlic peeler which I never thought I’d need but it does make it easier and keeps my fingers from smelling like garlic which is a nice bonus! I definitely recommend this garlic press! A free sample was given to me for an honest review.

I definitely found this book to be helpful. I have some minor knee issues from an old snowboarding injury and then exacerbated in soccer over the years. Well now I can’t do either of those anymore but I would like to reach that point again if possible. I need to strengthen my knees and keep them moving so I don’t stiffen up. It’s a vicious cycle, if you don’t exercise and stretch it will get worse but if you do then you’re in pain anyway. At least with the 2nd option you’re doing something to help get rid of the pain in the long run or at least lessen it. I really like how this book shows you helpful exercises but also explains why they work which I always read and find useful. This way I can identify the exercises that would help me most and I can keep doing those more often than the others.  I definitely recommend this book to anyone suffering with knee arthritis or other knee problems.

I got this as a gift for one of my friends who plays the Ukulele. He’s really good, he sings while he plays to us and over St. Patty’s weekend his strap broke and he lost some picks.  I felt bad and so I wanted to find him something to replace those items. I was looking for the items separately when I stumbled upon this ukulele kit that has the picks and strap I wanted to replace for him and on top of that it has hanger accessories so that he can keep it safe if he’s not playing it or holding it. Plus it was cheaper than buying everything separately too so that’s awesome! I gave it to him already and he said the picks are really great quality and he’s excited to have the hanger accessories too.

I absolutely love oils for my face, hands, elbows and feet. I mostly use argon oil from Josie Maran but it’s expensive and I’ve been searching for something to take its place. There are so many things to choose from though and I ended up giving this one a shot because of the ingredients, the fact that it’s made in the U.S., and it’s anti-aging! I’m turning 28 this April and I think it’s time to start with the anti-aging potions and lotions! I have always loved Vitamin C in my serums and oils and this one has 20% so it’s really working well to brighten my skin. I have pale dry skin so it’s easy for it to look dull and so I’ve always used a vitamin c serum to help with that and it really works so I’m thrilled that this contains so much and has such a potent version of Vitamin C. Also, seems like this oil was made for me because I have very dry skin, my cheeks flake and if I wear make-up it literally outlines all the flakes on my cheeks and forehead. So I use my Clarisonic in the morning, then put my oil and moisturizer on, let that sink in and then I can do my make up without looking like a cracked porcelain doll. This will be my skin saver! I definitely recommend trying it.

As a favorite Aunt, I’m always looking for something to do with them that doesn't involve the usual of taking them out to eat or the movies etc. I wanted to offer them something more substantial. I was lucky and grew up with the Harry Potter novels, I always loved to read and I want my family to share that love with me. I always read to them when they were young and now that they are getting older (10 (boy) and 12(girl)) I haven’t really been reading to them anymore. Well thankfully this book has changed that for us! I was looking for a good young adult novel that would be full of adventure and excitement to keep their attention. They ended up loving this book; we just finished it together last night when I babysat for my sister. I read it to them over time and wouldn't let them read it on their own just to make it more exciting for them. I personally love books like this so it was fun to read it with them, I hope to see more from this author soon, for now I’ll read them the Maze Runner series and hope they like it. I definitely recommend this book to young adults!

I absolutely love this professional resistance band set! I had back surgery in 2012 and I just really need to keep up with my physical therapy, get my core stronger, then keep it strong and also be sure not to gain any weight since that could impact my pain level significantly. I had a resistance band that my physical therapist gave me but it was just a light one so I went looking for a band set like this. I like this style of band so that I can keep it steady in my hand and have a better grip in general.  I love that they give you 5 too; all color coded and clearly marked from 2 to 20 pounds of resistance. I definitely recommend this set! Great for beginners too since you have the light one included and when you progress you can switch as needed until you’re toned & sexy!
Great look! Keeps business cards in tact. Highly recommend to purchase.

My husband absolutely loves this bag, it's a durable canvas bag with leather straps and brass closures for accent. It looks very nice and stylish. It has room for a laptop and some notebooks etc., a couple pockets on the side as well as a zipper pocket in the main pocket, and 2 more pockets under the main flap. I love that you get to have the belt buckle closure look without the hassle of actually having to take it apart when you need something. Instead, it's all connected with a magnetic closure, you'll see in the pictures I took. A free sample was provided to me in exchange for an honest review.

Material is great. The color is as expected. Not see through but nice and thin and comfy. I recommend it!! Cute skirt. It is comfortable, stretchy and goes great with so many outfits. It is so CUTE. It fits for the price. Great!

I am hesitant to purchase clothing online because of the inability to try anything. But I like the dress, it's pretty good quality and looks nice. Very elegant and a lovely dress. I like the feel of the chiffon, it feels so comfy and airy! Every time I wore it, the dress received sincere compliments.
Everything that you might need. Love the extender that allows you to bend through corners, that was the main tool that made me choose this kit over all the others, it's super handy.
Gets the job done. Seems sturdy enough to last some years.

Good gloves, very warm, the only issue is that you can't really move your hands when you have them on. The gloves are too thick to be able to do anything with them on.The conductive thread on the finger tips works fine.

This doesn't work, I live in Chicago and everyone tracks in a bunch of snow/salt/wetness and this doesn't soak very well. I followed the directions and washed it in cold water without soap before we used it but it's just a regular rug. Don't waste your money on this and get yourself a prettier rug, it will do the same thing.

perfect cookies everytime :) nothing else to say! My family loves my homemade chocolate chip cookies and I use this A LOT, it really does not ware. It hasn't become discolored or anything like that, looks brand new still. I've had this for a few months now and it's still in perfect condition.

I really loved this jacket, I just wish it fit my dog better. It zipped up but it was tight on his chest and I can't really use just this in Chicago for him because he barely has fur on his belly, so I tried using his knit sweater under the jacket but it was just too tight. The medium was almost perfect so I think the large would be too big, I don't want to deal with the back and forth shipping so I will just have to find another jacket for him that looks like this. Bummer for us, definitely recommend it for everyone else :)

Brainergy-X has been a life saver for me. I am really sensitive to caffeine and most products out there that promise an increase focus and an energy boost are filled with caffeine. I don’t even drink coffee because of how sensitive I am to it, it makes me shake. Thankfully this only has 100mg of caffeine and when I take one in the morning, I’m good for the day. I don’t take more than that and I never experience any crashes or anything like that. It helps me get moving in the morning since I have never been a morning person and not being able to drink coffee didn’t help either. I feel more productive at work when I take one of these supplements in the morning it keeps me alert and focused; I just feel awake and ready to take on any task my boss throws at me! It doesn’t make me feel jittery or sick to my stomach at all which is a problem I’ve had with other brands. Brainergy-X supplements just make me feel like I’m running at 100% instead of around 70% when you’re beaten down by all the stress in your life that just leaves you in a fog. I just feel like I can control what I WANT to focus on better, instead of letting the stress of life, kids, bills etc. take control because they are always in the back of my mind.Not only are these good for the energy boost and increased mental focus they are actually vitamins aimed at benefiting your brain. This is actually what sold me on these, I have dementia in my family and I worry that I’m going to develop it in the future. The ingredients in Brainergy-X are all natural and the product is made in the U.S which is great. All the ingredients are intended to increase your performance in daily life. I love that not only do these supplements have ingredients like Ginkgo Biloba and L-Tyrosine that play a big role in cognitive performance and memory function, but it also has ingredients that work and benefit from each other like the caffeine and the L-Theanine that improve your alertness obviously but it also works to reduce your tiredness, so you’re not just masking the tiredness with way too much caffeine, you’re actually relieving it. These supplements also have a nice impact on physical fitness if you’re so inclined after work or before work when you take one of these.

This MyBesty Callus Remover is great. My feet get really dry in the winter, no matter what I do it seems like too. I use lotion and oils sometimes with socks over the moisture treatment. I think it helps but I still need a little extra help in the winter and this little battery operated wonder helps me out a lot. My feet are nice and soft, and I don’t have to spend money going to a salon for a pedicure. I also love that I don’t have to do any manual labor to have soft feet! No scrubbing or pressure needed when using this compared to a pumice stone. That’s especially nice for me because I have some back/shoulder problems. I definitely recommend this callus remover.

This is a great thermometer; it’s compact, light, easy to use and I like the design. All you need to do is lift the ear a little bit with one hand and with the other just put the thermometer in, then you wait for the beep and read your temperature. I was able to do it to myself and to my husband very easily. I don’t have kids so I can’t really say on that but it seems like it would do fine for children as well based on my experience and reading other reviews. I also did a series of tests with the thermometer and all of the readings were in a .1 Fahrenheit margin, so that goes to show how accurate it is. I think people are having accuracy issues because they are not lifting the ear, the infrared thermometer might not work properly if you don’t do this. The only downside to this is that you have to wait for it to reset to do another test but it’s not very long so it’s not that big of a deal. I like this a lot better than any of the random thermometers we got at Walgreens, they always seem to break and aren't accurate. I definitely recommend this thermometer.

I got these Testosterone Booster Supplements for my husband hoping it would help him out after he told me he was feeling sluggish and just had less motivation in general even though he was still exercising regularly. He has vitamins and all that but I wanted to branch out and find something maybe strictly for men that would help him more. I’m glad I found this, I was happy to see it was made in the United States and that they have money back guarantee. My husband says he’s been feeling great, like a teenage version of himself. We definitely recommend this!

I received these goji berries for free in exchange for a review. I cannot give this product 5 stars or give it a high recommendation and here's why:While these goji berries have a somewhat pleasing, if more neutral flavor, and they work decently in baked goods, I have a lot of reservations about this product's origins and the honesty of its nutritional labeling.-The packaging of this product advertises that it is packed with vitamin A and C, yet the nutrition label says it contains 0% vitamin A and C. This calls into question the rest of the claims.-It is advertised as being "Packaged in USA", but does not state the country of origin. Nutrition regulations for food products require that country of origin is clearly labeled. I assume these goji berries are sourced from China. There is nothing necessarily wrong with a product sourced in China, as quality can vary from factory to factory, but food very much requires this labeling.-These are not legitimately USDA certified and do not have any labeling to indicate authentic USDA certification.  Morning Pep is not listed in USDA's searchable list of companies that have USDA certification-- they are misrepresenting that they have USDA certification (this is highly illegal and misleading to consumers, subject to massive fines).  [...]-The brand/packaging company "Morning Pep" is a business that only recently registered in the state of New York on June 2014. It's less than one year old. The business address that was registered with the NY Dept of State - Division of Corporations is a residential apartment complex. "MORNING PEP CORP, 382 WILLOUGHBY AVE APT 5F, BROOKLYN, NEW YORK, 11205" . Morning Pep does not list any physical location in their contact form on their website and there is no associated business in Nyack, NY, where they claim they operate out of. Take from this what you will.For these reasons, I am very skeptical and would not bet my health on this food product. Please read up on people's experiences consuming goji berries from questionable sources and then make your decision (may cause gastrointestinal discomfort). Unless I see something to prove that this product has been inspected, I can't confidently recommend this.UPDATE:  They've taken to photoshopping the product photo on the Amazon listing.  The actual product will have a label that says otherwise.  Additionally, they still don't have actual USDA approval and are falsifying their claim of being USDA organic.

My favorite aspect of these bottles is the easy to use sealing cap.  I was having problems of fruit flies getting into my vinegar and the incorporated cap is a godsend.  Rather than having removable caps that can be lost, the seal is incorporated into the spigot, with a rugged seal that makes it easy to tell that the bottle has been fully closed.  This is also protect me against my cats who occasionally knock bottles over.  I'll definitely be ordering a few more of these.

I've owned quite a few scales in my time, as my weight and dedication to exercise fluctates here and there.  I received this scale to evaluate and I am quite pleased with it.  I've had other digital scales where my weight would change every time I stepped on it-- not with this one.  The scale is very ruggedly built, so there's no chance of it tipping over.  The readout is easy to see and while it lacks some fancier functions like BMI, the smart function of remembering your past weights is a godsend.  I'm a sucker for metrics and being able to see my progression is a fantastic motivator to keep at it.  Very pleased with the scale and it's minimalistic appearance.

This does a great job at juicing most regular sized lemons and limes.  For larger lemons, I did have to cut them into sizes smaller than halves, but the squeezer it its job well.  You can get a good amount of leverage with this squeezer.  I received this squeezer to evaluate and I couldn't be more pleased with it.

The newest family addition can't keep her hands off of this.  I received this to evaluate and I can say it's a great product.  Before letting the baby play with and use this, I tested the strength of the stitching and there's no chance of any of it coming apart and creating a choking hazard.It has a very cute appearance and the pacifier is easily detached so it can be easily washed once it inevitably gets slobbered on.A great, cute way to keep track of a pacifier!  Other pacifiers can easily be swapped in.  This comes nicely packaged in a cute bag, so it makes for a great gift bag stuffer.

I've been running WD Green drives for many years, changing models out of production every 3 years.  I've never experienced a single failure out of the 30 or so WD Green drives that I've purchased.  My most recent WD Green 4TB drive is working great.  I ran full HDD health scans on this drive right out of the box, and after I had filled the drive to capacity with random data a few times to ensure the reliability-- no issues with data or speed after putting it through the initial torture tests.I always feel that it's necessary to full test out a hard drive before putting it into production-- run a full diagnostic scan while empty, then another after completely filling it with data.  Repeat this one more time and you're generally assured that you will not run into any surprise bad sectors as you use the drive.

Chopsticks are an underrated kitchen essential.  Compared with tongs, long chopsticks are better for quickly and precisely flipping smaller items on a somewhat crowded pan.  They'll keep you hands and arms out of harm's way when deep frying something and are extremely easy to clean.  I prefer chopsticks when mixing salads and portioning out pasta.These do exactly what I want them to and seem like they'll last a good while, so long as they are cleaned after use, like most kitchen tools.

These are good quality shitake mushrooms.  Very clean and flavorful, with no dirt or detritus, which is a problem with some of the other unbranded ones available here.  I enjoy using these to make dashi stocks, and then slicing the caps thinly, so that they can be used as a bibimbap topping.  The caps are a little on the smaller side, but the flavor is still very good, with a very meaty texture that one expects from shitake.Only knocking off a star due to the smaller cap sizes and price.  These are about $12.50 for 8oz ($1.56/oz), which is a little more expensive than Costco's 6oz containers of sliced shitake, with are $7.50 for 6oz ($1.25/oz).  Prices may change, so keep an eye out; these are still a good value.

This is an art book that coincides with a unique Japanese ukiyo-e exhibit that is running until June 7th, 2015 at the Japan Society gallery, in Manhattan, NY. Perfect for cat lovers and fans of Japanese wood block prints (ukiyo-e) or Japanese culture, this art book has cat influenced selections dating from 17th to 20th century Japan. The art selections highlight how cats' movements, affections, and whimsical actions have been memorialized and anthropomorphized for hundreds of years. This is a very unique art book that would make a fantastic gift for any cat lover, or lover of Japanese culture.

This is a fantastic, high quality 19V 4.74A charger. The compact design is incredibly portable and this thankfully uses a standard 2.5mm barrel plug, meaning you can use it for many other 19V devices, like non-Asus laptops. I am very impressed with the efficiency of this AC adapter's design, as despite the small size, the adapter does not get very warm, even under full load. A lot of the inexpensive AC bricks you find on ebay and elsewhere tend to get very warm. Spend the money and get a quality adapter to avoid fire risks/damage to your device.I use this adapter for other laptops that I have that require a 19V source and have the standard 2.5mm barrel plug (5.5mm outer diameter, 2.5mm inner diameter).This AC adapter is good for up to 90W use (19V * 4.74A = 90.06W). To make sure that your laptop is compatible, make sure to read the fine print electrical AC input sticker on the back of your device, it MUST be 19V, and draw no more than 3.42A (althought I suspect this adapter is good for up to 95W for short periods). It is OK to use a higher watt adapter on a lower watt device (ie: 19V 2.1A 40W laptop)

Valkyria Chronicles is an overlooked gem of the PS3 era.  It is an extremely addictive turn based strategy game with JRPG/anime themes.  The story is strong, and while there are some points where cutesy "moe" style anime  fanservice creeps in, it is kept to a relative minimum.  If you enjoy turn based strategy like XCOM and are ok with anime, you will definitely enjoy this game.  Character and squad customization keeps the game fresh and allows for some replayability and challenge levels.Valkyria Chronicles is a solid title to port, due to the turn based nature of the game.  While it is not a perfect port and some menu interfaces don't work as well as they should, the actual gameplay- which is the title's strongest point- is not affected.I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys turn based strategy, even those who aren't fans of anime.  The gameplay of Valkyria Chronicles is just that fun and addicting.  Hopefully, if this PC port does well, other titles in the franchise will be released on PC.

A bit saltier than I am accustomed to and many of the cans had very loosely packed anchovies.  Most of the product's weight is in olive oil.  While the taste of the anchovy is good and worked great with the Italian recipes I used them for, I am disappointed at how little anchovy was in the tin-- it is mostly oil with some anchovy mush and not enough firm anchovies.  When preparing anchovies I prefer to have small filets with firmer texture, which leaves me the option of being able to chop up or cook it down into a smooth texture, like for bagna cauda.
Very rugged adapter plate had everything I needed to adopt an older LCD TV I had to a VESA 100 wall mount.  Lots of included hardware and spacers to ensure a proper fit and install!

After hearing this play on KCRW / NPR a few times, I knew I had to look into this group a little more.  Duvan (dove) features hauntingly infectious melodies and lovely, smoky vocals by Amanda Bergmann.  There are hints of Buckhingam Nicks and Sigur Ros.  This track is strong after repeated listenings, as the beautiful highs and lows illicit feelings of a windswept cityscape (which is reflected in their music video).  This is a real gem- released at the end of 2014- and I feel their upcoming 2015 studio album release, Sky City, will be quite strong, based on the strength of this track.

I received a set of these for evaluation purposes and have been very happy with them.  The lighting is adequate and works well as an outdoor accent.  After I buy another set of these, I will be using them to accent my enclosed apartment patio.  These are well protected from the elements and the design is such that no drilling for wiring is required, allowing me to remove them if I move to a new place.

This digital magnifier is very clunky to use, with the controls being unintuitive and imprecise.  While not an expensive magnifier, I was expecting higher quality from the maker of some very high quality telescopes.  I used a 3D printer to make a more robust stand/adjustment arm, as the included stand is far too unstable to make adjustments without the magnifier moving around.

I was incredibly happy to find this Amazon. Rendered duck fat in place of butter or oil creates some very nice flavors, with crisp textures. I'm especially fond of using this for brussel sprouts, fingerling potatoes, and to crisp the skins of chicken thighs.

This towel works amazingly well at absorbing moisture.  I was highly skeptical at the claims when I was offered to evaluate this, but it truly works better than conventional towels.  The only downside to this towel is that yes, the colors do run and the feel on the skin is kind of strange, compared to a cotton towel.  I will be using this towel for hiking and the gym.

I enjoy making fancy flavored mayos, sauces, and other spreads to complement my dishes; these squeeze bottles are perfect for applying them in a visually appealing way.  The diameter of the opening is smaller, which is great, so you can cut off and adjust for more sauce.  To seal, just use a piece of cling wrap.

Consistent prints each time with this PLA filament.  While there are some kinks that made it difficult to go through my Makergear M2's filament guide tube, causing a feed issue, it was easily resolved by simply removing the guide tube.  Zero feeding issues after that-- prints came out as expected with my printer's suggested extruder nozzle temperature setting.  Great color, will definitely be ordering more filament from Hatchbox-- many filament can really be hit and miss and this is the first time I've been extremely pleased with.  Have done many prints with zero clogs.

These gloves are better suited for home cooking than grilling, since the gloves are pretty short.  I have very large hands and while these gloves fit snugly, there were a little challenging to remove and barely covered my wrist area, which is the most prone to burns on the grill.  One of the nice features of silicone gloves is that I have better tactile feedback and grip on what I am holding, compared with cloth mitts.  On the grip aspect, the grip with these is amazing-- these really help with gripping and fastening/loosening slippery objects.  The only major downside I see to these is that the hands can get sweaty/funky inside of them; I would not want to wear these in the summer.  Overall, this product works as advertised and has some extra functions that go beyond the kitchen.  This product was received for an objective evaluation.PROS:Work as advertisedExcellent gripExcellent tactile feedbackDishwasher safeCONS:Hands can get sweatyLimited wrist coverageSome difficulty removing

I've been using this externally for my dog and cats' coats.  I received this to evaluate and have been very pleased with the effect it has had on my pets' coats.  Applied externally, coconut oil has a softening effect and is non toxic.  They will also smell wonderful.  Applied externally on the skin has also helps with itching, when they have a rash, and is a better alternative than using hydrocortisone.  One teaspoon, applied with the palms, is good for one cat, whereas a medium sized dog of 30 lbs required about two tablespoons.

I'm very impressed with the quality of these chia seeds.  Typically, when I receive evaluation products for health food items, quality can be very hit and miss, but these are fantastically high quality.  No dirt or other detritus to be found, very high quality sterile packaging, and appears to be a product of the United States.I've been using these to boost and fortify smoothies and juices, as chia's mucilagenous properties can really help to thicken juices.  I'm going to try sprouting these soon, to see if I can successfully get some chia greens out of these, will update review accordingly.

Works exactly as expected.  I received this product for evaluation purposes and was able to use it to connect my old SNES to my newer TV.  I've used other converters in the past, which occasionally had issues displaying proper colors or brightness.  Color reproduction on this converter is great.

This dongle works exactly as it should-- there were no issues in getting my older PCs connected to my HDTV and displaying at the correct resolution.I received this product to review and it couldn't have come more timely-- one of my HTPCs used to have serious issues with having HDMI as it's primary display output, particularly when the HDMI output was connected to a receiver.  The HTPC would boot up and display whenever it was VGA output, but never with HDMI.  I believe it was an HDMI compatibility issue with the motherboard and TV/receiver.  This dongle has resolved that issue!

Recently, I've been getting into hiking and ultralight backpacking and the offer to evaluate and review this product couldn't have come at a more opportune time.  I want to be very careful to note that this is a product that fulfills very specific usage and is not for everyone-- that is, I feel it is best utilized by backpackers and hikers who want to save weight and space by carrying fewer extra clothing items, want to be prepared for a circumstance where they need to wash their clothes, and have a readily available water source available.  There are other scenarios that this product can be used for, but it is in hiking that the Scrubba is best suited.I've washed clothes using a stream and rocks to beat or abrade caked in dirt out of soiled clothing, but there is a high risk of really wearing down your clothes/fabric washing this way.  The Scrubba's nubs are a non-destructive way of working dirt out of your clothes and it does this job rather adequately.  I would recommend packing the Scrubba when hiking in areas with a readily available water supply, otherwise, you'll be lugging around extra water or using your drinking water supply if a washing need comes up.This is also a great product to pack while out on the ocean.  During a recent sailing trip, I really could have used one of these to work saltwater deposits out of some soaked clothes.Lastly, I can also see a situation where having this in the car can be a good emergency backup if you have a spill emergency while on a road, albeit this is a bit of a stretch.Overall, this is a great, rugged product that is very useful for backpackers-- it can also serve as a spare stuff sack.  If you go backpacking frequently, I would highly recommend carrying one of these along.

I've more or less carried this knife for four years now, using it for lighter duty things like cutting rope and breaking boxes down.  It's been a very reliable knife that holds its edge well, is easier to sharpen than one would think, and has a good deal of utility.  I've never had an accidental deploy in my pocket.  This is a great choice for an everyday carry knife.

Removes rust like a champ.  I use it to clean rust stains on tub and ceramic shower tile.  My apartment has very poor piping and my bathrooms are prone to developing rust stains.  I've tried several things to remove this rust, spending hours scrubbing, with baking soda, vinegar, and other chemicals...but none work as well as the toilet bowl cleaner. Fantastic stuff.

High quality smokeless candles with a great scent.  I received a set of these for review purposes, which included: Olive Blossom, Fresh Linen, and Lemongrass.  These are very small candles-- a mere two ounces each, but work well in filling rooms with a pleasing aroma.  One will need to meter these candles' use in order to get the most value out of them-- these are not candles that you leave burning all day; they are a touch expensive.  Burning one of the candles for an hour is more than enough to fill one regular sized room with the candle's scent.  All of the candles I received smelled fantastic, my favorite being Olive Blossom, which was more subdued.  Lemongrass and Fresh Linen were pleasing, but a bit strong for my tastes.  None of the candles' scents bothered me or gave me a headache, which was a nice change, as scented candles, plug in glade fresheners, and spray air fresheners usually leave me with terrible headaches.  Overall, very pleased with this product, but have some concerns about the retail pricing.

I've had my LN46A550 for nearly 7 years and it has seen very heavy use, serving my household well.  All things considered, a great TV, overall.  Recently, the set started experiencing the infamous click of death, where the set would take increasing amounts of time to turn on.  It was about to give up the ghost.  While I could have purchased capacitors and desoldering wick piecemeal, I had never done any kind of repair like this before and wanted to minimize the room for error.  This kit has everything needed to repair the faulty capacitors in these TVs, with the exception of the soldering iron.  I only had two bad caps, which were easy enough to replace, with the help of an easy to follow youtube vid.  (One can just search YT for LN46A550.)I'm keeping the spare capacitors in case any others go bad.  Fixing the capacitors on this TV is a very easy, quick repair for anyone who has a minimum experience of at least building a computer/minor technical know-how.

This has been a good walking shoe for me that has suited casual walks and trails with even surfaces, but it is not suitable for highly irregular, uneven surfaces.  The sole design is imbalanced and puts the hiker at high risk for ankle rolls/sprains, which is the worst thing that can happen on a hike if you're by yourself.
It works, but the velcro design is such that it is easy for the dog to get a hold of one of the ends of the collar and chew it up.
Good quality, fresh dal, never had any floaters. Clean taste and cooks very quickly. Great for thickening a soup.

I picked up a Medium sized harness for my 28lb Pembroke Welsh Corgi and it fits perfectly-- the harness is very comfortable for him for long rides.  My pup tends to be a little excited when first getting into the car and tugs a bit-- this harness has withstood quite a bit of that energy.  Stitching on the areas with the harness buckle looks quite strong and it's been a durable harness.

10000mah is a good balance between size/weight and the amount of charge it'll provide your devices. I have larger chargers, but they are too bulky and heavy for me to use every day. Smaller ones are easier to carry, but the hassle of having to recharge it frequently detracts from its utility. This Haidue has that balance-- it is a solidly designed charger and in my testing, is charging at the advertised rate, as well as having the advertised capacity.

This is a fantastic charger at an affordable price-- it is identical (and the same) as a similar appearance one that is being sold at a much higher price here.  Great value and does not look cheap/tacky, like other multiport car chargers.

I received this monopod to review and I haven't had any issues with the adjustment knob tightening/snaping on this camera monopod-- the product serves its purpose!  It is very lightweight which is good for travel, but the plastic ABS components do not feel as rugged as they could be.
I do not believe this is a new, OEM battery.  It does not hold charge adequately and is comparable to my year old battery that has been through hundreds of charge cycles.

I have been enjoying this hydration backpack for day trips-- fairly rugged, comfortable, and can hold a decent amount of stuff for small excursions.  My only gripe with this hydration backpack is that the bite valve has a tendency to leak a few drips a minute.  I'll be modifying mine to something less prone to leaking.
This is a great straining bag with a good amount of volume. I don't use this to make nut milks, but I use it for inexpensively making greek yogurt. Great price, easy to clean.

It hovers over your hand just like the picture and you can pass it back and forth if you hold it by the yellow stem on top and angle it slightly towards the other person.Made out of styrofoam it can handle crashes without breaking.Seems to take about 30 minutes to charge we've been getting about 10 minutes of flight time per charge.It's fun at first but the kids get bored of it pretty quick. I think a remote control helicopter or drone would be way more fun to play with and would have better replay value.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below. Thanks!!

This orange band connects to your iPhone or Ipad through bluetooth and makes sounds (from the Iphone/Ipad speaker) when you wave your arm around.Some of the sounds are cool for kids to play like swords or ninja stars but the cooking sounds (like eggs frying) are of very limited use.Making a train sound by waving your arm can get annoying fast.The drum and guitar sounds promising but it doesn't really time the beat of the drum to the hand movement. As long as you keep waving your arm the drum and guitar keeps playing but there is some lag and it's a little slow when you are trying to do air guitar.Also, you need your iPhone or iPad within Bluetooth distance (30-40ft) with the app running to hear any sounds. No sounds come out of the armband itself.You can change the sounds on the app and they keep adding new sounds every week.The band is fun for kids and makes lots of cool sounds likeSWORDNINJA STARTRAINBASEBALLBOXINGGOLFTENNISPERCUSSIONLASERBBQSTARS N STRIPES (GUITAR)ANIMAL (DOG,CAT,HORSE,LION)BOXINGFISHING (CASTING, REELING, FISH SOUND)HERO (VARIOUS JAPANESE VOICES)MAGIC (MAGIC WANDS)GUITARDRUMSCOOKINGThe band attaches to your wrist like a slap band.The band could also work great as a special effects sound device if you were putting on a play or something like that.Setup: The website on the box DOES NOT WORK (moff.mobi/setup)Instead you must download the app from the itunes store then watch a YouTube video to learn how to set it up.The link to set it up is https://youtu.be/_tZDBhh04z4 or just search YouTube under Moffband user guide.You must use the app to connect the band to your phone. Regular bluetooth pairing will not work. You run the app and make sure bluetooth is turned on and the audio is not on silent mode.Then you input your username, age, right or left hand, and you are ready to go.You can have more than one Moff Band registered to each account.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below. Thanks!!!

UPDATE: 11/16/15.I've been using this case for a week and the magnets on the keyboard that hold the ipad in place just fell off (see pictures). Now the case doesn't stay together.I tried superglue to get the pieces back into place but it doesn't hold the same. You need to be very careful when you superglue the magnets back on so that they are in the exact same position!I have another version of this case for my Ipad Air2 and I got this one for my new Ipad mini 2.This fits perfectly only my Ipad Mini 2 and has a nice sleek black look. There are cutouts for all the buttons and the camera lens.This pairs with the Ipad Mini 2 with bluetooth and setup was instant and easy and it has never lost connection.The keyboard is small but fully functional with extra buttons on the top for volume control, home screen, power, bluetooth, and arrow keys.The keyboard charges with an included mini USB cable and the charge lasts for 2 YEARS!!!!I can't verify that but my other Zagg keyboard has never needed charging and I use it everyday.The keyboard is detachable and can be easily removed from and the screen (held together by magnets) and can be turned backwards for use as a viewing stand for the sceen if you don't want the keyboard in the front.Overall, this is very attractive and thin case but the build quality is poor. If you buy this you should add a thin layer of superglue over the hinge magnets so they don't fall out.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs UP below!!! Thanks!

Very sturdy stainless steel wire brush with a hardwood handle.It's very thin but well made.I use one to clean my grill.I use another one to help me paint numbers on my curb. This brush is great at roughing up old paint off concrete to prep it for new spray paint.Even after multiple uses on pavement and concrete the brush is still going strong.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below. Thanks!!!

These are the exact same cardboard stencils that you can buy at Home Depot for the same price.I use these to spray paint my curb address numbers and they seem perfectly sturdy and will last for years if kept properly. Even after getting wet with spray paint they haven't degraded at all.My only complaint is that they don't sell a 4 inch version on Amazon as 4 inches is the exact height that the standard curb numbers are in my area.These 3 inch numbers are a bit small but still look good!!!If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below!!!! Thanks.

In theory this plug is a good idea which would let you use an iphone app and Siri to control a single device or a powerstrip.However, the iDevice switch kept losing the connection with my wifi.Even installing it and the app was painful because it kept resetting when it lost connection with the switch.Even when the switch was working it can only be controlled when you are at home in the range of your Wifi. I could not get it to work when I went outside to my front yard.In comparison, I have a few Belkin WeMo switches which work perfectly and can be controlled when you are away from your home.  The WeMo switch is bigger and less sexy looking but works better in real world application.Save your money and buy a WeMo switch.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below! Thanks.

These boots are made in Bangladesh, not made in the USA.I ordered a 10 Wide and the fit is very wide. It's about as wide as a New Balance 10 EE shoe so its perfect for people with wide feet and if you like to wear thick socks.The removable EVA insole that it comes with has a small air bubble at the heel but is otherwise super thin and flimsy and I would definitely change it for a better insole immediately. I went with an Orange Superfeet insole.The boot is comfortable but is more of a boot feel than that of a comfortable shoe like some newer more expensive boots. I would not recommend this boot if you have to walk long distances unless you buy a very comfortable insole to put inside it.The tread pattern is very grippy and the steel toe offers good protection for our feet.There are areas of mesh to allow airflow into the boot but it still gets hot and sweaty inside (it's not waterproof).Overall it's an above average work boot that is perfect for people with wide feet. Change the insole and it can be very comfortable.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below!! Thanks.

These are made in Columbia, NOT in the USA.The packaging color is blue and not red like the picture.My dog likes the beef colored filling. These have a glaze on them like a glazed donut which probably makes it taste better for the dog.These last about 10-15 minutes which is a lot longer than Dreambone.The ingredients (see included picture) have beefhide and "animal digest."Per Wikipedia animal digest is common in dog food and "digest is produced by the chemical or enzymatic hydrolysis of clean animal tissue that has not undergone decomposition. These animal tissues may not include hair, horns, teeth, hooves, and feathers, with the exclusion of trace amounts that are unavoidable even after acceptable processing methods"So far my dog hasn't had any diarrhea or vomiting from this.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below!!!! Thanks!

You get six die cast ship figures:Millenium Falcon, Tie Fighter, X Wing fighter, Slave I, Ghost (from Star Wars Rebels TV show) and a snowspeeder.We did not get a Star Destroyer in our 6 pack.The figures are sturdy and have lots of detail and come with a stand that fits on your finger so you can fly them around with your finger in the stand.There are some missing details on the ships.1.The X wing does NOT have an R2 D2 droid on it.2.The Snowspeeder is missing the rear gun for the harpoon.3. The fins and guns on the Slave I do not move.Those details won't be noticed by most kids so it should only matter to an avid fan or collector.Overall, fun for the kids and should last a long time.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below!!!! Thanks!

Fit and function: 9 out of 10.  With careful adjustment these fit nicely in the ear. The curved plastic will keep them in your ear if you rotate them backwards so the large part of the curve rests on the back of the ear.It comes with small, medium and large size earpads and a curved plastic piece to fit in the curve of your ear.You can also put the cords over your ear for more stability.These stick out of the ear a bit and the fluorescent green color isn't as cool as the beats colors. Conversely, the beats are less comfortable to wear with glasses and sunglasses.Sound quality: 8 out of 10. Sounds clean and crisp. Spoken word sounds great. Sound quality is good at low volume and high volume. Bass is not great. No sound drop outs.Bluetooth: Connects easily and pairs instantly with the iphone 6 and the Ipad mini 2 and with my two cars.Looks: neon green. not the greatest. Beats looks better.If you found this review helpful please give it a thumbs up below. Thanks!!!!!
THIS IS JUNK.... WHOLE TRAIN IS BATTERY POWERED AND IS 3 INCHES BY 2 INCHES..... THIS IS GARBAGE

So I've been using the activity monitor for a couple of days now and i do have to say so far so good on this one. It comes with a few different bands that really are sized for one size fits all because you can shrink them down. The unit very easily connects through the iphone and using the app that you download.  The application itself although very basic does everything to capture the data that is needed.As I have stated on previous reviews, Is this a big expensive fitbit?  Not at all but for 1/3rd the price of the normal one it does at least capture everything you might need and or want in a wrist wearable.I could not figure out how to get the picture feature to work with the iphone but I did get it to work on the android.  I think i may have "denied" access when it asked me on the iphone.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

So let me start out that these are nice solid teething rings made of silicone.  I love the fact that there is 3 of them so that you can keep them in multiple places.  The designs on the sides of it make it nice for the child because it can give different textures and locations to chew on.  You can also place these in the freezer to add to the soothing affect of the teether itself.  Now good points to make this is a solid piece so it cant break apart and choke the baby in anyway.using this and a nice bib will be great as they start popping teeth out!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

So far i am really enjoying this weather station.  The way i have it setup is i have it right above my alarm panel in my house so that it shows everything right there before i leave.  really overall the quality is nice the data seems to be actuate as i do have a weather station in the house that is connected to the internet.  Really what it comes down to is that this just works and is great for any amateur or even advanced weather station person. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Let me start out with I have fallen in LOVE with these bib bandanas The size is enough to absorb a good amount of spit up. The overall sizing on these may be a little difficult for a newborn but should be just fine for any time after that. I washed it once already and still soft sit seems like it will stay that way. These are good for both boys and girls but i am Excited to have these for my son! I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Let me start out I was a little skeptical but I WAS SO WRONG!  The process is VERY easy depending on where you look the benefits of this are through the roof.If you just pop this with no oil because its not needed then your talking really only 131 calories for the whole 1/4 cup of unpopped popcorn that you use.  With a Calorie breakdown: 10% fat, 77% carbs, 13% protein. <-- Just googled dataThe product itself.  Very easy to use put the popcorn at the bottom and put in the microwave for 2 min.  Keep in mind my microwave is an 1100 watt (i consider it industrial because its huge) so times varies depending.The popcorn itself when it comes out in my opinion tastes better then the air popped and almost doesn't leave a texture to the popcorn itself.Bottom line... .This is great for a diet person or College student... Honestly This would be great in the office at work also because a container of popcorn is MUCH cheaper then the individual bags that burn!Clean up is very easy if you do it dry then just knock all the seeds out and maybe give a quick rinse.  If you use oil then go ahead and wash it using your normal methods.

So i actually ordered these for my son not my dog.  i think these are the cutest things and have been ordering a number of them lately.  each one is different what i find with these are they are not reversible but that's OK.The overall bib on this is made of quality fabric and the snaps seem to be put into the fabric very well compared to some I have seen.You do get 4 bibs in this set of various patterns.Personally if you were not finding out gender these would work as a neutral gender product.We have ran these through the washing machine already and they did not fall apart and no stitches became undone.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

So let me start with my wife found this frame pattern on pintrest and i will be honest with you without me buying this i would have NEVER been able to do this! Almost perfect, missing 3 important items to be complete: quickclot or equilivant, tourniquet, and isrealli battle bandage. Check out my full video on you tube, Great gadgets & gear! Channel or type in adventure medical comprehensive kit. For the money this is a great value for the items included. A lot more than you can see in photos. They include quality items, some you'd never think about. It's a bit heavy for backpacking but excellent for home, car or base camp. The detachable watertight day bag is a smart idea for short trips away from the group. As with any kit you need to customize to your needs. Adventure medical makes some of the best off the shelf kits. Check out video to see everything in the kit up close! I got this kit real cheap due to meds being expired so got for 1/2 price!! Ebay great place to get refills cheap on meds or ointments or bandage refill kits.

These are great, better than tac ties for me. They hold things tighter to my bag and since there rigid stuff dont flop around. You can face them different ways to get them to work with bags from other companies that say dont match with Maxpedition or whoever. Once you know how they work there quick and easy to use. Plus no snap to come undone. These are my pick for mounting gear.

cool stylish watch, love the red and black face very unique. The white band really shows up with a tan, takes getting use to it, not a big fan of white plastic feeling band that's not removable, its part of the watch. Overall love this watch. I use it for MTB not diving keeps great time too! LOL

Junk, thought this was the same one I ordered before just a different color, WRONG!!! This piece of crap ripped after 3 days of use, the springs just tear through the thin cheap fabric on the bottom like a hot knife through butter! My other one took a year before one small corner wore through but that was on top through the thick wood weave. Pass on this one especially id you use it a lot.

What a Great break from granola bars!!! Yeah, don't get me wrong like them too but what a welcome change. This version is nuts and spices with a tasty vanilla flavor holding it all together. I'm hooked!! And healthy too? What?! really...

Very roomy pouch, it swallowed up my ham radio with room to spare. The material is softer than Maxpedition gear and didn't care for the tac ties for attaching, seems too loose for my liking, even tried different ways with Blackhawk speed clips but still seems looser than Maxpedition molle system. Even if you tuck the tac ties in and try to use the few rows of molle they don't match up right. Ended up getting the Maxpedition for my pack. This is a nice pouch for the money, roomy, same set up as the pricey Maxpedition version. This pouch really does expand and you can get a lot of stuff in it. I like it but not sure what to do with it now? Looks too bulky anywhere I put it. Dont care for cheap zippers that was an issue for me. Shipping it back would be 1/2 the cost of bag so guess i'll hold on to it.
I love this little guy!! keeps it tangle free and looks real cool. wish I got two! Quick easy wind up and removal, great product.

Great for a emergency or get home bag! Like other Maxpedition bags you can stuff and stuff it, but it will like others bags get more round as you fill it.. There is no rigid or plastic back support only padding so over stuffing will round the back and can make it uncomfortable to wear. This is the perfect size for me, it made me re think my choices of supplies and how to pack them. I was totally shocked at how much this would hold, I started out in a Gregory jade 34 totally comfortable with hip straps but too big for car for my liking. So after removing 2 MRE's I got down to a Gregory jade 28 with hip straps, real comfortable to walk with on as gear is only 20 lbs but didn't like the no organization options that hiking bags offer. So thought I'd give this a shot but didn't think it would work as the jade was 1750 compared to the 1400 of this bag! The organization options in this bag are truly great. The full clam shell opening in the main bag makes it easy to fit your gear together like a jig saw puzzle to use every inch. The smaller front admin pocket takes work and a few different tries to get items to not only fit but be easy to get at. The very front small slip pocket does hold more than you think if used properly and for more flat type items such as maps, zip ties, chem lights etc. Not a huge fan of molle bit too military for me but not so much on this pack its pretty nice looking for what it is. The area under the front pocket with the elastic cord worked great for a rain jacket in a stuff sack, nice and compact and fit perfectly and also holds the bag up. The water bottle pockets are small, I cant get a 1 liter water bottle in it, not the Nalgene kind anyway but my metal one works fine. I did attach a MM dump pouch to one side in case extra room is needed its compact and don't look too bulky on the pack. On the other side I tried a condor pouch gadget 6x4x4 but way too big and didn't attach as snugly as Maxpedition pouches. So I got the Anemone but its a bit small, needs one in between the two sizes to be a good balance. Ill figure something out to put in it I'm sure! The top V strap was the perfect place to store 100' of paracord. The quality of this pack is the usual except I am starting to notice poor stitching on the pack and loose strings which I've never seen before. I love the hard feel of the material it holds up GREAT over time and keeps the bag looking new. The pack works in my car and is a smaller footprint. Very impressed as usual with this gear. I just wish there was a flashlight sheath-phone/ radio holster combo, the tri admin pouch is too much for my needs. Should be a new product, the double duty pouch! This is a very small pack but if trying to keep a small footprint with a lot of room if creative this will work! So you know going into this, it's small, check out you tube videos of people wearing pack to see just hoe small, it's the best way to judge it without purchase. I had to buy and try and it did work for me.

What a great product! It has dual charging ports one specifically for apple and the extra port for no wait charging of another device. I really love the blue color it lights up with when plugged in and good to go. Easy to find in the dark car and let's me know I have a good connection for charging. This company makes high quality products, I also have their external battery charger another fine quality product long lasting, durable, and dependable. Great purchase and the company name I look for when making my purchases.
Great leash, perfect lenght, great color and nice and thick, no worries about it breaking. The retrackable has now gone in the trash, this is safer and more dependable. Would buy again.

Really cool product, and was pleasantly surprised it worked! It was tested out on the boat on a buggy night and it worked fine, no bites at all. Not sure how it preforms in the woods or for many days of use. But for a night out it was a great relief from the usual scratching and swatting. I got the shirt too, really cool. Totally worth the money.

Great, cheap addition to my pops emergency kit. For about $5 its a huge kinda heavy to wear and the harness over the top of your noggin is kinda irritating but it works. It adjusts to different viewing angle and it's pretty bright for a $5 headlamp. For about $16 energizer make a 100 lumen lighter version. But this is for very limited use and its worth the couple of bucks to see and not have to hold a flashlight.

Really thick, beefy solid knife for a pretty reasonable price. It was a perfect fit for my car kit. Not too big like my Marine K bar for the wilderness, but big enough for in the car or on the walk home, in an emergency. Its not the most expensive knife or the best quality blade out there, but for the price and for emergency use it was a great deal and easy to keep sharpened. If your a commando or Jeremiah Johnson you might not like it. It's a great knife for car kits or medium duty use. Not sure how the handle will hold up, but at least its full tang and can be wrapped if needed.Overall:easy to keep sharp, thick and comfortable to hold.

This thing always works, no broken flint to worry about, no out of juice problems or it got wet or run over. It works period. every time and anytime. Bug out bag must. My pops loved it. It was a great addition to the emergency car kit I made him for Christmas. I keep one myself in my kit. Little Bic's are great but these are totally dependable not that I plan on being stuck alone in the amazon or the wilderness but it's a great small light weight item to have on hand. Better to have it and not need it than to need it and not have it, right??

Once you figure it out its a great item to have for emergencies. You have to be licensed to use it for casual use but you can use it in a true emergency or injury. The programming is hard if you don't know what your doing but a few u tube videos should do the trick, I never bought the "programming cable" just looked up the information I need on the web. The license is good for about 10 years so might be good to have. Really wished I brought it mountain biking when I broke my ribs as there was no cell reception and had to get out myself. This is a bug out bag must!Overall: really cool, works well and great price for piece of mind! Need license to use if not a dire emergency or FCC will get you!

These little flashlights are really handy, bought several for home, car and friends and family. I mean how many times do you say "I wish I had a flashlight?" The real cree light have lines that run through the beam at full zoom to small square. the china versions don't. I have ordered both versions and so far no problems with either but will see the china ones usually break after 2 months. The Cree ones in USA cost a bit more but you get them fast and they are great quality. They are about 240 lumens so good for close work/walking but not to good for real far seeing. Very handy for purse, backpack or pocket.Overall: good stuff, compact, versatile and cheap!

I was really surprise at just how full of info and pro tips were in this book. Figured it would be gimmicky but not at all. I have tons of prepper books, best ones by Arthur T Bradley- for home survival and Creek Steward bug out for car or outdoors,  even some military guides and I must say this is a great book. It does not read like an end of the world fanatic book. Its more of a comprehensive book on surviving all different types of weather conditions, how to's and gear ideas, expert tip from the army, girl scouts, boy scouts and other experienced outdoor groups. How to improvise different things like snow shoes, bamboo beds, sun glasses and other really cool things. As much as I like all my books as its fun to get different perspectives, this is a great book if you only want one that covers the most outdoor survival. Aurthur T Bradley is better for home weather conditions like tornadoes and floods and hurricanes and the like. There is just so much information in this book its too much to list.The most important thing other than the great information is it's just plain fun to read, not boring or drawn out at all.
