This little "card" is so simple, yet it provides me with wireless charging on the Qi standard charger.  The instructions you get with it are on the card itself.  There is a little picture of a Samsung Galaxy S3 with the back taken off and the charging receiver somewhere in the back.It turns out the two connections on the end go into two depressions about 1" above where the top of the battery comes.  Then you can put you back on and the cover will hold the card in place.  Alternatively, they provide a small piece of double sticky tape to affix it to your battery.  But with the back on, it is not going anywhere.If you want to know if this will work even with a case on the phone, the answer is, yes.  It works just fine with my hardshell case on the phone.  But the phone gets mighty hot while charging. I don't know if it is supposed to or not.  But mine gets hot.  I have been using it mainly to top off the phone while sitting at my desk.This product works as intended.  It could use some better instructions, but I figured it out after trial and error.** I paid full price for this product for personal use.

I received this finder product last week and I've had a chance to use it over the past week.  I'm quite glad I tested it over a week because I got to try all the finder options.  There is the option to find the keys it is connected to.  Just install the iPhone app and you can run it in the background.  Then you just need to activate the find feature to find your keys.  But say you lost your phone instead of your keys.  You can use the key fob to find your phone!If you are at the shopping center, just remember to press the button before you leave your car and it assigns a GPS marker to your car location.  Upon leaving the shopping center, you can just look at the app on your iPhone and get directions to where you parked with arrows and distance.You can use this iHere fob to record voice messages, very handy to me.  As well, it acts as a remote shutter trigger for the iPhone camera.I found it easy to use.  Finding my cell phone and keys has come in very handy, as I often lose one or the other.  If I lose both, I'll have to call my iPhone from another phone and listen for the ring.  Then I can use the iPhone to find my keys.The key fob does make a fairly loud noise but I could see that in a noisy environment it would be hard to hear.  Maybe a strobe light every 10 seconds would be a good option.** I received this finder product at a discount in order that I might provide this honest and unbiased review.  I never promise 5 star reviews and all opinions are my own.

This review is for:Jawaytool®6pc Phillips and Flat Precision Screwdriver Set CRV Eyeglasses Watches Electronics Computer Tool KitForget the cheap tools you are used to seeing from China because this is a good set of precision screwdrivers.  They come in a very nice, locking plastic box.  The handles are aluminum with a rotating cap on the end to make holding and turning easy.  The handles are anodized in several bright colors.  There are three Phillips head drivers and three flathead drivers.  The metal that the driver tips are made from is strong and won't strip out when trying to screw something.The screwdrivers are easy to hold and use.  The shape of the handles makes them easy to use.  The case is handy, you can even place the drivers in an up position for easy grabbing when working on a project. (see picture)This is a very nice set of precision screwdrivers that come in a handy case.** I received a complimentary sample of this screwdriver set in order that I might test it and provide this review.

This review is for:Back To School-Batteries for Calculators,Watches, Remotes Controls, 42ct (Pack of 2), Back To School SuppliesThis is a great value in batteries!  You get a wide variety of batteries on the card, PLUS you get TWO CARDS!  What you see in the picture is what you get, but you get TWO CARDS!  This is such a nice variety of button cell batteries that are in common sizes.I tested one of each of the different batteries and they all tested strong.  If you have watches or other items that need these button cell batteries, you can't go wrong with this deal.  You get so many and they are all strong.You get the following batteries on one card but you get two cards, so all are times 2:AG 1 364 x 10AG 3 392 x 8AG 4 377 x 8AG 5 393 x 4AG 12 386 x 4AG 13 357 x 8This is a great way to get the button cell batteries that are most common and that you need.  Great variety and good number of each battery.** I received these batteries at a discount in exchange for this honest and unbiased review.

This review is for:Pure Sun Naturals Turmeric Curcumin with BioPerine - 120 CapsuleI have fibromyalgia and osteoarthritis.  I have pain a good deal of the time but due to stomach ulcers, I cannot take ANY NSAID pain relievers for my pain.  So I have been forced to look elsewhere for relief of my pain and inflammation.  The pain is caused by the inflammation and Turmeric Curcumin has been proven to relieve inflammation as well as providing pain relief by doing so.This particular brand has a dosage of 350 mg of Organic Turmeric, 150 mg of Turmeric Extract and 5 mg of BioPerine.  My regular dose that helps me is around 750 mg of Turmeric per day, so two of these capsules provide me with what I need to combat the pain throughout the day.  I am not sure how the BioPerine helps, but this particular brand is better at relieving my inflammation than other brands I have tried.This is a very good supplement for people with pain from inflammation or people who want the antioxidant effect from the Turmeric.** I received this bottle of Turmeric Curcumin with BioPerine at a discount in order that I may try it and provide this review.

0:56 MinsThis review is for:WATERFLY Portable Travel School Laptop Backpack Bag Hiking Camping Bag BookbagThis is a nice, very lightweight backpack. It weighs only a few ounces.  It is just one layer thick with no padding.  Great for carrying towels to the pool or beach or carrying your swimming suits for the family.  The bag is very well-made.  I tried ripping it at the seams and it did not give.  The lightweight straps are on well also.  I could not rip them off either.There is a pocket on the front that closes with a strap and buckle.  There is also a zippered pocket on the inside, against the back wall.  There are water bottle pockets on each side of the backpack.  The Logo on the front says, "Aonijie."  Not sure what that means.This is a very decent, lightweight bag for carrying lightweight things.  It would not be comfortable to carry with over 10 pounds in it. But as a beach bag or pool bag, it is very capable.  We took it to the beach today, filled with snacks.  It worked out well.** I received this bag at no cost in order that I may try it and provide this review.

This review is for:Beef Jerky for dogs - Wizzlers - 7PK Real beef dog treats made in USA - All Natural, 100% edible, great healthy dog training treats from Jack's Premium!These are great treats for dogs that love to chew.  They are especially good for puppies.  You can train the puppy to chew on this and not your shoes.  These treats are HARD not soft.  The dog has to gnaw at it and get it soft before they can get any meat from it.  Once they soften it up, it is just like a beef steak for them to chew on.These have no dyes so they are safe on your carpet.  Our Poodle ate his on light colored carpet yesterday and there were no stains on the carpet.Our dog really enjoyed gnawing at the treat.  He did not come anywhere near finishing it by the time he was tired and ready for bed.  So it lasts a long time. He chewed at it for 45 minutes before it was time for bed.  This morning, he is gnawing at it again.Once dogs learn how delicious these treats are, they will go nuts when you give them one.  These are good for big and small dogs.  If you dog likes meat and likes to chew, these treats are fantastic.  If you know your dog only likes soft treats, they probably won't like these treats because they are very hard to begin with.These are very good treats for dogs.  They allow them to chew on something that is okay for them to chew on and not your shoes.** I received these Wizzlers dog treats at a discount in order that I may try them and provide this review.

This review is for:Snap-N-Store Letter-Size File Box, Black (SNS01533)This is a decent file box.  It snaps together and the snaps are very good, very tight.  It doesn't offer to fall apart, even when loaded with files.  The size is great for our uses.  We needed a file box to put into the closet fire safe for important documents.  This one does the trick.I read some reviews that said it fell apart, came un-snapped during use. I don't see that happening.  The snaps hold very tight.  After reading some reviews I was ready to put some glue on the snaps to make it permanent.  But that was not necessary.  If you snap the snaps properly, the box stays together even under load.  The people that had problems with the snaps holding obviously did not snap them completely shut, because the hold just fine without glue.The lid... it is about an inch too big in all directions.  But I just needed the box to hold files, the lid doesn't really matter to me.  This is an inexpensive solution to file storage that looks good to boot.  4 stars because I like it.  It is not perfect, but it is worth 4 stars and works well for my needs.From looking at the picture in the ad and then my pictures, you can see they changed the product.  Evidently they put better snaps on it and they hold tight now.  But they didn't change the lid, so it is way too big.  But, as I said, it works well for my needs of a file box in the fire safe.  I'm going to use it without the lid anyway.** I bought this file box at full price for personal needs.

This review is for:FEINZER Professional Luxury Ceramic Knife Set (3 Piece Knife Set)This is a beautiful set of ceramic knives.  The handles and the blades are black.  Very cool looking set.  The handles are minimalistic, just enough handle to be comfortable in your hand.  These knives come very sharp.  They cut very well right out of the box.  We cut tomatoes, squash, broccoli, carrots and celery and everything cut so easily.  It is great to have sharp knives to use.These knives are as beautiful as they are sharp.  The quality of the edge is very good for cutting.  It has enough angle to remain sharp for a long time and is not too sharp with a brittle edge like a razor.  This set should last a long time, provided you take care of them.  Ceramic knives need special care.  Never put in the dishwasher.  Always wash with dish washing liquid and warm water.  Do not allow knives to contact each other in the drawer as damage to the edge might occur.  We use a knife block in our drawer that has slits for several knives to rest safely.** I received this 3 knife set at a discount in order that I may try it and provide this review.

This review is for:Royal Anti-Fatigue Comfort Mat - Multi Surface All-Purpose Luxurious Comfort - For Kitchen, Bathroom or Workstations - Beautiful Burgundy Color - 20 x 39"Right out of the box, this mat is good looking.  It is a nice burgundy color and the mat looks good.  Stepping on the mat really speaks more than words could ever say.  The feeling of springiness you feel when walk in place on the mat is uncanny.  We put ours in front of the kitchen sink. Not only does it look good, feel good on your feet and legs, but it is waterproof as well.Anyplace you need to stand for extended periods of time is a good place for one of these anti-fatigue mats.  They look decent and perform well.  The way they keep you from getting fatigued is amazing.  The springiness of them is like standing on a cloud.** I received this anti-fatigue comfort mat at a discount in order that I may try it and provide this review.

1:50 MinsThis review is for Koozam Orthopedic Anti-Slip Memory Foam Seat Cushion for Back Pain Coccyx Spinal Alignment Relief with Bonus Velour Cover (Large)Let me start by saying this Large seat cushion is a full inch larger all the way around than a standard seat cushion. (19" wide by 15" deep)  This makes it excellent for use in a wheelchair or recliner type chair just due to its size.  The cover it comes with is black velour and it also comes with an extra cover in burgundy.  I pulled the cushion out of the black cover and put on the burgundy cover with no problems.  You can wash the cover in the washing machine, but I would hesitate to dry in the dryer for fear it would shrink some. But you can probably dry it on low with no shrinkage.The bottom of the cushion has these little, rubber bumps that grip your chair so the cushion does not slide around in the chair.  This makes it good for invalids so it is not sliding out from under them in their chair.  But it is good for anyone who wants a little extra seat cushion.The memory foam in this cushion is very comfortable.  I've been using a cushion like this for over a year and this new one by Koozam is much more comfortable.  It really conforms to my body and makes sitting much more comfortable for me.  I'm so happy to have received this cushion as it has become my every day cushion in my office.  I was a little put off by its size, thinking it only would be good in a larger chair.  But it fits in my office chair just perfectly and provides the cushion I need for my back problems.I'm very pleased with this orthopedic seat cushion.  It is very comfortable and fits in my chair just fine.*I received this product at no cost in order that I might test it and provide this review.

This review is for:Yubi Power All In One Travel Adapter with Universal Outlet and 2 USB 2.0 Ports - Built In Surge Protector and Neon Light Indicator - Foldable Prongs for Type A, C, G, and I Outlets - Works In USA UK China Germany France Japan Canada Australia and more!This travel adapter from Yubi Power is a very lightweight, compact unit that takes up little space in your suitcase but will provide you with power in almost any country.  Keep in mind that many countries use a different voltage and you will still need a voltage adapter for items that don't provide a voltage change button.I tried the USB ports on the unit by charging a couple of mobile devices.  They charged as expected in normal time.I've given 4 stars because the item is very usable, but I find adjusting the metal prongs for different positions to be difficult and they don't retract automatically even though they engage automatically.  You have to push them in while sliding the Lock slider to Lock.This is a good travel adapter that has all you need to use your devices in other countries.  It is lightweight and sturdy.** I received this travel adapter at no cost in order that I may test it and provide this review.

This review is for:[Outstanding Outdoor Speaker] Ayfee Wireless Bluetooth Waterproof Speaker, Rugged IPX6 NFC Portable Bluetooth 4.0 Speaker with 7W Powerful Drive and Passive Radiator for Outdoors/Shower (Black)This speaker came yesterday and I have had a chance to test it rigorously. On the top are the buttons to make it work, power, track seek forward and reverse, and a phone button to answer the phone and use the unit as a hands-free product. I splashed it with water in the shower and it was just fine with that.  I'm impressed with the quality of this speaker.  This is a heavy-duty speaker that is resistant to water. But I used it in the shower this morning and it performed well.It was easy to pair this speaker with iPhone and a Samsung Galaxy S phone. The mids and highs do not get washed out by the bass.  The speaker gets really loud.  But even at peak volume, there is no distortion, even when listening to music with heavy bass.  I listened to pop, heavy metal, hip hop, country, and talk radio and everything I threw at it sounded great through this speaker.The bass response and peak volume are excellent on this speaker.  I am really pleased with the sound reproduction.  This is a great sounding speaker that will work in almost any environment and works well.  It is easy to pair and connect.  It rounds out to a very excellent speaker I am happy to own.  This is my new shower speaker and just plain every day speaker.** I received a complimentary sample of this Bluetooth speaker in order that I might test it and leave this review.

1:56 MinsI have tested 30+ earbud headsets this year and this pair blows them all out of the water. They work by producing the sound with drivers in the cables. The sound then travels up the air tubes into the earbuds and into your ears.The sound on these is tremendous. First of all, there is actually bass, thumping bass punch. The mids and highs are clear and not muddied by all the bass. The sound is very balanced and they can be very loud if you enjoy listening to them loud. I could only turn the volume on my iPhone up to 60% before it hurt my ears. But I'm old. I used to listen to music loud when I was younger, so I understand that. These headphones get very loud is my point.It's a toss up which is better, the A3 or the A1.  I find them both very good quality build and sound is tremendous.  I would say it's a tie.  So if you like the way these look, get them.This pair has gray tubes with gunmetal earbuds and a black, braided cord at the split of the cables.  They are black silicone from the split to the earbuds.  They have a green, metallic ring around the earbud near the tip.  They have a microphone with a phone button that will answer the phone or pause the music when pressed.  The earbuds are smaller than other earbuds because the driver is in the cable, not in the earbud.  This means you can have a smaller earbud.These are the best earbud headset that I have tested this year, tied with the Aircom A3s. The sound is terrific and the design is great. They really are worth the price. If you want pounding bass and/or high volume, these are great. If you are on the fence on these remember that you can return them if you don't find them satisfactory. But I can't see anyone returning these because they sound so good.** I received a complimentary sample of this Airtube headset in order that I might test it and leave this review.

This review is for:Innovo Forehead and Ear Thermometer (Dual Mode) - Newly released on Jan 2015 *CE and FDA approvedThis thermometer has dual modes.  That means you can use it to measure temporal temperature or eardrum temperature. This is handy to have the dual modes.  The thermometer comes with two AAA batteries, a small rest to place the thermometer on when not in use and instructions.To use it as a temporal thermometer, you leave the end cap on and press against the forehead while holding the F1 button and move it back and forth.  You'll hear a subtle clicking noise, this means it is working.  In just a few seconds the highest temperature will appear on the LCD screen.To use as an in-ear thermometer, take off the end cap and pull the ear back and up to straighten out the ear canal.  Then place the thermometer into the ear and press the F2 button.  It will take the temperature and give the result very quickly.I took my temperature using a standard, digital, under the tongue thermometer for a baseline temp.  I then took my temps via the Innovo Forehead and Ear Thermometer using both the in-ear and forehead modes.The temps between the under the tongue and forehead were within a few tenths of a degree.  The ear temp was a bit lower than normal, but within a degree.  I would consider the forehead mode to be the more accurate of the two temps as it nearly matched the under the tongue temperature.  But I read somewhere that ear temperature is always lower than oral temperature.This is a very nice, DUAL Mode, thermometer that works well right out of the box.  Even the batteries are included.** I received a complimentary sample of this Forehead and Ear thermometer in order that I might test it and leave this review.

This review is for:OPOLAR Notebook Laptop Cooler Cooling Fan...My workspace routinely gets above 95 F.  My office is out on a screened in porch so I can watch the wildlife during the day.  So my laptop gets really, really hot.  Parts of it get so hot to the touch I wonder if I could fry an egg on it.  The Florida heat is relentless.This laptop cooler fits on your laptop if you have a SIDE VENT.  If your vent is on the bottom, consider another product as this won't do anything for you.  The way it works is you adhere a metal slide that fits into a plastic piece to the bottom of you laptop. (You can make it work without sticking anything to your laptop if you so desire. So you can use on multiple computers.)When not in use, the metal slide can slide in, out of the way.  When in use, just pull the slide out and connect to the fan blower unit and use the two little arms to grip the top of the laptop.  It goes on easy whether you adhere the slide to the bottom of your laptop or if you use it without sticking anything to your computer.  There is a set of 3 silicone shrouds that you can use to funnel the hot air into the fan unit.  But mine works well without the silicone shroud.So, once you have it on the computer, either permanently or temporarily, you can plug it in and turn it on. It plugs in using a MicroUSB to USB cable, which is included.  It has an automatic mode that adjusts the fan speed according to the amount of hot air blowing out of the laptop.  It will dynamically switch speeds by how much hot air is blowing out of the computer.  You can override the dynamic mode and adjust the speed of the fan manually.  Either way, you get cooling.  I like to put it near the highest setting when the temps out here get into the 90s.So, how well does it work?  My laptop was getting so hot I could hardly stand to type on it.  The wrist rest and keyboard were over 100 F as measured with an infrared sensor.  Now, with the cooler installed,  even with the temps in the 90s, the laptop measures in the high 70s where it was once 100 F plus.  The wrist rest is cool to the touch.  This thing really cools my laptop.  I am really shocked and impressed with how well this device works.If you are noticing errors and experiencing the computer locking up on hot days, you might be overheating the computer.  Something like this side vent fan is just what the doctor ordered to keep a laptop cool.  I could not be more pleased with this product and the warranty is very good.  1 year free replacement for product defect and 30-day no hassle return & refund for incompatibility.You can't beat the cooling or the 1 year replacement warranty and if it doesn't fit, you can send it back within 30 days for a full refund.  So, you have nothing to lose and fantastic cooling to gain.This is a very decent laptop cooler that has made my laptop cool enough to use outside on hot days.** I received a complimentary sample of this laptop cooler in order that I might test it and leave this review.

This review is for:Debot Micro USB Car Charger for Samsung and Apple: 3.1A Dual USB Port Electric...This charger looks like a spark plug. That should make it popular amongst the gearheads in the group. It looks neat and has 3.1A of power through two USB ports.The style is the best thing about this charger. That and that it has two ports so you can charge two devices instead of just one. It works as expected, charging two devices at once while I drove into town to go to the store. Both devices were fully charged after the hour round trip.** I received this USB car charger at no charge in order that I may test it and provide this review.

This review is for:Weighter Kitchen Scale Serves - Professional Precision - Food in Gram Lbs...We all want simplicity.  We all want things that work well right out of the box with no extra steps to prepare the new item.  This is simply a kitchen scale and nothing more.  It works well.  I tested it with my scientific weight set and it is accurate.  You don't have to weigh right in the center to get a correct weight.The sellers state that this scale has no bells and whistles, it just works.  I would say that statement is true.I like that it is easy to use and has big numbers that are easy for me to see in my old age.  My eyes are not what they used to me and I appreciate the large digits.  I also like that this scale weighs the platform.  Other kitchen scales I have tested use the 4 feet as the weight sensors.  If you mess up one foot, the scale won't work anymore.  With this scale, the platform weighs and as I said, it weighs the same all over the platform.This is a very capable kitchen scale that is easy to clean and accurate on the weights.*I received a complimentary sample of this product in order that I might test it and provide this review.

This review is for:Hyperikon® LED Candle 3-Watt (30-Watt), Flame Tip Chandelier Bulb, Gold Housing, Candelabra Base (E12), 2300K (Amber GlowTM), 340°-Beam Angle, Dimmable, UL-ListedWe already have a set of LED chandelier bulbs in our kitchen fixture.  One is faulty so I got this one to replace it.  It give off a much warmer light than the bulb I replaced.  Now I want to do the whole fixture in this bulb.  The light is so nice.The bulb is a nice shape and comes to quite a peak.  The base on mine is gold, they also have a stainless colored base as well.  It looks nice in the fixture.  The candelabra base screwed in easily and seated well.  The light is on the instant you flip the switch.This is a very pretty bulb with a fine, warm light.  Light is 360 degrees from bulb.** I received this LED bulb at no charge in order that I may provide this review.

This review is for:Scouty's Travel Double Pet Bowl w/Bonus Single Dish, Bottle Loop & Clip - Pop-up Expandable / Collapsible Silicone - For Dogs and Cats, Food and WaterThis is an idea whose time has come.  We all travel with our pets and I'm sure we all have an old bowl we keep in the car for watering the pooch on trips.  But it takes up more space than it needs to.  This Scouty's travel bowl set compresses down to about 1" thick yet opens up to a full-sized water and food dish for travel.  It folds and unfolds easily.  It's easy to find a place to stuff it when not in use as it folds down so small.  It can even be slipped into a backpack for day trips with the dogs.The water bottle and bonus single bowl are excellent for trips to the dog park.  You can take water and a dish anywhere.  The design of the bowls is ingenious and I have some measuring cups that compress the same way.  It's really a space saving design.My dog, Freddy, drank his water and ate his food out of this dish last night and he loved it.  The shape helped him get the food into his mouth easier.  Although we will reserve this for travel, it was nice to see he didn't mind using it at all.  It is also easy to clean the bowls.This is a nicely designed pair of dog bowls with bonus water bowl that hooks to a bottle of water.  Very well-designed and works well.** I received this product at no charge so that I may test it and provide this review.

This review is for:Weighmax NJ100-BLACK Dream Series Digital Pocket Scale, 100 by 0.01 g, BlackI am a low grade coin collector and often times I need to weigh a coin to determine if it is real or counterfeit. I also barter with silver and this scale comes in really handy for weighing the silver to be traded for goods or services.The scale is black with that rubberized finish and feels good in your hand.  You can calibrate the scale with a 50 gram weight but I found it calibrated just fine right out of the box.  A one ounce coin weighs 1.003 ozt.  That's close enough for my use.It weighs in grams, ounces, ounces Troy and carats.  The clear lid comes off and can be used as a weighing tray for bulkier items.  The scale is small enough to fit into your pocket or backpack.  I plan to take mine to coins shows to weigh coins to ensure they are real.  It will also be handy the day that I get a handful of diamonds I need to weigh.  You know, when I win the lottery?This is a very nice, capable scale that weighs in several weights and is small enough to fit in your pocket. Plus, all Weighmax scales come with a limited 10 year warranty against failure.** I received a complimentary sample of this Weighmax Digital scale in order that I may test it and provide this review.

Aromatherapy (Quickstudy: Health) pamphlet is laminated and easy to understand.The cover page gives a definition of what Aromatherapy is. Tells you what oils are used in Aromatherapy (essential oils and carrier oils). The Safety Precaution column gives good advice on what to do and not do with essential oils. It also has a section on Using Essential Oils, Purchasing Essential Oils and Storing Essential Oils. On the two inside pages it gives you information on 24 of the most popular essential oils. The information they tell you are the botanical name for the oil, actions, uses and cautions of each one. The back cover  gives you a glossary of words with definitions along with a therapeutic index of traditional use. Pros:- easily dissolves, even in front washers with little water- fights typical tough stains- doesn't disturb colorsCons:- price compared to powder is a little high.Overall though, I can easily recommend this product of you want something that dissolves easily and you have problem with powders. It is an effective little ball.

Pros:- Buying the bulk 40 pound package will save you money, significantly cheaper than the smaller packages per pound.neutral:- Their special water coating amounts to about 50% of the weight. Basically, if you buy the same 40 pound bag from another manufacturer without the coating, you'd be getting about twice as much seed.Cons:- growing was very subpar. maybe 10-15% germination. Despite watering as directed.Some people have had good results, but based on the reviews a lot of others have had similar poor experiences. Basically, good luck. I hear Scotts has good support, and refund policy. Pros:- natural- mild effect?Cons:- limited effectiveness?- close to oil texture than toothpaste. I.e easy to run off or spill.Overall, it's hard to tell if this product works well or not for teething. I am giving it 3 stars, because it is natural and based on using it myself (full grown adult) I felt a tiny bit of numbing (very tiny) my guess is baby might feel it more.Wish the texture was a little harder.Baby's fuzziness/crying didn't really improve, which is why I am leaving the rating as neutral 3 star.

This stainless steel diaper pail might be the one you want.Pros:- Uses standard bags. This the reason I opted for 4 stars instead of 3. We've had multiple of these, and all required proprietary and very expensive bag refills. This one uses any standard trash bag.- Stainless steel throughout.- lid seals to keep odors in- Attaching a new bag is a simple process.Cons:- The video shows the diapers falling all the way down after you press the buttons and close the lid. Sadly to report this is not the case. The diapers stay near the top, you have to push them down with your hand or another object. I guess if you have a tremendously heavy diaper it might fall all the way down, but normal diapers aren't going down.- At almost $90 its more expensive than just about every other diaper pail.Neutral:- Just an obvious warning, the diaper pail is Gray. The picture makes it look a little like stainless steel outside (add in the stainless steel diaper naming) and it's a little confusing. It's not silver, its plain gray, does not look like stainless steel in any way. The picture is kind of accurate, its just easy to think you are getting a stainless steel looking pail given the name and the picture. But its plastic gray.Overall, given the use of any trash bags, this is a good diaper pail. Buying refills won't break the bank, just use the same ones you already have. Initial purchase price is more expensive than it should be, but overall I am happy with this.7/10

Received a broken product. Sparks as soon as you plug into wall. Fortunately it didn't fry the iPad I was trying to charge.I will update the review depending on the customer service from Belkin and the replacement part they send

I was torn between 3 and 4 stars on this chocolate. The pros and cons should explain this.Pros:- Very creamy (almost melts in your mouth)- hazelnuts are sprinkled generously throughout- good taste and textureNeutral- At around $4 a bar, it's not expensive for quality chocolate.- Made by NestleCons- The first ingredient is sweetened condensed milk. While I don't have anything against this (and I absolutely LOVED it as a kid) this makes this chocolate incredibly sweet. Way too sweet in my opinion. The good thing about the sweetness is that I couldn't eat more than 1 small half and inch piece.- The second big problem of it being mostly condensed milk, is that the chocolate kind of loses the chocolate taste. It tastes more like caramel. Again not a bad thing, but not what I expected of a chocolate bar, and contributed to the overly sweet nature of this bar.Honestly, if you are looking for a creamy caramel + chocolate bar, with hazelnuts, and love very sweet chocolate, you will likely love this bar. For me, it was too much sugar, too much caramel flavor and not enough chocolate.

As a bilingual parent, trying hard for my daughters to speak Spanish as well - while being born in the USA, it's good to see toys like these, with both languages. Now, this is not a language learning tool, but the phrases at least are clear and not robotic sounding like other toys.Pros:- soft and cute looking- not very expensive- english and spanish songs and phrasesNeutral:- Since Shakira is partnering with Fisher-Price on these, I was partially hoping we had her voice in the toy. It does not.Cons:- The songs are only quick glimpses of a toy. 15-30 seconds. So not full songs at all.- Despite being bilingual is mostly an English language toy. It's not split 50-50 it's more like 80% English, 20% Spanish.- Can't wash it very well because of the electronics. and 1-3 year olds are messy creatures.Given the low price, this is probably a 7/10 product. Not enough to give it 4 stars, but probably a little better than 3 stars.

This product is hard to beat as an ABC puzzle.Pros:- Bright colors / paintings- Puzzle (most all children love puzzles)- Wood pieces (will last A LOT longer than the cheap cardboard pieces)- Flip over wood base and you got a pretend little stove. (My almost 4 year old, LOVES this)Neutral:- If there is anything slightly iffy, is that it's a very non-traditional puzzle, so there are no clean shapes that fit into each other. They kind of go side be side together, but they don't "snap" or anything like that. I like the fact that it is non-standard, but just wanted to point this out.- Little expensive for a puzzle, but given the quality and the stove and materials, you are getting value for your money.Overall, you can't go wrong with this puzzle. Made of rubber wood, with bright colors and a little flip over stove, it's bound to be a favorite of your child.

This product is ok, but it's just hard to recommend at it's current price and the flavor/smell can go from ok, to not good at all.Pros:- organic- Relatively healthy ingredientsNeutral:- not all pouches mix as well, sometimes it takes a little work to get a decent mix.- Depending on flavor, some pouches can have unpleasant smells. I put this as neutral since a lot of baby food (especially those using broccoli and other strong veggies) smell pretty bad themselves.- For those who are trying to avoid corn (which is now in virtually all food) these have corn starch.Cons:- At $2 per pouch, even when buying in bulk its expensive. I buy other organic fruit pouches from Costco at less than $1 per pouch. Granted, it's fruit with a little big of vegetables, but thats less than half the price. And those are ready to eat, no need to mix anything.Overall, if the price was closer to $1.50 a pouch, might be easier to justify, but as it stands I can't recommend it without warning. You are paying a premium price, and the product is ok, but not perfect. If it mixed super easily, if the combinations were healthy but also tasted and smelled good, then maybe you could start justifying the high price.

I'm torn about this product.Pros:- Mirror is large- You can adjust the position with some success to look at the child.- Mirror is so large, it might even keep your baby distracted/amazed looking at herself in the mirror.Cons:- Very cheaply made. Like most people, I'm familiar with plastic "stuff". Most toys and gadgets are made of plastic. So at some point, you can tell which is a good quality plastic and what is a very cheap plastic. This mirror is made of very cheap plastic.- The straps also look very cheap/weak as does the locking mechanism. I don't think these will last long.- I read a lot about mirrors and found out that recommendations from safety regulations say it's better to skip the mirror. Their are two main reasons.1. In the event of an accident, the mirror can become  projectile and hit your child or other passengers, making it dangerous.2. You need to be focused on the road, and this way to see the child can distract a driver and cause accidents.Basically, now I'm torn if I'm going to use it or not based on what I've read. Just wanted to point it out here, because it doesn't seem like it's very common knowledge about the risks (especially #1).

Pros:- materials well suited for kids. (nothing toxic, which believe it or not, is still common in a lot of yoga mats)- monkey pattern is cute, and should last a while.- Definitely does not slip. I have very slick floors in the house, and this sticks to the floor like glue almost.Cons:- The "handle". It's sad because it's supposed to be a feature, but I feel like they over thought this too much. Sure, its easier to carry if you want to move it around fully opened, but that's like almost never. if you roll it up, like most people, the handle is pointless. This wouldn't really be something against it, except that now my daughter wants to tug at it from the handle all the time. The handle does not have any reinforced stitching or anything, and I am afraid this will be the first part of the mat to break- It's super skinny. .15 inches to be exact. its almost like sitting on the floor. Children don't mind sitting on the floor much, but feels like they went extreme on the thinness.Overall though - if you don't mind the thinness this is a decent quality mat, as a decent price.It has a fun pattern for the child, without being too distracting. So I recommend this mat.However, I debated giving it 3 stars, because there are other kid mats in the $15-$20 dollar range, and these are on the higher $30+ dollar range of mats. I was going to take it down a star due to thinness, but upon some research I saw that most kid yoga mats are super thin, some even thinner than this one.

This product could've been better and I might have rated it 4-5 stars if it weren't for the two issues it has.Cons:- The biggest issue by far is no temperature reading on the thermometer. You know how bluetooth connections can sometimes be finicky, and this thermometer is 100% useless without the app and bluetooth pairing. A small readout on the thermometer would've made a big difference. Sometimes you just want a quick temperature reading and don't want to depend on the bluetooth pairing and finding the phone.- The cap that it comes with to store it, falls off easily. There is no way to secure it, it's so loose, if you tip it at a small angle down it'll slide off and fall. You don't even have to nudge it over. This makes this protective cap almost useless.- Taking a child's temperature when they are moving is hard and gives errors. (especially tying to get an oral reading). Looks like if they move a little the reading needs to be started over.Pros:- You can have different readouts over time. Say you are checking on the fever progression of your little one. You take 8 temperature readings over 3 days, and you can get an idea if it's going up or down. The app logs and stores them under your child's profile. You can have multiple profiles for each child, yourself, etc.- It works on all 3 common areas (oral, rectal, under arm)- tip is flexible, so there is very little worry if this breaking.Neutral/Gimmicks- There is an area for symptom tracking, where you check of symptoms. The helpfulness of this is questionable.- The screen turns red/yellow/green depending on the temperature reading... I guess if you do not know what temperature means a fever, and you own a smartphone that cannot search google for the information, this might be helpful... not.- Upload a photo of your child along with the name! In case you forget your child's name, you now have a picture of them. If your forget their name and how they look like, this app won't help though.Overall, I feel like they got a lot of things right with this product. But as it stands, it seems like a first generation product, and their next version might correct these issues and make it a 4-5 star product.

This set looks decent for the cost, but does have extra pieces to clean.Pros:- tops are supposed to move like a nipple and easy to move back and forth between breast feeding.- Quality of plastic is very good (BPA free etc)- Colors are vibrant- Included brush works well for the bottle, and also of good quality.Cons:- It has extra pieces to clean, and that's more effort when you are tired and sleepy. Basically, it has 5 pieces as opposed to 3 of other bottles.

We like this toy, and the intricacies of the instrument means it will be interesting (it is interesting to our almost 4 year old) will last from infant to probably 5 years old.That said, they missed some opportunities.Pros:- Solid, well built.- Add or remove instruments of any of the 8 songs.- Songs are not annoying like other toysCons:- lights are all yellow. Pictures made it seem like each side would have its own color, but all the lights are yellow.- touching single instruments plays the same 10-15 second tune. This can get annoying. While touching the orchestra you can cycle through 8 songs, and add and remove instruments to each different song, if you tap the piano or just the violin to start, it's the same tune, over and over and over.Overall the ability to add and remove instruments, or touch an instrument to hear that sound separate from the rest should provide a fun present.

I've worked with computers and smartphones for a while. But I've always thought wearables (specially smart watches) don't seem to make much sense. But these fitness bands might have a place. This review will get long, as I'll be very thorough, and update it at various intervals.The rating reflects my first 24 hours with the band, but every few weeks or months I'll add to the review depending on how it goes. This review is based on the band paired with an iphone 6.PROS:+ Super easy pairing. I read some reviews saying it requires a computer in addition to a smartphone to pair. This is not true with this band. Basically charge the band and download the UP app on the phone. Then open the app and itll guide you. It paired in less than 15 seconds, completely flawlessly.+ Band updates, not just on the app. The second thing it did automatically was download some updates. Apparently you use to have to tap the band to change between sleep, high impact and other activities. Not anymore. The band does it all automatically. I have a newborn right now, and it did a surprisingly accurate take on my copious amounts of sleep and perfectly sound, 8 full hours of deep sleep. (Reported 5 hours and 2 wake ups between 2-7am which seems accurate as far as i remember)+ The band is comfortable light and secure. Clearly the listened to the issues people,had with previous band and did something about it. I cant see a normal scenario where this would fall off my hand. Its secure.+ People said they prefer other apps to sync to report food etc, but honestly i like the included food area here. It tracks a ton of different food and keeps calorie counts, etc. pretty impressive and i didnt expect it. Very easy to use. That said, the app is still very much based on food pyramid that pushes milk products as healthy even though if you do any research (Harvard recently removed dairy from their healthy food pyramid) you'll see dairy isn't the best thing for you. And yes, i eat and love pizza and Greek yogurt and ice cream and..+ looks good. I've seen some bands that look kind of odd. This one blends in and looks good.+ i really like the app with all the charts and the "smart coach", tells you what you are up to, steps ofmthe day percentages, compares calories eaten vs calories burned and more.+ silent alerts are a nest way to let you know something is up without an annoying ring.+ claims of a 10 day battery life, which is great. And takes they say about 90 minutes to charge to full.Neutral:- if battery dies, whole product needs to be replaced.- comes with a USB dongle but no wall charger, so you have to charge on a computer or borrow a wall to USB charger.- no instructions in the box. Just 1 page that says charge band abd download app. Just an FYI, it was just surprising. It took me a couple of minutes to figure out the band mechanism to adjust it to my wrist. Its easy, but having 1 drawing on how it goes on the printed paper would have been nice. The videos and information on the App, reference the old clasp, so they were useless.- id like the option of not synching so often to use less phone battery. Would be nice if you could choose to only sync every other hour ormwhatever custom amount you choose. As it stands it does it very frequently.CONS:- honestly have nothing bad to say about this product yet. Ill update the review as i gather more data.UPDATE #1- while it seems to have a good idea of when I fall asleep, and when I wake up for good in the morning, the middle of the night wake ups weren't showing up at all the past 2 nights. One particularly awful night of sleep when both my daughters woke up multiple times, and I was up at least 5 times was reported as my "best sleep" and had a shiny flowing light because I met my objective of 7 hours of sleep. So, I'll keep my eye out on this, at least start and end time seems accurate, but in between seems iffy at this point.UPDATE #2- After about a week, it's very clear to me that the sleep tracker is indeed mediocre at best. Everything from if I stay in bed an hour or so after waking up, it still counts as sleeping. Taking 1 star off the review due to this. Basically, sleep tracking just doesn't work very well, which is a bummer as it was one of the things I wanted to see.- Battery life seems accurate. Not sure how long it'll stay this long, but it works well. And it charges within 2 hours. So while you cook and eat dinner you can charge it, then be back tracking after that.- Bluetooth connection has been steady. I have had absolutely no issues on pairing. It has never had any issues syncing or anything else.- Still love the app, but I have started to notice some weird things in their food rankings. And foods that are easily found on other tracking apps (like my fitness pal) aren't found in UP. You can manually enter them, but it's weird. Steam broccoli, with lettuce/avocacado/tomato salad, with grilled tempeh and a cup of quinoa gives you a core of 8.2 in the health index. But a peanut butter and chocolate protein bar, gets a 9.5 as a super healthy choice. However, looking up those same foods in any online source, rate the energy bar as a D+ food, while the other as an A foo choice.- I shower with the band all the time, have played basketball, soccer, and other activities with it, not once have I ever had any issue with band coming loose or falling. It's a tiny bit harder to take off than a watch, but its very secure and won't fall off.

A friend of my daughter has this set and my daughter always goes to play with it (almost 4 years old now). However I feel like they went super cheap and it's not that great, however younger kids will likely still love it.Pros;- Has Anna, Olaf and Sven included.- sled as an extra dimension of play to the set.Cons:- while you can tell who the characters are, they are fairly poor replicates. Neither of the 3 look very close to the original animations. Not Anna, not Sven, not even Olaf. If they had spent a little more time getting a quality replica, I'd rate this set at least 4 stars. Anna looks very plain, more like a random girl instead of the princess that she is, and they made her hair bright blonde instead of the red/brown she has. Olaf looks silly, and not in a cute way.The other big fail, is that it's just a capitalize on Frozen fever play dough set. They didn't spend time to make a product that makes more sense. Like say, create icecubes and have kristoff transport them, or make play dough flowers or something more congruent. The set as it stands is kind of like here are among the most favorite characters from frozen and here are some play dough jars we needed to sell. Which is fine, but could've been better for sure.Overall though, our daughter loves it, and most children will love it too. But if they are very particular that something doesn't looks like how they expectIt, probably stay away from this set

I wish more thermostats would specify if they work with a wireless setup. A lot (most do not) but some battery operated - like this one - do work with a wireless setup. This does not work with a wireless setup. (Different from wifi in case you are confused when I first found this out a few years ago).pros:- app is pretty easy to use- can be installed horizontally or vertically. I like the horizontal one myself but I can see vertical being useful if installing in a narrow wall or between switches in a wall.- it's a clean modern design. Not as elegant as the nest, but I like the ability to program this one, as opposed to the Nest thinking it can do better than you automatically.Cons:None very obvious yet. I hadn't heard of this company before so I hope the product works well in the long run.Note:If you see this review beyond 2016, post a comment and it will prompt me to update based on the longetivity  and performance so far.Initial impression is good.

Pros:- Lots of crinkling parts (the ears, the legs, the tailall make a crinkling noise when touched)- Different textures. The hooves, the horns, the hind legs, the rail, the forehead the nose, the ears, all have slightly different textures.- Very soft. I disagree with reviewers who says this doesn't work as a blanket, it totally does, it's that soft. Not a carry with you everywhere you go blanket (too big for that) but around the house on a particular cold day, you can totally put this over the baby with supervision.- Quality is very good. There were no loose threads anywhere or unfinished patches. Everything was perfectly sewn together.Cons:- Pricey. At almost $50, it's no cheap.- Situational. You can't really carry it around, so it's mostly a use at home item.- Because of the crinkling parts, and different textures and gentle colors, its not the easiest product to wash if/when your baby has a diaper accident on top. Or throw up, or all the other fun things babies do :)Overall, if you are expecting a little play mat that looks exceedingly cute, is well made, and you can drop your baby for tummy time or play time on it, this is a good choice. If you want a matt you can "travel" more with, this might not be the best choice.

Lets break it down in simple pros and cons:Pros:- Nursing mom thinks it's helping. Hard to tell with these things.- Dissolves relatively easilyNeutral- Citrus flavor, while it contains sugar, it's very little. I tried it and thought it was good. Just a little citrus with virtually no sugar. But my wife who is the one drinking it, hates it. She mixes it with orange juice and says she doesn't taste it at all then. So if you hate the flavor, I suggest just adding the powder to your favorite citrus juice and you'll be fine.Cons:- It's not an obvious: "this is really helping with milk production" so it's hard for us to recommend it and say it is clearly working.Overall, it's a good way for those who enjoy a drink more than the more common hot tea bags of fenugreek or the pills.

This is a very strange "new product" and I've trying to figure out what it is. Check out the less expensive Aerogarden 3SL which as far as I can tell is identical to this one, but around $20 dollars less. (You can find it for $49.99 dollar regularly).I own 2 Aergardens Ultra  (the LED variety, which light lasts 3-5 years before needing replacement and grow 7 plants each).When it was first offered to me, I checked and it read that this was an LED. So I thought the Aerogarden Sprout, was just an LED version of the Aerogarden 3SL, sadly to say, it is not. This is a CFL bulb with mercury, that you need to dispose ever 6 months, and buy another one for around $15. Amazon appears to have fixed their product description and LED is now not mentioned anywhere.But again, this product looks identical on every way to the 3SL, which is cheaper. So it begs the question as what exactly is this?The box or instruction manual it came with does not even list the Aerogarden Sprout anywhere. There is no branding anywhere that tells you which Aerogarden this is. So my suspicion is that they had an overstock of the 3SL and are trying to rebrand them as Aergarden Sprout, which sounds like a better name that came from the marketing department to try to fix slow sales of the 3SL.Ok, that rant out of the way, lets start with the pros and cons:Pros:- Occupies very little space. Can fit between the kitchen counter and cabinets, even when fully extended.- Very easy cleanup. (Cleaning up the Aerogarden ultra after a big season is like a half an our job. This one is like 2 minutes.)- Grows herbs fine.- Simple operation, just 2 buttons to set the light and the nutrients, thats it.Cons:- Replace propietary CFL bulbs every 6 months. These contain mercury and need to be disposed properly. It's not that simple and it's time consuming depending on where you live to do this properly.- It doesn't extend very much, so not only do you only grow 3 items, but they won't grow very big. Basil can take up the full extension of the Aerogarden ultra which reaches about twice as much as this one and product a ton of basil. This one will produce much less, even if I plant only 3 basil plants on the ultra and 3 on this Sprout, the Ultra would produce about 3 times as much basil.Overall, I am not a big fan of corporations claiming they are releasing a new product, even though they are just rebranding a poor seller. If this product was an LED, I'd feel better and give it a better rating, but as it stands, it's wasteful and to top it off, it's more expensive than the 3SL which is its twin.So, if you have very little space and need a small aerogarden, and you live in a town which makes it easy to dispose lightbulbs with mercury, this might be a good fit, otherwise, I'd get any of their LED products.I've changed the review from 2 stars to 1 star based on the following additional issues:- it's loud. I thought I'd get used to it, but it sounds like if you're must've boiling water in the kitchen and it's on an unstable pot that vibrates. By comparison, the much larger Ultra sounds like more like a pleasant water fountain and it is not nearly as loud or have all the vibrations this one does. Main problem is just that it's all plastic, there is no rubber to reduce vibration, and pump is at the edge, while the ultra pump is deep in the center under a lot of water so it's significantly quieter.- the other disappointing issue is that there is half a finger of space between plants (after the domes/seeds are in) basically not much space at all. I'd be shocked if this produces more than 1/5 (20%) of what the ultra produces. The ultra has 6 times as much space in between. (I can fit 3 full fingers in any direction, while not even 1 fits in the sprout)- Another issue for all CFL lights, is that they burn what they touch. So if you don't watch your plants closely, the taller ones will get burnt. LED versions do not get hot, and you can forget for a few days, then trim and you get perfectly fine produce, even the one directly touching the LED for over 24 hours.Updated back to 2 stars, because their customer service is excellent and that adds value to any product. I actually talked to an account manager, and I wanted to point out what they said:- This product is identical to the 3SL but with an improved pump. apparently the 3sl had bad reviews mainly due to the pump which made for little growth and high failures. They changed manufacturer of the pumps and now all the issues of the 3SL should be improved.- contrary to some people who still insist (view comments section) this product is NOT an LED. Manager confirmed this as well.- 3sl is getting phased out due to the pump issue, so soon you'll no longer be able to buy it. The sprout is the replacement product fixing old issues.UPDATE on growth:* With my other Aerogardens, each pod usually produces around 3-4 starts, which typically end up as 2-3 strong growing plants (when doing basil, which is what I started here.* It's only one sample, but I got just 1 start on 2 of the pods, and 2 starts on the other. So 4 total plants growing out of 3 pods. This is virtually the equivalent of just 1 of the pods on the Ultra LED.Aerogarden introduced 9 new Gardens, all very decent products in their fall 2015 revamp. This Sprout is the only one they retained with CFL bulbs. All the rest are LEDs and much better. Spend the extra money on the Sprout Plus (this one but with LED bulbs) you'll get better growth and save money in the long term. (yes, better product that in 1.5 years is already cheaper than this one, based on power consumption and cost of replacement bulbs). Plus you don't need to deal with mercury every 6 months trying to find a facility that can properly dispose of these.Honestly, they just wanted as cheap as possible entry level product, and a way to keep selling their huge stockpile of CFL bulbs. The LED gardens are the way to go. No toxic elements, and no replacing every 6 months. Disappointed.

Here will be a journal of the 8 weeks of use of this thing, starting from day one. I'll use this every day and post updates periodically during this time.About me:4 years ago before having children I was in great shape and had a visible 6 pack, now I'm 20 pounds heavier, and the 6 pack is gone.Expectations:Since I know that the weight gain is the main culprit, and my abs won't come back unless I also lose at least 15 pounds, I don't expect to have a 6 pack back after this 8 weeks. This device is not to lose weight, it's just a convenient way for me to "exercise" my abs while I cook, clean, feed my daughter, or other miscellaneous household chores. So I am hoping my abs feel like they are getting a workout and my core feels stronger in 8 weeks. I am not coming in with the 100% unrealistic expectation of a toned stomach after 8 weeks, this is no miracle, it's just electrical stimulus for the abs, not a melting machine for the extra layer of me in between it and my abs.Basic hardware review.Pros:- Belt seems durable, comfortable- Easy setup.- Batteries were included, and it uses standard AAA batteries (3 of them), so you can use/buy your own easily.Cons:- The control unit is thick and old school. They suggest you can wear this under your suite for work. Sure, it will fit under your clothes, and the belt itself would not be noticeable, but the control unit is unnecessarily thick and looks like very cheap plastic construction. There is no hiding the control unit under any type of clothes. Maybe under 3 coats in the middle of winter while shoveling snow you can wear this outside. Otherwise it's an indoor only use. Again, if they had spent some money making a better and slimmer control panel you could get away with wearing this under a suite or a coat, but it's over half an inch thick. Anyhow, big bulge, saying you can use it under you coat is misleading. Sure you can, but you'll look real funny.- The pads need to be replaced periodically, and there are no spares included.Week by week review:Day 1:- Initial setup was easy, about 5 minutes being careful with the pads and making sure I read the instructions.- I started increasing the intensity (goes from 0 - 130) and it curiously does it independently by side. So you can have 1 side at 20 and the other at 40. (It has 3 contact points, the center cannot be controlled, only the 2 sides.- From 0 to about 14 I felt absolutely nothing, then each tick after that felt like I was just getting shocked. I double checked all the contact points and everything was in order, all contact points completely covered, the position of the belt, etc. Tried it again, and same thing. Since I've never had electrical stimulus, I am just going to assume it feel like yes, you are getting shocked.- I did the initial quick setup recommended time of 20 minutes. I set the left side at 22 and the right side at 20. That was as much "shock" as I was willing to tolerate for the first go around. Despite the increase on the left side, I still felt I was getting shocked more on the right side.- Since I hadn't really exercised my abs (I play soccer and basketball once a week each, but not real other exercise) I was expecting my abs to be sore the next day. They are always sore if I do a lot of abs after not doing them for a while. To my disappointment, my abs felt like I had done nothing at all the day before. I'll see today if I can tolerate higher shocks, but as of now the jury is out, and not looking good.- The 20 minutes I wore this, I was playing with my daughter, mildly active, running around. and did some crunches at the same time (only a dozen or so) just to experience the dual action.Ill update this weekly or so during the next 8 weeks. I've never tried one of these "As seen on tv" products, my expectations are pretty low, but since I am getting a chance to review it, I figure I'd give it a chance.End of Week 1:- The unit still feels like it's electrocuting me a little. My abs have not felt sore at all.- I'm using it for 25 minutes. You can control each side individually.  but they stop you at a 10 intensity level difference. So basically, I can up my left side to 33 and feel fine (was going to push it further), but any extra level there ups the right side by 1. And at past 24, the right side electric shock is way too much to handle, feels way stronger than the left one at 34. Not sure what the deal is to be honest.- Overall it's easy and convenient to wear, but I'm not feeling my abs getting much of a workout and the right side is shocking really hard beyond 24.AFTER 3 weeksI've been using this between 6 and 7 days a week with an occassional day that i use it twice.I contacted customer support and they were mildly helpful. Id say average, not great not terrible. I believe the pads that came with it have issues and thats why one side is getting stronger shocks. Ill update if they send replacements or not.Overall I've increased it to 60-50. At these levels you can feel yoir ab muscles contract. I still haven't been sore or any other feeling i get when really excercising the abs, so can't comment on the effectiveness.I'll keep using and give an assessment after 8 weeks.For now one of the pads wants to fall off and i expect it will have to be replaced soon. The sticky sides start losing stickiness and are harder to avoid removing it when tsking off the cover/plastic pads.

This is an excellent product, and depending on cost (still unclear at this time what it is going to cost) I would recommend it over the other typical BOSE speakers. I own 2 products of the BOSE Soundlink family. They are both $299, and can operate plugged in or via a battery.I want to get the bad things out of the way, because it really is a good speaker, and what I hope is the future sound systems. I was very interested in being able to listen to my Spotify playlist from the device for example. The device clearly lists Pandora and Spotify as systems you can use. But...Cons:- To listen to Spotify you require a paid subscription to spotify. If you are a casual Spotify users with a free subscription, you cannot use it with this product at all. And while this is more on Spotify than Bose, I think it's important to point this out, to avoid more frustrated users. If I were Bose, I'd make that clear on the product description. Again, requires a paid subscription to Spotify to work with this.- Soundtouch app is mediocre. Other reviewers are singing it praises, but that was not my experience at all. First off, you need to her very close to the device for it to work. Doesn't work from across a large room. In a bedroom it might be fine, but in the living room, one end to the other, the app didn't recognize the speaker (which was on and playing music). When I first download it, it took about 10 minutes to be functional. Upon opening the app, it stayed on with a "downloading updates" message on and I couldn't do anything.Once it was done downloading updates setting up the wifi to work with it was straight forward. The app itself is a little clunky and not polished at all. I'd consider the interface a step back in time. Lots of 3D effects and lights and animation, but little semblance of the user experience. Honestly, I rather use the remote that came with the product. The sound touch app is currently rated as 2.5/5 stars on the apple app store, so it's not just me who feels this app is mediocre. It's not horrible and you can still get your presets set up and system connected, but it's not a good experience.Ok, with the bad things out of the way, I wanted to point out why I still love this device.Pros:- No waiting for bluetooth. One of my pet peeves about the Bose Soundlink speakers is that sometimes they connect to my phone instantly and I can stream Spotify or whatever, but the other times, I spend 10 minutes and cannot get it to connect unless I do a hard reser of both the phone and the speaker to forget all devices then re-pair again. I have other bluetooth speakers that are much better at pairing than Bose. Either way, you still have to pair, and you still cannot talk on the phone while music plays through the speaker. This solves the issue. It connects to wifi and grants you access to your 6 most used settings instantly.- Pandora free can be used. I linked up my pandora account, and quickly filled 4/6 spots with different Pandora stations. Now I can get home, grab the remote and press the number 4 and start listening to my selected music. Didn't have to pick up my phone, hope bluetooth connects, open the pandora app on my phone, make sure the output is going to the Bose speakers and not my earphones or phone speakers.- You can still use bluetooth if you want. My biggest pet peeve, not able to use it with Spotify free, can be circumvented by using the bluetooth system. I haven't tested this enough to know if it's better than the awful bluetooth pairing on the Sounlink, but hopefully it's improved.- The sound is comparable to the Soundlink II. The size is very close too. This one is slightly larger, but not by much. But takes less space because it's not nearly as wide (you can tell from the picture, it's taller rather than wider).  It is very good and gets louder than I thought it would. I was not expecting it to get that loud. I preferred the sound from the Soundlink a tiny bit more, but it's very close in my non-audiophile opinion.Neutral and other observations- No batteries for this one. It must be plugged in to work.- Requires wifi for most of its features.- Requires an iOS or android device for setup through their mediocre sound touch app.- Remote battery included.- I hope they get more providers working for them. Right now its mainly Pandora (free or paid), Spotify (only paid version), iheartradio. Adding apple music, amazon prime music, and other popular music systems would be great. Being an amazon prime customer, I am bummed to not see prime music included here.Overall I can recommend this device to anyone who does not need it use it away from a wall plug. It eliminates the need for a smartphone whenever it is going to be used (requires it just for setup - or an android or apple tablet). If you love pandora, and hate setting up bluetooth pairing every time you get home, this is the way to go and hopefully more speaker systems will keep going this route.

This set is very good and I can recommend to anyone.I debated between 4 and 5 stars, but I didn't like that not all the items were the washable variety, so I dropped a star from it. Particularly the crayons.Pros:- Washable markers- Minion carrying case is very colorful and sturdy enough to last a little while.- Plenty of items (colors, crayons, markers, coloring pages, and more)Cons:- Crayons are not the super washable variety, and if you've had to clean the regular crayola crayons of some light color surfaces you know it is no fun. (magic erasers help a lot - discovered it after trying a bunch of cleaners to no avail).Neutral:- The price is a little high, so there is a premium for the case itself. Most of the items inside can be had separately for $2 - $8 dollars. So if you find a good crayons and marker sale, you can buy the whole collection for just around $12 - 15 dollars excluding the coloring pages. Normal prices it's closer to $25-30. Anyway, just wanted to point this out.

I'm honestly surprised at the high praise of these bars. So much, that I wanted to rate them as 1 star to start balancing out the praise a little. But overall, I feel these are a 2.5 star product, so I went high because the flavor is good.This review is in particular for the blueberry and acai dark chocolate and nut flavor. I have tried their blueberry/acai dark chocolates and those I'd rate higher than these bars.Lets start on a positive note.Pros:1. Good flavor.2. Crunchy but not too hard. (some nut bars are way crunchy and gooey, this is not one of them).3. Dark chocolate is very good quality.4. Ingredients are better than regular candy bars, no high fructose corn syrupHowever, the problem with these bars is they pretend they are some sort of healthy alternative bars, and they are far from it. Please read through the ingredient list (can be seen on the images on the product page itself). I'll list a few of the suspicious ones below.Cons:- No Acai. None. Not acai juice, not in the smaller "less than 2% section" not anywhere. They got nothing. I'm not sure how manufacturers are allowed to say these are blueberry and acai bars, when there is no acai at all. (there are blueberries...) This is false advertisement and lose 1 star for it.. Not ok for manufacturers to get away with this. If you do read closer, you'll see the bars claim it's just "Acai flavor" and not acai itself. But the product description in amazon does not make that clear at all.- The ingredients... IF this was labeled a candy bar, I'd give it a pass. But for a product trying to be healthy, just read through the list. Here is a highlight of some of them: In terms of sugars, it does a well job of covering them all: sugar, high maltose corn syrup, invert sugar, glycerin (maybe more a preservative than a sugar but still).- The blueberries and cranberries in the bar are sweetened. If it wasn't enough that fruits are naturally sweet, and dried fruit even sweeter, both the cranberries and blueberries have added sugar. Add to the fact that the bar already has tons of other sugars (in the chocolate, on the nuts, as the binding agent, etc, its another over the top sugar addition. This bar is a little too sweet because of all the sugar. 13g in total which is more than a glazed krispy cream donut (10g). Granted this is still less than a milky way or snickers bars which are close to 20g. Though they are also bigger in size.For what it's worth this product is manufactured by Hersheys.Overall, these bars taste good, and don't have high fructose corn syrup. Additionally they have less sugar content than candy bars, but overall not the healthy choice it tries to market itself as.

Pros:- Realistic- Change of clothes- chubby like most newborn babiesNeutral comments:Some reviewers said they got a baby with an open mouth instead of smiling. I am not sure it's just the odds or they changed the page to reflect it, but the description said smiling baby and I got smiling baby. Again, it could be a coincidence, or they updated the description to correctly reflect what baby you are getting.- knees/arms/legs etc don't bend at all. It is permanently with knees partially bent, same with elbows.- I think increasing the size to a more realistic 18-20 inches would've been good. This one is about 14 inches.Cons:- A little hard, would've been nice if the skin was a little bit soft.Daughter absolutely loves it (she isa few months shy of her 4th birthday) she can put on the diaper and play with it.The only downside is that it's not as comfortable to sleep with, like the previous baby she owned that was getting really dirty and broken down after 3+ years. That one was soft and she could snuggle it better. This one"pokes" her.Overall I recommend this toy for any child that loves dressing up and playing with babies. It is more realistic than most baby toys, and the change of clothing and diapers is a good touch. Don't expect it to bend or be soft and cuddly though.

Read before you buy. This might be good for what you want, or maybe not. It's hard to recommend without reservations.Pros:- The pattern is very cute and gender neutral- made from organic cotton.- All the seams and stitching is very well made, with no stranded strings or sloppy looking stitching anywhere (which is found in almost all inexpensive towels.- Generous size to really wrap up your child nice and cozy (up to about 6 months or so)- dries fastCons:- The towel is not as soft as you would think given the description and materials. In fact it's rougher than some of our adult towels here at home. It also gets rougher after a few washes.- Super thin. So while it might dry fast, it also gets soaked fast. Manufacturer claims it is very absorbent, while that might be true, most towels are twice as thick as this one, and as such about twice as absorbent.Neutral:- You might want to wash it alone, in cold water for a while and see if yours shed. We usually wash with whites and haven't noticed more than the normal brand new slight shedding, but other reviewers here have reported that, so it's worth keeping an eye out for it.Overall, it has a good price for an organic cotton towel, and if your baby has strong skin this will be a good choice/value. But if you care about being extra soft, and want something thicker, you are better looking elsewhere.

This is a good conditioner. Rich, detangles hair very well.It is also priced very competitively and does as good a job as more expensive conditioners.For reference, I have long very thick slightly wavy hair.Given the price, the generous size I can recommend it to anyone.

Of the 4 cases I have, this one ranks as the 3rd that I like the most. It's ok, but unless you like the color swapping it does, there really isn't much that stands out.Pros:- Case is slim. (2nd slimmest of my cases)- Sufficient shock protection.- Comes with a screen protector (I didn't think these were important, as I've never used them on my previous iPhones and never had a problem with glass screens, but my 6+ scratched the first month, no idea how, and hasn't scratched since I started using screen shields.- Cut outs are all in the right places- Price is very competitive and sometimes they have additional coupons (currently they have a 20% clip coupon)Neutral:- It comes with the 3 interchangeable plates. So if you have a gold colored phone, you can match it with the respective plastic plate.- Rubber around it is not as grippy as others.- I'd prefer the case to be single material, instead of having the insert for the different plates. It just looks not as smooth as a single surface would look. Some people might prefer the color options, but that's not for me.I give this product 3.5 stars, but given the good price, I rounded up to 4 stars.Overall, this is a good choice if you want a case that offers protection without much bulk. If you like the color options for the back plates, then this is the ideal product for you. If you don't care about that, there are other better choices out there.

This "wallet" case has become my daily use case. I have used 4 different cases, but this one is my favorite.Pros:- Slim (all the ones I have are slim, but I've seen some huge cases, this is not one of them)- Cut outs and butts are on all the right places- Comes with a screen protector- Good quality stitching throughoutNeutral:- The pocket to store credit cards has gone completely unused. Some people might like it, but it only holds a couple of cards, and I just can't see myself not taking my wallet instead. The leather like material used there is of good quality as is the stitching on it.- The 2 position slot to use the case as a stand as well (with the use of a credit card or similar card) works fine. It holds the device in place, and depending if you insert the card horizontally or vertically it gives it a slightly different viewing angle. This to me was a missed opportunity to add an actual flip stand to it. The bulk from the credit card holder gives the devices plenty of space to add some sort of flip stand, instead of having you take out a credit card from your wallet and insert it there any time you want to use it as a stand. I hope they add a real kick stand on a future case.- The plastic material used, while of good quality is not as grippy as others. I got another case that has a more rubbery feel, and it's easier to grip. This might make it easier to slip inside pant/jean pockets, but I like how the other case feels more secure in my hands. This case is still more grippy than the naked phone, which is slippery.Cons:- No real big cons, just 2 minor issues discussed above in neutral.Overall this is a solid case for the iPhone 6 Plus, and I can recommend it. No wasted space for a "wallet" and a real kickstand would make the case better though.

I like these sponges. I have owned several Scotch Brite products like a lot of people. And all the ones I have owned, after a month or so of use - even if it's relatively light use in this age of automatic dishwashers, they start to smell. This one seems to be holding up much better.Pros:- Fights bad orders- Cleans touch messes better than most products (there will be messes for which you'll still be glad you kept your copper wire scrub)Cons:- none so far.Not sure what else to say, it's a sponge, it cleans well tough messes, and its odor fighting agent seems to work.Solid buy for cleaning most tough messes

While a little on the expensive side, this set is overall very good, and comes with the most used sizes.Pros:- Red coating "ceramic/nonstick hybrid" seems very good so far.- Great shine and finish. Much better finish than non stick pans. Inside and out.- Very easy to clean (pretty much equal to regular non-hybrid nonstick pans I've had.- All the items have a little lip to hold them by after baking. Many competitors do not have lips on their products, lips just make it easier to carry around hot.Neutral:- The hybrid coating makes me a little hesitant, I hope it lasts but only time will tell.
