If you see this review after the summer of 2016, make comment below and ask me to comment on the longevity of the coating.Cons:- A little expensiveOverall, if you like red and don't mind paying a little extra, this is a great set.

Honestly, this product is very close to 5 stars, I just felt the plastic bag was not very good quality so keep that in mind.Pros:- Price is very competitive with all other pellets per pound. One of the best- No weird fillers, just good wood usedNeutral- I like pellets for grilling - have used 2 different brands of pellets, with this one being the third. I have discovered that I am simply not that good as distinguishing differences between pellet flavors. They all taste the same to me. Slightly better than gas grills, that don't really add more than just fire flavor, but I cannot distinguish between different pellets.Cons:- With minimal handling I made a whole on the side of the bag, my finger went through as I was carrying it inside the house. Makes me think the plastic bag is of low quality.Overall, I can recommend these pellets for their great price and equal quality to other manufacturers. The only caution is the bag they come with might be a little low quality so handle with care.

This is a good pillow for your little one.Pros:- Very cute. Close to what the images her show.- Good size (the picture with the baby is fairly accurate, I know many products that distort those to seem larger/smaller than what they are)- Very soft to the touchCons- there is virtually no support, so I can see the transition to sitting from lounging to be a struggle for a little one.Overall, if you child is yet to be born or very young (4 months or so) this is good lounging pillow for the first 9 months of a baby. It will be very  hard for a child to sit/learn to site with this pillow, since it's so soft and has almost no support. So keep that in mind. I just don't see what kind of use it'll have after 9 months at this point - contrary to other reviewers who say their 10+ year old still like the pillow, I think that's got to be the exception.

This pasta takes less effort and time to make than most pasta.Basically just use a 12 inch skillet and pour a packet and 3 ounces of water and cook for about 10 minutes, add desired sauce then stir until it has the consistency you desire.I made this yesterday and it took 12 minutes on my stove, then another 3 minutes while stirring traditional pasta sauce. The consistency was a little harder than regular boiled pasta (though the cooking process is essentially boiling it) but it takes less time from start to finish.In terms of ingredients, I was also pleasantly surprised. There are no hidden high fructose corn syrup or bleached flour.The shape is fun, with a lot of spirals, which my 3 year old daughter loved.The flavor was good, and I'd recommend anyone to try it.Overall, I can recommend this product for its flavor, fun shape, quick meal preparation and decent ingredients.

i have two other Gracco car seats including the Amazon best seller one - that goes for half the cost of this one. That one does not work for newborns though, as it's only front facing. So it's more 2+ years.I mention this because this is very similar to that one in terms of quality, even the colors are the same. The issue with this one, is that you likely are paying more for it than 2 car seats for infant and toddler+. The value of having just 1 car seat instead of two is mitigated by the high cost. It's as expensive as the Recaro car seat and those are clearly a step up in quality and comfort for the baby.This is still a very god car seat but it looks like they priced it higher than it should. At 200-220 dollars this car seat is well worth it. At 300 like it is priced today, you are better off buying 2 separate car seats, or spending the same for a better one like Recaro brand.Pros:- lasts forever- back and front facing as your baby grows- good quality materials- fairly easy to installcons- high price puts it in direct competition with other car seats that are better.- no resale value (since it lasts forever, you can't sell the infant one when you no longer need it) plastic is only good for around 6 years according to child safety information, so by the time you are done with this, it basically is trash.Overall though, I think Gracco will adjust the price down closer and make this a good value. as it stands, while a very good car seat, it's not the best quality for the price.

These are simply delicious though a bit small (about 2" by 2.5") the package it comes in is nearly half empty. Never seen any bars whose package comes so empty before. Anyway, hear is the rundown:Pros:- delicious. Very much like cheesecake.- Sweet but not overly so- Very soft texture - there is just a very thin cookie layer, it's mostly the cheesecake-like snack.Cons:- Has a ton of ingredients, not surprisingly, but still has like 4 or 5 different types of sugars. (Brown sugar, Fructose, etc)- Small (so the 150 calories is misleading, since that's mainly because of the size)Overall, if you love cheesecake (but aren't a good snob) you will enjoy these fiber one snacks.

My partner has been very happy with this product. Which might mean we are going to have to start spending the money on it...Pros:- skin is more even toned- skin is soft- skin is more radiantCons:- $75 pricey- doesn't do anything for wrinkles and suchOverall she is very happy and says she has noticed all these changes and is considering moving away from an Olay cream she uses to this one permanently

This was a hard product to review. On the one hand, it feels like a solid overall product. But as a conscious buyer, the price of the product makes me dock a star. Here is the breakdown:Pros:- Does not use a propellant, it's just a simple spray.- Very easy to apply to your head (and unlike propellant based products, there is no gas cloud after you are done)- Does not turn flaky or greasy under weather conditions. When it's 100 degrees outside, some products become an oily mess, this one did not.- Easy to wash off at nightNeutral- It has a mild but present scent. I rather it was fragrant free, but it's not overpowering enough to warrant a negative rating.Cons:- At around $16, it's hard to justify over other products. There are competing products anywhere from $3-$40. But depends on what you need, some of the less expensive ones will do as good a job as this at keeping frizz under control and such (like Garnier Fructis products)OVerall, I'd rate this product at 4 star if you can find it under $10. But at $15+ I find it hard to recommend without hesitation.

Overall, this product is pretty good. Lets break it down:Pros:- List price is $6 dollars, but Amazon seems to carry it for around $3 sometimes (including as I am writing this review) and at $3 it's hard to find a better value for a body wash.- Some body washes are just that - this one is also a shampoo. Which was a nice bonus, since it's not very easy to spot that by just reading the product description.- Pleasant smell, not very strong, some fruit tones - I thought the lavender would stand out, but not as much.- Makes great lather, and leaves skin feeling cleanNeutral:- Strong purple color. Was kind of surprised. You definitely can tell how much you are using unlike some of the completely clear products. On the other hand, it's a lot of artificial color added.Overall, if you find this product for around $3-4 bucks, it's an excellent value. If it's hovering around the $6 list price I'd wait till it drops.

Simply great. I don't give 5 stars lightly, and this product deserves it, despite a few shortcoming. Sometimes sweeping and using the dustpan is an exercise in trying to get all the dust you accumulated into the dustpan. It's not always easy, you have to go multiple passes, and then at the end, you just know that little bit of dust just ain't going in, but at least you got most of it. This solves the issues, as virtually everything you go over gets immediately placed in a container/dustpan you can then empty.Pros:- Sweeping and collecting all the dirt has never been easier.- Picks up big chunks and small equally easily, and "traps" it in the dustpan.- Comes in a tiny box, that then you put together. The main pieces are aluminum, but there is a lot of plastic- Sweeps and collect really well.- Very light, glides on floor effortlessly.Neutral:- Just a warning - this product is not really meant to be used for cleaning a floor . Most swiffers I've used you want to moisten the floor, some even included a spray to get the floor went so then you can mop the surfaces with very little water. This one is the prior step. It's a broom and dustpan all in one.Cons:- Most of the pieces that make it effective won't last very long. I was checking the rubber parts, and while they work great now, they don't look like they will last very long. They might still be serviceable in a few months, but not with the effectiveness it has now.- Doesn't work as well with reusable pads - I tried one, and it seems like you would need really thin pads/wipes to be effective, and then you will lose the grip that these disposable ones have.Overall, I highly recommend this product. And it feels weird to write a long review of such a simple tool, but it was surprisingly great.

This is a high end cable for sure. The chord is not the cheap plastic found in apple original cables, or 99% of all the other cables you find around. It's a nice braided cable for extra protection. Feels premium.Pros:- braided cable- aluminum tip- quality manufacturing all aroundCons:- More expensive than other longer cables- 6 inch is much too small for most applications. You might expect a little more, but 6 inches basically doesn't let you use this with a wall charger. Becomes strictly a plug to computer and not be able to use while charging cable.Overall, if you need a premium very small cable, this is among the best you can find. But you will pay a higher price for it - even when compared to the much longer counterparts.

I cannot believe the number of positive reviews of this film.It was by far the most painful experience I've ever had watching a movie. It went from super awful to just plain bad. I would say it gets "better" towards the end, but that's just because of the 3D cartoon.Cons:- The 3D starting image is a little misleading since 80% or so of the movie is similar to the cartoons. Towards the end they become the 3D animation that is featured everywhere. The rest is just one more regular spongebob cartoon.Antonio Banderas acting like a dumb pirate, 3D animated seagulls talking to him, looking for a treasure, or stealing one, or..Honestly, this is one of about 2-3 movies that I felt that Iwas totally robbed by how awful they were.I can't begin to describe the dialogue (worse than the regular show - which sets the bar quite low).Stay away, and keep your children from suffering through it.My almost 4 year old stayed awake, that's about he only positive I can give it.Save your money and eyes/ears from this "movie"

Overall these are a good way to store clothes and save space - taking a smaller bag.However, I was mildly disappointed to know that they do require a vacuum to be used. This is my fault, so I am not taking stars off because of it, but the product information has this statement:* "Ideal for storing clothing. The travel bag does not require a vacuum and is a perfect fit for luggage."I didn't real carefully enough, I figured the 3 were called travel bags, so I wouldn't need to use a vacuum to use it. Unfortunately, only 1 of the 3 is a travel bag, the others have different names and require vacuum use. On the plus side, they are made so that most vacuums that have attachments can be used, but I am not sure if all would work.As for the product themselves, its very clear plastic, and the instructions are printed right on the bags (so they are not totally clear, just clear with black instructions all over).It did help reducing the bulk that clothes/blankets make, and I can recommend the product.The sizes are fairly generous, unlike others that are too small.

Beware of the faulty focus ring.I love this lens. It was my favorite lens.However, after about 14 months of light use (maybe 300 - 500 pictures with it) the focus ring failed.I started digging information about this, and found out, that it's a relatively common problem with this particular lens.It's so common Canon knows exactly the cost to fix it, assuming you pay for all shipping, which totals to about $150 or so between insured shipping and the $100 dollar repair.While I would give the lens 5 stars based on overall performance - the way Canon handles a known problem with some of these lenses is deplorable, and as such I am giving it 1 star. If you are unfortunate like me, you'll have to spend another $150 to fix a known issue with the lens. It's a shame that Canon does not stand behind their products and provide a fix for a known issue with this lens for free or at a very low cost.Don't believe me, just google information about this lens and the focus ring problem.It just stops working for a few people, and if you are one of them, you are out of luck and out of money.I cannot recommend this lens, unless you want to roll the dice and hope you get one of the good ones, or that it stops working inside 1 year, then maybe they'll help.

I have long hair, it's wavy and very thick. This shampoo does as good a job as any others I have tried. (Pantene, Head and Shoulders, Pertplus, herbal essences, etc).Pros:- Cleans hair very well- Creates lots of foam- PriceCons:- NoneThis is up there with the best I have used. Given the lesser cost per ounce compared to the others, it makes it a no brainer purchase.* Note that while I received this item for free, I've been using this same shampoo on and off for a long time.

The main problem with this paper, is that it costs close to premium paper, but it's a thinner - cheaper kind. Calling it Eco efficient in your naming implication does not make it better or reason to charge more.That said, it is not bad paper, and perfectly suitable for drafts or other throw away paper.Pros:- Light and thin (both pros and cons)- Less wasteful, cause you use less paper in general due to the thin nature of itNeutral/other:- Reviewers have complain about jamming. I have an epson printer and have not had any jams so far.Cons:- Light and thing (yes a pro and a con)- Costs the same as regular paper, even though you are getting less product. Almost like paying a premium for less.Overall this paper is good for drafts and other stuff you don't mean to keep long.If the price drops to more reasonable levels, it's probably a solid 4 star product. As it stands, paying a premium for less paper is not an easy proposition to sell.

I think it's unfortunate that this product still has reviews attached to it from the old formula. I was hesitant to order this product, even though it was being offered free, due to the negative reviews and the fact that it would leave a thin residue/coat on your dishes and wouldn't clean. Lots of reviews mentioned that, and its one of the main reasons this product overall has underwhelming stars.I am happy to say that the issues have been fixed, and it comes with all the positives we can expect from Seventh Generation.Pros:- Better from the environment- Cleans as well as the powdered cascades that is recommended by the dishwasher I just bought (Whirlpool)- Cleans your dishes well- NO residue of thin coatingCons:- A little on the pricier sideOverall, I am happy to report the new formula does not have the problems listed by most reviewers. I can recommend this product without any issues. I am giving it 5 stars to weigh against all the 1 stars that are still associated to a product that no longer exist (previous formula). Overall, I'd probably give this 4 stars, but maybe even 5 if you find it on special sale.Worry not, the residue issue is gone, and dishes come out as clean as they do with Cascades.

This is a tough product to review.On the one hand, they are good quality pistachios. They are sealed and fresh - crunchy enough so you know they were well packed.However, at a price of about $20 a pound, it's very hard to recommend unless you want the outmost convenience.Pros:- Flavor- Fresh- Price (really...)Cons:- You may eat too many, because without having to remove them from shell, they become so much easier to eat!- The above wasn't seriously a con - in case you have doubts.At first I thought shelled pistachios were more expensive than regular ones, with shell. Seem logical, someone goes through the process of shelling them, so it would be an added cost.So I did a test, and found out that shells account for about 47% - 49% of the weight in a pistachio. To make math simple and easier for anyone to find out which is less expensive, just pretend it's 50% of the weight - it'll come close enough.So basically, if a pound of shelled pistachios is $18, the pound of shell on needs to be around $9 to be equivalent.Occasionally you'll see shelled cheaper overall, and sometimes you'll see the shell on cheaper. But they hover around the same price per pound, and someone already shelled (and disposed of those shells) for you.Overall a good product, and surprising value. Look for it for close to $7 a pound.

We have these and several other much less expensive sets.These rusted within a month of using the dishwasher.Pros:- Elgant design- Good weightCons:- Easy scratch- Rusts in dishwasherStay away if you plan on using them in a dishwasher. We have several other much less expensive utensils and they have not rusted. These ones already have about 15-20% of the pieces with rust within a month.

Ill update in a month.Initial impression has been fine. I just can't justify going higher now based on all the reviews.Pros:- Cord is thick - thicker than apple's or amazon basic cables.- The length of the cable.Cons:- People report issues within a month. I'll update my review up or down within a month.- Price. More expensive than almost all other competing products of the same length.Haven't had issues this week. Cables feels strong and sturdy so giving it 3 stars, because so far so good. It is expensive so it loses 1 star there. And if it lasts a few months of daily use (nightly charging with this cable) I might go up to 4 stars. If it breaks like people are reporting, it'll go down to 1 star.

Pros:- Light weight. At under 10 pounds, its very easy to maneuver.- Uses only 2 AA batteries (batteries included, I used regular rechargeable I already had)- 3 beams, I didn't test if they go all the way to- Amazon has it under $100 cheaper than other stores (home depot)- Carrying case (that stacks with other Bosch cases- sturdyCons:- Can't really see the laser outside. I was kind of hoping to use for a project outside, but it's not ideal for that - maybe in the winter time, but definitely not in the summer months.I'm happy with this laser tool, but a little bummed it's not made to operate outdoor under bright lights. Given all the good things it brings to the table, this might be a well worth it tool.

While I prefer the sweet chile sauce, this one is not bad either.Note: the ingredient list is not great, so health nuts will keep away. But it's not terrible enough to keep me away.What these sauces do bring is:- quick flavor to your foods- large container- relatively inexpensiveThe sauce consistency is thick, but liquid enough to very easily come out of the bottle.Overall this is a good solution for busy families that don't go out of their way to always buy healthier options. We personally buy a little of everything, some organic, some gmo, most of the time try to avoid high fructose corn syrup, but don't go completely out of our way for it.

Pros:- Lavender color- Soft initially at leastNeutral:- Made in China. It's just a little ironic that "American Baby Company" does not make their products here.- Average quality, average cost.- Save blankets for when they are older, not for infants.Cons:- American Baby Company seems unaware that the American Association of Pediatricians recommends against bumpers due to the risk of SIDS. Quoting from them (since you can't post links easily here): "[…] there have been some published studies looking at bumper pads, and we concluded that if there’s no reason for them to be in the crib, it’s better to just have them out of there, particularly in light of the deaths that have been reported, that have been associated with the bumper pads"- Overall value based on the dangers of bumpers is not great.If you want average quality for average price, this is an ok set. But as it stands, you are better off buying the pieces individually (from same company if you wish) and skipping the pads or other items you do not wish.

Will it survive more than a couple of washes?I'll make sure to update this review in a few months to see how it went.Pros:- The cotton part seems well done soft and padded- waterproofNeutral:- Made in China. Just pointing it out, since the name American Baby Company kind of implies its made in America. Then again, a lot (almost all?) American companies have factories overseas.Cons:- vinyl portion seems of low quality. Afraid it will break like a lot of reviews have mentioned.

Note: does not contain iron. Most gummy vitamins do this too, just wanted to confirm it.Pros:- taste- 1 for 1 (donates 1 to people in need every time you purchase one)- pretty much every vitamin was on par with what the doctors recommended. Except for iron.Neutral:- possibly the nicest presentation of a vitamin product. Happy colors, well designed, really make it seem like you are taking something special for the baby. I put it under neutral, since the package doesn't affect the product, but it's a very nice touch.Cons:None so far

Review of the Sweet Chili sauce:I've used this sauce a fair bit of time. Mostly as a stir fry. It has a nice sweet/tangy combination. If you like Chinese food sweet/sour sweet and a little spicy combinations, you will enjoy this sauce.The ingredients are not great - with plenty of sugars, including high fructose corn syrup, and plenty of salts, including calcium chloride. So obviously this is not for you if you are a health fanatic.Pros:- Good sweet/salty/mild spice balance.- thick- Huge (75 ounces is more than most juice bottle you buy, yeah that's half a gallon of it)Neutral:- Spice is very mild, so I'd recommend adding red pepper flakes and maybe some diced jalapeños if you like your food a little more spicy.- half a gallon of it - so you need to love it and figure out different ways to use it, or it'll be taking up valuable space in the fridge for months- It is a vegetarian/vegan product… but by no stretch of the imagination healthy.Cons:- Ingredients could be better, in particular high fructose corn syrup.Used in moderation this is a great and quick way to flavor food, I'd recommend adding more spice to it. Given it's price of around $12-$15 depending on subscribe and save and the half gallon size, it's a good value too.

We like this swaddling pouch. I'll contrast it to regular swaddle blankets.Pros:- Easy to put on. A regular swaddle blanket takes a little practice. Once you do it, it's relatively easy. But even then occasionally you put something not as tight, or an end is loose and it comes off. Also, when it's 3am and you are super tired, putting a swaddle on a baby that is not cooperating is a tall task. This pouch makes it all easy, easy to put on, easy to swaddle the baby, uses no brain power to get it on.- Soft fabric, seems and other parts are well put together.- Did I mention it's easy to put on?Neutral:- Thinner than I thought it would be. From pictures and others, I expected it closer to a blanket. But it's a little closer to a t-shirt in terms of thickness.Cons:- none so farOverall I can recommend this to any parent that will be swaddling their baby. The convenience of a regular blanket is worth the small premium.

Pros:- Sturdy- Comes in a tiny box, you just pull it out and add in the bottom part and its good to go.- Practical, and light- Soft cloth throughout- There are many other sizes from this brand to fit many needs and mix and match for what you wantNeutral:- Pictures here show the outside darker than it is in person. Not a stark differences, but it is noticeable.- Just wanted to note that the bottom is not attached. There is a cloth bottom that is attached, but the sturdy piece that matches the blue colors on the sides, is an extra piece you just place in there. It goes in easily, and the fit is good, so I'm not concerned of it coming out or falling. It also makes the box a lot sturdier by keeping not only the bottom, but the sides in place.- It feels like it's cardboard inside the cloth to provide the structure, this is fairly normal, but it means you probably want to avoid at all cost getting this wet. Note: I did not cut through the packet to know what it was, so feel free to correct me and I'll update the review.Cons:- none so farOverall, this is a good storage container. It has soft cloth around it, and should last a bit.

This review will be updated to see how well MoJack does with claims of something damaged. I am starting it at 3 stars and will update as I can put it together and based on their support.I was skeptical like most given the bad reviews, but the package arrived in good shape. Upon opening it, it's clear they have worked to improve it to prevent damage during shipment. Lots of cardboard and Styrofoam.Pros:- Looks high quality- Paint job (the red color) is very good- Fairly easy to install. My guess is that it takes 2 people about 30-45 minutes to put together. We would have finished it right around then if not for the missing pieces.- Customer support (ongoing, but they called me back first thing their next work day) is US based, and representative was very polite and helpful.Cons:- Lots of little imperfections. Given the cost of the unit, this is a let down.- For example the porcelain coated steel grates had several places where the coating was missing or chipped, and it went down to the steel. It wasn't just 1 place, it was like 8-10 places. They were small, but present throughout, so easy to spot.- The lid when you open and close hits some screws inside. There is some give like 1cm, if it's all the way to your right, it will barely touch the screw, but if it shifts to the left, you'll hit it very noticeably. Not a perfect fit. I looks at the culprit screws but they are in and as tight as possible, so there is nothing I can do to avoid the inside of the lid hitting the screws.- Part of the red paint has hit pieces of the black grill, and it's impossible to wash off - I tried.- temperature display is hard to see out in the sun.Neutral:- The packet with the screws inside it was open, and they were screws all over. Fortunately, they were all inside, but not sure if you will be so lucky.- Support is monday to Friday 8-5. So if you are putting together the grill on a Saturday and discover problems, or any day after work, you'll have to wait a little to find someone. (PS - have your serial number ready if you call)- If you come from the coal/gas grills, you'll be surprised (as I was) that it requires a power source to work. Not taking any stars off, because I've read that all pellet grills are like this, but from the pictures here you'll notice the power cable missing. Our back yard doesn't have an outside plug, so we'll have to figure something out to use it - a heavy duty extension cord or something. Either way, it's not very convenient to be dependent on a wall outlet.I'll update on cooking performance and other details when I get it working.Problem:- The 4 legs you assemble have a preinstalled "teeth/place were screws go in to tighten". I don't know the name of it, but 1 of the 4 legs was missing that. This is to make sure the legs don't wobble at the weight of the grill - which is around 120 pounds. So I couldn't install the grill because of this issue.- Inside the box was their phone number in very big letters asking to please call them if you have any issues with the grill. So I called them and left them a message.Update on support:- Sunday May 17th: Placed support call.- I got a call back Monday May 18th in the morning. The person was from the US, very polite and apologetic about the issue, and said they'd take care of it and send me another leg. I do need to give them the serial number for them to do this, so I'll need to call them again tomorrow with the number.- I didn't ask about the grates, but I'll ask next call, if that's within normal range, or if they will send new grates. I do want to point out that Monday-Friday 8-5 is very inconvenient - because they can help you with the install and other questions, but you have to take a day off work to be able to do that.Tuesday May 19th:- Called today with the serial number at hand, and gave the serial number to a lady (different support person). They had all my previously given information at hand, and she mentioned that they would call me back to complete the support. However, she noticed that the person that had helped me the previous day had gotten off the phone, so she would transfer me over.- I talked to the (customer service / support) again, and he was helpful again, determined which leg had the missing pieces, and said they'll package it up soon, so I can put it together. We will see how long it takes them to ship the part.- Additionally, I asked about the grates, and if that was expected. He said that those don't affect the performance of the grill, but since it's brand new, they wanted to make sure I didn't start with dinged grates, so they are sending those as well.- Overall I am very happy with the support so far, and I'll update the review and rating once I get to actually use the grill. I feel confident enough that I ordered some pellets already.Update: 06/01/15- The parts took about 7 business days to arrive ( they got here Thursday of the week after)- The grates arrived in about the same condition, so it's a general issue with a lot of their porcelain coating. I am not going to ask for another one. It's not terrible, just not what I'd expect. My older $199 grill had perfect porcelain coating.- I proceeded with the install and it was going fine. Fired it up, it started turning slowly, a little warm and then it all stopped working. The power turns on, but the fan and auger stopped turning on, temperature dial disappeared.- I tried a few things and no luck.- I called support again, and as mentioned, they only work M-F so had to wait until Monday. I went home during lunch and when I talked to them I went about trying to fix the issue.- The support guy was again very courteous and apologetic for the issues. He was helpful and guided me through using a spare fuse that comes with the unit. He guided me to replace it, and I managed to do it fairly easily.- The fan kicked in and temperature dial started working again. I was relieved, however upon testing it we found out it was not heating up or smoking or anything. Completely cool to the touch. They are sending me more replacing parts with more detailed instructions on how to fix the issue.- At this point, given all the poor reviews in Amazon, in addition to some positive ones coming up, I have a hard time recommending it. Spent way too much time fixing issues already, and about to spend even more time - who knows how long it'll take to replace that heating element, does not seem like it will be simple.I'll keep updating as I work on getting this going, but it's hard to recommend it at this point. It's a lottery, you might get a good unit or one with plenty of problems and then spend many frustrating hours troubleshooting the grill. I am giving it 2 stars because their support has been great despite limited hours. But nobody wants to deal with trying o get a grill working, and they haven't really offered anything extra for my troubles. Just more replacement parts for me to work on grill.

Pros:- very vibrant colors- cute giraffe pattern- folds to a small square. It is way more bendable than I thought- the very rubbery material stays put on most any surface- easy to clan, virtually just wipes off- the rubber seems of good quality. Haven't noticed any signs that it will break when bendingNeutral:- while the vendor makes a point of emphasis in the corner ring, we did not find this feature really practical. Putting that as neutral because it doesn't take much room, but for us it's not really and advantage.Cons:-  relatively pricey- the paint on the face of the giraffe was a little off, hard to explain but one of the cheeks was not smooth. You can't really tell unless you hold it on the light, but wanted to point it out just for information. This is minor, and does not detract from it.Overall this is a nice place mat, easy to clean, easy to take with you, and the rubber keeps it in place. Oh and it's colorful and vibrant. 4 solid stars.

I am reviewing the product now, but hope I'll update in a couple of months to just update and comment on how it seems to have worked or not.Pros:- Does not leave hair greasy or any other signs of a product being on it. You don't have to worry if you have to leave in 20 minutes after applying product. Just keep cap on for 5-10 minutes after applying, and then you take it off and style your hair however you want.Neutral:- "Activator cap" Is a really funny term for a simple shower cap. Really, it is identical to any plastic shower cap. It really is just a clear shower cap.- This product does not detangle hair or anything extra.Cons:- Not sure if it works...That's why it's hard to recommend. Maybe I'll notice the difference more in a few days, or something. I followed the directions carefully. Washed hair, dried to the point where it was a little damp not wet, then proceeded to apply a whole vial. They recommend from half to a whole one depending on hair. Given that I have very thick hair and long, I thought a full vial make sense.The problem is, My hair doesn't really feel any different. I have never dyed my hair or permed or anything so maybe it helps more if you have really damaged hair from treatments? Anyhow, at this point hard for me to recommend the product.Note:If you read this review later than July 1, 2015 and I haven't updated, please comment below and I'll get a notification so I can update the review.

These come in one huge bag. It's not several smaller bags, or something. The pieces as all jolly ranchers, are individually wrapped.Pros:- They actually surprisingly kind of taste like raspberry.- Sweet, but acidic too. A very nice flavor- Pros, last a good time in your mouth, it dissolves slowly, so you get to enjoy the candy longer.Neutral/Notes:- over 400 pieces in the bag. (They claim around 417 based on serving size. I haven't gone in and counted them all)- Leaves your tongue blue- Ingredients include: corn syrup, sugar, various colorants, "artificial flavors", malic acid.Cons:- 11g of sugar and 17g of carbs per serving. Serving size is 3 candies.I prefer healthier candy myself, but as you can tell by the 4 star rating, I don't go overboard with it. This is a nice sweet and sour candy with mild raspberry flavor. I am not fan of regular hard candy - the kind that is all sweet. That tastes horrible to me. But the acidic sweet and sour taste of these is great. Just try to eat them in moderation because there is nothing healthy in here at all.

I need to second other review here and repeat again, how misleading the picture is. The hamper is all cloth. It does not stay up right or perfectly cylindrical like in the picture. It's like a thick jacket. It'll lay completely flat on the floor. I repeat again, this does not stand by itself.Pros:- Fabric quality is good, it's thick, and it's well woven together. There are no loose threads or markings of sloppy stitching. It is well put together.- Since it's fabric, you can run it through the washer for cleaning.Neutral- You can take it with you, if you want to have a hamper in your travels. Since it folds up.Cons:- No support structure anywhere. Lays flat on the floor. Very misleading picture.- Very small. The name "hamper" gave me the impression that you could store lots of dirty clothes, like most hampers. But in reality, this is just very small. It won't store more than 2 days of clothes for a couple of people.- They say ideal for storing toys in the packaging too… But again, this is not ideal for it,  because it does not hold its shape. The only time it kind of holds a cylindrical shape is when it's full to the brim.Overall, it's hard to figure out a good audience for this product. As a hamper, you have to straighten and open it up every time you want to put something inside (since it just folds in itself). So it's not very convenient. It's also small, so it won't help you store much either. So at this point, I cannot recommend this product to anyone looking for a hamper. The only exception might be heavy travelers that would like to have a hamper to put on their dirty clothes on their short trips.

This Huggies pack, is a nice gift for new parents, but it seems like you have to watch the price and probably use subscribe and save to get the best deal on them. Under $30 or close to it (including subscribe and save discount) is a good price.Since the product page is kind of confusing with a ton of details, I wanted to give a quick breakdown of exactly what you are getting. So the 5 items are:- 1 Newborn diaper pack (32 total diapers)- 2 packs of size 1 diapers. (70 total diapers, 35 per pack)- 1 pack of baby wipes (216 natural wipes)- 1 reusable plastic container to keep wipes moist (and be able to buy cheap bulk packets)In addition to those 5 items, it comes packed in a box like you see in the picture. It's cute and gender neutral, you can probably even get away without having to wrap this as a present.Additionally, the diapers (little snugglers) are actually pretty good.1. Comfy and soft2. Wetness indicator (new parents will appreciate this)3. breathable fabric4. The newborn diapers have a little cut out for the healing umbilical cord. (nice touch)Cons:- Expensive if you are counting the price per diaper.Overall, I give this 4 stars, because it's not a great value. However, it is a nice gift pack, wrapped in a cute package, and the diapers and wipes are both of good quality. There are also $5 bucks in coupons inside.

Finally. Please make sure you are getting the Avent Classic Plus, instead of the Avent Classic themselves.I used to have the regular Classic, and though they were good baby bottles, they were annoying to clean and put together. And when we had an aunt or grandma taking care of my daughter, there would be the inevitable spill/mess because they didn't see that extra little piece you put to seal the bottle.The Classic Plus finally gets rid of that extra piece. Now you have less to clean, no chance of someone forgetting an extra piece and causing a mess, so basically... they fixed it.Pros:- Few pieces. Just the necessary ones!- Means less to bottles to clean- Good quality plastic and nipplesNeutral:- BPA Free etc. Put this in neutral because I haven't seen a baby bottle that has BPA in the last dozen years or more.- I am not fond of the transparent pink background. It's just a little odd, prefer them clear myself. But that is just a preference.Cons:- None. They finally fixed the annoying 5th piece bottle and made it into your core 4 pieces. (Nipple, nipple holder, bottle, and cap)Overall, I can finally recommend the AVENT Classic Plus without hesitation. Just make sure you don't confuse them for the regular AVENT Classic ones.

These are among the best and most convenient ones you can use. Though also the most expensive given that these are basically single use shells. Other diapers use inserts, that are single use and inexpensive, and the shells, that you can use multiple times.Pros:- Convenient (easy to put on and off - just one strap.- Snaps are easy to clean and don't get stuff stuck like velcro.- Pattern colors are good quality and should last through the wash.- Can add inserts for me water absorbency.- Not very bulkyNeutral:- Fit is ok, given the AIO size. About average. (not the best, not the worst)Cons:- Basically just single use then you have to wash. So you need to buy a lot of these unless you plan to do laundry every day or twice a day just with diapers.Overall, if you want convenient diapers, these are a good choice. If you want to save money, there are better options which rely more on the inserts than the whole diaper to keep fluids in.

Good quality all around, and daughter loves.Pros:- Long good quality hair. (Purple, which my daughter loves)- Comb, daughter loves combing it.- Horn lights up- Big, decent size. Larger than the my little ponies of the early 80s.- Honestly, it looks well put together, like it will last.- Stickers… every kid loves them.Notes/Neutral:- Uses A76 alkaline batteries (like watches). I am not particularly fond of this, since you can't really use rechargeable batteries. (included)- The blue diamonds on the leg are painted on, and looks good long lasting quality. Just wanted to point out those are not stickers, and are permanently there.

I used these for my first daughter, and we got another on the way which will get to use these now too. We used the small size version. These are the new newborn type, a little more snug for little ones.Pros:- Snaps are easy to use and don't get damage/messy like velcro. I suggest snaps over velcro for these diapers. Besides, if they is an accident, velcro is very hard to clean (and sometimes stains stay...). The plastic snaps are super easy to clean.- The main difference for newborn diapers compared to the previous small size ones, is the umbilical cord snap down. It's a minor detail that makes a big difference. Sometimes the stump is a little big and diapers can hit it and irritate it. These have an optional snap that you snap down to it, leaving the umbilical cord stump free and avoiding unnecessary rubbing of it.- Very easy to put on/off.- Outer layer is plastic and rarely gets dirty.A note on when to try cloth diapers:When they are a newborn is the best time to start cloth diapers. Their body fluids at this point do not smell very bad, and it will ease you in. As long as they are fed mostly breast milk, you'll be surprised how little they smell - even number 2. If/when they start drinking formula, you'll notice a smell right away. Once solid food start, is when the fun really begins :)Basically, if you are unsure about cloth diapers - better to start early as once the solid food start the smell might dissuade you…Overall, these are a good way to test to see if cloth diapers are for you. Not very expensive, easy to use.

This stapler offers great value.Pros:- Inexpensive (given the quality)- Material (plenty of heavy duty metal)- Easy to useNeutral:- It's quite heavy. You can tell its heavy duty, but just wanted to point out here, that it's heavier than it looks. Took me a little by surprise.- In addition to staples, it can use a couple of types of nails. I haven't tested those, but the package had that labeled and offered details on it. Here in the website I do not see any reference to that.Overall, this product is a no brainer for those who want a quality product without spending too much money. You can buy a cheaper one, for $5 to $10 dollars, but it won't last as long, won't be as effective and you'll end up spending two to three times as long trying to get they job done.

This car seat is very close to a 5 star product, and I have no problems recommending it.Pros:- Lots of cushion.- Removable/attachable head rest (read cons about it though)- Fabric is of good quality- Moves from rear facing to forward facing (from infant to a little beyond toddlers - 50lb)Neutral:- The colors didn't quite match the pictures. It says I got the Atlantis but the bluish/green color is not nearly as vibrant as in the pictures. Just thought I'd point this out. I still like it, and this did not affect the rating.- Though it works for an infant, It's not really infant friendly. Most people (myself included) prefer the seats that detach from the base. This is so you can pick up your baby while they are asleep. They stay in the "car seat" which you can hold, and the base stays in the car. It's much easier to sit them in the car seat in your home, then take them to the car and snap in place.Cons:- The removable head rest is a little flimsy, and I'm unsure if it actually helps. It doesn't really offer much support or structure. It just kind of flails to either side. If the headrest was better, I would have given the product 5 stars. I don't like to see my child with her head all bent or twisted when she falls asleep. We have a carseat (recaro brand) that has a really nice head rest, and she never has her head all bent on weird angles. It however, costs nearly 3x as much as this one. That said, sometimes it holds her head in place, but most times it's not.- Does not reclineOverall, this carseat is better than all others I've seen on this price range. It has more cushion, the fabric seems of better quality, the buckle works well, and it includes a detachable head rest.

I'm a wedding photographer and often spend 8-12 hours on my feet without sitting down for the vast majority of the day.  I need shoes that look good and that are comfortable.  I don't mean "comfortable for a dress shoe", I'm talking about tennis shoe-like comfort.  These shoes fit the bill and look great.  They fit as expected and comparably to other dress shoes I've had in the past.Right out of the box I would rate these shoes as being very comfortable for dress/work shoes, but not quite on the level of an athletic shoe.  I added a set of insoles in the shoe and now they're quite soft - which is just how I like them.After a long day, I find that I'm less fatigued in these than I was in my old set of Docker's.  I can especially feel the difference in my knees.  Overall a great looking and feeling shoe which also appears to be very durable.

This channel seems to be a collection of promotional videos put out by Porsche.  The videos are very well done, but almost all of them look and feel like advertisements more than anything.  There is no third party content and very few videos over a few minutes long.  The interface is horrible and I can never seem to figure out how to get the dialog box at the bottom of each video to go away.This is a good start, but it needs more third party consent and a serious user interface overhaul.

I have been searching forever to find an appropriate armband for my Sansa Zip Clip MP3 player.  The original band had long since worn out and I was searching for a replacement.The issues I was running into were either that the arm bands were too short to fit around my arm or too wide for the Zip Clip to attach.  This arm band fits perfectly.  It is exactly 1-3/16" wide (not 1" wide like the description claims), which allows the Zip Clip to fit snugly over the band with minimal play.  The band is also 19" long and will fit the vast majority of arm sizes - even large ones.  Fully extended with no stretch, this band will accomodate a 17" arm.  Taking into account the stretching of the elastic within the band, fitting a 20" arm is most likely possible  Fully wound up, the band should fit arms as small as 8" in circumference.

As a 32 year old athletic male, I may or may not be the target demographics for this product.  I can confirm though that I used this product as directed and it definitely did not provide all day odor protection.  This is a twice a day product for people like me.  I bought the 2.7oz, unscented tube and that particular products lasted me about 4 weeks.Having to use it twice a day is only a minor annoying and not a complete deal-breaker.  However what is a deal breaker is the fact that this deodorant made my underarms break out in both a rash and in acne.  I've never had underarm acne in my entire life until I started to use this product.  In fact, I really don't have sensitive skin at all and it's rare to find any product which irritates me.Switching deodorants to Arm and Hammer naturals, all of the acne and rashes went away.  This deodorant was a good idea in theory - all natural ingredients, no aluminum.  However it just didn't work out for me.

My wife and I bought a jug of the vanilla caramel.  I've been buying protein powders for the past 20 years or so and this might be the single most offensively tasting product I've ever had. The only thing that might come close is the soy proteins circa 1998.  It's so bad, I simply cannot eat it.  I've never (ever) thrown out a jug of protein powder before, but if my wife doesn't finish the jug, I will be throwing it out.The product itself does what it's supposed to.  You mix 3oz of water for every scoop of powder and stir into a bowl.  After a minute or so, the mixture becomes thick and takes on the consistency of a pudding.  It looks and smells appealing.  It even initially tastes good once you start eating it, but shortly after that you get hit with a strong chemical (artificial sweetener) flavor that is simply overwhelming.  It's bad to the palate and honestly makes me a bit sick.  I've tried it on a couple different occasions and it never got any better for me.If you are absolutely bent on buying this product, I would suggest buying a different flavor.  It could just be that the vanilla caramel is that awful and that the other flavors are better.  That said, an even better suggestion would be trying another product all together.  I use Body Nutrition's "Trutein" protein powder and I find it excellent - both in texture and in taste.

This was a perfect fit for my model MB1001 magic bullet blender.  Comparing to the original shaver blade, here are some notable differences:- The blades on the replacement are a bit larger and wider (should not be an issue)- The mounting plate for the blade is metal instead of plastic (again, I don't think this would be an issue)- The rubber gasket is a little wider and squishier than the one of the original (this might be an upgrade)- The blades on the replacement unit are NOT SHARPENED.  They are a blunt, straight edge.If you are looking to use this replacement blade for heavy duty cutting and chopping, it probably won't work as well as the original, so beware.  If all you're doing is using it to mix protein shakes and smoothies (as I am), then it will work great for you.

I drive a 2006 Acura TL with a manual transmission.  The third gear synchros in this car have been faulty for a long time.  You basically have to rev-match your third gear upshift into this car or the transmission simply will not engage third gear.  It will just bounce right out of the gate.  This is a well known and much maligned design fault of this car's manual transmission.  I've modified my shift technique to avoid the issue for a while, but it was becoming more problematic over time.I replaced my 2.5 year old, Acura manual transmission fluid (with 25k miles) with this GM synchromesh fluid and it made all of the difference in the world.  Shifting normally there are NO problems engaging third gear anymore.  I occasionally get a very minor resistance going into third gear, but it has not once popped out like it used to.  I would honestly note about a 90% improvement in the function of 3rd gear now.Whereas previously I was seriously considering a multi-thousand dollar rebuild of the transmission, instead a $50 fluid change was all I really needed.  This fluid is outstanding and vastly superior to what Honda recommends that I put into this car.  I couldn't recommend it more.

I used this tool to replace the transmission fluid in my 2006 Acura TL.  The fill bolt in this car is on the top of the transmission, which sit about a foot beneath the airbox under the hood of the car.  This tool reached down to fit into the fill hole perfectly.  Another nice feature is that the hose is rigid enough that it will sit up on its own without you having to hold it continually with one hand.  So when you put some fluid in, then go to check the fluid level underneath the car, the tool will sit upright and not leak fluid all over the place.Another great feature of this fill tool is that it has a cap for both ends.  This is SO nice.  I have a number of funnels and fill tools in my garage and one thing that makes them messy is they leak after you're done with them.  Fluid drips from both end of the device and gets everywhere.  With this tool you can cap off both ends once you're finished so there are no leaks.Although I didn't use it, the measuring and cutoff feature is quite nice.  If you know that your car holds 2.3 quarts of fluid you can put two full quarts in there, turn the flow off, measure 0.3 quarts of fluid in the reservoir, then turn the flow back on.  That way you know exactly how much fluid you put in your car.This tool was far superior to thank of a regular long-neck funnel for a transmission fluid change.  I'm glad I picked one up.

Overall the aesthetic design of this piece is nice.  It's very attractive, holds a large quantity of soap, and the pumping action feels good.  The issues I have with it are that the glass bulb seems to stain easily - either with soap or with water.  Since the bulb is so large, soap inevitably drips onto it, leaving a stain that does not seem to want to come off.  We have two of the pumps and both are starting to look not-great after just weeks of usage.  I will try other cleaning methods, but for now they are just "ok" for us - certainly less of an eyesore than the plastic pumps you get for 99 cent at the grocery store.

I recently bought a Canon 24-70/2.8 II that did not come with a lens hood.  I did a lot of research on third party hoods before finally settling on this one.  I am an experienced professional photographer and I've been using Canon equipment for the past 12 years.  I have the Canon 70-200 F2.8 II lens which has an identical hood type (not design) to the 24-70/2.8 II.I can state unequivocally this hood is NOT identical to the Canon version and is no where near as high quality.  Prime differences are:- This lens hood does not have the felt on the inside of the hood to prevent reflections. It is a bare, matte plastic.  Probably good enough, but definitely a cost cutting measure.- This hood has some minor resistance when putting it on the lens, which might or might not loosen over time.  Again, indicative of looser quality controls on the third party hood.- This hood has a plastic locking mechanism instead of the metal spring used on the Canon hood.  This is the big one for me.  This third party hood will unquestionably be less durable in it's locking feature versus the genuine Canon hood.  The Canon hood snaps positively into place and does not move.  This hood also snaps into place, but less securely and will move from its locking position with only moderate effort.So overall, for about 1/6th the price of the genuine Canon hood, this hood is a good buy.  It's not as good as the Canon piece, but will protect your lens elements just the same and that is primarily what I bought it for.

I've been pouring over this monitor for the past day or so and I've been very impressed.  For starters, this monitor works flawlessly at full, stated resolution on Windows 7 64 bit.  I have a Radeon R260X video card and literally after plugging it in using  Displayport 1.2, it worked perfectly with no fiddling with hardware or software settings.My first impressions of viewing the monitor are:- Wow, it's sharp- Wow, it's vivid- Wow, everything is small nowFor some background, I've been using a Dell 3007FPW for the past 7-8 years for professionally editing photos.  I generally consider this monitor to be the best computer accessory I've ever purchased.  Going from the 3007 to this monitor is a revelation. I would describe the experience as as having poor vision your whole life, then putting on glasses for the first time and immediately having 20/15 vision.  The clarity, vividness, and sharpness of the screen is really breathtaking.There is so much resolution here you almost have to change the way you use monitors.  With most screens you view at a normal distance and that is that.  With this screen you can view at a normal distance and everything looks great.  However when you lean in and squint at the screen instead of just seeing pixels (with most normal screens) all you see is more detail in your images.  It adds another dimension to screen viewing.  That said, if you have less than ideal vision, I'm not sure I would even bother with this monitor.At normal viewing distances, text will probably look a bit small for most people.  You can use built-in Windows scaling to fix this.  You can also use independent font scaling in your web browser as well. This fixes 90% of the "small text" issues for me.  By default, I've found the monitor to be too bright as well.  After reducing brightness a bit and scaling font, the monitor is a real treat to use and look at.Here are two potential issues I've found so far:***Monitor to computer communication***  There is a USB 3.0 cable which connects the monitor to the computer.  This serves the function of sending monitor hardware information to the computer as well as to act as a USB 3.0 hub for the 3 ports on the back of the monitor (which are a complete pain to get to).  I can confirm that the monitor functions perfectly as a USB 3.0 hub, but the monitor does not seem to be sending proper hardware information to the computer.  LG includes "True Color Pro" software for tweaking and calibrating the screen and this software requires the hardware information from the monitor in order to work.  Without a properly functioning link between the computer and monitor, you cannot use this software.  So for now, I'm using the default calibration.It's also important to note at this point that this monitor comes factory calibrated for color temp, gamma, and color accuracy.  You get an individual calibration report for your actual monitor from the factory.  The calibration spec from the factory is already so impressive that I'm inclined to just leave it alone.  Goodbye Spyder 3 Pro.***Screen flickering***  Every 10-15 minutes or so the monitor screen will go black, then come back a second or two later.  I'm not sure what this is about, but it has me a little concerned.  I'm also noticing some localized color noise which happens far less frequently and lasts for only a fraction of a second.  This could be an issue with the monitor, or an issue with the DP cable or connection.I will keep this review updated as the potential issues play out, but for now the monitor seems to be a winner for me.**11/14/14 UPDATE**Talking to both LG Tech support and another source online, it seems as if DP 1.2 cables can be flaky at 4K 60z because at this setting they are pretty much maxed out in terms of bandwidth.  They are on the outer fringe of their specification and any variation in tolerance is going to cause a problem with performance.Since then, I've reduced the refresh rate of the monitor from 60hz to 50hz and so far have had no screen flickering.  For me, there is no noticeable performance difference between 50hz and 60hz so for now all is good.**12/10/14 UPDATE**I'm sad to say that I'm packing up the monitor and sending it back for a refund.  There have been a number of issues which give me pause about keeping the monitor long term.For starters, the flickering has come back - even at 50hz over DP 1.2.  This seems to only happen after using the monitor for several hours - so heat could be an issue (maybe).  At one point yesterday I even got 4-5 flickers over a 10 minute period.  I can put up with one here and there, but this is unacceptable.Secondly, on starting the monitor I've heard a loud "knocking" coming from the rear of the monitor upon first booting the computer.  It almost sounds like plastic creaking loudly.  One of the two times this caused the monitor to cycle power and the other time it caused a row of pixels on the lefthand side (maybe 30 pixels) to turn to color static.  I had to turn the monitor off, then turn it back on to remedy the issue.So basically with all things considered, I am regretfully giving the monitor up.  It is still absolutely gorgeous to look at, however there are still a few bugs which need to be worked out before I can fully recommended it for serious professional use.  For now I'm going back to my trusty Dell 30" which as been a rock solid work horse for the past 8 years.For me the wait continues for the perfect 4K computer monitor.

I ordered these shirts too quickly without paying attention to the fact they have a rounded neck at the top.  Because of this they unfortunately look funny when I wear them beneath a button-up shirt.Ignoring that, this is fantastic undershirt which is of high enough quality you could almost wear it by itself with no shirt on top.  The material is very soft and feels great against your skin.  They cost a little more than regular, cheap undershirts, but are worth the money for me.

My perspective may be a bit different than many.  I bought this TV to use for photo slideshow presentations.  I don't have any 4K video content, but I do have lots of still images which are much higher than 4K.Here is my experience:**IMAGE QUALITY**4/5  This was the main reason for me buying the TV and so far I've been happy with it.  Predictably, images look breathtakingly sharp and beautifully clear and saturated on this TV.  The panel does not distort color when viewing off-axis, but it does lose some contrast fairly quickly if not looking directly at it.  There are MANY different color and picture adjustments and with some fiddling, you will be able to get close to the ideal image with this TV.  There is some color inaccuracy in the saturation of some subtle greens and reds, but I consider this a minor issue.  Overall the picture will not compare to a calibrated IPS computer monitor, but is still excellent for a TV and sufficient for professional image slide shows.**BUILD/DESIGN**5/5  The TV is slimly designed with beautiful touches all around.  The screen has a non reflective matte finish, the bezels are thin, and the inputs are easily accessible from the righthand side of the TV.  It is also pleasantly light for a 50" 4K television.**SOFTWARE/CONTROLS**4/5  The controller for the TV functions in two different ways - with traditional buttons and via a built-in IR pointer.  You can point at the screen and click on things similar to how you would a computer mouse, but I find the accuracy of the pointer to be lacking.  Maybe it needs calibration or maybe I just need more practice.  However I find the pointer fairly tedious to use.  The buttons, however, are top notch and very responsive.The TV also has a slew of built-in smart features with many apps for content viewing and gaming.  Though I don't intend on using this part of the feature set, I was very impressed with the content and functionality relative to our other smart TV here at home (which is a Vizio).The TV allows for media (video, photo) via inputs on the back of the TV.  It has two USB 2.0 inputs, one USB 3.0 input, and several others.  I use a USB 3.0 flash drive for viewing photo and video on the TV.  Video playback is exceptional and just as smooth/streamlined as any smart phone or tablet you will find.  Photo slideshows are good, but not great - the downfall is in the software.  With a photo slideshow you can hit "play" and let the TV scroll through the images at a fixed rate (slow, med, fast), or you can manually scroll through them with the remote.  My biggest complaint is that the maximum speed of the slideshow is too slow.  Even on "fast" mode, the TV displays each image for 5 seconds.  If you choose to manually advance the images, the fastest you can scroll through them is one image every two seconds.  I can press the forward button 5x on the remote, but I'll only get one image advance every two seconds.  This makes it awkward and tedious to get through large numbers of images.  One work around would be to use a laptop and video-in to the TV, but I would lose the beautiful 4K resolution that way.In summary, I find this to be a fantastic smart TV with a picture which is great for general viewing though slightly sub-par for color critical display work.  However my usage is fairly specialized.  Given the exceptional design and price of the TV, I really find it hard to fault as-is.As a side note, I bought mine used through "Amazon Warehouse deals" for about $300 less than retail.  If you choose to go this route, get a TV with original packaging.  I ordered a repackaged TV the first time around and it came badly damaged due to poor packing by Amazon.  The original Samsung packaging of my second TV was much better.

Before I bought this product I actually went to a local hardware store and bought the 7508 burner set (which was Genuine Weber).  Much to my chagrin, these burners were about 1" shorter than the ones I needed - which were the 7506 Burner set.Moral of this story - MEASURE your burners before you place an order.  The two sets look the same, but aren't.Ok now onto this product.  I was a little surprised to see that this burner set was almost literally identical to the Weber set I had purchased a week before.  I saw no reason to pay twice as much for the Weber brand burners when I could make no difference between the two sets.As others have mentioned, I can confirm these burners are maybe 1/4" shorter than the original 7506 burners.  This was a small enough difference that I had no problem fitting them into my grill securely.  The support platform for the end of the burners had enough dead space on it that a 1/4" shorter burner still fit with no issue.  The new burners brought life to my aging weber grill and helped me put off buying a new grill.  Overall a great product.

I only had this product for a few days.  I bought it for some suspension work on my Honda S2000, but had to send it back.  The opening of the forks was too narrow to fit around the ball joint.  If you are considering this for a Honda or Acura product, I would look elsewhere.

This is my first non-foaming shave gel and at first I didn't like it.  It goes on almost clear (slight foam if you lather vigorously) so it doesn't appear like it would protect your face very much.  It almost feels like you're rubbing body wash on your face.  I can confirm though, this stuff is very slippery and protects your face well from shave irritation.  I have definitely noticed less razor burns and bleeding with this shave gel over previous foaming gels.  I'll be buying more once this tube runs out.

I'll start off with the bad.  My computer did not like this enclosure over ESATA.  I run a P8P67 LE motherboard (with built-in Esata) on Windows 64 bit.  The computer would recognize all four drives and transfer data just fine for 30-40 minutes, then freeze up.  Cycling power on the enclosure did not help.  I had to reboot the computer to get it to come back.  I could then transfer data for another 20 minutes or so before another freeze up.  Now before I get too hard on this product, let me say that this issue might very well be an incompatibility with my ESATA controller.  The motherboard is 4 years old, so who knows.After switching to USB 3.0 the enclosure has been absolutely flawless.  I run this enclosure with (4) 4TB WD green hard drives and have not experienced a single hiccup. It took probably 2 days to transfer all of my data over to the drives and had no errors or malfunctions at all over USB 3.0.  I have been using it ever since then to backup data and have been very pleased.The product itself is designed very well and is remarkably easy to install and remove drives.  All you do is screw a small plastic bracket onto your hard drives, then insert them into the enclosure.  Within 10 minutes of opening the box, I was transferring data onto the drives.  Setup really could not have been easier.My impression of this drive after reading all of the reviews and using it myself is that it *may* be picky with interface controllers.  If for some reason it doesn't like your ESATA or USB 3.0 controller, you may need to get an add-in card for it to work properly.  Unfortunately this is a result of fragmented technology and is the nature of DIY computers.  Once you find a controller it likes, the drive is super easy to use and rock solid in its operation.  Fully recommended from me.

The big problem with using LED lights for photo and video work is color fidelity.  Almost all of them have some sort of nasty color cast that remains on the image after it has been color corrected.  This is due to the non-linearity in which it emits its color spectrum.  This "quality" of light is reflected in the CRI - or "color rendering index".  Sunlight is a perfect 100, and most other forms of light are lower than this.  Any LED light which does not advertise a CRI is probably a pretty bad light, so buyer beware.  This light claims a CRI of over 92, which is impressively good.A few years back I bought a $40 LED light here off Amazon and it was just terrible.  It left a nasty green cast to the images which made them only good for black and white. I literally used it once, then sold it - swearing off LED lights for serious photo work for nearly three years.  Since then I've been using incandescent video lights for low-light photo work and have generally been happy.  The issue with these, however, is that they are limited in output, have a fixed color temperature, and are power hungry.  They were relatively inexpensive, very portable, and had decent (but not perfect) color - so they were good enough.With the impressive specs of this light, I decided to venture back into LED lighting.  After a couple wedding shoots with this, I am impressed with the light.  They get fairly bright, use very little power, and have lots of great features such as a dimmer, color temperature variability (3200k to 5600k), and battery meter (YES! Finally).I am also happy to report that unlike cheap LED lights of yesteryear, these have decent color.  After some investigation, I suspect the >92 CRI rating is for the 5600k setting, not the 3200k setting, though.  The color quality at 5600k seems to be quite good, while I can report a noticeable - though not terrible - red color cast at the 3200k setting.  Keep in mind that this is going to result in a green tint to the backgrounds when color correcting this light at 3200k.  Depending on the nature of what you photography, this might or might not be an issue for you.  For me, it's not ideal, but not a deal-breaker either.Given the features, versatility, and quality of the light, I'm willing to let the slight red cast at 3200k slide with a 1/2 star deduction.  I'm definitely keeping the light and even thinking about picking up another one.  For me, this light is a game-changer for low-light events and portraiture.

First of all, this is a beautiful shirt.  It has a very small pitch pinstripe which is very subtle and can only be seen on close inspection.  It's a nice detail that looks really good.  It also has a slight sheen to it that gives it a nice look over what would be a plain grey shirt.  The shirt feels put together well and of very high quality.My only qualm with the shirt is that it definitely is not slim fit.  I ordered a 32/33, 16-1/2" shirt and have 42" shoulders and a 33" waist.  I have found there is a fair amount of loose material around the midsection, which is slightly disappointing.  I would put this shirt about halfway in between a true slim fit shirt and a regular fit shirt.For me, this wasn't a complete dealbreaker, but it is something to consider before ordering.

I bought these to increase my signal with the Asus N66u router, but unfortunately they didn't work out for me.  My cable comes in the house in my office, which is upstairs to the far right corner of the house.  My Vizio smart TV in on the ground floor at the far left corner of the house.  So basically this is the worst wi-fi configuration possible for signal strength.  Right now I'm using a repeater to get a reliable signal to the smart TV and it's working well.  I'd like to ditch the repeater and just use the wireless router in the office to the entire house.This is where the antennas come in.My connection is 50mbs/11mbs Comcast cable and has been very reliable.  These are the signal tests I performed using the "wifi signal strength" app on my HTC One Android phone.  I held the phone up near the TV (with the repeater unplugged).  Note that this is a "worst case" scenario for wifi in my home, but unfortunately its exactly the scenario needed by my smart TV in order to stream video.Stock N66u antennas: -68dB, 20mb/s download speed  (test completed without error)Super Power Supply antennas:  -74dB, 3.5mb/s download speed  (test actually errored out before completion)So with the "upgraded" antennas (positioned identically to stock antennas), I lost about 6dB of signal strength and a significant amount of speed to my wireless connection.  I tried a couple other antenna positions to see if I could improve reception, but it only got worse from there - which suggested the original position was the optimal one.So that's the story for me.  Not only did they not improve reach, but they actually made it worse.  I'm not saying all of the other folks are wrong, I'm just saying your mileage may vary.

This is a low end low priced softbox which works just fine.  I've used it for a few headshots and the light is quite nice.  If I had it to do over again, I'd probably pay a few bucks more and get a different softbox.The reason for this is that once the softbox is set up, you cannot access your flash.  For flash units which require you to make an adjustment on the flash itself (instead of remotely from your camera), you literally have no access without peeling back the diffusion layer and grid.  If you only have to make a single adjustment, this isn't too tedious, but for constant adjusting, this is an absolute dealbreaker for this product.Bottom line for me... for flashes that you can adjust remotely, this is a 5/5 product.  For flashes you need to continually access for adjustments, it's a 3/5 product.

I own an Epson Artisan 730 printer that is an absolute diva with paper.  I seriously have not gotten a photo to print properly on it using anything except Epson branded photo paper - which is super annoying.  So with that preface, I do really like this product because it works well in my printer and the prints are the best I've seen.  The prints dry almost instantly and look incredibly good.  Color accuracy, saturation, and tones are all spot-on.  With quality like this, I actually prefer printing at home instead of sending jobs off to a print lab - even though it does me a little more.

I bought two jugs of the 2lb peanut butter chocolate flavor about a month ago.  Now having gone through one of the two pound jugs I feel like I'm ready to give a review on the protein.First of all, the bad.  Taste. I feel like MuscleTech went way over the top with the artificial flavors and sweeteners with this protein.  The protein has a very intense artificially sweet taste to it.  If the sweetness is a "10", I feel like something around a 6 would have been ideal.  If you have the option, I would recommend mixing the product with milk instead of water.  This will blunt the sweetness a bit and give the shake more substance.  Granted, I've only tried one of the flavors, but I suspect the intensity of the sweetness is similar with all of the flavors.However... with that in mind, this seems to be a great functional protein.  Shakes are thick and keep me satisfied far longer than regular whey protein.  The difference was noticeable from the very first time I used it.  So in that regard, I do really like this protein.In the end though, most high quality proteins are more or less equally effective.  It's not magic and one brand is not going to make drastic changes in your physique regardless of what any company's marketing department tells you.  For the price, I feel like there are equally good proteins (or better) on the market with a much less offensive taste.3.5/5 stars

My wife and I used this fixture in our bathroom to replace an (unnecessary) ceiling fan that had broken down.  This is a very simple, elegant fixture which was very easy to install and looks nice in the bathroom.  I'm not exactly electrically inclined, and I had this installed in 20 minutes.  It uses a standard mounting plate and takes a pair of light bulbs.  The diffuser tightens by hand with three screws placed 120 degrees apart.  Overall, very simple construction and usage for basic lighting needs.  I would definitely buy another one.

This is an interesting product.  Its lower in quality than a photographic paper, yet higher in quality than card stock.  I consider it a good choice for people looking for a high quality paper for ink-jet printed brochures.  I run a photography business and I use these for sell-sheets and have been pleased with them.  The paper is very smooth and has a fine grain to it, which lens itself to more high quality graphics than a lower quality papers.I've found the color with this paper to be consistent and the drying time to be extremely fast.  The paper also lays flat after auto-duplexing.  This is notable because I've noticed that lower end card stock papers tend to curl up and distort slightly after being printed fed through the printer twice to have both sides printed on.Overall a nice paper with very good performance in my Epson Artisan 730 printer.

I put this reel in my garage so i could unwind hose and wash my car just outside the garage.  The overall design of the unit is fine, but I suspect it would have benefited greatly from a few metal parts.  Instead, the all plastic design is rather flimsy *and* the unit has leaked since day one.  I followed the directions to the letter, even reseated the reel on it's wall mount several times, carefully.  This did not reduce the leaking.  There is a slow drip coming from the bottom of the unit.  I finally gave up trying to fix it and just put a cup beneath it to catch the water.  Over the course of a 20 minute car wash, it will collect about 10oz of water.  Slightly annoying, but not the end of the world.The reel carriage itself is plastic and does flex some.  After about 4 months of usage it has bent and warped slightly so that it is no longer straight.  The reel still works "ok", but I have a feeling this unit will probably completely break or fall apart in less than two years.  If I had it to do over again I would have gotten something sturdier.

These are nice cards which look identical to what you see in the picture.  They come delivered flat, not folded.  This means that you have to "fold at the crease" to get the card in a form which most people will use.  Not a huge deal, but be aware if your folding skills aren't great, you're likely to mess up a few cards while going through the pack.The paper is a nice quality and accepts ink well, though the stock is a little thinner than I would prefer.  I would pay an extra 5-10 bucks for thicker paper, but in all this is a nice product for the price.

Check the active ingredients on your Tribulus and you'll find that they're not all the same.  This formula by Sports Foods (a relatively unknown brand to me) is the most potent I have found.  I've used tribulus in the past and found it good for mainly increasing libido, but little else.After going on a 6 month break from tibulus, starting back on this product was a real treat.
