Weight is an issue in a vacuum like this, because as you vacuum the floor, your arm supports most of the weight of the vacuum.  I am not particularly weak, but the downward pull of the larger machine is very tiring on my arm.  The motor head of the other machine kicks crumbs around on the bare floor.  Those two features and a few lesser ones make me realize how silly I was to insist upon a corded vacuum, and that my attempt to save money was less than successful.It's an easy task to walk over to the trash can and open the little trap door to release the picked-up dirt.  I haven't cleaned the filter yet, but it simply lifts out and can be rinsed and allowed to air dry.Kudos to the Dyson company for packing the vacuum into its carton with recyclable cardboard instead of Styrofoam.I realize that this is a high-priced item and initially considered removing one star for that reason, but the performance and ease of use are so satisfying that it would be unfair to give it less than a five-star review.

Turning a Victorian "Fainting Room" into a computer room presents challenges.  When the house was electrified, there was only one outlet put into this room.  A couple of electrical upgrades later, but we still have only one outlet for all this "stuff."  This Belkin 12-outlet  surge protector strip, is short enough (about 13") to fit into a tight space, and three rows of outlets allow us to insert different varieties of plugs and transformers at various angles.  The 8' cord  with a flat-lying plug allows us to snake it from the outlet to a convenient spot.  I am so glad that we have this product!

I'm on my third iPod Touch, always taking it traveling, always charging it with Belkin plug-in chargers.  Most of my charging cables have been Belkin products also, and they've never frayed, cracked, or failed in any way.  The "mixit" 1.2 meter or 4 foot cable I received to review has a couple of features that are different from the others.  First feature is the length.  I don't know why Apple makes those puny 3' charge/sync cords, which require the user to be right next to an electrical outlet or computer.  Four feet is a definite improvement, although I still prefer the 6 foot cords I've bought.  Second feature is the cool cable look.  The cord looks like one of the locking cables that people put on their laptops to secure them to a chair in a coffee shop to prevent a grab theft.  I don't know and doubt if the actual working cables inside this braided plastic sheath are any different, but the multi-shade sheath appears to be actually braided, and, if so, would be stronger than a thin plastic coating.  The connection points appear to be sturdy, and my iPod started charging immediately when I plugged it onto the new cable.Great cable.  One star off for the high price.

In the last decade or so, beer has become a beverage to be discussed and savored, in addition to its traditional function as something to drink while socializing or watching a sporting event.  THE BEER WENCH'S GUIDE TO BEER, by Ashley Routson, can serve as a manual for savoring and understanding beer.  It is a fun and informative manual that avoids becoming too technical or pretentious.So, what are the different styles of beers?  Where did they originate, and why?  There are nine separate chapters on many of the popular brews, from pale lagers to very bold ales and beyond.  How are they made?  This aspect of beer is handled more briefly but with enough detail to provide an understanding.  This is not a manual for making beer.  Finally, enjoying beer, which is what this book is really about.  Choosing beer styles to pair with various foods:  There are suggestions to get started.  After trying a few suggested pairings, we can branch out and can begin to recognize what works together and what doesn't.  We can start cooking with beer.  There is a sampling of recipes submitted by brewers.  I have my eye on those Blackout Stout Chocolate Cupcakes.  Finally, there's a section on beer cocktails.  Those are for you to try; I'm not quite ready for these.  Maybe next year.

It looks like many other flat graters, like a paddle with a handle and two widths of grating blades, ribbons, and coarse shreds.  You can hold it with one hand and grate a little cheese or chocolate onto another part of the recipe.  An example would be some Parmesan cheese onto pasta.  On the underside of the handle is the button that activates the feature that makes this Joseph Joseph grater unique.  Push the button and rotate the handle to put it at a 90 degree angle to the grater.  Then set it onto a board or plate, where the angle at the end of the handle creates a way to stand the grater up,  You have to hold onto the grater with one hand, so it's still a two-hand operation, but with the grater propped in this way, you can take on some bigger jobs that can't be completed in a few seconds.  You now shred a whole apple (not the core, of course), or enough cheddar or similar firm cheese for tacos or to top onion soup.  The propped-up grater is quite stable, thanks to the grippy material at the end of the handle and along the opposite edge of the grater itself. I'm finding it very easy to use, easy to wash in the dishwasher, and easy to store when it's flat.  There's a durable plastic cover that slides on to cover the sharp grater.  You can also grate directly onto this cover, and supposedly measure how much grated food collects.  The measurement is wildly inaccurate, but it's fine for an estimate of how much you've grated.

It was fun reminiscing about past work assignments where we would be stationed far from home and where there were many co-workers from British Commonwealth countries.  Tea was always served in proper china cups, and the sugar and the milk pitcher were carried to the table on a little tray.  Even those ladies used teabags most of the time, so my family and I tested Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire Tea in complete confidence that we were using authentic procedure.  After allowing the bags to steep in the just-boiled water for a few minutes, we poured and sipped, at first with no milk.  The outstanding quality to me was that the tea was very smooth and flavorful, and there was no hint of the acrid bitterness that I have experienced when drinking typical teas of the brands I grew up with in the United States; I'll not mention any brands.  So I added a little milk and I felt I was back having an afternoon cup with my fellow wives of construction employees in far-off places.  If your impression of black tea is that it is something that makes your mouth pucker a bit, please try the Taylors of Harrogate.  It will be a new taste experience.

I was expecting the Cetaphil Men Daily Face Wash to be a close relation to the Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser I've used for years on recommendation from a dermatologist.  The Men product is quite different.  The first thing I noticed was a mild scent, which faded quickly.  Second, while the Gentle product can be wiped off or lightly rinsed, the Men product clings more to the skin and must be thoroughly rinsed off.  Third, don't do what I did and use the Men product on or near your the eyes, as I've always used the Gentle product!  Ouch!  Does that ever sting!We have placed the pump bottle of the Men product in our shower rack and are using it as more of a general shower gel.  And we like it.

Phyto 5 Extreme Cream is intended for dry, needy skin.  I've been applying this cream to my face twice a day, as instructed on the Amazon.com website, and my average-to-dry face has felt dryer than it has in the years I've been using a product that I buy in a big jar for around $10.  In fact, today, when I'm not wearing make-up, my face felt too dry, so I rubbed on some of the old stuff over the Phyto 5.  The dry vs hydrated feeling is purely subjective; others may love the soft, not moist effect.  I did discover that it is a mistake to use more than a tiny amount of the Phyto 5 or it leaves a whitish film that I dissipated by spreading the cream over my neck and collarbone.  There is a faint floral fragrance that lasts.  I could smell it on my pillowcase when I awoke this morning.Kudos to the company for using a new type tube for this product that promises the ability to use every last drop of what you pay for without having to cut open the bottom of the tube and scoop out the last drops.  Waste of products because of packaging is an insult to consumers, so I hope the packaging delivers as promised.

The name "Ritz" on a towel means, to me, a tough workhorse kitchen tool that will take on all the drying and wiping tasks I demand of it, and, on its way to the laundry, maybe wipe up a spill on the floor.  That towel will happily survive a hot-water wash, maybe with bleach, and return to the kitchen, challenging me to work it harder.  I have at least six Ritz kitchen towels in their signature plaid that are around ten years old, and still going strong.  My Ritz potholders have survived similar treatment and get used all through every day.  The Ritz name, partnered with All-Clad, another serious cook's favorite, I thought would mean a product that could take the heat in the kitchen.  The towel I took out of the packaging had a couple of white thread pulls from the reverse white side pulled through to the tan decorative side before any use.  I washed it before using it, as directed, in cold water, and it did an admirable job wiping some glassware and plastic items that didn't get dry in the dishwasher.  It does look great hanging in the kitchen.  But if a couple of people wipe their hands on it, I want to wash it in hot water before I use it on dishes again.  This is a very attractive towel to save for when company is coming and I want the open kitchen to look its best.

The TP-LINK Archer High Gain Wireless Dual Band USB Adapter is a tiny device that has proven to be a big solution to the weak wi-fi signal in the bedroom that is farthest away from our router.  It was a simple matter to disable the wi-fi capabilities from the somewhat aged laptop we keep down there and pop this device into the usb slot.  Amazingly, the signal is almost as strong as when we do a speed test right beside the router.  We are very happy to have had an opportunity to test this little addition to the laptop.

The scissors themselves are nicely made - no rough edges, grippy handles that work for lefties or righties, in four bright colors, and a convenient measuring gauge printed on one of the (2") rounded-tip blades.  There's a little clear tab under which one could place a tiny scrap with each kid's name, but I couldn't get the tab to budge, and it really doesn't matter, because we pass out and collect the scissors after each craft session.  These scissors will not disappoint a kid who wants to cut out a snowflake or valentine, as the cutting edges are sharp enough to do the job.The carrying case is a teacher's dream.  There's a center-handled case that holds four cups of six scissors each - easy to set out on craft tables, and easy to collect.  Each of the cups fits snugly into a corner slot of the central handle.I know some kids, I call them the "flash mob," who are going to love using these scissors when it's my day to do crafts with them.

I love the crisp, rather nautical, Oxford blue and white color of the Contigo Jackie Kids Water Bottle, but, since it holds 17 ounces of water, it is not just for kids.  In fact, I've decided to keep this for myself, and grandson L bring one of his own when we go on our walks.I like that the top can be opened by pushing a tab with the thumb of the same hand I'm using to hold the bottle.  However, be sure to push the top back on firmly; as I'm writing this, the top has popped open when I didn't push it completely closed.  To use the carrying ring, hold the bottle and grasp the ring from the sides 90 degrees from the hinge.  It's easy to clean this bottle, because the entire white top unscrews, a feature more bottles should have but don't.All of the edges and sides are silky smooth, the hinge is sturdy - quality all the way.  Tell your kid not to lose this one!

We have a long, narrow row house; the DSL connection enters at the front of the house.  Near  what used to be the rear end of the house, about 60' away, we have a second router/modem connected to the first one by CAT6 cable in the attic.  behind that there are three bedrooms stacked upon each other, and, formerly, there was no dependable internet connection in the farthest, first-floor bedroom.  The Linksys AC1200 Amplify Dual Band Range Extender was delivered today, and, within twenty minutes or so, there was a decent signal both in that room and in our backyard, right behind that room.  The signal shows on my iPod touch as being strong, but the speed drops off slightly.  Here is our download speed breakdown, according to speedtest.net:  At first router about 13mbps.  At the second router, about 5.85mbps.  At the farthest bedroom, with the Linksys AC1200 connected, about 5mbps.Placement and installation of the new range extender was easy.  First, we tried to connect to the Linksys website listed in the instructions, but received an error message.  Next, we tried the Linksys main website, doing a search with the model number, and received some help, but not the connection we'd hoped for.  Finally, we plugged in the extender to an electrical outlet that seemed logical, and moved on to step 3 in the Quick Start booklet, connected to the website given, and, seeing the extender show up as an option on our Kindle Fire, and we were in business.We have not, and probably never will, stream music to a wireless device with this extender, but the feature of being able to use the outlet that is covered is a plus, with limited outlets in that room.  So, the extender extends, and all's right with the world.

I served all four varieties of Chef's Cut Real Steak Jerky on a tray to a group of friends who came over to watch a Giants game.  The Giants lost, but the jerky was a real winner!  I've eaten the jerky that is sold on a rack near the cash register in a drugstore.  This is a whole different product.  We noticed right away that it is sliced slightly thicker, which gives it a nice mouth feel.  It is more flexible and chewy, more like eating meat, not cardboard.  Because it tastes more meaty, it does not seem as salty as drugstore jerky.  Each of the four varieties had distinctive flavoring, and our friends had personal favorites among the four in the variety pack.  I particularly liked the chicken and turkey varieties, but the beef varieties had some real fans among us also.  This is a premium product, and we very much appreciate this opportunity to taste and review it.

This review is for the Westinghouse Iron, 5 oz. tank, listed as "good."  And it is good.  It does some jobs my $300 steam pressure iron cannot do, and I don't have to wait 10 - 15 minutes for the steam boiler to heat up.  This is the iron that quickly heats up enough water to steam press an outfit when you realize that you really cannot face colleagues looking so wrinkled, or when you want to dry iron on a decal or patch or a piece of Velcro.  The lightweight Westinghouse iron steams vertically, so you just pull on the lapel or skirt of a hanging garment to stretch it a bit, then blast it with a bit of steam.  Nice.  This iron weighs only about 1.5 lb, without water, and the lovely 8.5 foot cord swivels around on a ball bearing.  It has the control properly placed under the handle so that the thermostat is close to the soleplate.  This gives more accurate temperature control, even if it is a little more difficult to turn the dial.  The iron has automatic shut-off, which I find annoying, but which probably has prevented many house fires.  I recommend this iron as a second iron for a serious, committed ironer (there are a few left in the world), and as a first and only iron for a modern person who performs mostly light ironing and lets no-iron fabrics take care of the rest.

The first thing I noticed about Scotts Outdoor Cleaner Plus OxiClean was the smell.  Unless you put your nose right to the open bottle, there isn't one.  I did side-by-side comparisons with two other products that I use regularly.  The Quick-n-Brite I use in my kitchen, simply was not at all effective on the smoky, greasy exterior of our stainless steel gas barbecue, so that left the Scotts and the Krud Kutter solution, my go-to product for greasy clean-ups.  I sprayed both onto the metal, which was a warm from the sun, waited a few minutes, then wiped with microfiber clothes.  The results were pretty even.  The softer grease wiped right off, and with a little rubbing, so did the more crusty parts.  On a patch of once-reddish, now green bricks, the Scotts Outdoor Cleaner bubbled and foamed, and the green wiped right off the smooth bricks.  The Krud Kutter took slightly more rubbing, but it also worked.  Neither product was very effective on the algae-covered redwood fence board I tried to clean, even with a scrub brush.The Scotts Outdoor Cleaner is very effective on the types of surfaces it claims to clean, the label says that it is safe for plants and grass, and it is essentially odorless.  This formulation comes in an ergonomic spray bottle that offers spray and stream options, and it is ready to use, without having to measure and make a solution with water.

As a home/rental property owner, I try do most of the small repairs myself.  The wrenches in this Crescent combination wrench set will probably not get the hard use at our houses that they will in a car repair place, but I've applied some real torque to one of them, loosening a nut on a rusted planter box somewhat easily, and I'm enjoying the ease of being able to loosen and tighten nuts without having to move the appliance they're attached to.  Experiment #2 was tightening the nuts on the back of my dryer to cut down on the rattling.  Usually I have to pull the dryer away from the wall in its little slot.  Now I was able to reach behind and tighten up what needs to be taken care of.  I like to do the same thing on the washer, but it is so heavy that I need a second person to help get the thing away from the wall.  Again, I was able to tighten the nuts by simply reaching behind.  It's so easy to do with the open-ended side of the wrenches in spots that are really too tight even for my socket wrench.  Most of the jobs I do involve inches, not millimeters, so I will purchase another set, while my spouse is eyeing the metric set for his beloved sports car.

While waiting for my shipment of Nia 24 Neck Sculpting Complex to arrive, I read the review of a fellow Vine reviewer describing a painful reaction to this cream.  So, when my sample arrived, I tried it in the crook of my arm for a couple of days before applying it to my neck.  There was no adverse reaction, so I got down to business of transforming my slightly crepe-y neck back to its condition in my golden youth.The cream is a dense formulation with a slight herbal aroma and a very slight alcohol-like scent.  All the scents dissipate when I apply the cream.  It doesn't take much; the jar will last a long time.  In the six days I've been using the cream, I noticed nothing the first couple of days.  Since then, I've felt a slight tightness in the area, which I'm taking as a good sign.  There is no discomfort.I believe this cream is working, but it will take several more weeks before I can declare definitive success.  Of course, for this treatment to be successful long-term, one must keep buying more of this cream.  And, that's why I took off one star - the cost of the treatment.  But, the worth of expenditures is a personal decision.

The Hitachi cordless driver drill includes a few helpful features that another small drill I own does not have.  First, the kit comes with a second battery.  Although Lithium-Ion batteries last a long time on a full charge, when they do go out, they drop off rapidly, so it's great to have a second fully charged one ready for an extended job.  Second, it is really helpful to have a clutch on a small driver drill when you're driving screws in a tight space barely big enough to get fingers near, a clutch can insure consistent torque and may prevent over-driving a screw when you can't really see what you're doing, even with the help of the convenient included work light (which should be placed closer to the top of the handle so it shines directly onto the workpiece).  I found myself up on a ladder attaching some trim high over my head on our back fence.  I probably would have pushed too hard and maybe dropped the screw without the consistent torque.  This project brings up the third helpful feature.  It's that included belt loop.  When last I tried a project along this fence, I dropped my hand clippers over to the neighboring property.  I could hang this driver drill onto a hook each time I wanted to make an adjustment.  The small size (6.75" length, plus whatever bit you add) and light weight (just under 2.5 lb including the battery), make this a great option for repairs and home projects.  Its small diameter allowed me to reattach a strip of trim to a cabinet with a thin screw that is only about an inch above the floor.  When I originally attached this trim, I had to use a multi-tool (Dremel) which involved a cord, and was quite inconvenient.The kit comes with a carrying case, the second battery and charger, and a set of bits, which are all enclosed in a decent carrying case with room for some drill bits (not included).

These earrings, depicting the Celtic Tree of Life, have an elegant, silky feel.  The wire branches of the tree intertwine, as do the roots.  The border of the earring is composed of tiny balls within two circles, and each sphere is accented by dark oxidation in the background. At the center of each tree is a gray-purple adventurine stone about 1/16" across, and the stone is set in a four-prong mounting as the stone in a ring would be.The feature of these earrings that distinguishes them from other earrings in this price range is the careful finishing.  There are no rough spots anywhere, including where the elements of the design are joined together.  The earrings have the appearance of fine jewelry.  The size of the circles is about the same as a nickel, and the top of the loop that holds the circle onto the wire falls just below my earlobe.

Commercially prepared sauces in jars will probably never be as good as Mama's or Luigi's at the café down the street, but they can be really useful in preparing a healthy meal on the fly, when the alternative is fast food.  That is exactly the situation I imagined when I prepared a quick meal of a jar of Barilla Roasted Garlic Pasta Sauce, 1/2 pound of spaghetti, and a package of pre-cooked Italian sausage.  Making a quick salad from a bag of pre-washed greens completed a decent dinner in less time than I could have ordered take-out or waited for delivery.The sauce is rather mild for my taste, but a little salt and a shake of red pepper on my portion fixed that.  There are lots of pieces of roasted garlic in the sauce, and the mild flavor of roasted garlic is quite noticeable.  As I said, it's not homemade, but it's good.The Spicy Marinara is even better, to my taste.  It has lots of chunks of ingredients and a snappy chile bite that might be a bit too much for a picky child.  This variety does not need any doctoring to sauce pasta, polenta, or a sauté of vegetables and sausages.Both varieties are low calorie and very low in fat.  I will, from now on, keep a few jars of Barilla sauces in my "last-minute dinner" arsenal.  Thanks, Amazon.com and Barilla, for the opportunity to try and to review these sauces.

We live in a somewhat gritty urban neighborhood; surveillance of the street right before we installed this system may have identified the criminals who broke into a parked car in broad daylight outside my house last week.  We found that set-up was reasonably easy, although the system kept jumping to another wireless network than the one we specified on my mobile device.  We called customer service, and were surprised and delighted with the attentive and patient assistance we received from "Andy".  He helped us to re-set the system a couple of times, to match one of the two networks we have in our home.  It's good that we learned to do this, because we have had several notifications that the monitor is not responding, and we have had to go through the process repeatedly.Setting up the cameras is easy if there is a plug near the site where you want the camera.  We are going to have a cleaner installation when we have a plug installed a little closer to our porch, but for now, we've run the thin wire through a window and under some molding a total distance of about eight feet.  The cameras come with devices to connect to a building with various angles permitted.  The camera comes with a thin cord plus extension cord.  Why, we wonder, are there right-angle connections between these two cords?  A much smoother connection could be made with either one long cord or another type of connection between the two cords.  As an experiment, we took the second camera to our rental across the street, maybe 100 feet, and were able to get a signal, although we don't plan to put a permanent installation there.  The video transmitted from the cameras is quite high quality, even with all the shadows from street trees that we have.  This system will be a very satisfactory set-up for us, as soon as we can get the signal to be consistent without having to re-set it so often.

The Hefty Slider Storage Bags claim to have a stronger seal than Ziploc bags, and I certainly wouldn't argue with that claim. I've never been able to get Ziploc bags to seal and always use a clip to hold them shut.  The Hefty sliders do close quite securely and will continue to seal for a few uses, but over time, or if the grip edge gets greasy, the grip just fails.I find the quart size bag best for packing snacks to take kids to the playground, or for a day hike.  They will keep a sandwich fresh, and they will securely transport a handful of fruit.  They are great for keeping sewing supplies dust free  and organized, and for transporting items one wants to keep clean while doing a messy job.  For example, I like to put masking tape in a Hefty Slider bag before I throw it in with my paint supplies.  So long as the bag is not overstuffed, they live up to the claims on the box.

Space is at a premium in our house, and our broom doesn't have a closet to hide in, so we've always kept it in a little space between the refrigerator and the end of the cabinets.  Because the orientation of the hanging loop on the broom itself, hanging on a hook attached to the cabinet has never quite worked.  The Command Broom Gripper grabs the broom below the hook, so the problem is solved; the broom now lies flat and fits into the space.Installation is simple enough:  Clean the surface with alcohol.  Remove the adhesive from one side of the included strips and stick to the hook.  Remove the liner from the "business" side of the strips and press the Gripper in place for 30 seconds.  Let the adhesive set for an hour, then it's good to go. There are instructions for removal, which with other Command products, I've found to be simple and neat.Push the broom into the gripper to secure, and pull on the broom to release it.  It's all quite ingenious and unobtrusive.  The Broom Gripper protrudes from the wall 2".Rating:  5 stars for the product itself.  But it seems a bit pricey for a hook.

The window we like to keep open most of the time is on the west side of our house and catches the wind that roars in from the Pacific most afternoons.  The room closest to this window is our bedroom, which has always been in need of daily attention to the layer of dust that blew in.  I saw the roll of PollenTec Clean Air Window Screen discussed elsewhere and ordered it from Amazon.com.  We opted to have a new screen made for this window rather than retrofit the crumbling old one.  Popped that screen into the window and immediately noticed that it was slightly darker in the room.  Slightly.  After a few days I don't notice it anymore.  There is still a breeze blowing in, bringing the fresh air to the odd back part of our very old house.  I noticed the next morning that there was still a very light mist of dust on the windowsill and the nearby furniture.  Then, I realized that for the first time in weeks my eyes were not itching!  My spouse is so happy that he is not fighting with the avocado tree in the neighbor's yard, which is in bloom right now.  This is great.  We have lots of Pollentec screen left, so I'm going to attempt to make a small screen for the other window on that side of the house.After I bought the Pollentec, I received an email from Paul Honnen, owner of Pollentec, asking me to write a review here.  So, I emailed him back pointing out that there were no cleaning instructions with the roll of screen or on their website.  He replied, saying that once or twice a season to spray the screen with a medium spray from a garden hose.  Note:  I did not receive any compensation for this review.

Grandson, almost 2.5 years, was absolutely captivated by this toy owned by other kids at the playground a couple of times when he jockeyed his way through the gathering to play with it.  I almost had to drag him away to go home. So, I bought him one of his own.  He couldn't take it outside the day it arrived, but he took it into the tub for water fun. When sand or water is poured through the cone at the top, the first wheel spins one direction, and the second wheel spins the other direction.  The bottom support is perforated to allow sand to flow through.  He calls it "making coffee."This one, and the ones at the playground, seem sturdy and up to the treatment a little kid gives to a playground toy.  A well-made toy that's fun - what could be better than that?

Until the last year or so I thought people who talked about their allergies were hypochondriacs or malingerers.  That was then.  More recently, particularly in the house, I have felt itchy eyes, congestion, and other symptoms that I had scoffed at.  I blamed it on cosmetics, my grandkids' colds, not wishing to brand myself with the scarlet "A" for allergies.  An always-open window brought in enough dust to require daily attention, which it didn't always receive.  So, when I was offered an opportunity to review the Febreze HEPA-Type Tower Air Purifier, I vacuumed, dusted, put the curtains into the dryer to de-dust - everything I could think of to get ready for the arrival.The tower itself is easy to set up.  Remove the covers from the filters, pop in a Febreze fragrance cartridge, and plug in.  The fragrance at the highest level was a bit too much for us, but turning the knob to just below half-strength gave us a hint of fragrance.  The cleaning level knob offers three levels, and of course we started it at level III, eager to get moving.  We turned it down to II to quiet the tower while we slept, and I sort of forgot about the thing.  Then, this morning, as I was putting on make-up, I realized  MY EYES DID NOT ITCH.  Absolutely amazing.  This afternoon, when the light shined through the window just right, I gave the curtain a good shake, and the smaller-than-usual amount of dust that I could see in the light started moving toward the tower.I'm convinced.  Allergies are real, and I have some.  Thanks to this efficient air purifier, my sleep is not going to be interrupted by sneezing and dry eyes.  We are thinking seriously of buying one of these for the front part of our house.  What a relief!

I have, over the years, watched in awe demonstrations of automatic embroidery machines, but had never actually used one.  As the Brother PE 525 Embroidery Machine is an entry-level machine, I am relaying my learning experience, hoping that others will be able to assess which machine to buy.  The machine is a snap to set up; essentially you plug it in, wind the bobbin (there is one pre-wound bobbin included), thread the machine, snap fabric and backing onto the machine, pick a design, and you're embroidering!Now, step-by-step:  There is a quick-start guide included, but I found the more detailed Operation Manual (two, actually, one in English and one in Spanish) to be more suited to a rank beginner.  Attach the power cord and turn the machine on, and spend a few minutes surfing the little screen for various features, included patterns and fonts, then get to the business of winding the bobbin.  First, I learned that the bobbins are a standard-size, available wherever sewing supplies are sold.  They are usually wound in white thread because the embroidery patterns cover both the back and front of the fabric; the bobbin thread does not show through on the right side of the pattern.  The books have a diagram for threading and for bobbin winding, and there are numbers and arrows printed on the machine itself.  The process is very much like winding a bobbin for a sewing machine.Second, thread the machine.  This is pretty straightforward, much like a sewing machine, except for the self-threading needle.  Wow.  I love this!  I re-did this part of the process numerous times, because this is something that is very difficult for me on my sewing machine.For practice, I used scraps of old fabric from the rag bag that I attached with spray glue to a purchased piece of interfacing.  The work area and the included patterns are 4" x 4", not a big area, but by moving the hoop and adding another pattern or repeating the same pattern, the total design could be much larger.  Choose a pattern, and the machine tells which color to thread onto the machine.  It quickly takes care of business, making all of its stitches, then either pauses and moves to another area that uses the same color or it stops and tells you to thread in another color.  After the process is complete, all you need to do is remove the fabric from the hoop and clip the threads with the (included) embroidery scissors.  I also experimented with a couple of the included fonts.  You simply choose the font, choose the size (large, medium, or small), and choose the letters for your word on the touchscreen.  All the stitching I did, using the included thread and bobbin and then using some of my own threads turned out perfectly.  I will purchase the recommended polyester thread for any "real" projects.The seventy included designs are mostly very traditional.  There are an unlimited number of designs available for purchase from Brother's own iEmbroidery site and from others.  It is also possible to use an existing .png design file by converting it with software to a .pes file compatible with the Brother machines.  If I understand the manual correctly, these functions can only be done with a PC, not an Apple computer, at this time.  However, watch for software updates, which can be accessed with the included USB cable.I have found the Brother PE 525 to be extremely user friendly and I am thrilled to be able to add this skill to my projects.

It was a little difficult to get 4-year-old L. to try these, because he smelled the bottle as I was counting out a recommended dosage of four gummies.  The bottle has a familiar (fish oil?) "vitamin" smell that is not noticeable once the individual gummies are away from the bottle.  He and I both tasted them (he agreed to try one), and found them to taste like not-to-sweet candy.  Soon after, I noticed an oily taste in my mouth, which L. did not mention.  His present vitamin is two slightly larger bears, containing half the sugar of four of these gummies.  These have the omega 3 added, which is fine, but otherwise the formulation is quite similar.I am not a scientist and am not qualified to analyze the composition of supplements.  A complete multi-vitamin is probably a good idea, especially for kids whose diet seemingly consists of a few items.  So, the best vitamin is the one the child will take.  L. said he doesn't want the "smelly" vitamins, so we will put them away for a couple of weeks and then offer them to him after taking them out of the bottle.

There's a spot on my upper back that I can't reach.  The spot has always been dry and itchy, and I've been very diligent about rubbing on my usual lotion with a device - a sponge on a handle.  Sometimes by mid-day, even with the lotion, my back would be itchy, and if time and circumstances allowed, I would put on moisturizer mid-day.  But it was always itchy.Amazon.com sent me a free sample of Curel Ultra Healing Lotion to review, which I started using last week in the morning after my shower.  Yesterday, it occurred to me that my back is no longer itching.  I've been using it once a day and loving the results.  Another plus feature is that it has no discernible scent.  The lotion is not at all greasy, and it only takes a very small amount to be effective.  When this bottle is gone, I will happily, gratefully buy more.

We connected this device (HDMI to 2x VGA Splitter Dongle) to a laptop, and then connected it to two monitors.  In our trial, the splitter dongle performed perfectly well, enabling both monitors to display the materials.  The connection was trouble free.  Whether this is worth $53, with the short use span of equipment in an office environment is a decision each office would have to make.  What I hope to do with this splitter is connect it to two somewhat older projectors that my organization uses at monthly meetings.  Many of the attendees have limited English abilities, and we now use verbal translation with earbuds.  We would like to have our translator type the important points onto a laptop and project it to the large room and cut down on the background conversation among the attendees as they explain a translation to each other.  I haven't been able to test this ability yet, as we haven't had a meeting during the timespan I am required to meet to test this product.

My four-year-old grandson was beside himself with excitement when the Hot Wheels Color Shifters Color Splash Science Lab arrived.  He has another set that he loves, even if it is a little ragged from repeated uses.With a little help from his mom, he quickly assembled the parts.  All snapped together securely.  Then we sat and decided where the stickers should be placed.  Next, out onto the deck with some hot and cold water.  All of the action works exactly as described on the box, and we were able to use the cars from the old set as well.  The waterfall, in particular, is a lot of fun. Yes, the launched cars sometimes fly over the mark, but that doesn't seem to bother him or his little brother.This is an inexpensive toy and probably will not last as long as other toy investments that cost more.  But for the price of a couple of hot dogs at the zoo, children will have months of fun with this set.

There are a couple of qualifiers for people who might choose Puroast Espresso Nespresso Capsules:  (1) they must own a Nespresso machine that uses OriginaLine capsules; and (2) they want a low-acid coffee.  Plus, they must be willing to pay about twice as much for these capsules as the Nespresso brand capsules.Okay, we had the big taste test today.  After warming the machine and two cups, I made, in quick succession, a cup of the Puroast Amore Italiano, and a cup of Nespresso Volluto, described as "sweet and light."  The Puroast cup was very smooth, light, and mellow.  The Nespresso, even though only Intensity 4, had that punchy bite that I associate with espresso.  There was a huge difference in taste.The capsules appeared to be exactly the same size, and I had no trouble using either one.  This is a fine product for people who do not like the slightly bitter tang of espresso.  But that flavor is the reason I drink espresso drinks, so I'll stick with the originals.

This Spear Head Spade is amazing!  I ordered it after seeing the short-handled version on a shopping network and checking out the reviews here on amazon.com.  The task I wanted to attack first was digging through the masses of surface roots put out by our street tree, a New Zealand Christmas tree.  This shovel cut through the masses of roots so fast, I moved up the street and dug around three of my neighbors' trees also.  This job is something I've tackled many times over the last 20 years or so, but never has the job been so fast and easy to complete.  Next up, separating and thinning the clivia.  No stopping now; I love this thing.

I've been using Cetaphil cleanser on my face for several years, after becoming alarmed at how dry my skin felt after using even mild bar soaps, so I was curious to see how Neutrogena Healthy Skin Boosters Cleanser would compare.  The answer:  very favorably!  After using it several times on my face and waiting before putting on moisturizer, I did not notice that drawn and tight feeling I used to feel with soap on my medium-dry skin.  The light aroma is pleasant, not overwhelming.The first time I used it, I pumped the same amount into my hand as I would with Cetaphil, a spot about the size of a nickel.  The transparent cleanser formed a white foam on my face that took several rinses to remove.  From then on, I've used a spot about the size of a dime, which seems just right for removing makeup and sunscreen.  A little is plenty.

I've had one of these for over ten years, and still love it.  My knives are always handy near the stove, and no visiting small children can reach them easily.  I remember marking the holes with an awl and then drilling pilot holes and attaching it without using the template.  The largest knife I keep in there is a 10" Wusthof chef's knife.  There's also a slicing knife up there about the same length.  The smallest knife is a 3" paring knife.

Mice seem to appear at random times, and we blame their arrival on rain, drought, cold weather, but one idea prevails:  Get rid of them!  They are destructive and filthy.  Glue traps are easy to place along a wall, with a dab of peanut butter or chocolate candy pushed onto the center of the trap.  They do not require the dexterity to set as many mousetraps.  It is best to set the glue traps against walls where you believe the mice are running.  They can be set behind stoves and under low furniture.  Just be sure to check them and remove trap and mouse by scooping them up with a piece of cardboard.Glue traps are far superior to bait stations, which do kill the mice, but the dead mice often end up between the walls and causing a characteristic stench.  If the mouse dies outside, it may be carried away and eaten by a bird, which also may die from the rodent poison. Killing rodents is not pleasant at all, but if maintaining your food, linens, electrical wiring is important, glue traps are great.  These come in a package of six, stuck together, which seals them until you need them.  The package states that these contain state-of-the-art materials to make them extra dependable.

This colander is a typical OXO offering:  Take a common household item, and add some outstanding features.  Have you ever been in the middle of preparing a meal, you have a dirty pan in the sink, and now, the vegetables need to be washed and drained?  Do you toss the vegetables into a colander then realize there's no place to set it in the sink?  Not with this Over-The-Corner model.  Simply drop this colander onto the upper corner of the sink, letting it rest on the edge, and rinse away.  Washing the pan can wait.The secret of the tight grip this colander maintains while suspended from the counter is that it creates its own support against the sides of the sink.  Besides the wide lip that rests on the counter, there are small, probably silicone, supports on the outside of each side that make contact with the sink, aiding in the support.  The weight of the food itself creates the secure grip.  So clever.It wouldn't be a review without an "if only" paragraph.  If only there were a hole in one of the corners of the lip for hanging, it would be easier to find a storage spot for this colander that doesn't nest in anything I own because of its unconventional shape.  But I still love it.

This compact over-the-door rack has six hooks that could be used in many situations, especially in a bathroom or bedroom, or even a home office.  The silicone knobs at the ends of the hooks keep slippery sweaters from hitting the floor, and prevent hook marks in the backs of jackets and sweaters, very nice features.  Other pieces of silicone on the backs of the hooks prevent marks on the doors.  The adjustable feature of the part that fits over the door means that the whole rack will not slip around when I remove an item.  The rack is solidly made and unobtrusive.The Amazon.com webpage states that the rack works best if there is at least a 3/16" gap between the top of the door and the door frame.  What they mean is, that without that gap, the rack will not fit over the door and allow the door to close.  In my crazy old house, none of the 1880s doors had that gap, which wasn't terribly surprising.  Even in the 1980s addition to the house, that has standard pre-hung doors, only two of the six doors had the required clearance.  The lesson here is to measure that gap before ordering or be prepared to plane or possibly saw a little wood off the top of the door.

I am delighted to have this towel set, even though I do not (gasp!) participate in yoga classes or any workouts outside my home.  I am finding the big towel perfect for putting down on the carpet in my exercise/spare room.  I was using a regular bath towel, but this is like heaven.  I am almost six feet tall, and so is the large towel, which is a luxury and protects the carpet.  There is no bunching; the towel lies flat and does not curl at the ends.  While I might wish the small face towel were a few inches wider, it is a handy size to drape around my neck and to wipe my face and neck.  The fabric, while it looks as if it would be rough like canvas, is very soft, especially now that it has been washed a couple of times. It can go into the dryer, but I just draped the towels over my drying rack, and they were dry in a few hours.  All of the outer binding stitching is neatly finished, with no loose edges, and when I accidentally caught the towel on a rough back of a chest of drawers, no threads became unraveled.  All in all, this is a high-quality product, and I'm very appreciative of an opportunity to try it and review it.

Sunscreen should be part of every outdoor event, and the easier it is to apply, the less likely one is to skip using it.  This sport sunscreen spray by Neutrogena is great.  Simply spray it on and give it a quick rub to spread it a little more evenly.  It was simple to apply to legs and arms, although I made sure I was away from walls and carpet to avoid any overspray.  This sunscreen spray is almost an odorless and very light-feeling aerosol spray that is clear, not chalky looking.  It dried very quickly, and I hardly knew it was there.  The instructions say that to apply it to the face, spray it into your hand and wipe it onto the face.  When I saw that the predominant non-active ingredient is denatured alcohol, I decided not to put it onto my dry-skin face at all.

Cooking on the outdoor grill means no stove or oven to clean, a very good thing. The 8.25" x 11" cooking surface is the right size to cook a side dish for two - maybe four people while the main course is cooking on the other side of our two-burner Weber gas grill, and it fits perfectly.  This griddle is a very heavy gauge stainless steel, with nicely finished edges, and simple-to-use tilt mechanism to allow grease to drain off.  I've let it heat up then oiled it, and browned par-cooked potatoes so they're crispy.  Also, I made some rice patties with egg as a binder.  I had to turn the heat on the burner way down for these to avoid burning, but they did cook in about the same time as the meat on the other side.  Clean-up was easy.  The Griddle could go into the dishwasher if one wanted to clean it that way.This griddle is a worthy addition to our barbecue tools.

These magnetic numbers come in a nice looking wooden box with a clear top.  It's very attractive, but somewhat difficult for us to open and impossible for our 4-year-old grandson.  Okay, the numbers will probably spend most of their time on the refrigerator anyway.  It's nice that these are a little thick and easy to hold, and the magnetic surface covers the entire number so they won't slip down to the bottom of the refrigerator.  Each numeral has an accompanying familiar object in the correct number, for example 14 jellybeans surrounding the number 14.  Cute, in an old-timey way.  Grandson is experimenting with early addition, so he can count the objects to check himself.  The set seems well made; the decals are firmly glued to the wood shapes.  Most important, grandson likes them.

I will use these filtration bags as replacements on my ProTeam ProCare vac.  They are about 1/2" shorter than the original bags that came with the machine, but they fit just fine, as the cardboard top is exactly the same dimensions.  Also included in the package are four felt rectangles that appear to be some type of filter and may be needed in some of the vacuums that are listed as appropriate for this size bag.  The material itself feels about the same as the original bags, and I haven't noticed any accumulating dust outside the bags in the cavity where the bag fits or anywhere else.  And, at about $1/bag, the price is right.There is a anti-microbial treatment on these bags that is supposed to prevent odors.  I'm hoping this will prevent that funky vacuum cleaner smell.  If it does not, I will update this review.

Each of my kids, when they left home to set-up housekeeping in college, received a little George Foreman grill that probably was used to warm take-out and frozen burritos.  The new 2-in-! Evolve Grill is larger and has features that make it appropriate for a real, grown-up kitchen.I started with the waffle plates (which are a traditional non-stick, not ceramic), and used the suggested 425 degree setting. The results were great, if a bit non-traditional size: 5.5" x 7".Grilling this way is new to me, so I experimented with hamburgers and chicken breasts.  The sear function creates nice grill marks, although the actual time for boneless chicken breasts was at the short side of the suggested range.  I realize the manufacturers are required to use USDA mandated internal temperatures, but food continues to cook after it's removed from the heat source.  Also, consider the starting temperature of the food.  Be careful, or you could end up with a very dry dinner.  Cooking time on hamburgers varies according to taste; it's easy to open the grill and pull one burger off for a rare-meat lover and then continue with the cooking for others.  In all the experiments, the ceramic grills are very easy to clean and don't need to go into the dishwasher.I like it.  This grill produces very good grilled meats without using the broiler on the stove or having to go outside to use a barbecue.

Sunscreen and a hat are essentials for me when stepping out ever since I saw a picture of an Eskimo with his hood pulled away from part of his face.  The aging difference between the part that had been exposed and the part that had been covered all his life was startling.  That said, many of the sunscreens I've tried on my face have been unacceptable because I always managed to get a little into my eyes, and the burning sensation was reason enough  not to use those products.  Fallene Cotz Flawless Complexion, based on zinc, does not seem to burn.  It has a light texture and is slightly tinted.  When I use it without make-up, it very slightly tones down color variations on my face, but not as much as make-up foundation.  I do not notice the tint after I've applied the sunscreen.  There is no noticeable perfume in the product either.I'm enjoying using this sunscreen and will swallow hard and spend the money for another tube when this complimentary tube I received runs out.

Compared to the other numerous brooms that have collected in our garage over the years, this one sweeps more effectively than any.  The stiff bristles clean out the corners of the front stairs, including moss that has grown up the risers.  On our back deck, the bristles caught the little bits of seedpods that fell as well as the big leaves.  On the handle there's a rubbery hand grip that can be slid up and down to accommodate different height users.

This powerhouse vacuum cleaner is intended for effective cleaning by professional cleaning crews.  When it arrived, I immediately assembled it (well, not immediately, see last paragraph), and used it in my small home with all sorts of small tables, throw rugs, stairs - not open expanses of carpet and hard flooring one would encounter in an office, for example.  The machine is relatively quiet, and has extremely good suction.  It was able to glide under the edges of couches and some chairs.  It moved easily from rug to hard floor, as turning off the beater bar is accomplished with a switch right on the handle.  It was not able to squeeze into the somewhat narrow spaces between walls and ends of couches, for example.  This would require using the extension wand, which is on-board.  Simply turn off the beater bar, attach the clever included stair tool.  Unfortunately, the wand is not long enough to reach the floor without bending.  In addition, the instructions with the machine warn users to hold onto the main vacuum handle while using the wand, probably in response to the tipping problem mentioned by other reviewers. The edge cleaning demanded by home vacuum users is non-existent.However, there's lots of work for this vacuum in the halls of our small apartment building.  Perfect.About the assembly:  It took two of us almost an hour to get the alignment of the carry-handle/hose winding apparatus holes to line up to screw on the essential part.  The top of the container that holds the filter bag must be pushed on really HARD to get it to stay in place.  The little tabs that secure it seem flimsy and could be the first part to break.

These are a well-made set of two potholders with a pocket on one side that allows them to be used as a mitt.  There is a rubbery material on the "business" side that has a texture to make the grip secure.  I've tried them out on a couple of casseroles that were baking at up to 400 degrees and didn't feel any heat transfer.  I've washed them at the "medium" temperature and dried them on "low," and they've come out looking fine, although not exactly as pristine as when new.  That's fine for potholders.I do not care for these potholders as much as similar shaped ones I've used for years, because the non-skid surface makes them stiffer and more difficult to wrap around the handles of hot pots and casseroles, than the others that are made out of two layers of thick terrycloth.  This is simply personal preference; I suggest trying a set to see how they work in one's own kitchen.

As soon as I saw the little drainage hole in each corner of the bottom of this tote, I knew it would go to the swimming pool at the gym.  So easy to keep my shampoo, moisturizer, etc., all in one place.  I can take it into the shower, then squeeze out my swimsuit and cap, pop everything in and carry home (I walk).  InterDesign products are high quality and attractive, and they are a good value.This tote has stiffer sides than others I have (Reisenthel) that I stuff with toys.  This means that the bottles, swim gloves, mask, all stay in approximately the same place I put them.It is especially nice to note that this tote is made in the USA.

Although the instructions on the back of the can specify that this product should be used on dry hair with a heat tool, such as a curling iron, I took a chance and used it on my wavy hair while wet, then dried the roots with a diffused dryer and "scrunched" the rest.  Hey, it's great.  I'd describe the hold as firm, but not stiff.  The spray is much finer than other pump-spray products I've tried, so it seems to get a lighter coating over a greater area.The scent in the product dissipates quickly, and my hair stayed in place and did not feel stiff.

I bought this for my grandson, 4.5 years old, because it is suggested for ages 4+ and contains over twice as many pieces as any of his other puzzles.  I was astounded at how fast he put it together and am wondering if the suggested age range is incorrect.  However, the picture is interesting, with a variety of construction equipment, which kids love.  Fresh out of the protective bag, a couple of the pieces were de-laminated; the back layer of paper came off before I could find some glue to repair.

This book was very down to the point and interesting. I know NOTHING about Scientology to be honest, but I tried to learn and pick up from it as much as I could. Leah Remini was real, and not only did she share things about Scientology, she also let us into her marriage and her family life. This read was raw, funny, and sometimes creepy. And it made me want to learn more about the subject. The book is shocking, but I think she maintains class. I keep thinking about what she must have purposely left out, haha.She starts off by talking about Scientology right off the bat. She mentions how courses alone were 2 million dollars!!!! She mentions how it was actually her mother who got her into it as a child. NOTE: I only started hearing about this religion 10 years ago, so I had no clue it had been going on for so long. Due to Scientology having the tendency of seeing children as equally wise and important as adults, it gave her confidence and acknowledgement if you will. She then went on to join Sea Org (a place I had never heard about until now), and recalls how the nursery there had squalid conditions for the babies left there by members. She spoke about the RPF, (another thing I had never heard about before.) The Rehabilitation Project Force, where behind the scenes, people pretty much had to beg for table scraps, and not speak unless spoken to. (I cannot wait to do some reading on that.)She mentions sleeping around a lot, but settling down once she met her husband even though she found out he was married at the time after sleeping with him.  She actually had him and his wife at the time take Scientology courses, LOL, to which she later got in trouble for once the wife released that info to STAR magazine. Something called the “disconnection policy” where she was asked to either leave her husband, or have him drop contact with his previous family. She ultimately ignored them and finds out she is expecting.We then hear how only after giving the church a 1 million dollar donation, that she got to meet Tom Cruise, almost as if that was her reward. She had awkward moments with Tom and Katie, and noticed how 2 specific Sea Org handlers were ALWAYS around them. Once Katie left Tom, Leah began to see things clearly and started opening up about her frustrations with the handlers, which caused a lot of drama. She started raising concern over Shelly Miscavige’s whereabouts. She started losing friends and kept telling herself that if Nicole Kidman was able to continue her life that she could too… even though she never even met the woman.Overall we learn interesting tidbits about Tom’s tantrums,  how nice and peachy her years were besides The King of Queens, some drama she had with Sharron Osbourne, and some off-camera drama at Dancing with the Stars. We learn dirt about her family, mostly about her mom, lol, and how her leaving made them closer as a family.

My kids had an older model and used it for a while before getting bored.  This newer version  arrived complements of the Amazon Vine program  and they have renewed their interest in it for sure. It is simply a fun, lightweight, portable little writer where kids can play hangman, tic-tac-toe, and other quick games while in the car  or elsewhere. It is especially fun for younger ones like to draw and a race, scribble and create their own doodles. We had no issue with the erase button whatsoever. It worked perfectly each time. I love that the magnet keeps the unit close at hand either on our office cabinet or fridge.  It is especially useful while doing math homework with the kids. Quick write on and wipe off without the need for tons of scrap paper.  The stylus slips into the edge of the writer to make a kickstand but we would not see a use for this since you cannot use the stylus once it's being used to prop up the writer.  We have not used the option to download the notes onto an app, but we are aware that it exists. Don't really see a need for that.

If we weren't diehard 49ers fans we would not have looked twice at this but it was a clever way to bring our favorite team to our home office compliments of the Amazon Vine program.  First I'll say that the stapler is solid in hand yet not overly heavy.  It opens easily for tacking.  That's where the pros end.  It did not provide more than four consecutive stapled papers before it jammed.  It is supposed to be jam-free according to the packaging.  I cleared the jam once, then twice.  It most definitely will staple a dozen sheets of paper, but not 25 like the package states.  Swingline is normally a dependable brand in office supplies so maybe this was just a bad apple.  This will be a kitchen drawer item for light use, not for heavy duty like it's meant to be.

This easy to carry, lightweight charger handled a full load with our kids tablets and provided a full charge for both without the need to rejuice the unit.  The blue LED lights tell you how much juice is left and even when it is half depleted it will charge your device fully. Plug it into your computer to charge it up. Comes with lightning connector.  Eliminates the need to have several different chargers and an outlet accessible for all of your charging needs.  Great for travel too.  Excellent Amazon Basics product.

Pants are comfortable and offer ease of movement.  Feels like you're wearing nothing!  Easy wash and dry.  Tiny pocket makes it easy to slip money, headphones or a key.  Be precise in choosing your correct size because if they are too big or small they will affect negatively affect the overall feel and function.

Perfect for cool fall days.  This shirt is handsomely tailored and lightweight with thin yet cozy material.  Machine wash and dry.  Holds its shape beautifully.  Generously sized XL offers plenty of room.

I'm always looking for a way to mask my terrible under eye dark circles,  and I have tried many products, from liquids that apply with a sponge applicator to creams that wind up looking cakey and flaky after a few hours. This product has none of those nasty attributes. Easy to apply in a rollup  lipstick style tube, the corrective stick goes on smooth with no lines or creases. Provided me  with all day coverage of my dark circles with none of the flakiness that is usually present with other similar products. This neutral shade number 15 was perfect for my olive complexion, but the product  comes in other shades. I love that it is water resistant, good for sensitive  skin, and  Paraben free. I  happily give this product two thumbs up and will continue to use it after this complementary tube s finished.

Very thin and not as  absorbent as advertised. My husband is a chef and the towels he uses in his kitchen are much more absorbent and sturdier. These are almost like lightweight curtains!  Supersized, much bigger than standard kitchen towels.

Told from the husband's perspective, LIKE FAMILY is the story of a young couple and their son whose relationship with Mrs. A as their housekeeper/ nanny / friend becomes a metaphor for their lives together.  Affectionately known as Babette, Mrs. A. helps each partner learn more about themselves and each other, just through her strong  and  benevolent presence in the home.  Diagnosed with terminal lung cancer, Mrs. A. valiantly tries to savor each moment of her life, however much time there is left to it.  Deeply missing her long deceased husband, Renato, Mrs. A. finds stability and comfort in the caring for the small family. Her bond with wife, Nora, is akin to mother – daughter and since Mrs. A. never had children of her own she can offer advice, a shoulder to lean on, and old fashioned wisdom on marriage to the couple who are somewhat out of touch with each other.The story is poetically written with a somewhat somber tone, sometimes  without even a glimmer of lightness,  especially after the cancer diagnosis. I found it very heavy hearted at times, especially as the disease progresses and the couple sees more and more cracks in their relationship as their beloved Mrs.  A. approaches death. Regret, loss, and the realization of the fleeting nature of time are all themes prevalent  throughout this beautiful story. The way the relationships are intimately woven like a fabric helps magnify the emotions  during various stages of the story and of the cancer itself.Inevitably, the couple learns so much about their own relationship--acceptance, patience and devotion,  mainly thanks to their devotion toMrs. A. and her love for them in return.  I found myself weepy at many points during this book, finding it hard to put down though I knew inevitably how it would end.  A small yet sharply personal story.

This case fits my iPhone 6 like a nice, snug glove.  The feel in your hands is smooth yet not slippery so you're not afraid the phone will slide out of your hands.  Clear case shows the lovely gold of the phone but the SPECK name brand faintly shows across the Apple logo.  All cut outs are perfect EXCEPT for the mute switch which is not easily accessible through the slit.  You'll need to put a sharp nail edge in there to switch it on and off.The phone can be placed face down with no sliding problems or scratching of the screen thanks to a recessed edge.I'm happy with this product and would've given five stars if that mute button cut out were not so deep.

Carhartt is a trusted name in well made, rugged outdoor men's clothing.  Receiving this compliments of the Amazon Vine program, we were delighted that it is a Women's Jacket and with fall upon us here in the Northeast, it was a welcomed addition to our wardrobe.  With cozy soft camo fleece lining throughout {including in the hood}, this jacket will easily take us into colder winter months.  It is a soft shade of light violet called Sandstone and it's perfect for young ladies.  It holds quite a rectangular shape on your body, which some people might not appreciate.  Perhaps to make it a bit more feminine they could have cinched the stitching on the waist a bit, but this is still fine for casual outdoor wear.  The front pockets are deep, the inner pockets will hold your wallet, cell phone, keys, etc.  One pocket closes with Velcro and the other does not.  I know from prior purchases that Carhartt clothing launders well and over time will become much softer.  The stiffness of the material is at its toughest when the item is brand new.  While the material is not 100% waterproof, you will certainly stay dry in a light rain or snowfall.  Great for camping trips, hiking, biking and just enjoying nature.

These cups are very lightweight and thinly made, yet sturdy.  Perfect to toss into a picnic basket, ballgame, beach or bbq.  Though we are not Tennessee college sports fans, we received these compliments of the Amazon Vine program and will happily utilize them at our casual indoor and outdoor gatherings.  Only reason I didn't give them full five star rating is because I personally prefer a cup a bit sturdier to withstand breeze backyard blow aways!  Otherwise a fine Hefty product.

We received a 4 pound bag of this dog food courtesy of the Amazon Vine  program. Our 9 pound Chihuahua mix is seven years old and tends to gain weight quickly because she has a voracious appetite.  For this reason we have had to reduce the serving of her major label dry food from what she has been used to in order to get her to optimal trim size.  This resulted in her always being hungry and begging for table food.We did the switch to this food over a 10 day period  and have been very pleasantly surprised. First it does not smell funky like most other dry dog foods. From the moment we opened the bag it smelled very appetizing. Each morsel is shaped like a three dimensional triangle and our dog immediately loved crunching on it when we gave her one to try.  By the time we had transitioned to this food hundred percent we had noticed she had less bowel movements, was not as thirsty as before and had a softer coat.  I'm not saying this food worked magic that quickly but we are pleased with her weight and she seems much more satisfied after her daily meals.  I'm pretty certain this is due to the protein rich, grain free formula.

We received this courtesy of the Amazon Vine program.  Yankee Candle's popularity centers around the beautiful selection of candles whose names capture the essence of the scents.  We've bought these for many years during various seasons and most of the time we come to the same conclusion after burning them…The fragrance doesn't smell enough when lit!  Unless you burn it  for quite a long while, the fragrance does not fill the room whatsoever. You get the strongest, truest scent only when smelling the candle in the jar.  This fresh bread scent is delicious in the jar, but once lit the smell pretty much disappears until nearly an hour of burn time, then you can detect a faint smell in the room.For the high price you pay for Yankee Candles, it would be great if they actually filled the room with the scents we love.Just a side note:  Bath and Body Works candles are a few dollars less costly and yet the scents are similar and the fragrance fills the air wonderfully when lit!

Having purchased something similar years ago, we expected this to be a beautiful addition to the wall in our master bathroom. What it turned out to be was a very poor quality peel off plastic set of letters,  It's supposedly was to be applied with a transfer sheet but this was a joke since it was separated from the set of letters in shipping, which took nearly one month to arrive from China.  I ultimately had to peel and stick each letter, several of them tore easily, and the result is nothing short of sloppy.  You get what you pay for.  But in this case I got even less than that.
Excellent back up USB cable for your apple devices.  I needed a spare for my classroom and this worked beautifully.  You will need to supply your own wall charger.

This soft activity book came to us courtesy of the Amazon Vine program.  It is part of a series of sensory books for infants ages 6+ months.  This 1-2-3 Count edition is colorful and appealing with animals throughout.  Press the circular sound piece for a weird sounding "animal" voice which counts down each number and names the food on every page.  There are crinkly sounds on soft padded pages and peek-a-boo flaps for self discovery.  I like that it folds easily to stash in the stroller and has a loop for hanging.  The sound piece was bulky and the voice very odd so I give it three stars for these reasons.

This lovely set arrived courtesy of the Amazon Vine program.  I immediately noticed how plush and luxurious they felt.  The color was crisp white and each towel has a long and sturdy label loop making hanging very convenient.  They laundered extremely well and fluffed up beautifully in the dryer.  I would love these in a beige or ivory shade.  They are well made, thick and of great quality and highly absorbent.  They did not retain a musty odor after several days of use like other, more cheaply made towels can.  I attribute this to the bamboo in the fabric.  This would make a great house warming gift!

This package of Ladies Bikini pants came to us courtesy of the Amazon Vine Program.  First thing I noticed was that the material was stretchy and lightweight, felt like the kind of material which runner's shirts are made of, namely the micro-mesh which makes it breathable.  The fit was snug despite the fact that we wear the same size 8 all the time in regular cotton underpants so I'm uncertain why these don't fit the same.  The package states that the fabric is ventilated and I can't say one way or the other whether this is true since we wore these under our jeans and couldn't tell the difference.  The colors are nice and they laundered well.  Love that they're tag free.  Reason for three stars is simply due to the oddly small fit.  Otherwise they are comfy and of good quality workmanship.  I don't see these shredding in my washing machine for a long time.

This full-color hard cover book came to us courtesy of the Amazon Vine  program. It is laid out like an actual yearbook featuring all of the favorite characters from Disney's newest hit movie, the Descendants.  My daughter is a huge fan of the movie so this book has turned out to be the perfect addition to her Disney collection. She loves the actual photos from the movie, introductions and bits of information about all the characters, a message from the fairy godmother, the characters' future dreams for themselves, what classes they enjoy the most… Just like a real life high school yearbook!  The final pages show the winners of votes such as most athletic, best sportsmanship, biggest flirt and most artistic.  Any fan of this movie will love the yearbook!

Mat is a pretty pink with zen-like designs, rolls up super tight and weighs next to nothing yet offers a nice thin cushion for floor exercise or yoga.  I will replace my old and way too bulky rubber mat with this one.  Stays firmly in place on wooden floors.

This item arrived courtesy of the Vine program.  My 11 year old put it together in ten minutes following the step by step instructions.  Right off the bat our cat found her way into the cubby.  Then the dog decided to try out the plush side!  You will have to have enough floor space for this since it was bigger than expected and has a very wide footprint.  The toy remained untouched after one week but this is likely because our kitty forgot about toys a long time ago.  I suppose it would keep younger cats entertained for plenty of hours.  The jungle pattern is cute and the plush pad is machine washable.  Scratching pole great for claws.  Nice item for animal lovers.

This blow dryer arrived compliments of the Vine program.  It is supposed to dry hair quickly and with minimal frizz and damage.  I found the drying time to be the same if not slower than my Conair 1875 blow dryer.  The rocker buttons are in an awkward thumb position and get in the way of a smooth grip on the handle.  Top it off with a very bulky and weighted feel and you have a dryer that is not suitable for our preference.

Love these dividers for three reasons: 1. they have a front pocket that fits papers without interfering with the binder rings; 2.  the tabs are larger than usual and have notches that hold the label in securely; 3.  you can count on Avery to offer attractive and good quality items and this product is no exception.  We use a set for all school subjects and love them for office work too.

This toothpaste came to us from the Amazon vine program. Gave it a try for about two weeks, and other thannoticing the consistency was pleasantly smooth, not gritty like others,  there was nothing extraordinary about this product. The minty fresh feeling in my mouth stuck around for a few hours, and there was no sensitivity to my teeth or gums after using it. However, I simply  cannot justify spending over five dollars per tube for toothpaste. Ingredients are very similar to other toothpaste, and if you are concerned with triclosan,  avoid using this product.

This sleek case is lightweight yet durable.  There is a thin inner sleeve made of silicone which you put on your phone first, then attach the hard outer shell.  All cut outs fit well.  Buttons operate perfectly.  The exterior is a bit slippery in your hand and this is the only reason I rate this product with four out of five stars.  I prefer a case with a bit more grip action on the edges and back.  Otherwise a fine product.

Velcro products are supposed to make life easier, safer, and neater.  This item does none of these things. With directions so convoluted you could spend an eternity trying to figure out that what they mean by "cord" is really just the other side of the Velcro strip.  Why not just say that?  There is no protection from anything as the package implies, and all you are doing is simply threading one end of the cord through the slit on the Velcro strip, and then wrapping the other end of the Velcro  over to tighten the cord into the Velcro. Big deal! How is this helping?  Sadly there is nothing useful about this item whatsoever.  One reviewer posted excellent  photos showing exactly what this item looks like once you thread a cord end to end.  Basically a big "so what?!"  I  can't think of anything useful for this so I gave it one star only because I could not give it zero.

This compact spiral bound notebook with perforated sheets is just 5"x7" so it fits in pretty much any purse, backpack, or bag.  Front cover has pen loop, the spiral binding is protected by a sturdy cloth covering, and there is an easy to move pocket divider which allows you to separate the notebook into two sections while also offering you two slip in sections for smaller papers like business card or cash.  Five Star is very popular  brand for school supplies as they are affordable, well-made, and have a "lasts all year guarantee" which comes in handy for our kids  who tend to beat up their supplies before the first vacation break in the winter.  We received the aqua blue compliments  of the Vine program.

This set of tabbed plastic bookmark/dividers came compliments  of the vine program and being a lover of all things organizational, I promptly found a perfect place for each and everyone of them. Designed to snap in a three ring binder, you don't have to open the binder rings in order to move this bookmark around where you need it. Sturdy and lovely, makes it's super easy to organize your important papers whether at school, work, or at home. You can print or write on the adhesive tab labels so it's super easy to organize your important papers.  Kids will be using these for school and I will get some more sets for other important projects around the house where storage binders are handy, ie, insurance papers, medical, etc.  Excellent product from Avery.

This appliance came to us compliments of the Amazon Vine program.  As with all other products, I tested this for several weeks before compiling my findings.  Here is what I conclude.  Though Cuisinart is a top rated brand in kitchen appliances, I find this particular blender to be less than expected.  To start, it takes up way too much counter space making it a no-no for daily use unless I had a bigger kitchen.  Next, the powerful motor is so loud it can be heard three rooms away in our home, no kidding.  Also, I prefer glass containers and this one is heavy duty, BPA free plastic, which makes the entire unit lighter weight but this isn't a necessity for me as I find that plastic retains a certain odor over time, especially when you blend vegetables, and even with excellent washing (dishwasher safe) the smell will be there if you use it long enough.  With a glass container, this would not be an issue whatsoever.  My old Hamilton Beach blender had a wonderful glass container and never smelled odd even after years of use.
