Last but not least, the base of the plastic jar has a screw off blade which, if not precisely and perfectly replaced after washing, will leak all over the motor base when you fill it the next time.  We learned the hard way that we can't screw it in hastily unless we want a mess next time.  In other blenders I've used, the blade in the base of the jar never gets removed, you just wash the entire piece in warm and soapy water.  Here are the positives, and they are important.  The easy to use settings allow you to make smoothies and cremate basically anything from carrots, celery, apples, kale, you name it, the results will not disappoint.  Each button clearly indicates what it is best for.  We made a nice salsa with mango and tomatoes, a lovely puree of steamed sweet potato and carrots and a thick chocolate milkshake, all while experimenting with the different speeds, and all done with only one push of the button.  Our smoothies with ice, yogurt and several fruits were gourmet quality, especially since the ice was crushed perfectly in no time.  I would give this five stars if only for the jar, loud motor and removable base blades.

This item is pretty much useless. Did not eliminate even one flying insects in our yard this holiday weekend. The citronella smelling pad fits neatly in a pull out tray, the on off switch will allow for either a dim light to be on by itself or along with the fan to "circulate" the bug deterrent.  Looks like metal and is pretty if only it actually did the job it's meant to do.  Sorry I won't be searching for the refills.

We tested these bars for three weeks on oily facial breakout areas and on one spot on our back.  There was little to no soapy action but it got skin clean.  No irritation was noticed and skin felt tighter but not dried out.  Breakout were controlled because the skin wasn't as oily each day.  This soap will be used more when our kids begin adolescent breakouts.

These  towels are pretty, but offer no absorbency whatsoever. The chocolate brown, mocha, and latte colored shades will add a nice touch to your kitchen, but the scroll design looks faded, especially on the lighter two towels.  Washed well in the laundry but really just for decorative use.  Medium weight cotton.

This calendar arrived courtesy of the Amazon Vine program and within ten seconds from unwrapping was confiscated by my middle school daughter.  She absolutely went wild for the cover designs, the lovely interior page floral and scroll designs, the color palette used throughout, and the logical way the months are laid out.  July 2015 through July 3, 2016, the cover is durable plastic and has an inside page with 2014-2016 years for reference.  Months are separated by a plastic tab (we'd have preferred a separate divider sheet with perhaps a storage pocket).  Every page holds space for notes at the start of the month, and daily lined sections for each day.  A two-page full month spread starts every separate month with the traditional boxes to see your whole month at a glance as well as a small prior month and next month reference.  The very end of the calendar has two full pages for CONTACTS and NOTES and an Event Calendar and HOLIDAY LIST which shows holidays through 2018.  This is especially handy.  The lovely floral and scroll design gives every page a cheery, happy feel, very appropriate for desktop, school or dorm.  The generous size makes it easy to write all you need and carry with other  notebooks and files.  A good choice for the upcoming academic year.  The only reason I gave four rather than five stars is because I'd prefer at least one page have a slip in file pocket, similar to others I have used in the past.

We have a home full of smudges on all glass surfaces, from bathroom mirrors, screen doors, to tv screens, etc.  Instead of spraying a traditional glass cleaner on a paper towel for cleaning all these messes, these handy glass wipes do the job 100 times better and more efficiently.  This three-pack arrived courtesy of the Amazon Vine program and I promptly went to work shining every glass surface in our home.  The results were dazzling, to say the least!  No unpleasant bleach smell, no drippy liquid in each wipe, just a small, soft cloth with enough solution to properly and precisely wipe away all the grime and smudges from our backyard screen, front door, two bathroom mirrors, and glass coffee table....all with one wipe!  Eliminates the need for spray bottles of glass cleaner and costly paper toweling.  Got the glass crystal clear and with no residue or fogging. Excellent CLOROX product which we will keep on hand from now on.  Great for car windows too!

This may perhaps be the best book I've read in many years.  I was drawn in by the title and the cover, a sweet combination of sugar donuts making up the "00" in 100, and the title itself, "100 Days of Happiness" as I'm always curious as to how authors unravel the happiness mystery to their readers.  The question posed:  WHAT WOULD YOU DO IF YOU KNEW YOU HAD ONLY 100 DAYS LEFT TO LIVE?  Wow!  Actually, I'd never contemplated this question.  Until now.Author Fausto Brizzi has a splendid, conversational style.  His pages read like a letter from a friend.  He mixes cleverness with humor, and creates a character who is both humble and self deprecating with all his foolish imperfections, transgressions and sins.  After the first several chapters which lead us up to the actual stage four liver cancer diagnosis, the book counts down from Day 100 to the last Day 1 in the life of Lucio Battistini, an Italian man who savors a freshly made donut at sunrise the way most people enjoy sex.  We relate to this character from the onset, as he is a very likeable guy, though not without his faults.  He cheated on his wife and got thrown out of the house, but he works tirelessly to gain her forgiveness while staying close to their two children.  He treasures his two lifelong friends, hangs out with his father-in-law who runs the pastry shop with those great donuts, and gets a natural high over coaching water polo.Now enter the tragedy.  After ignoring pains for quite some time, and neglecting his wife's instructions to have an abdominal sonogram, he gets the sobering news that he has inoperable liver cancer which has metastasized to his lungs.  Basically, his days are numbered....100 to be exact.  Raw emotion is evoked in the plain and simple truth that his cancer will kill him before the change of seasons.  What follows is a 100 day personal journey to live out his days on his terms.  He does things we only dream of doing, such as quitting a now loathsome job.  He makes peace with his past and even finds his creative side while beginning a journal in an old grade school notebook and jotting down a sort of "bucket list" of dreams to achieve while he still has the time.  Accurate and detailed medical terminology adds authenticity to this "every man's (or woman's) story of life, love, loss and death.  It makes you pause to consider "what if it were me...?"  Reference is made to the fact that life is nothing but a collection of "last times" i.e., the last time you talk to your father...take a swim in the sea...kiss the woman you love. The chapters had me feeling a range of emotions ~ sadness, hopelessness, hope, then even more sadness, and deep empathy.  One poignant quote stood out:  "I realize that I can't seem to think about anything but the past and the future.  It's as if the present has lost all meaning to me.  But actually, it's the past and the future that don't exist, and the present really is the only thing I have left."  How fitting those words for someone who is counting down the final days of his life.  This novel is one you will not soon forget.  Indeed, by Day "0" I felt as though I'd just lost a good friend.

I purchase two or three At-A-Glance planners every year.  Normally I carry a pocket size planner in my purse, then use a full size one such as this at work.  This July, 2015-June 2016 Academic Calendar came to us compliments of the Vine program and was immediately an eye catcher on my desk in the classroom.  The cover has a faux leather look and a lovely aqua blue spiral ring along with cover detailing.  I love the generous 8 3/8" x 11" sizing and multiply ways in which each month is laid out.  First you have a two page spread at the start of each month with large daily boxes.  Next there are side by side lay outs of each date (four days per side) and the lined spaces under each date give you loads of room to write notes, appointments, numbers, etc.  At the end of each month there are boxes for notes in general.  Each month is separated by a tab divider page showing the month in clear orange letters.  The very end of the calendar has two pages for 20 contacts, and ten plain notebook style pages, followed by a page with a Twelve Month Event Calendar, a full page Holiday List through 2018, and a US Time Zones and Area Codes map.  Top it all off at the very last page with a clear plastic pocket folder which includes both front and rear side pockets.  This is a jam packed planner that is well worth the money.  The only reason I give it three rather than five stars is because the cover is flimsy.  I would much prefer a harder, flexible plastic to withstand daily use or travel in and out of briefcase when needed.  Otherwise, a beautifully appointed Academic Year Calendar.

These "handy-wipe" type towels are perfect for quick kitchen and bath clean ups.  I received a two pack compliments of the Amazon Vine program and promptly began using one in the master bath and the other in the kitchen.  The cloth is very soft and absorbent.  The soap holds well in the subtle grooves of the material.  I washed a sink of pasta pots and the sauce stained the towel a bit, so into the laundry it went.  It laundered quite well, and of course I air dried it rather than the clothes dryer.  The print remained clear and sharp, no flaking or peeling.  I would not purchase these, however, because they are so much like a thicker version of Handy Wipes that it would not be worth the added cost just to have the design.  Also, Handy-Wipes are much larger.  These are basically the size of a pot holder.

This machine is a lifesaver in our home.  A family with allergies, we are four people who sneeze year round with all sorts of environmental triggers, i.e., household dust, aerosol sprays, perfumes, etc.  Add to this list the pollen, mold spores, pet dander and trees and you can picture our watery eyes, drippy noses and tickling throats.  This air purifier is both lightweight and portable.  It measures 28" high x 7" wide x 9" deep and is a neutral colored creamy white.  We set it up in less than 60 seconds, literally.  Just remove the filters from the protective plastic, then place both the carbon filter and the white filter together inside the front panel, snap close and you're ready to turn on the unit.  It has a nice quiet motor so you won't be disturbed.  We placed this in our bedroom for a week and after checking the filter found lots of dust, hair and dirt particles which were captured by the filters.  Rather than waking up with a stuffy nose and headache, this actually helped keep our sinuses open and allowed us to get a more peaceful night's sleep.  Though the unit is advertised as "Baby" air purifier we certainly would recommend this for any room in the house, whether with an infant or without.  Various handy features on the front of the machine make it easy to adjust the strength of the motor, and the panel lights dim so your sleep isn't interrupted.  This would come in handy in a dorm room also, especially if there are smokers around.  It also sucks the stinky air out of the house if you are cooking something pungent like fish.  Fellowes makes products perfect for the home and office and this HEPA Air Purifier is no exception.

Our child's bedside turtle light runs on three AA batteries.  Since the touch  light stays lit for 10 minutes at a time, it can be reactivated with a simple touch  and throughout the night, our child will reactivate the light. This means lots of battery changes every month.  We received these courtesy of the Amazon Vine  program and are pleased to report that they have kept the bedside night light on for more time than other brands have.  We have yet to change these batteries, and the light is still shining brightly. Good product!

Pros:  sprayed on white yard chairs, deck box, and composite deck then hosed off to find a clean and like-new appearance awaiting beneath.  I didn't even use a scrub brush!  Foaming action literally washed away the winter green and brown yard scum.  Used more spray on white yard fence and yielded same stellar results.Cons:  because the nozzle did NOT open as easily as instructions stated, we leaked enough liquid to stain our hands a powdery white which would later dry to a crusted film.  Not happy about that at all.  Wear gloves by all means when using this product.  And if your nose and eyes are sensitive to chemicals, play it safe by throwing on dollar store protective goggles.  To use this product, we had to pour entire bottle into another plain empty spray bottle to use it the normal way, without hooking up to hose.  I found an nearly empty kitchen cleaner and rinsed it out to use with this product.I don't think I'd purchase it again because I could get the same results with other products and a scrub brush.

This handy eight pack comes courtesy of the Vine program and offers classic colored ink pens like black, red and blue along with several fun colors as well.  Kids grabbed the Aqua, Pink and Violet right away and loved these vibrant colors for their school notebooks.  The easy grip makes it comfortable for extended writing  assignments and the ink is crisp and clean on the page. Really love the silky smooth lines you will get with these pens.  BIC still remains a great quality yet affordable brand.

The first thing that came to mind once I open this box was, "wow this looks cheesy".  Seven stones with one really fake looking center stone are  set way too high and wide on the ring, making it rub against surrounding fingets and catch on clothing and even edges of furniture.  If the stones were not there, the rig would actually look pretty, with a dainty appearance. The sterling silver seems to be of good quality.  Too bad the stones are so phoney looking.

Love the stand up taco.  This box came compliments of the Vine program and the kids loved the idea of the nacho flavor.  We loaded them with shredded lettuce, cheese, sour cream and chopped meat and they really stood up to the job.  Lots of tasty crunch if you love that nacho chips flavor.  We're mindful of sodium so this won't be a regular go-to in our home.  Kids thought they would be great for after school snacks and sleepovers.

PBA FREE set looks lovely on a festive holiday table and catches flicks of light when the lighting is dim.  Used this at backyard BBQ and guests were impressed.  Serving bowl is shallow and holds 3.4 quarts.  Individual bowls are narrow and deep holding 22 oz. each, the "spork" and spoon serving utensils are 9" long and offer large scoops of salad.  The overall feel of the set is quite flimsy, sorry to say, almost equated with Dollar Store quality thinner tableware.  Not something I'd purchase myself, but as a complimentary Amazon Vine product we will happily use and for the purpose of this honest review.  Washed quickly with soap and warm water, did not stain with dressings and did not retain any odors.  Non-microwaveable but they are dishwasher safe.  Made of recycled post-industrial material to reduce landfill waste, so this set is both stylish and environmentally friendly.  Will be great for cereal, chips, nuts and other snacks.

Compact and perfect for light home use, this Epson Wireless printer arrived compliments of the Vine Program.  Set up was straightforward and simple, taking less than 15 minutes from start to finish.  Easily recognized our home wifi and allowed immediate printing of documents and photos from our laptop and iPhones.  We used the CD for set up but you can also run software online if you don't have a CD/DVD drive.  The four packs of ink include Black, Yellow, Magenta and Cyan.  Easy snap in installation.  Convenient front slot for SD card, and easy on-screen menu to adjust paper settings and scroll trough all the printer features, i.e., scanning and social media uploading (Facebook).  I love that it fits neatly in the corner of our desk without taking up loads of space.  Documents were crisp and very clean, nearly laser printer quality.  Photos were just fine, vibrant and clear.  A small printer that does it all!

This giant bag of Hershey Kisses came to us compliments of the Amazon Vine program and proved to be just the perfect size for an upcoming event where homemade favors were being created.  A whopping 4 + pounds of sweet and creamy kisses with classic silver foil offered the perfect addition to our favors, which were simple clear plastic sundae cups filled with these chocolates and then wrapped in clear cellophane and tied with pretty ribbon.  Made it so easy to complete the project without having to buy multiple bags of kisses.  This product also comes in blue foil and pink foil kisses, making it ideal for baby showers, weddings, Communions, Confirmations, graduation, you name it.  Hershey's Kisses go with every celebration!  If you don't need these for favors, they are great for classrooms, waiting rooms, offices, break rooms, anywhere that a little sugar rush is needed.

I am reading this book as a "starter" for deeper meditation  during a particularly stressful time in our lives. The  daily readings are short, follow similar themes, and leave you with a question to apply to your real life situations.  Not so much a journal as it is a theme book to lead you towards further  exploring your thoughts and feelings on a deeper spiritual level. Quite thin and light weight, this paperback book is neat, crisply bound, and easy to bring along on your daily commute.  Print size is  basically larger than Bible print, but smaller than regular book print. I agree that the space after the meditations is small, allowing for a few thoughts or words, not full journal entries.  I did not find this to be a problem as I jotted key words related to the question, then used each daily reading and subsequent question to reflect more deeply and privately each Sunday during worship services. The questions offer opportunities to contemplate personal experiences in work life, family dynamics, and personal growth.  Some meditations, quite frankly, forced me to take pause to answer some very important personal questions.  Thought-provoking little book.

These small yet satisfying snacks are loaded with flavor. Pocket-sized and easy to tote in your lunchbox or snack bag, chocolatey and delicious, very moist and chewy. A perfect, 90 cal snack without the guilt.

This game is a favorite with SpongeBob fans.  12 ailment pieces and tweezers are included. Remove the ailments without getting zapped.  Player who removed most ailments wins.  The buzzer can be a little startling for more sensitive, younger players. Personally we prefer the "skill edition" which includes a tray underneath for the tiny pieces to be stored safely, play money, playing cards and a figure board that is a bit sturdier.  Find it here: http://www.amazon.com/Hasbro-40069-Operation-Spongebob-Edition/dp/B000OOJOXQ/ref=cm_wl_huc_item#customerReviews

Received this courtesy of the Amazon Vine program.  I wanted to like this because the dispenser holds the roll of glue dots conveniently, unlike when you buy a box of them and they get stuck on the interior of the box.  This dispenser is easy to hold and the roller action is smooth.  However, and it's s BIG HOWEVER, the dots are positioned closely together and do not easily move without balling up like a clump of rubber.  Furthermore the box states they hold up to 2 pounds ---- not when I used them!  I ran a long strip across the bottom of a cotton curtain panel to try to shorten the curtain length and not only did the dots roll right off the material but there was no holding power whatsoever on the hem.  I would use this for scrapbooking but because the dots are too close and you really cannot easily control shorter rolls of the dispenser, I will have to toss this as it really won't offer much convenience.

This craft kit arrived courtesy of the Amazon Vine program.  Adorable pictures on the box enticed our eleven year old.  She promptly assembled all parts and organized her colors to make the red apple.  First there was not enough yarn to complete the project.  Then the instructions were unclear, often just telling the user to cut the yarn, without specifying how long to cut.  Certain colors were required that were not even in the box.  The end result didn't look like an apple because of the lack of proper yarn colors.  It turned out just like a pom pom.  I suppose if you just wanted to make multi colored pom poms this would suffice, but for the cute food and creatures depicted on this set, you will not find the way to make anything worthwhile here.

The handcrafted premium leather appealed to me with this case at first look.  Coming to us compliments of the Amazon Vine program, I was impressed with both the sleek packaging and the bright and cheerful color of the case.  That's about where the pros end.  This case is flimsy and offers no protection whatsoever to the expensive, delicate iPhone 6.  I was actually annoyed at the lack of coverage on the top and bottom of the phone, virtually exposed end to end with the exception of a bit of corner protection  I wasn't impressed with button access either.  If I were looking to merely cover the phone with a leather cover, I would have rather used a folio case where at least an accidental drop would not spell disaster.  This case is pretty, but that's about it.  Comes with a screen protector and cloth which I did not use since I have tempered glass on my phone.I reviewed a different iPhone 6 case recently and loved it, in fact I would highly recommend this one instead:  LAX Gadgets Slim and Protective Grip Shield Case for iPhone 6.

The handcrafted premium leather appealed to me with this case at first look.  Coming to us compliments of the Amazon Vine program, I was impressed with both the sleek packaging and the deep rich color of the case.  That's about where the pros end.  This case is flimsy and offers no protection whatsoever to the expensive, delicate iPhone 6.  I was actually annoyed at the lack of coverage on the top and bottom of the phone, virtually exposed end to end with the exception of a bit of corner protection  I wasn't impressed with button access either.  If I were looking to merely cover the phone with a leather cover, I would have rather used a folio case where at least an accidental drop would not spell disaster.  This case is pretty, but that's about it.  Comes with a screen protector and cloth which I did not use since I have tempered glass on my phone.I reviewed a different iPhone 6 case recently and loved it, in fact I would highly recommend this one instead:  LAX Gadgets Slim and Protective Grip Shield Case for iPhone 6.

This northeast winter has been particularly harsh on our skin, taking a toll on skin from head to toe...dry, flaky cracked and in some cases, even broken and bleeding.  This Curel lotion truly does what it claims to do.  From the moment I smooth it on, I could feel my skin drinking in the moisture.  Non-greasy, unscented and lightweight, this is a perfect addition to your daily skin care routine.  No slippery residue.  Perfect dry skin treatment ~~ you WILL SEE a noticeable difference.

Olay has been a go-to brand for generations in my family.  This oil free product came compliments of the Amazon Vine program and I am thoroughly enjoying it thus far.  We're in the Northeast and have suffered an unusually frigid winter this year, so dry skin is part of the package here.  This easy to store and even easier to dispense pump bottle is perfect for bedside or vanity in your bath or bedroom.  Though it states Fragrance-Free, I find it to have a light and lovely soft and gentle scent which is not irritating or offensive.  The consistency is smooth and coverage is complete with only a small pump in your hand.  The product lists 7 benefits all in 1 bottle including smoothing fine lines (this worked for me!), evening skin tone, enhancing brightness (again a plus for me) and restoring firmness and moisture.  I didn't notice a visible reduction in the appearance of dark patches, but this wasn't a deal breaker for me, I still loved all the other benefits.  Apply to a clean face for an all-over feeling of fresh, healthy and youthful skin.  With an SPF of 15 it's perfect for use in the colder months when you don't normally slather on the sunscreen.  Added bonus is that this contains Vitamins E and B3 along with other nutrients that help your skin stay smooth and youthful looking.  I apply both in the morning before my minimal makeup routine, then again before bedtime after the daily grime is washed away.  I recommend this for all skin types as well.  Excellent and affordable skincare.

This gadget arrived complements of the Amazon vine program. Being an iPhone owner for many years, I have always thought that thumbs and fingers are a clumsy way to text on the flatscreen, so this stylus offered a perfect alternative.  Slim and sleek in a brushed chrome, this is the most accurate stylus I have ever used. Fine point is flawless.  Here's why I don't think it's practical. In our fast paced world of communicating, this is not a quick grab accessory. It has a twist off cap so it certainly would not be handy if you want to shoot off a quick text. Use this for lengthier communications, or if you are just playing around on your tablet or phone. Good for gaming as well.  Not really sure how the notched end is useful for carrying.  Would be better if it had a hole to attach to a Key ring with a fast release clip.

We are a family that loves their salads, all colors and textures and load it with all the fixings.  This easy to use OXO Good Grips Scissors has fast become the new favorite kitchen gadget in my home.  Compliments of the Vine Program, we are now enjoying a chopped salad in no time and the end results so professional you would swear a chef did the chopping!  There is a safety lock on the bottom to keep the blades closed, and with a quick flip, you just release the blades, grip the handle with one hand and place the scissors into your bowl of salad.  Just squeeze and move around the bowl as the blades do all the work.  Spring action makes it comfortable to use and no irritation on your palms.  Clean in warm water with dish liquid.  I love that these fit neatly in my utensil drawer without taking up a load of space like some other fancy kitchen helpers do.  I would give these to anyone who loves salad and wants to spruce up their presentation with no fuss.  Good for Bridal Shower wishing wells, too!

We have just gotten braces in our home, so this was a must have for the bathroom.  I loved the small footprint of this unit, much better than the full sized Waterpik.  The green receptacle holds enough water for two people to use the machine.  The stickers were cute, and they're removable, coming in both girl and boy designs.  I was sadly disappointed, however, in the NOISE THIS THING MAKES!  Wow!  If you think you could use this when someone is sleeping in the next room, think again.  And don't even consider turning it on if you just got the baby to fall asleep.  This sounds like a jack hammer and I'm not certain why.  Nothing is malfunctioning, no leaks and no broken parts, just an extremely loud motor.  Oh well, at least it does the job.  Three settings are available, but the first one is pretty lame.  Our kids use the second one with good results.  There are two attachments to choose from, one for braces and one for regular teeth.  You can also purchase others so that other family members can use the same machine.  Keep it empty and dry between uses so that you don't wind up with bacteria or odor.  Good machine for the price.  If it weren't so loud I'd have easily given it five stars.

The new iPhone 6 is much thinner than previous versions, so protecting my investment was paramount once I brought home the new toy.  This LAX case arrived just in time compliments of the Amazon Vine program.  I was impressed with how comfortable the case felt in my hand.  Its perimeter is rubber so you can grip the phone well.  The back is nicely designed with a raised ribbed pattern which has a cut out circle so you can still view the Apple logo on your phone.  The access to buttons is perfect with only one very small exception.  The cut out for the mute button on the left side is just a tad too deep to quickly flip the switch, so I find that I have to really get the right corner of my fingernail in there in order to activate the mute function.  All the other cut outs are perfect and allow total, easy access.  I have a tempered glass protection on the phone and the case does not interfere with it whatsoever.  I like that this offers good protection without adding noticeable weight to the phone itself.  I have the gold iPhone 6 and this case just so happened to come in gold, so the pairing is complete.  Love this product and highly recommend it.

I live in a home with organizational junkies.  This bin seemed like a great little holder of all things tossed in our food pantry.  I love the fact that it's clear and very sturdy, and that it has a handle.  That's where the love ends.  It is really pretty useless.  It stores minimal items because of the narrow rear, and unless you have a HUGE shelf with a lazy susan to add a full circle of these to make a complete round, there isn't much you can put in here to justify having it.  I found myself trying to figure out which room would offer the best use but really couldn't see it helping me organize anything much at all.  I wouldn't buy more to make a full circle, but I will say if this were a rectangular shape I would have loved it.  You can't store much in triangles.

Pasta is a favorite staple in our home, right next to rice.  But buying good tasting, healthy pasta is challenging since the traditional whole wheat pastas are mostly awful tasting, especially to children.  This Barilla White Fiber is a healthy alternative and was an instant hit.  Cooking up in a jiffy, the mini penne were tender yet firm, mixed well with my secret mac and cheese recipe and satisfied the masses as a side dish, entrée and snack after school.  The added protein is an appreciated plus.  I watch for sales on Barilla because the brand costs more than others, but when taste is this good, it's worthwhile.

This generous sized 16.9 fl. oz. spray bottle came to us from the Amazon Vine program. We have been using it now for over a week on household items such as scatter rugs, throw pillows, blankets that are tossed on la-Z-Boy chairs, and on a sofa where the pets love to nap.  I even sprayed a shower curtain with it for a nice change in the spare bath.  The sent is very pleasant but we overused it on the furniture and the smell wound up burning my throat a bit.  Next time around we used it more sparingly and found that the sent did not offend at all. It was long-lasting and permeated the entire room. I recommend this for any home with pets, smokers, or strong cooking smells. Just be careful around anyone with breathing issues such as asthma or allergies.

I stock up on Plastic Pocket Dividers each year when the kids start school and again while sorting and filing a year's worth of family paperwork.  The Avery line of Big Tab Pocket Plastic Dividers is my go-to product for all my binder organization needs.  The Vine Program sent assortment of awesome Three Pocket Insertable Corner Lock 5 Tab Dividers along with a bonus heavy duty binder to help get us started.  NOTE:  When you purchase these dividers from Amazon, the binder will NOT be included.  Three extra wide pockets allow me to store paperwork without interfering with the 3-holes of the divider.  Corner Lock tabs prevent the papers from falling out but beware of stretching them too far because they rip easily. Free templates available at avery.com make it a snap to customize the inserts according to your needs.  I can easily fill the pockets with a short stack of standard 8 1/2" x 11" papers with no fear of them getting bent or damaged on the ends.  I give this product a four star review only because my corner locks ripped too quickly.

I stock up on Plastic Pocket Dividers each year when the kids start school and again while sorting and filing a year's worth of family paperwork.  The Avery line of Big Tab Pocket Plastic Dividers is my go-to product for all my binder organization needs.  The Vine Program sent me this lovely assortment of 5 Tab Dividers and these come in pretty designs to add a little flair to our binders.  Extra wide pockets allow me to store paperwork without interfering with the 3-holes of the divider.  The tabs stay put and the free templates available at avery.com make it a snap to customize the inserts according to your needs.  I can easily fill the pockets with a short stack of standard 8 1/2" x 11" papers with no fear of them getting bent or damaged on the ends.  Five star approval from this Vine Reviewer!

Bought this because a friend had it and we loved it, so it was a perfect find here on Amazon.com. Sad to say, just seven months after purchasing, we almost had a fire using this thing! The electrical cord became loose from the base of the unit, exposing raw wiring, and sparking with a flame one day while my 11-year-old child was using it! It was totally terrifying, and we were very lucky she did not get burned. This unit was not used daily, nor was it tugged on or abused in anyway. Will never trust this brand again.

This book came to me from the Amazon Vine program and being a lover of all things Apple, I was excited to start reading this to get some hints on how to better use my iPad mini. Right off the bat I noticed its size and bulk, not exactly what I was expecting.  The colorful pages and layout was nice but the print size a tad too small.  I read several different sections, and after completing the book, I was surprised at how unnecessarily wordy many of the sections become. The author uses frivolous words over and over again.  Too many silly anecdotes fill each section and it gets tiresome quickly.  The author could have cut down on the length of the book easily by getting to the point quickly and more concisely.  The book is over 300 pages long.  I would like to have seen more bulleted pointers and more colors throughout.  Since Apple prides itself on simplicity, both in its design and approach to technology, this book is an ironic opposite of the Apple philosophy.

Nicely designed, this sleek black Belkin case fits your iPhone 6 perfectly.  It has a matte finish, a low profile which easily slips into purse or pocket, and a handy slip in pocket for money or credit card/id.  All cut outs are precise and allow access to every button.  I give it four stars instead of five because the stand does not really hold upright correctly, the phone slips and won't stand up straight.  But since I don't use this feature typically, I am not concerned about it not working.  You can't beat the price on these cases, however, I received this product from the Vine Program and hope my review helps other customers make the right choice for their needs.

Our 8 lb. dog has loved Cesar for six years as a supplement to her regular IAMS dry food..  We previously used only the Cesars pate but over time, we noticed her stools becoming too soft so we stopped feeding it to her.  This new line, Cesar Home Delights, offers something better and different than what we've always used, and since I received a generous case from the Vine Program, I wanted to try our pup on it an see if she would experience any negative bowel issues with this choice.  Well after using this for nearly a month, I'm happy to report that our dog is healthy and loving it, no bowel issues whatsoever, and she laps it up like a Thanksgiving feast.  The substantial and juicy sauce adds to a perfect consistency with the meat and veggies.  Opening this tray, you are not overwhelmed by a "dog food" smell like with so many other brands.  Rather, this container smells like real roasted chicken, very succulent and flavorful.  I feed her half a tray each day along with her usual dry IAMS and she's maintained a healthy weight.  I will try the beef variety next time.  NOTE:  The Amazon Vine page said I'd receive the Beef Stew, however, we received Low Cooked Chicken & Vegetables Dinner and it is wonderful.  Loaded with vitamins, minerals, chicken and vegetables like peas, carrots and potatoes.  A good choice for your dog.

These thin Carefree Liners are comfortable, and stay in place all day. They offer dryness and older free protection for daily use, or on extremely light end-of-your-period days.  Personally I prefer the scented liners, but this box was complimentary from the Vine Program so I have used them regularly for the purpose of this review. I also like that they are Long and thus give extra coverage.

Five Star has been our go-to brand for high quality, affordable school and office supplies for over a year.  We received this three pack from the Vine Program and are happy to review the notebooks with five stars.  Sturdy pages, a heavyweight double sided pocket folder to store plenty of papers, and a splash proof plastic front cover make accidental spills a non-issue.  The metal ring spirals are tight and well threaded so unwinding is not a concern.  Pages are college ruled and removable.  A definite A+ product.

Not sure why these are marked BUNN because they are not tall enough to properly hold coffee in my BUNN brewer.  When we bought our machine, it came with a sample pack of filters and they were wonderful.  We figured buying only BUNN replacement filters would ensure a correct fit.  We were surprised to see the price was higher for these name brand filters, and then totally disappointed in how they hold (or didn't hold!) the grinds.  Each and every brewed pot yielded an overflow of grinds.  We were not guilty of over filling, we know how to make coffee.  I am going to write or phone BUNN, they've always been helpful with other questions about the machine, and see what they suggest.  I love my coffee machine, but I don't like tasting grinds in the cup.

I use these around the home for everything from hanging the kids' clothing, belts & baseball caps to draping cell phone charger wires next to our desks.  They are sturdy and apply easily with strong double sided foam tape.  I removed one after application to determine how easily it came off, and I had no issues at all.  Though I prefer invisible clear hooks to white, these are fine since I'm reviewing them for the Vine program.  Package states maximum 2 lbs. and the closest we got to that weight was a child's terry robe.  I would suggest extending the hook depth a tad so that more items could fit on it.  The shallow hook prevents more than two items such as belts or bags to be hung, and for this reason, we couldn't even get close to hanging 2 lbs. worth of accessories on them.

These pads are VERY thick and bulky.  Generally, however, I prefer thinner supers, since puffy pads like these don't yield the most pleasant feeling all day.  Wear these on heavy flow days and you won't worry about leaks since they are highly effective and absorbent.  The very center of the pad rises in an almost awkward and sometimes uncomfortable way, so I don't think I'd turn to these for more than just this review for the Vine program.  They come tri-folded in a pink wrapper so toting them around all day is convenient.

This expanding zipper pencil pouch has two areas to store your necessities.  The front of the pouch is great for pens and pencils.  The rear side has a zip around closure and there is plenty of space for protractor, small notepad, scissors, eraser, even a cell phone or change purse.  The metal grommets reinforce the three holes for ease of movement in my child's binder.  The bright red is nicely contrasted with black.  We're certain this will withstand a full school year without ripping or falling apart as Five Star is a respected brand with durable products we use all the time.  Seams are well made and tight and the zippers are super strong.  A good choice!  Thanks, Vine!

This is perfect for my daughter's Galaxy 7" tablet.  The soft padding protects the device and the zip around closure keeps it safe inside.  Front mesh pocket is ideal for the charger, SD card, and stylus.  Her tablet already had a slim protective hard shell around it and believe it or not we didn't have to remove that in order to fit the device inside this sleeve.  It fits perfectly with the hard shell still on it so we're getting double protection.  I like the loop which makes it easy to grab, go or hook onto the interior of a backpack.  Five Star is a favorite brand of ours for well made, attractive, multi-functional and affordable student notebooks, pencil cases, and now electronic device storage.

This product has saved us so much stress while on the road with our Apple devices. Easily plugs into your cars cigarette lighter, and will charge your phone, iPad, etc. in no time.  Great for road trips and extended hotel stays where you don't always have a chance to recharge in a hotel.

These loafers are quite comfortable, but beware they run very small. And we mean VERY small. In fact these size nines fit our size 7 foot with only a small bit to spare at the toe. They run narrow, but not so narrow that they squeeze a normal width foot.  Comfy soles are flexible and sturdy. The dark navy is very chic and smart looking, either with capris, jeans, or shorts.  Well-made and durable, these shoes will carry you through several seasons of regular wear in comfort and style.

Received these with high hopes, since I am a sucker for quick bars to kill the midday hunger pangs and I prefer a healthy alternative to granola bars which are normally loaded with sugar. These are a decent alternative. I tried them for several days, having one in the middle of the afternoon, then waited several hours to see if I would experience any unfortunate gastric issues. Nothing too terrible, maybe a little gassy, but nothing atrocious. Didn't really taste much chocolate in these bars, but the cherry is a strong flavor and quite good. Consistency is a bit like sawdust in a brick, but it is chewy and tasty nevertheless.  It smells like a Christmas fruitcake!  Sugar is the second ingredient after soybean, but the grams will not put you over your daily allowance. I like that they filled me up between lunch and then dinner much later in the evening. They satisfied my midday craving for something sweet in a healthier way than other bars would do.

This little Dynamo is a total mult-task king!  Easy to grip design features a stand up base.  Store extra staples under the rubber flap on the base.  Use the staple lifter (remover) on the rear of the stapler, and sharpen your pencil to a clean, fine point, all with one nifty gadget!  I have several office supplies made by BOSTITCH because I find the brand to be dependable, affordable and long-lasting.  I also have children that are hard on school supplies so if I find something that works well and does more than one thing I appreciate the opportunity to condense my spending and get them things that can be more of an all-in-one item rather than buying separate items for separate functions.  So far none of the features are giving us any problems.  The stapler works well, the sharpener just as well.  I might avoid putting spare staples in the bottom only because the rubber flap seems to like to lift up and this might eventually end up with staples falling out.  I received the royal blue color and it goes well in my office.  I could use one of these in my classroom and the kid's homework area too.

I wanted to love these loafers, not only for the Cole Haan quality name, but for the lovely maple sugar shade and lovely patent.  They basically disappointed in every major area.  First off, they don't fit like a size 8B at all, but more like a Narrow.  My instep was squeezed terribly right under where the tongue is; my toes reached the very front of the shoe where generally there should be a smidgen of wiggle room.  The ankle was irritating and finally, the soles, which are flexible with raised bubbles kind of like cleats, made for precarious walking and in fact, I nearly twisted my ankle because they feel almost like wearing heeled loafers but without the proper support.  I give this shoe two stars because the patent is my favorite material and the color is dreamy.  Otherwise, no dice.

Our kids wear navy pants as part of their school uniform.  They go through scores of pants each year because after a dozen or so launderings, they seem to look like rags.  Dickies KHAKI are not only well made and durable, but they look smart enough to wear as a school uniform pant.  I love the button adjustable stretch waist.  Easy machine wash in cold water and tumble dry on low heat.  They need next to no ironing, in fact, I don't have to bother since they come out smooth and neat right from the dryer.  The more your wash them, the softer and more comfy they become.  Thick enough to keep your child warmer in cooler temps but not so heavy that they cannot be worn in warmer months.  An excellent value and dependable brand.

Not sure why these are popular.  They are cheesy looking and much like what you'd find in a dollar store toy aisle.  The sticker they come with make them look a bit more realistic, but honestly, for the money we spent on this, I would definitely look elsewhere to add to my child's mini collection.  This product is obviously advertising on national television to kids who have not seen or played with them before because once you open the package you realize you've been robbed.  The ads make miWorld look like much more fun than what it really is.

We are a one cat household and change litter weekly.  This product indeed is lightweight and fragrance free and absorbs quickly, but the clumps are so huge that it take more litter to fill the pan since we have to scoop and dump larger clumps each day.  I like that it is finely ground but I didn't notice that our kitty tracked less outside of the box than other brands which are heavier.  I think it makes more sense to buy a cheaper brand and use less of it.  This is not worth the extra cost.

Wanted to like this product since it's all natural.  I used it for nearly a month each night and all it did was dry out my skin.  I was not overly enthusiastic in my scrubbing since I didn't want to irritate my face, but even with gentle rinsing, my skin felt tight and dry upon towel drying.  The smell is medicinal and the scent is not at all like I expected considering the yummy organic ingredients it contains.  I also expected a bit of foaming, but unfortunately not even the slightest bubble emerged as I tried lathering.  I have to admit my skin is generally not problematic but I have an occasional breakout on my chin and forehead so I wanted to try this for a refreshingly good cleansing; it might have worked better if I had oily skin.  I will pass it on to my teenaged niece who will benefit from the acidic feel on her hormonal skin.

The Atlantis by BIC is a sleek and slimly designed pen with an ultra fine point.  It feels like you are writing with a razor sharp tip.  Smooth glide, comfortable grip and "Sharpie" like ink, yet no running or smudges.  Very durable and handy for home, school, purse, briefcase or office.  Will be ordering other colors.

We are a family big on binders.  Every facet of our home organization is dependent upon storage of important papers within the safe and convenient covers of easy to access binders.  This Avery One Touch is perfect for medium sized subject storage.  The smooth and quiet one finger tab makes opening and closing a simple and painless operation.  The sturdy feel of this binder assures you that it will stand up to regular use on your office shelves or bookcases.  Our children love using these for school but they are a bit hard to fit into backpacks.  We like the larger ones for keeping household papers together, i.e., insurance policies, car information, etc.  The front cover has a convenient slide-in pocket for your personalized cover page and the inner cover holds a large quantity of additional papers.  All around great product.

A favorite in our home for several years, SPOT IT has always offered us many hours of family fun.  A simple idea brought to life by quick thinking and even quicker action, this game develops hand-eye coordination and requires both visual and verbal stamina.  Several various ways to play, each one with the same idea:  MATCH ONE OBJECT, CHARACTER OR WORD ON YOUR CARD TO THE CARD ON THE TOP OF THE DECK.  There is only one match each time, and sometimes your eyes play tricks on you when you can't seem to find the match.  But look harder, there is guaranteed to be one there!  Our original SPOT IT has been used till the edges have worn thin.  This FROZEN version will delight youngsters who love the movie and all the wonderful colors and characters will come to life on the cards.  You will want to stock up on a few sets for all your FROZEN fans on your holiday list this year.  It's a game that not only entertains but also teaches.  Easy to tote along in the car or for play dates, sleepovers and parties.

For $3.99 plus free shipping, I'm not complaining.  It fits what I need to carry along with me each day, has a load of pockets on either side, plus the center compartment along with the two side zipper top compartments.  One zipper gets stuck each time I use it, so that would be why I'm giving this three out of five stars.  Otherwise, it's a pretty color, large enough for everything I use daily, and easy to use.  This makes pocketbook-switching a snap.

Creepy and disturbing, this is one of the late Robin Williams' finest, yet understated roles.  His portrayal of a loner / foto-mat employee / day dreamer / stalker is one that will both jar you and stay with you long after the final credits role.  Williams plays Sy Parrish, a long time employee of a local big box retailer, who develops photos day in and day out with precision and dedication unlike most other employees.  He has an affinity for the members of the Yorkin family, especially the young son, but over time, the attachment becomes an obsession and layers of Sy's demons become undone.  What happens by the end is both shocking, sad and sobering.  A must-see for any fan of psychological thrillers and/or of the great Mr. Williams.

I was searching high and low for a bag that would function as both a work tote and a purse.  This one fit the bill nicely.  I love the pewter color (currently sold out, I got the last one!) and the silver bangles compliment it nicely.  The strap drop is just long enough to fit comfortably on my shoulder over my outerwear.  The material is lightweight faux leather, very supple and soft.  I was hoping the interior zipper pocket was sturdier since I use this frequently and the zipper has already split in the middle but other than that, I was very pleased with the roominess, style and function of this bag.  The other shades of rust and blue which are still available would not be as versatile for my personal every day use, hence, the pewter goes with just about everything I wear.

Jo Burkhart didn't enjoy time spent in the city. Meeting her agent was a necessity though. She needed the money through her books to keep the family home in Maine. Meeting a gorgeous man in the coffee shop was a plus. Agreeing to go back to his place, well that was something she didn't do. But how could she resist him. Benjamin Paul was used to women trying to meet him in all different ways. being director in the theater. meeting Jo in the coffee shop and her not even recognizing his name was a definite plus. That was something that never happened. Along with wanting to see her again after their one night together. AS his life falls apart he finds himself running to Jo.  This is book 3 in the Second Chance series but can be read as a standalone. Love the characters. Jo was a solitary person. Staying home and writing her books. Ben Paul was immersed the theater and television world. Yet together they blend wonderfully. Ben wasn't sued to the feeling of not being on top of the world and felt his whole life was falling apart. Jo was used to trying to keep things together. You get to revisit with characters from the first two books, which hopefully lead to more books in the series. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Charlie Garrett is headed west with the wagon train to get a new start. All Olivia Walters wants is to head west and teach. Leaving home after turning down Silas's proposal. He wouldn't take no for an answer and listening to her mother tell her what a mistake she made. Olivia was ready to go fulfill her dreams. Playing poker with Charlie to pass the time, she ended up right back in the place she was trying to avoid. Charlie thought Olivia was bluffing when she agreed to marry him if she lost that hand of cards. She calls his bluff. Even standing in front of the preacher Charlie is waiting for her to say it was a joke but she never does. When his past catches up with him he realizes he wants Olivia as his wife and will do what ever he can to keep her. Olivia is torn between making things work with Charlie or letting his past tear them apart.  Another great book in the series. Each can be read as standalones. Olivia at times could be cold and unforgiving. As her life comes to light you start to understand where she is coming from. Charlie wasn't to honest about his past until he needs to prove to Olivia he is a changed man. I have fallen in love with the characters in this series. Can't wait until the next book. I am hoping it is Pete's story. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Raven lived life on the edge. Taking clients, skydiving, weeks on camping in the wilds. When she is hired by Josh Price for a few weeks of camping for him and his coworkers, Raven feels uneasy. They are clients so she figures take them , get back and it will all be over. Yet while out for people that say they have never camped. they seem to know a lot about being in the wild. Which makes Raven feel even more uneasy. Something  tells her to cut and run. Before she can take that step, danger reels it's ugly head.  Loved the first part of this series. It draws you in from the first page. Fast paced and action packed. If you love shifters, romance and suspense you will love this book. Can't wait for the next part. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Desert Moon- Lana didn't want to go back to Arizona, but she figured she would go with her grandmother and stay a few a days then head back to the east coast.  All she remembers about being here before was a scent she couldn't get out of her mind. Ty eldest son of the pack alpha and an alpha in his own right, never takes time to anything but pack business. He to is caught up with a scent from his past  Love the story, Lana was a strong women. Used to taking care of herself. She didn't any man to do it for her. Hot sexy, yummy alpha Ty needed a strong women to  be his mate. But between rogue shifters, pack business he tries to overlook Lana.  Wonderful first book in the series.Desert Blood- Heather Luth is on the run. ending up in the desert, she figures this would be a safe place to lay low for awhile. Staying in the small town and getting a temporary job teaching in a one room school house, she believes she will be safe. Meeting Cody, a man that makes her feel protected and safe. She has no idea what he really is. And Cody is afraid to tell her. For one she is human and for two he doesn't want to scare her off. He knows she is the one for him but how to make her see it.  This is the second book in The Wolves of Twin Moon Ranch. I love the characters. Each one is so different. Cody is easy going. He wants more but his father just sees him as a screw up. No way will his father ever let him mate with a human. Trying to find a way to keep Heather and protect her at the same time, Cody has to learn to step up and be the alpha he is. Heather finds herself falling for Cody but she is afraid for her life and knows at some point she is going to have to run again. The book is a standalone but does refer back to past characters.Desert Fate- Book three of The Wolves of Twin Moon Ranch series.  Stefanie is on the run.  Something is happening to her and she doesn't know what it is.  Finding herself laying in the desert at dawn as Amy a man standing over her.  Kyle Williams never thought to find a woman just lying in the desert.  As soon as he saw her eyes he knew she was a changeling.  He also knew she was his mate.  What neither of them knew was they had been childhood friends.  Pack law says Stefanie belongs to the pack bit her.  Kyle doesn't want to give her up.  Another wonderful book in a series. Kyle was a loner in the other books.  Even though he was a state trooper he stayed on the fringes of the pack.  Stefanie although a strong woman has trouble accepting what she has become.  She feels the pull towards Kyle but is unsure if she wants to take the next step.I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review

Desert Yule- Anna Lowe- Fantastic holiday story. Christmas is coming on Twin Moon Ranch. You get to catch up with all the couples and their children. Even the grouchy ole alpha shows signs of Christmas joy with his grandchildren. I love catching up with all the characters at the ranch.Still reading the rest of the book, but so far all the stories are great. Enough to get you in the holiday spirit.I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Matthew and Lauren were both such wonderful characters. Matthew knew Lauren was someone special after their first night together. he had no problem chasing after her. He was open and honest about what he wanted and what he was feeling. Lauren had a plan and she didn't like to deviate from it. She had convinced herself she wasn't ready for a man in her life. But as she got to know Matthew she felt torn between the plan and seeing where this was going with Matthew.  Fantastic dialogue between the characters. You can't help but fall in love with all the Walsh's. So looking forward to reading all the books in the series.

Hudson Maddox real estate extraordinaire is doing a favor for his brother Liam. Getting the water turned on for a house Kennedy Harper is flipping. Hudson has done work for her father Hank and had just assumed Kennedy was a male. Heading to the house to let her know he is taking care of the problem. Kennedy is mothing like Maddox thought. Striking sparks off each other and not always good ones. Maddox has a problem with Kennedy's smart mouth and Kennedy has a big problem with Hudson's overbearing ways. Yet they can't stay away from one another.  Liam Maddox was in in love with Chelsea Sampson through high school until the day she said they were to young to marry and took off, never to look back. Now years later she is back in town and bought a house down the street from Liam. Needing renovation work, Liam's company is the last choice she wants to make. But the best and she knows she has to suck it up. Liam can do this. Work on Chelsea's house and not get involved again. She is in the past. HE has since moved on. Yet as they are thrown together again and again it is obvious something is still between them.  Two of my must read authors in one book. Life can't get much better. Neither brother is looking to give up being single. They both love playing the field. Kennedy isn't even Hudson's type. She is more a t-shirt, work boots kind of women. Kennedy isn't looking for a man, much less an ocd sexy hot millionaire. Love these characters. Kennedy is feisty, independent and knows what she wants. Liam is determined never to get his heart broke again. He just needs to get Chelsea out of his system once and for all. Chelsea knows she gave up the love of her life when she left all those years ago. Is this a second chance or is it just closure. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

What a riveting fantastic read. The first in a new series from Maryann Jordan. Jack Bryant was the ultimate man. Protective, smart and strong but not over the top alpha. Bethany Bridwell, a strong independent women, helping her grandmother run Mountville Cabins. neither are looking for a relationship, yet have problems staying away from each other. A serial killer is loose and Jack and his team are determined to find him before he kills again. When it becomes to close to home can Jack save the one person he has feelings for.  I love romantic suspense. Yet normally I can figure out who is behind the killing. So the romance always takes the main story line for me  I have to say I had it narrowed down but I can never at any point say with any certainty who it was in this book. So for once the mystery and suspense was forefront in my mind. All I could say at the end was wow. I received an authors copy in exchange for an honest review
Loved Cami and Vince. Loved how the sisters had to work together and not having known each other. Good clean romance with some suspense.

Jake has spent his life feeling guilty and lost over the death of his parents. His twin brother Lane has always picked up the pieces of his life. When Jake finds himself in jail on Christmas eve, he Is determined to fix this himself. Alyson Road was a public defender. Assigned to Jake she goes in on Christmas eve to question Jake. Jake finds himself drawn to the PD. They keep running into each other and Jake thinks it is a sign they are supposed to be together.  This is the second book in the Crossroads series. The author suggests reading the first book for the full story. I haven't read the first one and except for a few things in the beginning I never felt lost. This is one of those emotional books that draw you in and make you cry, laugh and at times scream. Ally and Jake both have their issues. Ally being shy and having grown up poor she never sees herself as good enough. Much less for someone like Jake. He is rich successful and has women falling all over him. Jake doesn't see himself that way. All he sees is a broken guilt ridden man. being with Ally makes him feel as if he can have it all. When things take a turn towards danger, Jake needs to step up and become the man he thought he never would be. Ally needs to dig deep in herself and realize she can have the man and life she thought she would never have. I received and arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Second book in the series. Lean Rhodes was a wildlife photographer. Heading to Alaska to photograph grizzles. She meets Jenner. Whom everyone says is the best guide. So that is who she wants. Lena is attracted to Jenner from their first meeting. But something about him is different.Jenner knew Lena was going to be trouble. She was a spitfire, one that made his bear grumble.  Can be read as a standalone. This book does fill in a few of the pieces the first book hinted at. What happens at the end make me so impatient for the third book.  Lena had me laughing at times with her smart mouth. She had no problem standing up to Jenner even when he growled at her. Jenner definitely met his match in Lena.

I fell in love with Ian and Elyse. Elyse had a abusive relationship with Cole and after her hit her she kicked him out. Being no way prepared for an Alaskan winter Elyse struggles to survive. Deciding to advertise for a husband. Not a romantic relationship but a partnership to help her on the homestead. When Ian showed up at her door that is what she thought he was there for. Ian was only delivering a letter but something about Elyse called to him and made him want to spend time with him. He thought once she found out his secret she would send him on his way. This wasn't your typical shifter fall in love story. There is so much more going on. The hibernation, the McCalls and how the Silver boys were raised. Since it is a series I am guessing those little secrets will slowly come to light in each book. Looking forward to reading the next one.

I started with it in my living room lamp and it just wasn't bright enough. Then I used on my desk lamp and it works great in a more concentrated area. I haven't sued it long enough to say about the life of the bulb. Gets warm to the touch but not hot. Like the look of the bulb and there really isn't any glare when you look up into the light. I received this product free in exchange for an honest opinion

Allisandre needs to kill her mate to become godlike. At the last moment she cursed him instead. Making him a dragon shifter hoping it would make her mother happy. But it is death or nothing. Aeric will do anything to get his fated mate and have her by his side. What he didn't know was she will now die because she didn't kill him. After waiting hundreds of years for her will he lose her.  Great story in the series. Can be read a s a standalone. parts of the story are continued in each book but it doesn't take away from the actual story-line. I received this book in exchange for an honest review.
Love the shirt. I did get a size bigger then I wear but I wear shirts or a camisole under them. They are roomy and comfortable

Love the wig. Easy to fit on your head. Didn't make my head sweat at all after wearing all day. I had no problem covering my hair with it and it stayed in place. Love the red color and the waves in the hair. Does tangle kind of easy. So you need to keep it neat. You can finger comb it without hair falling out. I didn't try to style it. The textured didn't feel as if I could. But since I like the style I didn't feel the need to. I received this product in exchange for an honest review.

One Winters Night- Heather Tullis Jonah Owens was struggling with his art, opening his new gallery and trying to sell his grandmothers house after her fall.  Selling the house would be a lot easier if it wasn't next door to the Red Star Ranch. Farm animals in a residential area wasn't the best selling point. Kaya loved the Ranch working with the children and animals was her dream. The equine therapy business barely kept her head above water, so out of necessity she had to take a part time job over the winter. Jonah losing his part time help takes it out on Kaya. When Kaya leaves her job and is looking for a new one, Jonah's grandmothers send her his way. Desperate enough for the help he hires her. He never planed on the feelings that she brought out in him as her got to know her.  Wonderful book. It wasn't a love at first sight, it is a slow build up story. Way before the end. So don't think it is one where they get together in the last chapter. Kaya is open, honest and a hard worker. Jonah is struggling with not being able to paint after a tragedy in his past but slowly comes back into his own. A sweet romantic story where you fall in love with all the characters. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Arden the alpha of his pack is worried about the rogue wolves biting and turning humans. He wanted to get it taken care of before the council sent in Death Hunters. When it starts happening closer to home things start to heat up. First Finley the son of the police chief is bitten, then a newcomer in town Quinn Lamone. Quinn just moved to town to open her store and to get away from her father. While out back of her store she is attacked by the rogue wolves and gets bitten. When Arden shows up during the attack he realizes she is his "true mate" As the change comes over her Arden can't wait to claim her. Quinn has a secret, one that will make Arden turn away from her if it was possible.  Loved the story line. Lots of suspense and romance. Quinn doesn't accept the "true mate" easily. She is mad that she is turning. She fights every step of the way. She is a strong independent women and finally getting away from her father she has no intentions of getting involved with alpha Arden She is determined to open her store and take care of herself. Arden needs to convince her to accept him but when her secret comes out. Arden is torn between his hatred of her kind and the need to make her his. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Fantastic collection of dragon shifter stories. Some of the authors are past favorites and a few are new to me and will be looking for more from them. If you love paranormal and dragons you will love all the stories in this collection. Some are smoking hot and some are sweet and romantic.

Sammy loved her job setting up the lights for rock bands. It was all she ever known. Kept her with her father away from a mom that seemed to hate her. When her brother talks her into coming home for Christmas so they can spend some time together. Sammy is unsure, she doesn't want to see her mom but yet she can't wait to spend time with Jase. Running into her first love Alan wasn't part of the plan. She has never gotten over the hurt when he chose music over her. She missed how he made her feel but she didn't want to go through the hurt again. Especially when it seems nothing has changed between them. Then working for Alan's band she meets Jasper, instant attraction but oh so awkward. As Sammy and Jasper explore the attraction and feelings between them tragedy sticks and Sammy's life starts to fall apart.  A emotional read. Make sure you have tissues handy. Sammy is a wonderful character. She has close friends but at times so confused about life. She keeps going day to day. Picking up the pieces of her heartbreak in so many ways. Having two men who want her she has to decide which one is right for her. I liked Alan but he did put his music career before Sammy and he didn't seem like he had any intentions of changing. Jasper I loved but he had problems in his life that interfered with what him and Sammy could have. Can Sammy make the right choice for herself? I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review

Andi is headed into the Sierra Mountains to fulfill her mothers last wish. Never being one for the outdoors. Andi is determined to do this. Maybe she should have checked the weather before heading up the mountain. When a mud slid forces her to swerve and what she thought was a boulder turns into a bear. Andi ends up going over the embankment and ends up in the river. When the bear rescues her she doesn't know what to think. It has to be a dream or a hallucination. When she comes to instead of a bear park ranger Michael MacBrun is rescuing her. Michael can't believe what he did to Andi. It just wasn't done that way. Now he needed to let her go and hope she came back to him.  Talk about action from the get go. As soon as you start reading the book draws you in with action. Loved the characters and really enjoyed the face paced story line. They both feel the attraction but Michael tries to keep what he is and what he has done from Andi. She takes it as rejection. How can he convince her they were meant to be with out telling her the truth right away. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Janie is trying to pick up the pieces of her life after being widowed at 29 met her best friend Candy for a drink. After Candy leaves Janie is finishing her drink when a big biker guy sits next to her. Introducing himself, Max proceeds to try and pick up Janie with some of the raunchiest pick up lines. Even after all that Janie finds herself attracted to him. Max has a problem he is trying to get solved When Max's secret comes to light will Janie stick around or leave.  Between the steamy sex scenes and the humor, this was a good book. Some of Max's lines had me laughing out loud. I don't know if I could keep a straight face if I heard somebody speaking them. It seems to work for Janie. Then you have the MC club Pork Pirates, a pork based club. Even their tattoo had sausage in it.  Even as corny and raunchy some of the dialogue was, it was a fun short read. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Amy wasn't sure what she was going to do. She had to close her chocolate store since the mall had been sold and they were turning it into a virtual mall. She really didn't have the money to start over and the store was her dream. Ex-boyfriend and mall security Mitchell was a creep. Coming into the store as she was packing up giving her a hard time, then Zach walks in. Finding out Zach is behind the mall closing Amy has no problem telling him exactly what she thinks. Even after feeling that instant attraction to him. Amy's only chance of setting up shop elsewhere is a person she had been emailing from Craig's List.  Great story. Some suspense, humor, romance and hot sexy attraction between Amy and Zach. You don't know where they story is going to go and that in itself keeps you turning the pages. Wonderful characters and a smooth flowing story line makes for an wonderful read. I received a copy of this book in  exchange for an honest review.

Lara Hollywell has had a crush on her boss  Blake Snowden for awhile. She never figured it would go anywhere but it was nice to dream. When it was time to draw names for secret Santa, she ends up with Blake's name she has no idea what to get him. And why now is he suddenly spending more time talking  to her. After losing her fiancé  7 years before she still doesn't feel ready to move on but a crush never hurt anyone. Blake has been trying to find a way to get closer to Lara for awhile now. Rigging the secret Santa drawing seemed liked the right thing to do. Now he just needs to find her the perfect gift.  A sweet Christmas story. I think Lara was ready but was afraid of getting hurt again. She pegged Blake as a work alcoholic and a player. Finding out he was neither of these things, gave her hope. Blake was up to trying anything to get Lara's attention and a date with her. Can he convince her to take a chance on him. Wonderful way to get into the holiday spirit. I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.

When Jo wins a bet to work on a crabbing boat for the season. She figured it was a good way to make money needed for her dads medical bills. Except Jo doesn't like to follow orders. Keller the captain of the boat never figured Jo would win the bet. Now he has no choice but to let her take her fathers place for the season. When Keller finds himself attracted to Jo, his job might be the one thing that keeps him from having her.  Wonderful cast of characters. I loved Jo, she was smart, feisty and had no problem making herself seem bigger then her petite self. Family comes first with her. Taking care of her father is her number one priority. Keller feels guilt over the loss of his father. As much as he wants to rescue Jo, he lets her do her job and fight through on her own. The crew all blend nicely with different personalities.  Graham, Jo's best friend will do anything for her and always has her back.  Pete never seems to let up on her. Over all a great read. The attraction is there almost from the beginning but isn't acted on until late in the book. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review

4 starsAdalyn lived a sheltered life with her parents. Home schooled and kept close to her parents until the day her mother tells her she needs to go. To keep going until she is far away. With new eye and hair color a whole new identity, Adalyn ends up in the small town of Aster Lake. Finding out it is hard to fly under the radar in a small town, Adalyn settles in with her new friend Madi. A new job and soon her own apartment. Rudd Archer a police officer in Aster Lake tends to keep to himself. Yet something about his new tenant keeps drawing him back. He knows she is hiding something.  You are drawn into the story from the first page. What big secret is Adalyn's parents hiding. For being so sheltered Adalyn finds herself trying to adapt to life on her own. Madi doesn't let her keep to herself. Rudd was different. He life changes when a secret from his past comes forward. One ne never knew. Then he finds himself unable to keep away from Adalyn. Plenty of suspense and romance. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Drew, Jason and Ellie have been friends since childhood. Razes Hell is taking off. Trying to hit the big time. A fake feud between Drew and Jason takes on a life of it own. Ellie finds herself in the middle of the brothers. While younger Ellie had a crush on Jason. It never went anywhere, she realized it was just a crush. Now with Drew, what she felt for him was so much more. She never thought he would ever feel that way about her. Drew is tired of being second to Jason. He is tired of pick up the pieces and trying to keep Jason on the straight and narrow. He wants to be first for once. Most of all he wants Ellie.  Drew was the older brother and always tried to do what was right. He over thought things and second guessed feelings. Jason was into the rock star life. Different women, drugs but no matter what was going on he always wanted his best friend Ellie nearby. Ellie was the peace keeper between the two. She always tried to smooth things over. Even keeping her feelings to herself about Drew. The book is full of emotion and quite a few tear jerker moments. So keep the tissues handy. I loved Drew he was just one of those special people who had deep feelings for. A story of friendship, love and doing what is right. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Elizabeth Shaw has her life planned out. She never steps away from the plan. Never letting anything get in the way. Not friends, men or family. Moving to Chicago from New York is part of the plan. Finding a house she loved, she couldn't wait to move in. Seeing toys and bikes out doors next door, she questions who her neighbor is and how many children they have. She doesn't need the noise. Meeting Joe Antonetti and his two children didn't exactly get them off to a good start. Joe thought Elizabeth a beautiful women but she really needed to loosen up. As they are thrown together more often then either of them like, things start heating up. Sometimes life is better then what you plan.  Loved Elizabeth, she started out so unbending. As her past comes to light, you see why. Who can resist two children who insist on trying to be her friend or they hot and sexy father. Joe has been raising his children on his own since his wife's death. He didn't think he would ever move on, but Elizabeth sneaks into that open and empty place in his heart. There is so much they need to work through and when something tragic happens to Elizabeth. She needs to learn to learn to let people who love her help her through it. Definitely one of the must read books this year. Loved the flow and the direction of the story. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Penny and Z are happy in their relationship. It is so much more then Z expected. Z saw a future with Penny. She is everything he wanted in a women. Melissa is miserable in her life.
