Thinking money will make it better. When she sees a reward to the whereabouts of Kristy Bradley for a million dollars she can't resist. Except she knows Kristy Bradley by another name. She sets in motion a series of events that brings Penny's past into her here and now.  This book had so many twists and turns. I loved it. I never knew the direction it was going to go in. As each twist is revealed you can't read fast enough to find the next secret coming to light. Melissa puts her own life and the life of Penny into danger. As they race to stay one step ahead the clock is slowing ticking down. I received and arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Awesome collection of books. You get Fifty Shades of BDSM. Jack Kimble and Melita are engaged to be married. It was set up by their parents. Not what either of them actually want but they are willing to go along with it.  Melita is willing to learn about the BDSM world for Jack but when things get out of hand she realizes there are some things she isn't willing to sacrifice.  In the second one Jack Kimble. Jennifer is hired on as the assistant for Jack. She is different from what he normally goes for but he finds himself chasing after her. Has he finally met his match.  Loved the story lines. You know right off the bat that Jack and Melita have no chemistry between them and no matter how and they try and make it work it isn't going to go anywhere. Melita has every intention of going along with the engagement, even leaving behind the man she actually loves. As passive as she is in parts she also has back bone when it matters. The second book is after the fact and Jack is playing the field with fake blond bimbos until Jennifer comes along. Completely different then his normal, she has no problem turning him down. I received an arc for an honest review.

The best installment yet. So much going on. Things are about to change for the clans. The question is are they good or bad for them. This book dealt mostly with Isabella and Helga and Keith and Tori. But you still get what is going on with other characters. For being short books a lot of action is packed into them.

Happily Mated After- Anna Lowe  Tina and Rick have been married three months now. Starting to settle into their new life together.  While working in the office Tina is involved with the books but Rick has other things on his mind when he comes in. Tina has no problem getting on board.  Bonus epilogue for the Desert Heart book. I fell in love with Tina and Rick in the book and it was great to read a little more about how they are settling in to married life. Lets just say they are still in the honeymoon phase. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Tag Chasers- Kandi Steiner  I fell in love with Corbin in Tag Chasers. In Tag Catcher Corbin and Paisley head to Oklahoma to visit with Corbin's family. Paisley is nervous enough meeting Corbin's family for the first time. Throw Rachel in the mix and it really sends Paisley down the road of insecurities.  Rachel has been in love with Corbin for a long time. Plus she has the advantage of being friends with the family. She sets out to make Paisley as miserable as possible and to show her in the worst possible light.  I loved the chance to revisit with Corbin and Paisley. The are two of my all time favorite characters. Corbin was his same wonderful self. Paisley wasn't shown in the best light at times but that is what makes the story. Got to hand it to her she did a lot better then I would have. I received and arc of this story in exchange for an honest review.

Julia Stewart is a busy women. Principle of the high school, single mother and trying to be there for her parents. She is quick to jump into help others but doesn't allow any to help her. She can do it herself.  When she gets a phone call that her daughter was injured at her parents and at the hospital she runs of to the hospital. DR. Alex Campbell has a two year contract in Lobster Cove. Working in the small town is helping  him pay off some medical school loans. He has no intentions of staying past that date. He finds himself drawn to Julia and her daughter and as time goes by he finds himself caught up in the small town and its residents.  Love the slow pace of the romance. The attraction between Alex and Julia is there from the beginning, but they don't jump into anything. Each has different goals in life and as much as they try to ignore what is between them. they find themselves unable to sat away. As a friendship forms between them Julia is learning to deal with her parents medical issues and her best friends. The town comes together when someone is in need. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Tess knew everything about Max's case. She had read the files over and over. When her lawyer boss sends her to his parole hearing in his place. She thinks she has a good chance to get it granted. She never counted on being in the middle of a prison riot and escape. Max was guilty of murder and he never denied it. He planned on doin his full time. He had no remorse for what he done. Escaping prison that day with Tess in tow, he never thought of how his life would change.  I have to say I was torn on the book. I loved the story and the writing. I love alpha males and Max was definitely one of those. Yet at times he seemed more mean and nasty then alpha. Yet as the story went on, I started understanding him and his ways and slowly fell in love with him. Tess already had the hots for Max before they met. She believed in him. At times she seemed whiny and at times annoying but together her and Max worked.  I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Kellie has known from an early age, she wasn't meant to be a female. She wants to be Kaleb. A mother that forced her to be in pageants no matter how badly she fought. Coming out with her secret to her father she learns he to has been keeping a secret. What transpires are many other secrets members of the family have been keeping.  This is not a romance. It is a story of transgender, abuse, bulling and human trafficking. How the people closest to you can have deep dark secrets that will pretty much do anything to keep them secret. It is wonderfully written. You can feel the emotions from each character and in a sense you can feel where they are coming from. Whether right or wrong they all believed they were doing the best thing for them or other family members.. Granted some took things a little to far. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Love the first part. Abby and 5 friends were in a car accident during a blizzard. Andrew found them near his house and invited them to stay. The attraction between Abby and Andrew was hot. Can't wait to read the rest of the series. As I just discovered the box set I am extremly happy to get to read straight through.

Loved this series. I had read the first one and then saw the set.I love when I don't have to stop reading to finish. Abby was a sweetheart. She is one of those women you fall in love with. Andrew had a bit of a past he found hard to let go of. Meeting Abby gave him the incentive to start moving on. They had their ups and downs but it was a wonderful read.

The four immortals are sent on a quest to find the lost city. First they need to find a map. Braving sand storms, traitors and enemies on their search. They meet up with spy who had betrayed Jadeth in her lifetime. Now he wants to redeem himself. Jadeth is finding it hard to forgive what he had done. Ivo starts having feelings towards Emaranthe. Can it go anywhere between two immortals.  Action packed and full of suspense. If you like fantasy you will love these books. They aren't long stories but a lot is packed into the pages. I love the immortals and as each one has a special power I don't have a favorite. They work well together and they complement each other in battle. I received  an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review

Four Immortals are out to protect a village and their mining. Each immortal has a special power and they work together fluidly to save those that need their help. They all have some memory of their past when they were mortal and that is woven into the story. It helps you learn the characters and follow along with how they became immortal. This book is building up to the next in the series. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Jamie Denver enjoyed her time with Chandler. Can't call it a relationship. Chandler doesn't do them. She knew letting herself feel anything for him would end in heartbreak. Yet the heart wants what the heart wants. So now she knows it is time to move on before she gets any more attached. Chandler enjoyed Jamie. The sex was great, she didn't play games. They had a good thing going. he didn't do clingy money hungry women. His life was the way he loved it, why then after two weeks away from Jamie he was finding it hard to move on. When Jamie ends up pregnant, Chandler swears there is no way it could be his.  Loved Jamie, she was strong and determined to do the pregnancy on her own. She didn't need Chandler or his money. As much as she loves him she hates the way he is being. Chandler was hateful and at that point I was torn between hoping for the best or agreeing Jamie was better off with out him in the picture. Chandler learns a hard lesson. Nothing is impossible. How he uses this knowledge is up to him.  I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Part 7 picks up where 6 left off. Pepper is sent to John's house. She thinks Dmitri has completely given up on her. John has lots of things planned for Pepper and none of them are good. Dmitri can't get Pepper out of his mind. Know he just needs to get her back and show her how much he feels for her. Then he finds out where she was sent and realizes it is up to him to save her.  Wonderful conclusion to the series. I would have liked to see where they go from here but it wraps up. Lots of emotions in this book. A  young women down on her luck but wanting to make something of herself. A rock star turned actor who thought the was through dating a popular actress but finds himself realizing you can't control who you love. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

All three books in one. Great way to read a series.Bad Lust-Jake is the guy every women wants to be with, the bad boy. He has no problem being with them all. Except for Jade. After the night with her he hasn't forgotten it. When she winds up as his stepsister, it takes a whole new turn. Jade wants Jake again even though she will try her best not to. He was her first and know living in the same house with I'm makes it that much harder to get him out of her mind. Just one more time. There is so much more to Jake then he shows the world. I think Jade sees that in him. he doesn't want Jade to know he has feelings for her so he comes off hurting her as much as possible. Jade is looking for love and she wants Jake. Some of the time I really wondered why she wanted him. Seriously there is only so much you can take of being put down and hurt. Since this is book 1, I wonder where the author is going to take itBad Heartjade is being pushed towards Hunter by her father. That's the kind of man he wants her with and it is good for business. All Jade wants is Jake. Knowing it  won't go anywhere beyond what they do in bed. Jake fights what he feels for Jade. He has no intentions of being a one women man. He likes his life the way it is. When he ends up in trouble he realizes Jade is the only person he has to call.  There is a lot of back and forth with feelings and emotions in the book. Neither Jake or Jade will admit or know what it is they are feeling.Bad LoveThe final book in the series. Jade and Jake after everything they have been through. All the ups and downs have finally decided they are going to do what is right for them. They both have had enough of being controlled by parents and their pasts.  I loved the final book. It wraps up in a fantastic way. After everything in the first two books. I was starting to despair Jade and Jake would get it together and stand up for themselves. Both characters have grown so much. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Jamie is slowly getting her life back together. Becca her best friend and physical therapist realizes Jamie isn't making much progress anymore and suggest she go to Montana and allow her brother Cole to work with her. It was a strong suggestion. Cole had returned from overseas, broken and lost. Starting a clinic he worked with wounded warriors and helped them get their life back together. Jamie is willing to do pretty much anything to get her life back. Making the call to Cole was easy, hanging up after hearing his voice not so much. Cole had never been so turned on by a voice. He couldn't wait to meet Jamie and see how well the voice fit the person.  From that phone call to their first meeting the attraction between Cole and Jamie was undeniable. They both worked hard to keep it professional but it was a losing battle. Jamie and Cole were both wonderful characters. You can't help but fall in love with them. Some drama ensues to keep the book going. Beside the main characters, you meet Cole's family and some neighbors and Jamie's other best friend. Which introduce you to some of the characters in the series. This was definitely a sweet read. Some teary eye moments. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Tristan and Annie are coming together and I hope for her sake he changes his mind about the plan he had. Izzy and Luke still something odd going on there. Luke is seriously up to something and I don't think he is on the same wave length as Izzy. Keith and Tori are together and he is finding it hard to protect her. Lucy and Sven are in their own world. Now to wait for the next installment. Seems like forever. Now that things are really heating up.

I can't believe what Tristan and Isabelle are up to. I just hope Annie and the Tristan's love can change the course of things. Keith has finally given in to Tori. Like he could resist for long. Isabelle and Luke are both up to something and I am getting the feeling it isn't the same thing. When Sven arrives in town, Lucy is smitten. Thought he isn't quite what she had in mind. This series keeps you on your toes trying to figure out what alternative motives everyone has.

Tori is trying to prove to Keith she has moved on. But he is showing some jealousy about Jax. Annie is awaiting the arrival of Tristan's mother Helga and the triplets. If anyone can win them over it will be Annie. Isabelle mated with Luke but something is up with that. Makes you wonder what they are up to. I can't wait to read the next installment.

Now I am seriously wondering what Tristan is up to. I am hoping things change and Annie doesn't get hurt. She is a wonderful character and will do anything for anybody. Tori is still having dreams and Keith is trying to keep his distance. So much is going on. I love it

I read this book as part of a box set. Needless to say I got caught up in the secrets and lives of the different Kingdoms. I love the characters and the story line. Can't wait to find out more what is going on.

When I opened the bag the chain was in a knot. I finally got the knot out and then noticed there wasn't a bigger link for the hook to fit into. So no way hooking it to wear it. Then I was checking it out thinking I might be able to add a link and a big section of the chain came apart. So I never even got to wear it.  The snowflake is pretty so I put it on another chain I had.  I received the product in exchange for an honest review

Books are being reprinted with mistakes and defects and Pacifico's a Chihuahua shifter is determined to find who is behind this and stop it. Heading to the WWP to confront the head of it he discovers that Atlandia is now in charge of it and not her mother Dominka. Pacifico feels an attraction to Atlandia. As he explains the situation she agrees to help him find out who is behind the reprinting of the books.  This is the fourth book in the series and can be read as a standalone. Action packed full of adventure. Takes you up against pirates, evil werewolves. A hurricane on a Caribbean Island. The relationship between Pacifico and Atlandia grows as they search for who is behind the evil plan. Wonderful book to escape life with. You find yourself drawn into their world and you don't want to leave. I received an copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

4 starsBliss in the children's librarian at the Shipsfeather Public Library. She is also a dog shifter. A greyhound to be more exact. Her boyfriend Harry a werewolf was in love with Bliss. She had taught him so much. On his way to meet Bliss he hears her calling for help. She was being restrained by what looked like dogcatchers. This leads up to Harry and Bliss going on a quest to save an Lost Library of the ancients from destruction.  This is the third book in the series and can be read as a standalone. I will admit I had trouble getting into the book. So many characters are thrown at you in the beginning. Trying to keep names and shifters straight was hard at first, but once I did I settled into the story nicely. I loved Bliss and Harry, they were so much in love and it was a close relationship. It is action packed and suspense filled. You fall in love with characters, well most of them as you get to know them. The story does wrap up at the end. Wonderful afternoon read. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.
Desert Hunt- One of my favorite hot steamy sex scenes from the book by Anna Lowe. Made want to go back and read the book again.

Saber Toothed tiger shifter Alaric must fight in the arena until he finds his mate. he has been having dreams about her so he knows he is getting close. Audrey is the sister to the master vampire in their area. Being a human she has no problem being around shifters. Audrey receives in invitation to the NWFA fight. She decides to check it out. Hearing a loud roar she finds herself wanting to go see who it was.  Loved the book, it was much to short. Audrey being around supernaturals didn't panic or freak out in any way when she discovered she was Alaric's truemate. Alaric couldn't wait until he made his mate his. Spend time with her, mate her and live happily ever after. Smoking hot sex scenes but such a sweet romance. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Awesome collection of four novellas. Each one is a complete story. Little drama, some suspense and sexy hot sex scenes. They all tie in together but can be read as standalones. Men afraid to make commitments. Men looking for commitments and the women they fall for. Second chance romance. Something for everyone. Wonderful afternoon curl up on the couch read. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Faith got caught up in the biker gang. Being Wolf's property wasn't the way she wanted to live. She had no idea how to save herself. Jackson showing up that day and meeting Faith, he knew he wanted her and had no problem telling her that. In very explicit terms. When Faith decides to run she runs right into Jackson. Jackson agrees to help her if she becomes his in everyway. Faith is attracted to Jake but also she knows he is the only way she is going to escape. Jake wants a son to carry on his name. He is determined Faith is going to be the one to give him that.  I enjoyed the story Loved the characters. Faith was a strong women. Jackson had his code he lived by and nothing was going to divert him away from that. Even falling in love. I had a problem with the twelve years. That is a long time to remain celibate. Faith was picking up the pieces of her life and raising her son.  Jackson was out making sure Faith was safe from Wolf's gang coming back and harming her. Just a hard time line to work around. I did like that they just didn't pick right back up. They had to get to know each other again. The feelings were still there but after that long they were different people. The duel point of view kept you in the loop of what each person was feeling and going through which did help with the story. I received an arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Book 2 picks up where book 1 left off. Jake can't get Addi out of his head. He is slowly starting to change as his attraction to Addi build. He still isn't sure what he feels. Addi knows what Jake is, but she feels something for him. She is determined to stay in control of the relationship which makes for a smoking hot scene.  You have to read the first book to follow along. Addi had something or someone in her past that makes her afraid of stepping out. Jake is determined to convince Addi to trust him. He isn't used to women telling him no much less take control in the bedroom. This part redeems itself after the first book. I can't wait to see where it is going. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Jake owns his own tattoo shop. He is successful in business but a manwhore outside of it. He pretty much screws any women who throws themselves at him. He has never met a women he wanted to give it all up for.  The night of his twin brothers club opening he meets Addi, his brothers partner in the club. For some reason she gets under his skin.  I was torn on my feelings for this book. Most of it just seemed to be Jake having sex.  Which really didn't hold my attention. She has no respect for women and seems like he will have sex with anyone. Then Addi pops in the picture and the book gives you hope that it is actually going somewhere. Addi seemed like a lovable person. She doesn't seem like she will play Jake's games. So with that I am looking forward to reading the rest of the series. I received an arc copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Alyssa after losing her husband Derek, needed to get her life back together. She was being smothered by good intentions with the family. She put her daughter in the car and drove. Now two years later she still hasn't went home. Opening her own café her and Lexie started healing. Then Alex showed up. Alex was making a fresh start, having the interview for the cook position in the café was allowing him that time. He never planned on falling in love with a little girl and her mother.  This is the second book in the Winters Family Series. They can be read as standalones. I read them out of order and had no problem following. Such a sweet love story. Alyssa had been through losing her husband and being smothered by family. She didn't plan on falling in love again. Alex wasn't looking for love but he couldn't ignore what he felt when around Alyssa and Lexi. They have their moments where they try to fight what they are feeling but mostly they are both willing to see where the relationship will go. In my opinion makes it all the more sweeter. I received a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Book 1- Is Scarlett and Tripp's story. When roommate and friend Maggie drags Scarlett to a DownCrash show, the hottest band on campus. Scarlett figured she needed a night out, a few drinks and be away from Andy. Andy was her best friend but here lately it seemed as if he wanted to be more but Scarlett didn't feel that way about him. Meeting Tripp at the bar, they talked for a few and he had to go. Scarlett never imagined he would be the lead singer in the band.  The book does start slow. Towards the middle of the story it picks up the pace. Scarlett feels the attraction to Tripp but for some reason she keeps Andy hanging on thinking he has a chance. I have to say that part bothered me somewhat. When the secret comes out it does make sense in a way. Tripp was great. Such a player Scarlett and Tripp go back and forth a good bit when they finally settle in. Tripp is carrying his own demons around. Until they both work through what was in the past they can't work towards a future.Book 2- Tatum and Maggie's story- Maggie had met Tatum through Scarlett and while they were both attracted to each other, they never acted on their feelings.  Maggie had an ex that was bad news. Tatum made  a decision that for a long time wasn't sure it was the right one. When Derreck returns Maggie doesn't know how to get away from him. Tatum isn't going to just let her go he is determined to protect her.  This book starts off fast paced and stay that way. Where as the first book took its time and introduced all the characters, you know them now and it jumps right into it.  Maggie made a promise and it needs to be broken. Some promised especially once under duress should never be kept. There was so much more to Tatum then meets the eye. Decisions that are made sometimes might not seem like the best ones, but they work out for the best.Book 3- Logan and Annie's story- I had trouble warming up to Annie. She was kind and caring and it seemed that fast she would turn. The back and forth is throughout most of the book. While they did have things in common with each other it seemed as if Annie couldn't make up her mind but when the going got tough and Logan needed her she was there. She just needed that extra push to come to terms with her feeling.

Jason is relying on Flossie more and more in bed and out. Matty and Lawrence take their relationship one step farther. Alexandra's mother is planning a house party.. Determined to keep her daughter out of working in the hospital. Elizabeth doesn't care about the party she is determined to never marry. Men are not what she is looking for. Polly while collecting gossip in town catches on to Flossie and Jason.

Jason and Flossie are keeping their relationship a secret. They both have their reasons for it and they know it is short term.  Matty feels safe living with Lawrence in the blacksmith. The opening of the hotel brings everyone together under one roof. So much went on in this episode, really got things rolling in the series.

Marshall is still reeling from the death of his wife. Trying to keep his family together and run the hospital is taking more effort then he thought. Now his wife's family is trying to take the girls to London. Flossie gets a letter from home with bad news and she needs more money and has no idea of how to get it. Alexandra's mother is trying to do anything to keep her daughter away from the hospital.

As the story comes together. Flossie makes herself indispensable to Jason in the hotel. DR. Lady Alexandra is enjoying her work at the hospital. Finally having the chance to do what she is trained for. Jason is determined to court Lady Elizabeth. He sees it as his chance to move up in the world. Lawrence is keeping Matty safe but she still doesn't remember much about what happened. I have to say I am really getting involved with the characters. Each one is unique and I can see this series as becoming addicting.

In the first episode we are getting introduced to the characters. Flossie arrives in Brynthwaite to start her new job at the hotel Jason Throckmorton is opening. Dr. Marshall Pycroft  is running the hospital as the only DR there. Lawrence Smith the blacksmith finds a women hurt and with no memory. Enjoying getting to know the characters in the story and how they inter connect with each other.

All the books in the Blackbird series in one place. I loved this series. Between the snarky comments and steamy hot sex scenes it has something for everyone. You fall in love with the characters and I will be sad when the series is over. As a added bonus you get to read Lorcan's story.

The girls are spending the day at the beach. Spending time together and connecting.Jarrett tries to talk to Jess but she blows him off. I think the girl doest protest to much...hmmmCassie is hung up on Adams kiss, but she knows he has friend zoned her. Yet she can't get him off her mind.Skyler and Bear make up after their argumentSkylar wants to skip the Halloween party because of the tournament coming up, but how can you skip such an important event.All this and more in Episode 4. I received a arc of this book in exchange for an honest review.

In this 5th episode of PSU we find things heating up  between Skyler and Adam. Even though he keeps bringing up Cassie. Asheli is paying for her one night with Hayden, with Kya making her responsible. Parting days are over for the time being in the house for Bear and his brothers. One more episode left in the season and I have a feeling things are going to end with a bang. I love the characters in this series. It like a soap opera in the afternoon. Can't wait to see what happens with them next.

Kitsun's Raven: At First Sight by Phoenix Johnson-  When dreams become a reality. Kistune bumped in to Karasu. She felt the tingles as she looked at him. The two shouldn't be. Neither is willing to give up. Greta story. Love can overcome hated when you want it bad enough.The Claiming by Laashell Collins- Toni Montgomery was a strong, feisty women. She ran her fathers company with no problems. When she hits a wolf driving home one night and gets bite. Strange things begin to happen. Xander needed a mate. He knew who she was but he didn't have time to convince her of that. Now that he started the ritual he has to convince her that he is right for her.Savage by Kim Faulks-  Mia escaped from her cage where they had been holding her. She was afraid to let the beast out from within. She though tit would kill her. Coen and Drake find Mia and take her in. They try and convince her to let the beast out and it that it would help her. Need to be careful of whom you trust.Love Like Wings by Amy Lee Burgess-  Alexa was alone in the world. She didn't date or hang with friends. She preferred to be alone. Having to put up with Sebastian was enough. Sexual innuendos, a new women constantly. He wouldn't leave Alexa alone. She didn't fool with players. She saw what her mother went through. They had a business arrangement and that was how it was staying. There was more to Sebastian then meets the eye. She judged him before she got to know him.Claiming His Mate by Bethany Shaw-  Erik has been gone 3 years. Being back in town was hard. All he could think about was Lexi and how he left and never said goodbye. Now finding out she is married and has a child. He can't believe he lost the chance with the one women who was supposed to be his mate. Just because she was human. He couldn't help who he feel in love with. Lexi seeing Erik after all these years, made her nervous, scared and mad. Denying his child how dare he come back now. It seems the pack was keeping secrets from Erik. Great story, sometimes the unthinkable can happen.Complication by Elle Thorne-  Laken Araya a black panther shifter has lost her leg. Now she spends her time overseas serving as a Doctor. Planning on a vacation with her sisters she ends up being called to the Shifter Supreme Court to oversea a case. Shifter Malachi Romanoff was supposed to be off but when they give him a case from another representative, he never thought he would see the one night stand he couldnt ever forget. After all this time they should have forgotten each other. But their animals remembered every moment from that night. Second chance for mates.When the Snow Flies by Kiki Howell-  Anna has lost everything in life and has the scars to prove it. Avoiding people and staying to herself is the only was she copes. She finds some solace in the labyrinth. Until the night what looked like a creature out of a fairy tale swooped in and scared her. Grael wasn't scaring her he was rescuing her. She was in danger and as her mate he had to save her. She just didn't know he was her mate, actually she hadn't met him yet. Love over looks the scars both inside and outside a person.Unbroken by Fiona Steele -  Pegasi was a proud breed, strong,  winged shifter. Majestic when in flight. The Belleros, a serpant shifter whould have wipped out the Pegasi is they wouldn't have made the pact. The two kings on an island together. Davian the king of Pegasi felt his mate near which couldn't be possible. Emma was engaged to Jeffery. Not that she really wanted to be. Everyone told her it was the best for her. A man from a wealthy family and a poor girl like her. When Jeffery wants the wedding to tak eplace on an island only his family knows about. It sets in motion the one thing that can change the history of the Pegasi.Not Your Bitch by Angelica Dawson.  Zoe hated herself, she knew a girl like her would never get a good guy. One that would love her for herself. No matter how Elliott treated her, she never spoke up. It was better to have a boyfriend that was hateful and belittled you then none at all. Until Linc. Linc wants to bad to tear Elliott apart for the way he treats Zoe. She deserves so much better. To Linc, she is beautiful and if given a chance she will prove it to her.Ngyong by Melissa Bell-  Nygyong heard the story of the Legen of the Fox while sitting next to his grandmother on her death bed. She never knew how the story would paralle his life. Hiding out and trying to stay off the radar, Nygyong never planned on taking a mate or having a family. Savannah had an esscape plan. Her best friend Renee helped set things in motion. Her family was determined to marry her off to a person of their choosing. She wanted her own life. Suvannah watched Nygyong do his martial arts work out. He drew her in as she watched. She never meant to draw him into her problems. Quickly is becomes so much more.

Summer returned to Midnight Cover for Mandy's wedding. She hadn't been back since that one summer four years before. Running into Blake and Devin again was to much. All that summer they were best friends until the night with both of them. Summer had to run to New York who dated to men at the same time and they were best friends. What would people think? Devin and Blake always considered Summer the one that got away. They both wanted her and were willing to share as long as it was the three of them together. Blake and Devin want to convince Summer to give them another chance. But will a big secret keep her from staying.  Loved the characters, Summer having to deal with a mother like she had, no wonder she found it hard to go outside the norm. No matter how she really felt about Blake and Devin. Blake and Devin would do anything to get a second chance with Summer. After all these years they still knew she was the one for them. Convincing her would take some work. Helping her remember how it was between them back then will help. I was kind of with Summer when the big secret came out, I would have had a hard time for forgiving them. Some things are hard to forget even if it wasn't intentional. But I am a sucker for second chance romance. Well written and the flow of the story was steady. I received and arc  in exchange for an honest review.

I could not hate this product more. I normally really like Physicians Formula products, they are the only drugstore brand I've found that really works well and plays nicely with my more expensive products. I was looking for a powder I could dust over my face that would brighten up my skin (I'm almost 40 and this was a long winter, my skin was looking dull and lifeless) whether I was bare faced or over my foundation. I first tried Hourglass Ambient Lighting powders from Sephora and was extremely disappointed, for the price I saw NO difference in my skin... simply nothing at all. So when I saw this pretty compact on a shopping trip I decided to try it, from the description I thought it might give me the soft glow I was looking for.OH MY GOODNESS... ladies as I mentioned I'm about 40, but even when I was in my 20's and intentionally put glitter all over myself to go out dancing I don't think I'd have liked this. I dusted it LIGHTLY all over my face and from about 5' away it looked ok, but any closer and you saw millions of tiny silver glitter specks all over my face, we're not talking shimmer... we're talking actual glitter. It was so awful I had to wash my face. Not one to give up I tried again another day, same result... I tried UNDER my foundation, nope those dang glitter specks showed through. I suppose I'll use this on my chest/arms maybe for an evening out, or pass it to my tween to play with at home. It's that bad.On the plus side I didn't give up, I read more reviews and several mentioned the Physicians Formula Mineral Glow Pearls, I purchased the Beige Pearl here on Amazon (great price) and it's everything I wanted and more. It's absolutely perfect and gives a healthy glow without glitter. Go check it out but say away from this one unless glitter all over your face is what you're going for, in which case this product will not disappoint.

I'm snuggling up to 40 and my skin was looking dull and a bit sad after a long dark winter. I was looking for a powder with a bit of magic (ok shimmer) that I could apply quickly to my bare face to look a bit more alive, or put over my foundation for an even more finished but awake look. I watched 101 videos online and read lots of reviews and actually ordered the Hourglass powder with one of my Sephora hauls. I tried it about 5x and every single time I died a bit inside... I couldn't see ANY difference, not a tiny speck of a difference. I wanted it to work so badly but ended up returning it. I've used Physicians Formula products in the past (they are one of the few drugstore brands I really like) so I next tried a gorgeous palette of theirs I saw in the store "multicolored custom bombshell bronzer" I about died again when I tested it at home, my entire face was COVERED in very noticeable silver glitter, I was looking for something that made a difference, but not that big of a difference! I wanted something that gave my face a bit of life and this was like a fairy dusted my face in a very bad way.I almost gave up but saw some references to this powder online. I figured I'd give finding my holy grail product one more chance and ordered it. I tested it as soon as it arrived and WOOHOO, exactly what I was looking for. I purchased it in Beige Pearl and it gives just the right amount of light reflecting soft shimmer but no glitter. It pretty much disappears on my face whether I'm bare faced or have on foundation/blush in that it's not a noticeable color, it just makes my face look brighter and me more awake/lively! I'm considering purchasing one of the darker colors to see if it gives me natural sun kissed look on days I just want to toss on some tinted sunblock and go. If you've been disappointed with other products give this one a try, the price here on Amazon is great too!

I'll openly admit that when I first took this fan out of the box I was feeling like I might have made mistake, while it's really cute (normally I'm not even a fan of red, but it's a pure true candy apple red and quite attractive) and felt pretty solid I also felt like it was crazy small. I've paid less than 1/3 the price for fans bigger than this one in the past. I plugged it in (and was impressed that it has it's own fuse, so if it stops working do check that first) and turned it on.WOW! This little fan puts out some air! I do wish there were more than 2 settings, I feel like a medium speed option would be really great but it's not a deal breaker. The fan is pretty quiet on low (almost too quiet if you're someone like me who likes white noise to sleep) but not too loud on high (and it's a nice sound, some fans produce such an awful sound on high you never want to use them, this isn't like that at all). It puts out a nice amount of air on each setting and even on high in front of it you don't feel like you're being attacked by air, just comfortably cooled.Our house is typical of many these days in that the summer can get unbearably hot upstairs even with the air working well on the main floor. Previously we had the large standing fans in each of our bedrooms, which always made me nervous with our youngest as she frequently knocked it over... this fan is going to her room and I know it'll be perfect to keep her cool and is small enough to fit easily on her dresser top. The grills are great and I have no concerns of her or our cats safety. I think I'm going to suck up the expense and purchase 2 more for our other bedrooms and donate those big standing things :)All in all an excellent fan, and the 5yr warranty makes it even more attractive! Wish they'd come out with a matte black option or steel gray (hint hint Vornado people)

I'm really happy with this EcoTools brush, it's the first I've tried (I've been using a lot of the Real Techniques brushes also sold here on Amazon... which I like so much I've thrown away my old MAC brushes which honestly were never worth the money in the first place)... since I've heard so many great things about this company too I figure I'd try them out.First thing to note is that I was a bit surprised when this brush arrived, the description mentions precise makeup application several times so I thought I was getting a brush I could use for contouring or maybe bold blush application... while I love this brush it wouldn't work for either. This particular brush is really really big... there is no way you're doing anything precise with it in my opinion. It's also VERY soft... it feels heavenly on your face, but again it's much too soft IMO for any contouring or blush (even if you could manage to not apply it to your entire face with this, yes it's that big). It is however WONDERFUL for a final dusting of setting powder, it also works well if you have another sort of finishing powder, or even to apply to your body (something with a big of shimmer maybe along your neck line & arms). I'm looking forward to trying out more of these brushes!

We've been really lucky that our American Bulldog/Boxer mix has never had fleas in his 8yrs. He's 99% an indoor dog and pretty much hates going outside so I'm sure that plays into it. I've used Frontline Plus and K9 Advantix II on him in the past but try to use it sparingly as he has white fur and his skin seems really sensitive. However we moved this past year to a new house that is pretty far out in the country, lots of wild animals & deer wander around our yard and the back of our lot is wooded so I know that fleas & ticks are much more likely to be hanging around here than our previous home (and with indoor kitties I REALLY want to be sure we don't bring in fleas) so I picked this up to use with him, hoping to save a few bucks but still get great treatment.So far so good, he didn't have any sort of skin reaction (I do apply it all along his spine... he's not super flexible in his old age so I don't worry about him licking it and I keep him away from the cats for 24hrs after application to make sure it doesn't get on anything they might lick either) and knock on wood he's still free of fleas & ticks. I'll update this as the season progresses if we see any unwanted critters but so far so good!

I love fall, and yet I despise leaves... at least once they fall to the ground. We don't have all that many of our own trees on our property however there is some weird vortex thing going on with our street and I swear to you the entire streets leaves end up on our lawn (this also happens with snow!) Both neighbors on either side of us will have hardly a single leaf and my lawn will be covered even though our main tree hasn't lost a single one yet... it makes me CRAZY. I'm also however cheap and hate paying a lawn service to clean up... racking is awful. Bagging is horrible. My husband and I would argue about who was going to do it every single year. Then I discovered the original model of this... I ordered one immediately and tried it out as soon as it arrived. I was THRILLED. Sure, it didn't do a great job on wet leaves, and the side zipper was a huge pain in the butt to empty and I almost always got the chopped up leaf gunk all over me but it was still awesome, because I didn't have to rake much (piling up leaves with a quick raking does make it go faster as does loosening any that are maybe damp on the bottom and would otherwise want to stick to the ground) but best part was no arm fulls of dirty buggy leaves to try and bag.When I saw this model with the changes (the main one I cared about was the zipper is now on the bottom of the bag) I grabbed it, only thing better than using one of these is having my husband and I both have one so we can get it down 2x as fast. It hasn't disappointed. It's MUCH easier to empty the bag now (I actually need to see if I can order a 2nd new style bag for our original one) and this model seems to do a better job with damp leaves too.All in all I absolutely love this vac (I really never use it for a blower, we have a lawn service that cuts the grass and I hate when people blow their leaves around, since like I mentioned they always end up on MY lawn) but I'm sure it works great as the vacuum feature is wonderful!Side note, they aren't very heavy, and the strap makes them comfortable to "wear" across your body, they are however really loud so you might want to wear some ear protection & also watch out for sticks/large twigs as they can jam it up.

I'm using this with my Dewalt multi-tool... no problems with it fitting in, fits snug and feels like it locks in as well as the Dewalt blades that came with my tool. I've only used it to undercut door jambs (I'm installing laminate flooring in our house) and it worked as well as the Dewalt, I wouldn't say really any better or worse and as of this review the Dewalt blades are actually less expensive, and if you purchase one of their small kits with a couple blades they come out far more affordable. I don't see myself purchasing this unless there is a big price drop.

I've bitten the bullet and purchased a charger case for each iPhone I've owned, with 2 app & youtube happy kids and being grandfathered into unlimited internet my phone is forever being used, and drained. Typically these cases are a total pain. I keep one in my car or purse for emergency use but never ever just leave it on the phone as they are usually huge/heavy/ugly and make it impossible to charge/sync my iPhone.This case is 100% different from all other battery cases I've owned. It's really easy to get my newest phone in and out, however I find myself leaving it on far more often then I take it off. It's attractive, feels good in my hand, adds some weight to my phone yes, but in a comfortable the phone feels more solid type way. It's finally easy to sync or charge my phone with a battery case, and I LOVE the ridge around the front (why are so many cases missing this? My phone is forever being put down face first and so many cases don't take that into account.Honestly, if you are out and about & frequently have a drained iPhone battery this purchase is a no-brainer!

If you can get your hands on the packaging pictured (the gold zip top bag) GRAB THEM  UP, those are a 5 star product. My cat who gets frequent bladder infections loved them and they were the only thing that helped her (when even antibiotics couldn't). We recently ordered a new package and were surprised to see a packaging change, they now arrive in what looks like a small icecream cup. Immediately I could tell something was different since they are much harder, not at all a "soft chew" like we were used to. I gave one to my cat and she bit at it a bit, looked at me and starting meowing nonstop. She refused to eat it.I checked our new package against the one we had just finished up and was really surprised to see that the ingredients were different. (another reviewer here has uploaded images showing the ingredients so I won't bother retyping them). Needless to say my cat refuses to eat the new ones and I'm wondering what we'll do now :(

I'm THRILLED with this purchase. I've been doing my own gel nails (mostly with Gelish) for over a year now, first using the Gelish branded 6 watt lamp (which lasted me maybe 6 months, so only around 10 uses) then I purchased a twin for it here on Amazon (another little 6 watt) which is still working fine but never seemed to really cure all the way (I'd have a bit of color on the wipe after curing sometimes) so when I saw how affordable this one was, and that I could actually fit my whole hand (seriously, this alone is enough to make it great... I was sick of having to do my thumbs separately from my other 4 fingers) I jumped at the chance to buy it.It arrived yesterday and I used it for the first time. LOVE LOVE LOVE. I used a dark turquoise and had no color transfer at all after curing. I was a bit worried about the beep (I do my nails after my little one is in bed) but it isn't overly loud. The timers worked perfectly and being able to do a whole hand at once, awesome!My nails look great, I have no doubt they are fully cured. I've seen some concern about the lack of mirrors inside however given the number of leds and their placement I don't think mirrors are going to make a difference. If you really wanted them I'd imagine you could get some small ones froma craft store and glue them in there, I opted to get the white lamp assuming it would reflect light the best.... so that's something else that may or may not make a difference vs getting the black version.

I have enjoyed Susan's books for a number of years-I have all of the cookbooks and other books she has written and illustrated.  I like them because they are bright, happy and full of hope and enjoyment of life.  I think we all can use that.  I was not quite sure what the Fairy Tale Girl would bring but I was excited to read about the wonderful woman behind the scenes....I was not disappointed.  She uses her diaries from when she was in her 20's and fleshes out the earlier years full of all the things that you do and then look back and wonder how you ever got through it all and became "mature", whatever that is.....maybe I (and she) still don't know.  She never loses her sense of fun and adventure and is not afraid to pull back the curtain on more painful times in her life and that is why you love the book.  It is like sitting down and listening to a girlfriend.  It is handwritten and illustrated as all her books and I devoured it in a weekend then was very sad that it will be mid next year before I can get the second one....I wish I had made it last a bit longer.Susan is a breath of fresh air and brings a brightness and coziness to her writings that I just want to cuddle up to and enjoy like a present.If you haven't already read her books, grab a cookbook and this first book and become an instant fan!  5 stars all the way!I

We replaced our old feeder with this beautiful red glass feeder.  It is very elegant looking and is easy to fill, bright and pretty.  We have already seen the hummers, who come around quite frequently come and feed at the new feeder.  I'm not quite sure if there is any extra traffic in comparison to the clear glass feeder we had, but they are drinking from it, so I think they like it too!  I would say the only drawback is that because the glass is red that it is a bit harder to tell if the feeder is getting low, but overall, lovely design and a hit with the birds.  We would purchase this item when it is time to replace, which should be a long time as this is also well made.

We hail from Northern California and with 4 years of drought we have had to make "brown the new green".  We tried the Shaker jug granules and did some minimal watering (with a very brief rain thrown in) and were very surprised to see green sprout back up where it was noticeable within a couple weeks....Wow.....we plan to buy some more of this and try it out on the front "lawn" to see if we can get a little boost there too as we wait for the rain to help us along.  This definitely is a help with our drought conditions and makes us feel like we may just have a shot at a lawn again as it is helping a little water go longer.Overall, we are pleased and will be purchasing this item.....

A good sounding  power amp with multiple inputs and a wired remote controlI wanted something to power our high quality (B&W) ceiling mounted kitchen speakers along with the patio speakers that had multiple inputs, Blue Tooth (BT) capability, and a wired remote control. We have a special power supply (takes in 120 VAC and puts out 13.8 VDC) which allows this unit to be used in a home environment (if you look for one if these, make sure they are Underwriters Labs, UL, certified).We found this little amp with all the features we needed and a few extra - there are a pair of RCA inputs - for connecting to a line in from a receiver (or Ipod) and a line out (for connected a separate amp or sub woofer output amp). The wired remote control allows you to switch between the wired RCA inputs and the Wireless Blue Tooth.There is even a USB (5V @ 1amp) charging port - which will charge most phones without any issues. Our Samsung S5's reported the connection to be lower power - but proceeded to charge anyway.It's all about that watts? (sorry, Megan :-(  ). Is is really 125 watt/channel?  um,  Possibly!  - But if it were that much, it would sound like your vacuum cleaner running on hardwood floors! You see, the unit only draws 15 amps (protected by a 15 amp fuse) and runs on 13.8vDC (auto voltage when your engine is charging the battery). That is only a 208 watts total power into the unit. There is always some looses in converting all the power to what we hear in the music. What would you expect to get out of this power amp? The numbers tell the story - 208 watts in probably produces with the Class AB design somewhere in the 20 - 25 watt range with minimal distortion (what is distortion? That is when you turn up the volume so loud is becomes garbled :-(  ). What is it good for ? Lots! This is great amp to have an a truck to power a pair of speakers mounted the shell for the tail gate parties - all control able from your phone. Will this work in a car with 4 speakers - yes ! You can even connect a sub-woofer amp (not included) to this amp (Line Out)  - so you, too, will hear 'All about that BASS'.

Just looking at the picture I knew that I would probably like the top for yoga and hanging out but wasn't sure about the back of the top.  I tried it on, and though I would have preferred a top that was the same front and back, my husband liked the unusual back detail.  The fit is as expected, the sleeves are nice and long with a gather and the top is well fitted, with a perfect scoop neck that is not too low.  The cut is flattering and is fitted.Overall, I do love the shirt, for me I would wear to do yoga/walking etc, but would not wear as a casual shirt because of the back detail....not sure why, but I just wouldn't.  Big marks from my husband.  He loved it.  The one holdback on this one is the price.  Over 50.00 for this shirt is a little on the expensive side, so while I do like the shirt, I would not go out and purchase this at that price.

This necklace is pretty and very light weight.  It has an almost Asian look to it.  I like how dainty and feminine it looks.  I have gotten a couple necklaces from the collection and after wearing them would have to say I always love the pendant piece but am not super-jazzed with the chain.  It looks so much prettier with a chain of a little higher quality that also doesn't tangle quite so easy.  Overall, a good value, and a fun way to dress up your look, just wished they supplied a different chain, the higher price for a better quality chain would be justified in my opinion.

I am a fan of chocolate....an all around, equal opportunity chocolate lover, dark, milk, white....love 'em all.  With that said it was a no-brainer to try this milk chocolate with hazelnut bar from Switzerland.  YES PLEASE!  The milk chocolate is melt in your mouth smooth and I was very impressed that they did not skimp on the hazelnuts.  Chock full.  A LOT of nuts in this bar!  We had pieces of the bar with a little red wine...ah, love at first bite!  My husband is pretty much a dark chocolate guy but he had several squares, so I guess I can't sit in the corner and eat this alone....damnit.....Overall, a big hit in our house!  We often buy bars like these, mostly Lindt or Ghirardelli and this is on par with those brands.  A delicious bar and I would definitely buy and try different varieties.Indulge!  You only live once :)

What a great find this book is!  My husband especially loves the old west and he was fascinated by this book and was excited to have it as a reference book.  Filled with pictures and timelines and those historical figures that shaped the old west it is a treasure trove of information.The book has an intro covering the Louisiana purchase and then goes to Westward Expansion from 1803-1846, The Mexican War and Gold Rush 1846-1861, Preserving the Union and Spanning the Continent 1861-1869, War for the Plains 1870-1879,Law and Disorder 1880-1889 and the Last Frontiers 1890-1912.  Though perfect to just thumb through, I plan to read up and learn (or should I say re-learn) about the old west.  This book really hits it out of the park-beautifully done.  I know that we will be enjoying this book for years to come!  Definitely a must have for those fans of the old west and history!

My husband rarely wears a fragrance, but I kind of liked when he used to have a little something on when we had a night out, so we gave the Burberry Brit Rhythm a try.  I don't know what exactly makes this a young or edgy fragrance, I think it is just a nice smell.  I read what it was supposed to smell like and really couldn't say it smelled like one note overtook the rest or that it had a strong scent of one particular thing.  It smelled a little like wood/cedar to me and I thought it was a nice blend.  It was not too heavy-handed on the fragrance and tended to stay on when he wore it.  Overall, I think it is nice and would love to have him wear it occasionally.  He thought it smelled good, though it didn't seem like a real "wow" factor for him.  Nice packaging, good fragrance and stayed on.  May purchase again, depending on whether he gravitates to wearing it more often.

I really wanted to like this book.  I'm a long time fan of Karin Slaughters books and have read them all, but I didn't enjoy the book.  The level of violence in this book to me was way over the top, and I read mostly thrillers.  The writing was good, but after I finished the novel I found myself with images in my head that I would have preferred not to have there.  The book centers around a family where the oldest daughter goes missing and the aftermath of the family that is left behind.  Other girls also go missing and are about the same age with the same basic look.  Let's just say there are ties and that all that you see with the family is not quite as it seems.For me I was a bit sickened by the torture and the psychopath behind the torture, etc.I was more than happy when the book ended, and though it was a satisfying (as much as it could be) ending I walked away from the book wondering if I had missed something, since the book had so much praise.I would say if you don't want to read about torture or have a weak stomach you should pass this up.  I am a fan, and will read her books again, especially in the Grant County series, but I honestly wished I had passed this one up.  I'm thankful I checked it out at the library and didn't actually pay for it.

With these being an XL size I thought these were perfect my husband who does a lot of wood working and related garage projects.  I actually tried these as well to see how they would work for doing dishes.  A little big on me, but gripped a dish quite nicely and were heavier than I had expected.  Definitely not flimsy or the kind of glove that you would think would be single use.  My husband really liked them as well and said the nubbies for gripping are excellent and much better than his box of single use gloves.  Overall, a good glove that you could use for many uses and really something everyone should have for their home.  Good product, good value and would definitely recommend.

This pack includes 4 treatments-4 each of the gels for the smile lines and 4 for the forehead.  I would say it was kind of fun to try them and I liked the cool gel on my face but don't really know that they visibly did much of anything.  I think my forehead looked a little less furrowed, but I couldn't tell any difference on smile lines.  Overall, I liked the way they felt, but to purchase them because they really plumped up lines, eh, not so much.  I will say hydration of any sort though seems to do a little something, even if it is just getting in extra water so you don't look like the crypt keeper.  For me, I will finish the box but I wouldn't feel compelled to recommend or purchase.

This is a lovely watch.  Now a couple things....if you are just looking at the picture it is difficult to really picture the face on this-it is large/oversized.  I like it a lot when I wear something dressy and I love the mother of pearl face.  Very pretty and feminine.  The watchband has an easy release and it is very easy to put on by clasping one side and then the other.  My one disappointment was how seemingly huge this was as delivered.  You will invariably find yourself at the mall or watch repair shop to have links taken out.  I read a review where someone had three taken out and I thought it totally didn't apply to me.  I am not waif-like in the least and my wrist is just under 6".  I had to have 2 links taken out and it ran me about $20.00.  I felt that wasn't much to pay but if you shell full price for the watch and then find yourself adding another 20.00 to the tab you might be unhappy, so I'm just disclosing that piece if your wrist may be a similar size.  I wear mine snug with just a tad bit of room and two links was perfect.  I love the quality and the look and that it is different than my more dainty everyday watch.  It is a nice switch up.  The face is easy to read and has a pink second hand which could come in handy.Overall, very pleased with the watch and extremely pleased once I had the watch correctly sized.  I might have liked this a tad bit more with a different band, but I do really like it and it would make a very nice gift, coming in a beautiful box and well secured with it's own little pillow to make sure it makes the trip to the recipient unscathed.

I have read quite a few books in the last few years about happiness and what Christine Carter calls "finding the sweet spot", that point where you feel that you are functioning at a peak level and you are happy.  I feel like her book resounded with me because she seems to struggle with the same thing we all do.  Finding time, finding energy and figuring out how to find that happy balance.  Don't get me wrong, this is not ground breaking information, but it is highly usable information, that sometimes you forget when you are in a rush in your hustle and bustle of life.  I disagree with some of the comments that this is just focused towards people who have kids or who work at a job where they don't have the luxury of taking more breaks, it is about being present.  She gives a wealth of ideas and some of them will be for you and some won't work in your situation.  No book can cover it all and be relevant for everyone.  I'd love to be able to take a 10 minute break every 90 minutes or so, but it isn't really feasible with my job, but I can work on more taxing things for a stretch and do something that is a little lighter on the brain power for a little while or go to another department to handle business in person instead of emailing.  I can adapt the information to what I CAN do.  I may not have time for "recess" but I do have to eat lunch and I can tack on 10 minutes to meditate (I tried the app she uses: Headspace and love it!...).  I can set up more things as a habit so I don't have to use a lot of brain power on menial things and use my brain when I really need it.  I can work at being kinder and more patient.  I felt that this book had a lot of great ideas.  I actually read a library copy and I convinced my husband to buy a kindle copy because I think it is a book you can use by someone who has also struggled to "find the sweet spot".I also loved her humor, energy and honesty in her writing.  To me she was very easy to relate to.Overall, I thought this was a very good book and I have already recommended to a few people.  I think with any book of this type you will maybe not be able to adopt all of the practices in every circumstance, but you will find those that ring true for you and for those gems this book was a worthwhile read for me.

This 7/16" drive is needed for industrial applications where drilling into concrete could require twisting that could require in excess of 300 ft. lbs.  I was able to test this on one half horse power drill and it performed without any issues.  It is made of good quality materials and designed for heavy duty/industrial use.  This will not fit your standard 1/4" drive home drill driver systems.

On the whole these bags are pretty good.  I normally do use a brand that is comparable made by Glad.  I think with these bags you don't have quite the amount of fragrance, but it is sufficient to not have that garbage smell.  I did notice though that the top of the bag tended to slip more than the other brand.  It just didn't grip the can as well.  The tie is good so that you can cinch up and tie it off.Overall, I don't think I will switch my brand, but I would buy these if they didn't have the other brand available.

I've decorated with tips before but this was my first try with using the recipe to make royal icing, which seemed to come out a little wetter than expected which I attribute to my newbiehood in this area.  The plain writing/outlining tip worked well, but I will need to play with the consistency a little for the star tips, etc.  So, my next go around will be with the buttercream icing instead of doing the royal icing for cookies.  I did love the ease of using the bottles, which I thought was easier than a pastry bag which always seems a little messy for me and clean up was a breeze as the bottles can be flipped inside out and are supposedly fine to put in the dishwasher, though I decided to hand wash.  You get two bottles, the couplers, and six assorted tips.  I really like the idea of these and it will be fun to work on perfecting my technique but the hubby is willing to help me eat any of the mistakes, so its all good.  With a little practice I should be making fantastic cupcakes by spring!Overall, great idea, compact set and a good value.

Every year when I buy or am given a diary or travel journal I wish that that someone would get wise and put a pocket in the journal for all of my small treasures that I want to keep safe, ie: ticket stubs, pressed flowers, little notes, and other scraps of life.  These little pockets are amazing.  I have put them in my every day journal and my travel journal and never again will be coveting a diary with that detail.  These are sturdy plastic with a closure that keeps everything safe and there is room to right on the front of the pouch.  The possibilities are endless.  I plan to keep a couple of these on hand so I can keep all my mini-treasures safe and secure with my journals.  Wish I had known about these sooner!Overall, no complaints and will definitely purchase this item again!  Perfect size and excellent quality!

So, there a couple reasons why I decided to try this roller.  I like a nice massage to my back muscles after sitting in my cubicle all day and my husband has tight hamstrings and also has a desk job.  I found in trying the small pamphlet of exercises that was included in the roller that this is an item that you have to gear to what you need/want.  The roller is medium intensity on the muscles, it might be a little too intense for some.  You do have to be semi-coordinated in order to me laying on the roller for the back rolling so this also might not be for everyone.  My dad tried it out as he had shoulder surgery years ago and does exercises to keep his shoulders supple and used the roller up and down the wall for mobility and thought it was great.  I liked it for my back a lot, but not probably as much as sitting in my chair with the shiatsu roller going up and down my back.  Overall, the number of reps that are suggested are just that, a suggestion.  You should use this item carefully and stop when you feel you have done enough.Would I buy it?  I don't know that I feel it is an absolute must have, but it is a nice tool to help massage out those points that tend to hold tension and if you aren't lucky enough to have a massage cushion for a chair and you don't mind doing a little work, this may be just the ticket.

My husband receive this backpack as a gift from me at Christmas and I hit it on the nail with this versatile and well made backpack of canvas and leather.  Lots of pockets for phones, train/transit passes, wallet and enough space for laptop or kindle.  Manyly enough for a guy and not too masculine for a woman.  I don't remember hearing so many compliments on recent purchases but my husband really loves this pack and it looks great on him as he hits the train for work.Overall, great for student or 9 to 5'er.  Sylish, well made and built to last!

I always look forward to the Rizzoli & Isles books, they always have tight plot lines and I love to revisit the characters.  This one was good but was not as good as some of her previous novels.  I didn't feel like it was quite as tense and edge of your seat as usual, but it was still a good read.This book starts off on a bush safari in Botswana that goes horribly awry, with the vacationers apparently being hunted and killed.  As they are slowly picked off the members of the group start to doubt that their trusty guide Johnny may be the culprit and they are unsure where to turn and to whom they can trust.  The secondary story fast forwards about six years where a semi-famous game hunter is found gutted and hanging upside down as a kill.  As the story unfolds there are similarities and coincidences that intersect between the two stories and you realize that some of these characters may not be who you think they are.I wasn't quite as taken with the story line and it take me a little longer to read than normal just because I thought it was a good story but not one I couldn't put down.  As always though, she does write a good novel and for those that love the characters it is nice to revisit them once again.This book is a series, so I do not recommend jumping in if you haven't already read previous books, but for fans of the series it is a pretty good addition to the series even if it isn't maybe the best in the series.

This is not necessarily a movie for everyone.  Let me explain the premise....April lives in a small NY apartment and is the black sheep of the family.  She and her boyfriend are hosting Thanksgiving for the first time and what might be her mom's last Thanksgiving as she has cancer.  I know, sounds like a downer and not a comedy, right?  Well, depends on your perspective.  When this came out we had started to deal with my mom's cancer and mom watched it with me and we could definitely relate to the mom's wicked sense of humor and not wanting to be handled like a breakable object.  She even stops the car at one point to advise the family that they will all have to come to grips with how they will deal with....(see everyone's grief stricken faces).....April's lack of cooking skills and how they will hide and get rid of the food.....Meanwhile back at April's apartment her boyfriend, Bobby has gone out to do some errands and she finds that she does not have a working oven so she roams the hallways with her turkey trying to find someone that will let her cook the turkey in their oven.  She obviously knows no one in the building, so it is hilarious as she goes from the family that can't speak English, a Vegan that says she wants to speak with her alone)....so April leaves the turkey on the floor in it's pan.... and the African American couple who open their home for a brief time and school her in the evils of canned cranberry sauce.I disagree that there isn't humor, the movie has many funny moments but some humor is a little on the dark side.  It is about trying to reconcile, living in the moment and dealing with the cards that life deals you.  After mom and I first watched this it became our quirky tradition to watch around Thanksgiving most years.  I still love it!Overall, not for everyone, but definitely had great acting, lots of humor and a heartfelt story line, but if you are looking for a laugh a minute and light hearted fun, this would definitely not be for you.

Ok, these are a little different....they are little squares of fruit and nut, about the size of a small crouton, so I could see these marketed for salads.  Not sure, I might use them in a salad...  They are also good out of the bag just for a little snack.  I think I might like these not in the square shape, maybe as just small clusters or something, but as far as the taste, they are a nice balance of fruit and nut. I doubt I'd eat on fruit but maybe I'd mix into yogurt or have with ice cream if I got the strawberry flavor.Overall, a nice taste, but I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to purchase for a salad, etc.

I'll be honest....I don't know if I saw these in the store if I would have tried them.  Sweet and spicy bars with a bunch of nuts....eh, not so much.  I was, however a bit intrigued and somehow thought I should give them a try.  I was surprised that I liked them, but I did.  They have a sweet/spicy flavor that is akin to bbq sauce and are full of peanuts, almonds, pumpkin seeds, raisins and coconut.  The spice comes from ground chipotle chile, so they have a nice smoky flavor.  This bar is non-gmo, gluten free, soy free and dairy free, for those that need to know.These bars I definitely would buy again, they are flavorful, nutty, chewy and delicious.  One bar is 160 calories with 80 calories from fat and 2 g of saturated fat.  There are 8 g of sugar and 3 g of fiber.  Calcium comes in at 2% with 4% Iron.If you need a snack you don't have to feel too bad about, with good fat from nuts and a yummy bbq flavor, this may be the ticket.Overall, my husband and I both enjoyed these and would purchase again.

This is probably not my 1st choice for a novel to listen on audio since I usually gravitate toward mysteries and thrillers, but I was at the end of my book when this became available and I thought I'd give it a listen.  I'm so glad that I did!!!  What a well written and interesting book!The book starts with an old woman that is moving from her Oregon Coast home to an assisted living center.  She is suffering from terminal cancer and goes through the story of her life from the time she was growing up in a small town in France after the death of her mother through world war 2 and what happens to her and her family during the occupation.The book centers around Viann and Isabel, who come of age during world war 2 and the German occupation.  Viann is a young wife with a small daughter whose husband is called to war.  She is the responsible daughter who tries to do the right thing and play by the rules, unlike her sister, Isabel who has gotten kicked out of every school and convent that she attends and feels rules are made to be broken.The war takes them in very different directions as Viann's house is taken over by a Nazi soldier and Isabel becomes an aid in the Resistance.The book occasionally peeks back to the present day, but basically is the story of the two sisters and their family and friends during the occupation.I found there were lots of twists and the last several disks really kept the plot moving.  I was moved and very satisfied with the book.  It was not necessarily an upbeat story, but a story about survival and the ties we have with our family and friends and what we do to survive.What a satisfying book this was.  I was actually sorry to see it end and found myself listening much longer than I usually will with a book on disk.  Also I must add that Polly Stone the reader is excellent and really gives the story a voice (literally and figuratively).Overall, a very good book, well told and moving.  I would definitely recommend and will also be seeking out more books from this author to see if I chance upon another gem like this one.

My hubby and I were excited to try these bars and are now wondering if there is a way to show less than a star in the review.First the pros:  Lovely wrapper.....(yeah, that's all we could come up with).Cons:  This is the oddest bar we have ever tried.  It had a very weird consistency like a bar made of 10 lbs of playdough dyed an unbecoming color that looks like it could have come from....well, lets not get gross here....it was an unbecoming color that you would expect from someone eating something unpleasant....nuff said.The taste-I have not seen my husband make this face before and I was afraid it would stick that way.  He almost wiped his tongue off with his hands rapidly to get the taste off.  I am sure I mirrored this as I felt the same.  It looked like taffy, tasted like peanut butter and playdough and had a weird after taste that I can't seem to pinpoint (nor do I want to).I understand that these bars are "the bar" of Tough Mudder-an endurance race for crazy-fit people.  Good for them for being able to stomach these.....Overall, NOOOOOOOO!  Would not purchase these even for my husband who is one who has done cross-fit and eats right.  These had no redeeming value for us....

This clamp takes a little time to get used to as it requires a little closer tolerance to engage the clamping mechanism than a standard clamp does.  Think of this little baby as a cross between a traditional clamp and a vise grip....in that once you are able to get it close to clamping, you can squeeze the vise grip to lock it down.  You can adjust the clamping  pressure with the small adjustment knob on the inside of the tool.  All and all a very solid tool, good materials and easy to use.  A handy addition to the handyperson's tool chest.

Here is the review on what we like to call the Handyman's Toy bag....(this review is from my hubby that is actually using these tools to help redesign our bathroom),  this man knows his tools....(just sayin').....And here is the review.....The Power Saw:A great saw with the right balance between power and weight for most field jobs.My tests were done with the mid range battery pack, the 2 amp hr. The balance with this pack installed was a good fit for guiding the saw through the material. I tested it with few old first generation growth fir 2x4's with the stock blade. Next it was on to some plywood, 3/4" cabinet grade - about 10'. The stock blade tracked the guide line with out a lot of correction - I will probably switch out the blade for a cabinet grade 40 tooth version to reduce tear-out on higher quality woods. The safety lock and the blade brake make this a excellent saw for all around work. Lets face it, we all get tired and work past our point of safety ("The one last cut rule") and having these features will probably save some fingers and thighs. It is a great complement to a 1800 watt electric saw, when there is no power around or you just don't want to dig out the extension cord.The Impact driver:Why do you need an impact driver? Think of it like putting all your muscle into just keeping the screw going into the wood - without it bouncing out and damaging the wall.
