This is skillfully done.  I think my problem stems from the fact that I work in a building full of lawyers and don't enjoy being reminded of their presence.  A group of these stories together has a similar effect.  I believe I would enjoy them more if they were spaced across several anthologies along with stories from other authors.  (I have a similar reaction to Robert Reed's Greatship stories--best taken in moderation.)The stories in the last two sections had a different effect.  They convinced me that the author writes with greater sensitivity and nuance than evidenced by The Law stories.  My three favorites are from these sections.  I'll say a little about each:"The Orpheus Fountain" is a moving exploration of what it means to be close to someone.  It is hard to believe the author's claim that it began as a response to a writing exercise.  If you have ever lost someone you love, or lost the love of someone, it will touch you.  It belongs in one of the Best of the Year collections.In "Hear the Enemy, My Daughter" the main character strives to understand an alien race which is at war with humans.  Key to understanding the alien Sheshash is puzzling out the relationship between their two-member fighting pairs.  One is a three-meter giant and the other is a half-meter dwarf.  They fight with incredible coordination and recklessness.  Understanding is possible, but comes at a cost."Tenure Track" is another story constructed out of documents.  Although I grew a little weary of this format while reading The Law stories, it really works here.  A set of letters and receipts traces the lives of a husband and wife.  One receives a medical treatment to greatly prolong life.  The other is unable to benefit from the effects of the treatment.  And their lives go on.I enjoyed this collection, in spite of my original impression.  I suspect that attorneys or attorney aficionados will enjoy it more.  The later stories should be accessible to and appreciated by a wider audience.  And, of course, "The Orpheus Fountain" is a gem._____*Disclosure:  The publisher offered me a free Kindle version of the book with the understanding that I would write a review after reading it.  There was no attempt to sway my opinion or request that my review be favorable.  I have no other connection with the publisher or the author.  My opinion is my own.

This brief guide to XML is part of WAGmob's series of Simple `n Easy guides on technology-related topics.  They offer "on-the-go references that enable our customers to refer, learn and remember."  They also promise to respond to all customer emails within 48 hours and use feedback to update their books within 60 days.  Ambitious.This guide taught me the basics of XML, confirming a lot that I already knew and clearing up a couple of misconceptions.  So it was worth the low price and the short read time.  The book was reasonably organized, unevenly written, and overused a small set of examples of XML code.  It is suitable as a quick overview of XML for someone who already knows HTML.  It would not work for someone who did not have this background.If you need a solid introduction, I'd still recommend XML For Dummies or a similar introductory book that helps the reader with more explanation.

W. Craig Reed presents a series of linked stories from the experiences of submariners (including himself and his father) who served in the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union.  Some of these accounts are told for the first time because participants have been released from their long-term commitments to keep them secret.  Others are made possible because of declassified records made available by security personnel from the former Soviet Union.The book's stories include:- How American technicians invented new technology to locate Soviet subs after their adversaries switched to "burst" radio transmissions.- How close some sub commanders came to launching torpedoes at enemy ships during the Cuban missile crisis--and starting a war between the superpowers.- The role that a military family's pet bear played in advancing submarine detection technology.- How a U.S. sub installed and maintained a tap on an underwater Soviet military communications cable.- The Soviet espionage that allowed decryption of U.S. communication codes.The book achieves a balance between technical detail and good storytelling.  Readers are taught enough about sonar, radar, and other technologies to understand the relative advantages of U.S. and Soviet systems at different stages of the Cold War.  Reconstructed dialogue produces a sense of in-the-moment urgency in encounters between ships and subs from opposing navies.  The author is careful to distinguish fact from speculation when investigating the final hours of several subs that did not return from their missions.Reed's book is informative, entertaining, and intriguing.  Anyone who enjoys a good military or espionage thriller should find it rewarding.  Of course, it will be particularly rewarding to those who like sub stories, such as Tom Clancy's The Hunt for Red October and sub histories, such as Peter Padfield's War Beneath The Sea.

There's been such a fuss about the iPad mini cover ever since it was released.  The magnetic latch that snaps so easily into place is very cool, as is the feature that activates/deactivates the iPad mini whenever the cover is opened or closed.  And the cover folds nicely into a stand for those who use their iPad minis in landscape orientation.  But there was nothing for people like myself who like to use them in portrait orientation.Until I found this case.  It fits easily onto the iPad mini and I can finally use it on my desk at almost any angle.  The multi-position stand mounted on the rotating platform on the back of the case creates lots of angles to choose from, in both portrait and landscape orientations.  And the case is sufficiently stable that clicking, typing, and general poking on the screen doesn't jar it.  Oh, and you can fit the original, award-winning iPad mini cover on along with this case.  The best of both worlds.The only--very minor--drawback is a slight tendency for part of the rubber border around the edges to slip off.  But this only happens to small sections of it.  Not enough for the case to come off.If you have an iPhone 5 check out the ZeroChroma case for the iPhone 5, which is pretty much the same thing, only smaller.  Both cases are a little much, buckwise.  But they are worth it.

I've always wanted to set my iPhone on my desk at an angle and have it stay there.  The naked iPhone is too slippery to just lean against something.  It always slip-slides back to its fully prone position.  I finally settled for getting a leather case with some traction to it.  But I still couldn't get the iPhone at the right angle most of the time.Then I bought this one.  I can finally use the iPhone on my desk at almost any angle.  The multi-position stand mounted on the rotating platform on the back of the case creates lots of angles to choose from, in both portrait and landscape orientations.  And the case is sufficiently stable that clicking, typing, and general poking on the screen doesn't jar it.  So I can stop grumbling about the angle issue.  One less thing.If you have an iPad check out ZeroChroma's Case for the iPad 2, which is pretty much the same thing, only bigger.  There is also a case for the iPad mini.  All three cases are a little much, buckwise.  But they are worth it.

Author Ben Shapiro thinks that Liberals fight dirty.  "Calling you a racist and sexist, a bigot and a homophobe, gives them a sense of satisfaction with their status in the universe.  The left no longer makes arguments about policies' effectiveness.  Their only argument is character assassination."Shapiro suggests that Conservatives fight back using similar tactics.  The "eleven rules for debating a leftist" he advocates are:1.  Walk toward the fire.2. Hit first.3. Frame your opponent.4. Frame the debate.5. Spot inconsistencies in the Left's arguments.6. Force Leftists to answer questions.7. Do not get distracted.8. You don't have to defend people on your side.9. If you don't know something, admit it.10. Let the other side have meaningless victories.11. Body language matters.Most of Shapiro's suggested tactics match the assumption that "debating the Left" involves battling a hostile and malicious opponent.  But not all.  Some are also appropriate to sincere debate about the issues.Readers should repeatedly evaluate the nature of the specific discussion they are engaged in and take the highest road that seems appropriate.  The suggested approach may well be appropriate for a public confrontation with an unpleasant and scheming Piers Morgan.  It shouldn't be a starting point in a friendly car pool conversation.  It's important to remember the difference.

This book is a partial biography of Edward Forbes Smiley III, a collector, forger, and thief of rare maps.  Smiley originally met with author Michael Blanding and agreed to tell his story.  Once interviews began, Smiley backed away from the project.  The author warned him that the work had gone too far to be abandoned and that the book would be finished with or without his assistance.  Smiley disappeared and refused to meet with the author again.And the book was finished.  It tells a somewhat distanced tale of Smiley's legitimate work building collections of historically significant maps.  And it reconstructs his shadier enterprises.  Along the way, readers learn about various maps and mapmakers, both famous and obscure.  The narrative is a painless combination of modern crime thriller and excerpts from the historical record.Although pleasant reading, the account suffers noticeably from Smiley's decision to withdraw from collaboration with the author.  Speculations about his reasons for doing so and his unconfirmed criminal activities lack the credibility and descriptive detail Smiley would have supplied.  Expansion of the historical information is a reasonable filler strategy, but also feels like one.  The result feels like the product of an author making the best of a bad situation.Your mileage may vary.

Michael Flynn's science fiction novel has three primary subplots.  The first is based on Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine, a nineteenth-century design for a mechanical computer which was never built.  In this story, the engine was built and allowed development of modern programming methods a century earlier.  The second subplot derives from the fact that the developers of this steampunk computer keep its existence secret.  This group develops the science of cliology (much like Hari Seldon's psychohistory), which enables them to make accurate predictions about future trends and events.  They use this capability to influence social and political developments, and, of course, to make profitable business investments.The third and primary subplot begins in the present when Sara Beaumont discovers, first a hidden cache of Babbage computers, then a collection and research records written by cliologists.  Soon afterward the friends she confided in are killed, a faction of the secret society makes contact with her, and she goes into hiding under a false identity.  It becomes apparent that there are several hidden groups observing and manipulating world events, each with competing agendas.  Sara must decide who to trust and what to believe.There are innovative ideas in this book, particularly considering how long ago it was written.  While the narrative is fast-paced and entertaining, the story falls short of its full potential.  I understand that there is not real science behind most of the invented technologies of science fiction.  But part of the genre's appeal is a certain amount of well-executed hand-waving about how it all works that stays just within the bounds of plausibility.  This story would have been better with more invented information about Babbage computers and about the strengths and limitations of cliological prediction.  It seems almost wasteful to introduce both ideas, and then devote most of the attention to the efforts of various secret groups to exterminate each other.That said, the book was enjoyable and worth reading.  However, it will be more to those who enjoy action thrillers than it will to fans of hard science fiction.

John Olsson is one of the world's top forensic linguists.  He has testified in more than 500 court cases, published numerous research studies, and co-authored (with June Luchjenbroers) one of the field's leading textbooks, Forensic Linguistics.  In this book he teaches readers about forensic linguistics using the case study method.Each of the twenty-three chapters describes a case the author has contributed to as a forensic linguist.  He has selected each one to illustrate particular aspects of his work.  "My aim is not primarily to tell a good story, but to illustrate how interesting and complex language is, and how powerful a resource it can be when it enters the arena of the law."  All of the cases are worth reading.  These three are reasonably representative:Chapter 4, "Is The Da Vinci Code a Plagiarism?" examines an accusation that Dan Brown "borrowed without permission" major plot elements of his bestseller from another writer's book.  Olsson addresses this question by examining the order in which the plot elements occur in each book.  He also looks at instances where both authors made the same unusual or erroneous word choices.  Olsson reports the legal outcome and invites readers to form their own conclusions.In Chapter 8, "Murder or Suicide," Olsson is hired by the family of a young man who has apparently committed suicide and left a suicide note for his family.  Suspicious circumstances lead his family suspect the man was murdered and the note forged by the killer.  In reaching his conclusions, Olsson considers both characteristic features of the young man's writing and the tone and content typical of authentic suicide notes.Chapter 20, "Return to Sender," occurs in the context of a woman's claim that she was sexually assaulted by her psychotherapist.  As this trial approached the city's Social Welfare Division received an anonymous letter asserting that the woman suffered from several specific psychological disorders and was unfit to care for her children.  Olsson's analysis addressed the scarcity of psychology terminology in everyday language and included a word choice comparison between the letter and the therapist's patient notes.Each chapter tells an engaging story and showcases at least one linguistic analysis technique.  Good reading, a good introduction to the forensic linguistics specialty, and a well-crafted invitation to learn more from the author's weighty text.  Nicely done, Dr. Olsson!

This trendy little item fits over the front cover of a pocket-sized (3.5" x 5.5") Moleskine Classic Notebook, secured firmly by its own elastic band.  It holds a pen ready to hand, ensuring that your writing stick of choice can be deployed quickly when a worthy idea appears and is in need of preservation.This pen quiver has changed my life.  I used to just clip my pen on the right side of the front cover.  This allowed me to look the notebook's elastic band over the pen and hold the note book more securely closed.  Now the pen is in the quiver and the elastic band slips off occasionally.  And the notebook flips open, spilling contents and exposing pages to the weather.  Also, the bulky quiver now keeps the front cover of the notebook from lying flat, making it difficult to write in the notebook about half of the time.  On top of this, the quiver is overpriced and unattractive.Nevertheless, I love the quiver and plan to buy a second one.  It is stylish as hell.  I like having my pen right there for all to see with enough room for a backup pen, laser pointer, Slim Jim, or small lethargic snake.  I can impress my acquaintances endlessly with my good taste and comfortable level of disposable income.  I am boundlessly grateful to the Native American yuppies that invented the pen quiver and shared it with the world.  Imagine our cultural discomfort if we had to make do with an embarrassingly-Eurocentric pen holster instead.

This collection is the second volume of science fiction stories collected by Harlan Ellison.  He intends them to represent the creative and unrestrained voices that were emerging in the genre at that time.  The first volume is Dangerous Visions; a planned third volume was never published.Here are five of the forty that I liked a little more than the rest:Ursula Le Guin's "The Word for World is Forest" is the novella version of the subsequently published novel The Word for World is Forest.  Heavily influenced by the author's view of the Vietnam War, the story chronicles human colonization of the planet Athshe and their exploitation of its native sentient species.  Initially passive, the natives eventual decide they have had enough.Joanna  Russ's "When It Changed" takes place on the planet Whileaway where there have been no men for centuries.  When male astronauts from Earth reestablish contact with this lost colony, it is clear that contact with men will impact the planet's culture and values.  Not everyone is pleased at the prospect.Chad Olliver's "King of the Hill" begins in the near future on an Earth expiring in a swamp of pollutants.  Sam looks around him for some way to use his great wealth to make this dying place a little better.  He sees no hope.  So he turns his attention to who will inherit when he is gone.Piers Anthony's "In the Barn" is built around the existence of parallel realities, each with its own Earth, solar system, stars, etc.  Some realities differ greatly from ours, some differ only slightly.  Hitch is an investigator who travels between realities to evaluate differences from our own and the advisability of official contact.  In his latest investigation he makes a close contact within Reality #772's dairy industry and learns the importance of proper breeding.Ben Bova's "Zero Gee" is a roommate story.  Chet, Jill, and Linda spend a few days in a space station on a mission for the U.S. Air Force.  There isn't a lot of privacy.  And sometimes three really is a crowd.  `Nuff said.And there is even some interesting poetry by Ray Bradbury.  There are some good stories here.  Most do not have that frantic, trying-too-hard-to-shock feel that was too much present in the first volume.  Perhaps the nearly ten years that passed between the two publication dates had something to do with it.  The new voices were starting to become the voices we were used to.  Whatever the reason, the result is a better collection of stories.  Enjoy!

Harlan Ellison collected these thirty-two stories to familiarize readers with the "new" voice in 1960's science fiction which broke taboos, flouted conventions, and challenged assumptions.  He solicited stories which had something to say.  "Each story is almost obstinately entertaining.  But each one is filled with ideas as well.  Not merely run-of-the-pulps ideas you've read a hundred times before, but fresh and daring ideas."Here are seven that seemed a little better than the others:- Frederik Pohl's "The Day After the Day the Martians Came" - When the Martians arrive there is worldwide excitement.  Then the wonder wears off and everybody starts talking about them.- Miriam deFord's "The Malley System" - A new method of punishing violent criminals reduces the recidivism rate dramatically.  But not the rehabilitation rate.- Larry Niven's "The Jigsaw Man" - In the future there is strong public support for an organ donation program integrated with the driving licensing process.  What possible harm?- James Cross's "The Doll-House" - This is more of a three-wishes-from-a-genie fantasy story than it is science fiction.  The moral:  Treat your genie well.- John Brunner's "Judas" - This story reenacts an important New Testament lesson.- Norman Spinrad's "Carcinoma Angels" - A man who has achieved everything is diagnosed with cancer.  He fights and wins his last battle.  Alone.- Samuel Delany's "Aye, and Gomorrah..." - Explores relationships between asexual Spacers, who are neutered before puberty, and frelk, who are attracted to them.This anthology and its second volume, Again, Dangerous Visions, are important landmarks in science fiction history and contain some innovative and provocative ideas.  There is a noticeable, but not off-putting air of adolescence about the way many of the stories jump in the reader's face.  You can get a feel for this from two of the shorter stories.  Henry Slesar's "Ersatz" delivers a sexual shock (to 1960's sensibilities) without having much else to say.  Damon Knight's "Shall the Dust Praise Thee?" makes similar gratuitous use of a religious topic.  It's a sixties thing.Nevertheless, there are some good stories that are worth reading.

This is another Robert Heinlein book for young people written during the 1950s.  It mixes the excitement of space exploration with the closeness and competitiveness of identical twins.  It fits into Heinlein's Future History series, but does not require familiarity with any of the other stories.Tom and Pat are identical twin teenagers who have always been close.  In fact, they discover they have been communicating telepathically without realizing it since early childhood.  This ability they share with some other pairs of identical twins turns out to be valuable to space exploration.  Before long, Tom is headed for the stars in a torch ship while Pat remains behind.  Their telepathic link allows real-time communication between Earth and explorers remote from our solar system.After Tom and Pat part, the story develops along two lines.  Tom reports on expeditionary life, with challenges ranging from petty shipboard disagreements to contacting new and dangerous alien species.  Readers also follow the relationship between Tom and Pat, who is aging at a must faster rate due to the effects of relativity.  Things become more interesting as Tom.develops a telepathic link and close relationship, with one of Pat's female descendants.  These two story lines eventually converge.Although written as a Heinlein juvenile, this story contains themes also interesting to adults.  It is worth reading and adding to your collection. Enjoy!

Lawrence Smith is an unknown, untalented actor who gets a lucky break.  He looks just like a prominent politician and is offered a job to pose as his look-a-like while the politician is off on a secret errand.  Initially reluctant, Smith is pressed into service by a crisis.  And then he becomes trapped in the role indefinitely.The twin-of-somebody-famous plot is as old as The Man in the Iron Mask and has been explored by practically every television sitcom at some point.  Robert Heinlein pulls it off reasonably well.  The book explores the limits of what people actually know about each other, long-term consequences of living as an impostor, and how alliances based on deception can evolve over time.  It tells a pretty good story, too.  The plot trajectory is often predictable, but it was probably less so when the story was originally published.Read this one if you are a diehard Heinlein fan who has not yet experienced it.  Or if you want to think a bit about issues of identity and pretense.

Dan invents some very clever and marketable mechanical devices that ease the burden of housework.  A stereotypical engineer, he has no business sense and leaves all of the financial arranging to his partner.  Who, of course, betrays him.  Depressed and destitute, Dan decides to delay decisions and drop out.*  He goes into suspended animation for thirty years and emerges to face a changed world.  Changed in some ways he had not anticipated.  Dan learns that time travel is now possible and vows to return to the past and make things right.  We wonder how he can succeed and whether he will finally get the girl.It's a good Robert Heinlein story with interesting characters and a signature reverence for science and technical details.  The characters are uncomplicated--you can always tell the good guys from the bad guys even when poor Dan cannot.  Heinlein introduces the vocabulary and paradoxes of time travel with minimal pain.  This may not be the very best first experience with Heinlein or time travel, but it will do.The book is recommended to anyone who enjoys a good story and doesn't mind invented technology that now seems dated.  Readers hungry for more of Heinlein's views on time travel should pick up a copy of his "All You Zombies-".  It will make your head spin.  Those preferring a more comprehensive exposure will enjoy Harry Turtledove's The Best Time Travel Stories of the 20th Century._____*Sorry about the alliterative excess.  Just couldn't help myself.

It's the future.  And some people have twice the normal lifespan.  This carefully guarded secret becomes known to the general public who demand access to life-extending medical treatments.  Unfortunately there aren't any.  The longevity enjoyed by members of the "Howard Families" results from naturally-occurring genes and selective breeding.  The public is disbelieving, envious, and angry.  Efforts are commenced to extract the secrets of extended life through force.Most members of the Howard Families go into hiding.  In the middle of this crisis Lazarus Long, the oldest living Howard, reappears.  Long presumed dead*, Lazarus has mastered the skills of secrecy and survival.  He leads the Families in a bold attempt to leave Earth and colonize planets around other stars.  The story follows Lazarus and his co-conspirators in their quest for a new home.This is the prototypical Robert Heinlein science fiction novel.  It ties together earlier works in his Future History series and links it to the following series (beginning with Time Enough for Love) that focuses on Long and his family.  Lazarus is clearly another version of the author's recurring "Grouchy Wise Old Man" character.  He is quick-tempered, opinionated, and peppers his dialogue with useful nuggets of knowledge.  He is also a dirty old man, which Heinlein goes to great pains to justify.  How-to science is center stage as Long delivers extended descriptions of spaceship piloting, exobiology, and so on.This book may also be the best "read it first" Heinlein work.  If you are a science fiction fan and haven't read it, do so.  If you don't have it in your library of science fiction classics, you should.  If like me, you are moving your library onto your Kindle, go ahead and buy it a second time.  It shouldn't be left behind as you move into your own future history._____*Sorry about that.

Readers follow Thorby through several distinct phases of his young life.  We first encounter him being sold as a slave on the planet Sargon.  He is bought by an old beggar, Baslim, who feeds, protects, and educates him.  It soon becomes clear that Baslim is an intelligence agent, tracking the movements of the interplanetary slave trade.  When Baslim's activities are discovered, Thorby barely escapes from Sargon with his life.Thorby next finds a home on the Free Trader ship Sisu, where he learns the skills of spaceship life and lives by the unusual customs of Free Trader families.  There are interesting comparisons made between life as a slave and the obligations and structured roles of the Free Traders.  Thorby soon transfers to a military ship of the Earth-based Hegemonic Empire.  On the way to Earth, Thorby adjust to a new culture, learning the customs and constrains of military shipboard service.  Investigations finally reveal Thorby's true identity and family connections.  He takes up the reigns of a new set of obligations on Earth.  Ultimately he must make some decisions about what kind of life he wants to live.This book is yet another book of successful Robert Heinlein "juvenile" science fiction.  Written in an age of technology focus, this work points the way to a sociological emphasis more typical of late 60's and early 70's genre writing.  Not only does Thorby encounter and compare several distinct cultures, but even has the help of an anthropologist at one point to guide his growth in perspective.  Heinlein has written something far beyond the clichéd space opera typical of his time.This is classic, old-school science fiction by one of the Grand Masters.  Definitely worth reading.

Juan Rico graduates from high school and goes off to war, where he learns how to fight, sees some of his friends get killed, and finds out that his high school history teacher was right about life and responsibility.  Sounds like a cliché WWII movie, doesn't it?  Many of the ideas came from that war and the author's experiences in the U.S. Navy.  But he used those experiences to write science fiction instead of historical fiction.The enemy in this book are the Bugs, ferocious aliens from outside of our solar system who open hostilities by nuking a few of Earth's major cities.  (Including Juan's home town.)  Learning to fight requires operating a highly automated and nearly autonomous spacesuit and numerous beam, projectile, and hand weapons.  Juan's reflections on the lessons of his teacher, a combat veteran, provide a forum for Heinlein to lecture the reader about self-reliance, responsibility, and citizenship.This is a representative Heinlein juvenile science fiction novel.  Everything from the action to the politics fits the bill.  The technology has aged well and the politics... well, readers will have to decide that issue for themselves.  It's worth reading.Do NOT confuse this book with the very shallow and stupid movie of the same name.  Don't see that movie, either.  Read the book instead.

Teenager Bill Lermer travels to Ganymede with his father, and his new step-mother and step-sister.  Readers get a Bill's-eye view of a future resource-depleted Earth; life on board an interplanetary colony ship; dirt-level terraforming of Ganymede; and the challenges of adolescence.  The latter include adjusting to his blended family, conflicts with others his age, and finding the right distance to maintain from girls.This novel originally appeared as a serial in Boy's Life magazine.  There is a strong Boy Scout influence in the story which blends well with the frontier setting and skills needed to survive in it.  This is classic Robert Heinlein science fiction from the 1950s.  The science is dated, but charmingly so.  The adventure of space colonization nicely parallels the main character's coming of age.One disappointed observation--the story could have gone on longer or easily supported a sequel.  It's odd that a prolific writer like Heinlein did not follow up with one.  Perhaps some detail of the licensing arrangement with Boy's Life explains this.

The non contact thermometer has been a really great and reliable tool when my kids get sick. This is easy to use and measure temperature. The general build is solid and dependability. You just hold the thermometer 2" from the forehead/temple area and push the button and within 2 to 3 seconds you have the temperature without being invasive or spreading any germs through contact. It has big  white LCD backlight, so it is ease to read digits, even in dark room. You don't need to turn light on. At the same time,  you have to follow the instructions. We wanted something we could check our 5 year old daughters temperature without being invasive (even while she slept) and this fits the bill.It works by sensing temperature difference between object (usually our daughter) and the environment. First, as instructed, do not expect it to be accurate right out of the box. The batteries need 10min to calibrate once placed in thermometer. Second, you can't take it into a different room (if the room is a different temp) and expect it to be accurate immediately, again it needs 10min to recalibrate. As most thermometer, the digital thermometer reads in Fahrenheit and Celsius all from the safe on/off button. One of my favorite features is the reading memory help to help you keep track on each temperature change.So far we have found this Thermometer by GRDE very accurate and easy to use. We have tried remote temp monitors but he either pulls the probe off, or it moves out of the armpit, so although they are a great idea; they have been no help. This product while not able to continually monitor him, makes the job of taking his temp much easier. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This is a rather lovely pink case by Wisdompro case is exactly as stated plus it’s just what my Aunt needed, and it looks nice and is well made! It has slots for credit cards, drivers license, and phone. The case attached to the cardholder by magnet, and it's easily detachable from the wallet case that holds everything together. Unfortunately, she is one of those people who puts too many cards and mine so it doesn't stay closed, but if you only have a couple of things inside, it will close beautifully.The wrist lanyard is a nice touch because not many wallet case has them. While taking photos, the strap around her wrist eliminates the fear of dropping her phone. The camera hole in the case is perfectly cut so there aren’t any problems shooting video/photos with the phone in its case. This box Android 5.1 TV box by VicTsing is really good and everything works well. Initial setting is not difficult but I had my husband set this up because he's pretty handy with these type of things, We just spent about 15 to 20 minutes to figured out how to use it to watch live TV and movies. I got a wireless keyboard and mouse, which is necessary. Reason being when setting up the box I recommend using a USB mouse and download the zipped apps to usb and load them via USB instead of downloading. This will save you some time. With a little patience I got everything set up and working properly.Once it worked properly we were both glued to the TV. The picture can be formatted to fit your TV so no more cut off pictures. Picture quality depends on what you are watching. Some of the streams are crystal clear HD quality, some of them are not so great but still watchable. Sound is very important to me so if you like watching movies and shows through the speakers on your TV, it's ok for that. There is still a lot to investigate, and I feel improvements will come though the internet eventually. Since this is the only android box I have experience with, I can't speak for any others. Make sure your internet connection is adequate because that will also interfere with the streaming process. Yesterday my router went out so my internet was not working properly. I did a good bit of fussing before I realized what the problem was.The movie selection is AMAZING. We have a Roku and this is hands down better. There are new releases that I can watch. Plus I can catch a series I wanted to watch from the very first pilot episode. That in itself was a selling point for me. Videos stream effortlessly with no tiling or buffering. The only time I had problems is when my internet was off line. Overall, my husband and I  like the Android box and would recommend to other people wanting to have literally UNLIMTED streaming of Movies, sports, shows, etc. This is the biggest reason why we tried out this box because it gives us the flexibility to add on what we want in our household. Other then that this box works well. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This is actually a good Bike phone mount.  Holds my son’s Samsung Galaxy 5 with its OtterBox Commuter case no problem. He rode with it a couple of times with no issues so far. Being able to mount the phone in this holder makes the ride more comfortable for me and less risky for the phone, and I would recommend this mount to others for such use if you have a phone (with case) that is less than 3 1/4 inches wide. Installation was not difficult and the instructions helped make the job quick. Once installed and on the road, there seems little vibration; the base of this mount seems quite strong and well constructed, while the actual phone-holder facing seems to work just fine but is made of lighter weight material than the base is. I love the is has the band straps for extra security.This mount is fully adjustable with its 360 rotation for various angles. I sense that this holder can fit well on most any size bar/pipe, so handlebars are an easy fit. It secures well with a quick-clamp similar to bike seat posts and the like. The pads on the sides help get a snug fit and keep from scratching your phone, though I always have mine in a case anyway. The mount itself is made of quick thick and sturdy plastic, well constructed.Overall, this is a fine way to keep your phone protected from bumps and holes, but it allows you to keep in touch while you ride. A good thing to have for communications and just in case you needs a little help. Recommend this bike mount by Comsun. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I love these colorful braided mesh bath straps by HOMMP.  I gave one to each member of my family. They do a great job of exfoliating the skin while getting to the hard places on your body--like your back, etc. They aren't a soft sponge but they aren't abrasive either like some other people mentioned. Unless you have extremely sensitive skin you shouldn't have a problem. They break in with time and aren't quite as stiff after enough uses. At first they seemed short but they stretch quite a bit after you've been using them for a while. Once you break them in they are perfect. The strap handles are  sewn in well and constructed good enough so that it won’t out or off. I like these because they make washing your back very easy. I love low maintenance and this has held up to my expectations. I simply rinse the Loofahs after use, squeeze out excess water, a little reshaping so it lays flat for next use, but then I just hang it on a hook in my shower to air dry. These Loofahs are reasonable price and they come as they look on the profile.  I highly recommend them. Received this product as a sample in exchange for a honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

These are good garbage bags by HOMMP. Comes in a nice big roll and they are easy to tear apart. First, when you put them into the can, they reach all the way down to the bottom of the can - no problem. Next, they comfortably fit around the top opening of the can without having to stretch the bag over one side then the other, then going back again to stretch back over the first side again!! Our cans have a wide opening, and these breeze right on in. You can fill the garbage can to the very top and then when you take the bags out, there's still plenty of room to grab the bag and remove it from the container without ever touching any of the garbage inside of the bag and there's room to even tie a knot in the bag before carrying it out. We've had no tears or rips. I suggest that you don't overload the bag because you need enough space left at the top to use the drawstring plus these bags aren’t heavy duty but more on the thin side.The description says 6 gallon, I'd say these are definitely in the 8 to 10 gallon range. I mostly use them for our cans.  We have a trashcan that's divided into two sections, so we use these on one side and regular garbage bags on the other. It's the perfect way to store our recyclables so we don't have to go out to the garage over and over again. With 6 people living in the house (and single-stream recycling in our area), we end up with a ton of recycling, so these have been great. Furthermore I use them as recycling bags for our car. We always have water bottles and pop cans from our journeys so instead of throwing them out, I bring along one of these bags and recycle them when we get home. And even better, I can see these lasting for several months! You get a good amount of bags for the asking price, recommend them. Received this product as a sample in exchange for a honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I love this Nutri Ninja Auto iQ and the best part is the clean up is nothing compared to juicers. First, I love the outlook of this machine,  it’s handsome and rather classy looking. It does not take up much of my counter space and can be placed in a drawer when not in use. There are only 4 buttons on the machine, which eliminates the guesswork of blending. I do not have to sit by it to make sure the cap does not come off like my regular blender nor do I have to check to see if the blending is complete.It comes with three sizes of blending cups, the largest of which is a full 32 ounces, or one quart. Generally this doesn't mean that you end up with a 32-ounce smoothie, because you always reduce the content in size when you blend. It is super convenient to use the straw top right on the cup to go. OT is easier to clean that a Kitchen aid type blender...less parts, and just an easier shaped blending vessel. There are no hidden places for gross banana purée to get stuck in which is a pet peeve of mine. So far what I like about is this:Pros:-The iQ is actually really nice. It pulses on it's own and the timing is perfect to get everything nice and smooth.-The narrow cup size makes it more likely to fit into cup holders if you are taking it to go in the morning.-The propeller on the base that attaches to the blades is made out of hard rubber (see my comment about the bullet below).-1000W of power crushes anything you could possibly put in it (that is actually food).-Blends everything so smooth, The only thing I have encountered that it has trouble with is flax seed (whole). It brakes it down some but you still get little pieces.-The design of the blade is easy to clean (compared the the bullet)Cons:-Loud (but comes with the territory)-Only comes with one blade (unlike the Nutribullet 900 that comes with two).-When it pulses the blender can actually move across the counter top. So depending on the surface, this could be problematic if you put it on auto and walk away.- The suction feet on the unit really grab the surface they're sitting on and it can be a pain in the you-know-what to unstick them when you want to move the unit. The trick is to tip the unit backward from the front and presto! -- the feet release the unit.Yes, it comes with a nice dietary advice book that I might take some cues from, but that's really not what I will use this Nutri Ninja Auto iQ for most of the time. If I'm honest, I wanted it because I wanted something ideal for making smoothies and shakes. Other then that I look forward to trying lots of different things in the days to come.

These smart balance scooters are awesome. Once you get over the initial learning curve (which is pretty short), this scooter is a lot of fun! It accelerates by simply applying pressure with the front your feet. It carries two driver motors within the wheels that can be controlled with both feet individually for easy turns, rotation, acceleration and smooth breaking. We have ridden this in our neighborhood, on the local streets, and in parks, and my sons have had a blast using it. Yes, it is an expensive toy, but it was totally worth it in my opinion. The motor is terrific on this scooter, a very intelligent design in my humble opinion. As I've already mentioned, when going downhill, the motor doesn't let the scooter pick up too much speed, it keeps it in check. If you hit maximum speed (whether going downhill or just on a flat surface), the motor rattles telling you that it's reaching max speed. The motor is also designed to make turning easier. If you apply too much pressure on one foot in an attempt to turn, it will rattle telling you that the balance is off.It seems there are several brands in the market for this type of scooter. They are all effectively exactly the same product coming from exactly the same factory, just sold under different brand names. The price tags on these vary between $200 to $1900 (insane!), depending entirely on the price a particular brand wants to charge for this product. Only the packaging and manuals are different, and some companies may include some extras like kneepads, but the scooter itself is exactly the same. So if you are unsure of which one to buy, I would say that you can go for the one that is priced lowest and can be delivered to you the quickest. I fine that a great number of companies send this directly from China which can takes several weeks to arrive. So look for a domestic company to order from (of course their price may be slightly but think of the peace of mine). Other then that this is a great product. It's really easy to get used too and one of the best things I've ever rode. The board is really durable and its so soothing to ride.

This is an incredibly warm scarf by Tahari, and quite unlike any other that I own. It kept me warm and cozy as well. The next task I had to put it thru was washing. It handled washing and drying multiple times without shrinking, stretching, loosing shape or color!There is a good number of different color combinations that you will surely find one that fits your liking. This is excellent for winter since it’s so warm and secure. Overall, for the price, the fabric and the look, I think this a great buy—highly recommended. This pure and natural rose water by Regent Naturals is a great addition to my beauty regiment. It's a fabulous facial toner and leaves my skin feeling refreshed. Rose water is touted to tone, clarify and hydrate my combination skin. I like that you used this as an anti-inflammatory and can produce a calming effect on your skin. This also has a subtle Rose smell. It is not super strong so you won't go around smelling. Unlike a lot of synthetic fragrances, this doesn't have that cloying heavy-handed fake smell that ends up giving you a headache.So here is how I use it, after using my toner I spritz my face with rose water. If I'm wearing make-up after everything is applied and I'm ready, I do a spritz. At the end of the day if I need a pick me up, spritz. When I need to remove eye make up, obviously I don't spritz, but apply to a cotton pad and remove, If it's real heavy-duty stuff this may not cut it, but for my needs this is usually fine. It does a great job at removing makeup and keeping my pores minimized. It makes my skin feel so soft; it's not oily at all. It leaves your face feeling refreshed and ready for the day in the morning and in the evening it leaves your face feeling refreshed and ready to hop in bed for a nice relaxing evening. Plus I haven't had any adverse reactions, so I'm going to continue using it because I like the results I've gotten so far.I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good toner and cleanser for your face. It's good for the hair, which I’ll probably give it a try one day. I would definitely recommend this product since it is so useful. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I enjoy sleeping in a hammock when outside, because it keeps me off of the ground, out of bugs and away from snakes. The seams are mostly triple stitched except for the outer hem.Pros:-Holds up to 330 lbs.-Has everything needed to hang (no additional cost)-Packs into own pocket-Affordable-Durable-Nice Color ComboCons:-Might be a bit large for some (although could be considered a benefit based upon your needs).Furthermore, I love that it doesn't stretch out of shape, and tucks back up into the sewn on storage bag. I had been wanting to try these wraps for sometime so it was great to try them. The Body wrap sticks to your skin, as the cloth stretches as u applying it with no saran wrap. There is no liquid mess. You can easily wear this body wrap running errands or while sleeping (up to 8 hours), very convenient! The body wrap can be cut for other areas you may target which is nice.  I used the wrap on my stomach and I like that it has a hole for your belly button. When measuring myself around the waist I was 28 inches. As directed I did one application on Wednesday night 11/04/15 and Saturday evening 11/07/15; I noticed a difference by Sunday morning 11/08/15. I continued to notice a reduction in my belly fat. Then I place another wrap on Tuesday evening 11/10/15 following the same procedure. I re-measured and it come out to be 26 inches, which is pretty amazing leaving two wraps behind right now.They definitely stayed in place and didn't shift or move around at all. Once you put them on there's no taking them off to resituate them back on but it's simple to make sure you get them on right in the first place. There's no scent to them whatsoever. I'm guessing that if you have a big belly you might not be satisfied, because it will take you longer to see results. At the same time, don't get discourage on after your first applicator, you will continue to get results. If you are working with a little gut, little pooch...etc., something medium to small and you need something to get your stomach flat or from getting bigger; you can use these to help firm and contour your stomach for sure. At the same time I drink a lot of water throughout the day, it’s just my way on cutting back from sugar drinks.Here is what I do: (before bed):1. As Directed I shower, dry off and dry skin brush my whole stomach area, enough to get the blood circulating and get the area warm.2. Apply the wrap along the stomach area.3. Sleep with the applicator on ALL night 10:00 pm to 7:00 am (if you want good results this is a must.)4. Next morning take the wrap off and go about my day.5. Waited between 2 to 3 days to place another applicator at night.Though I’m 41, I can't stop the aging process but I sure can stop 'how' I age. (Side note: I also exercise and use a host of necessary vitamins and supplements so I continue to stay young and healthy and vibrant). Other then that this is a great product by Shape and Tone Body Products to assist your appearance. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. This silver scale is great. So much handier and more accurate than trying to fit a bulky bag on my human-sized bathroom scale. At the same time I do own a number of these hand scale. The construction of this device is great.Compared to our other luggage scale I like two features on this one better. This scale will lock in the final weight and continue to display it either with a red or green light. A green light means your baggage is below 50 lbs. and shouldn't incur any overweight baggage fees. A red light turns on at 50 pounds or above indicating you may be charged overweight luggage fees. Awesome display. This is much better than trying to read a weigh that is continuing to change. This also has a nice big handle you can grip with two hands which is helpful when weighing a 50 lb. suitcase. Additionally the strap attachment is helpful for wrapping around suitcase handles of different sizes.This will either pay itself off or give you a whole ton of triumph as you show up to the gate and you've measured everything perfectly. Beside that this digital luggage scale by FREETOO is small enough that it stores easily and the measurements are pretty accurate. Worth the money. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

O man I’m in love with this car organizer by Fasmov. No more do I have to spend time picking up all the little items and putting them into my back seat when taking on a passenger. No more do my items fall between the seats and become lost. This organizer really helps keep my car neat. Now I no longer have a pile of papers sitting on my passenger seat, my umbrella tossed in the back, and pens floating around who knows where. They're all tucked into place in the organizer. Plus I like that when someone is going to ride with me, I don't have to grab all my mess and toss it in the back. I just flip this around in one swoop and when I am solo again, I can swoop it back just as easily.It works just as well as the higher models and it has a lot of room for all of your stuff that you will need. I notice that it works great in the front of the seat, the back of the seat, and even the side of the seat if need be. The quality is pretty good and seems to hold up pretty well. I personally like the adjustable webbed straps buckle around headrest posts for a secure fit for my drinks.I would like it if it came in different colors would be great as well so you could pick one the color of your seat so it could blend in and it wouldn't be so conspicuous. This car organizer is such a clever idea; I wish I had this years ago! Received this product as a sample in exchange for a honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This headphone is sweet and I fine the sound sharp, clear, and intense. I listen to a wide range of music, from jazz to hip-hop, and pretty much everything in between. So, I like my headphones to be capable of producing heavy bass, but I also like to be able to tone that down quite a bit to focus on other instruments and vocals in other kinds of music. As you open the package of course you get the headphones in a molded plastic case. The case has a nylon zipper with a metal closure and a Sentey-logo’d pull. The cord will be to the left ear cup hat, with the inline control module about 6” from the left cup at that.What I love about these is that they cover the over the ear well, and do a pretty good job of isolating outside sound and delivering your input’s sound. They are comfortable and easily adjustable. At the same time you can turn them down and listen to them at a comfortable level and they do a good enough job of canceling out ambient noise. They don't have the greatest noise cancellation, though, and they do bleed some music at higher volumes, so know that if you're in a quiet area with them turned way up, others will be able to hear the music. With that I had my husband help me with that area.They look just as cool as any of the popular sets out there. Maybe not the highest quality materials as the high-end phones, but in no way do they appear as cheap. It's obvious that in order to offer pro studio quality sound at an extremely low price, it appears that Sentey understood what materials were best suited to achieve this. At the same time these headphones are very attractive, with cool colors that by no means have a cheap look.Other then that, this headphones couldn't be more comfortable. Like having a pillow on your ears so you can have them on for hours in comfort. I highly recommend this product! Received this product as a sample in exchange for a honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I’ve wanted to improve my meditation practice led me to try this sleep mask and it worked great! I meditate best with minimal light and noise and I found this eye mask to be a perfect solution to help with that. The fit of this mask is a solid design, comfortable to wear and does not fall off when I move while sleeping. At times you will come across some minor light bleed comes into the eye from the nose area at first, but the mask adapts/molds to your face over time. It's kind of like wearing a nice piece of well-fitting clothing on your head. The elastic band does not cut into the back of your head like with other sleep masks.This handy travel pillow can easily be rolled up and put back into its nylon carry case. A big Pro about this pillow is that it vary inflation level allowed me to get a good fit. Plus the texture is comfortable, and doesn't make you feel like you're going to slide off.I also like it when traveling to help me sleep. It keeps out the light, it is very comfortable, and having the earplugs included securely in the band means I never have to look for where I put them! This eye mask set by CeyDreams is rather nice on my eyes. Other then that I recommend this eyewear. Received this product free as a sample in exchange for a honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This mirror is better than the one I had previously. I like this one a lot more. It looks classier and fancier plus It is heavy and therefore not prone to be knocked over. I don't feel like I have trashy cluttered counters when I leave it sitting out because it looks so nice it's rather decorative. Plus I can leave it out on a shelf in my bathroom and it looks nice.The magnification is wonderful; I use it to apply eyeliner and to tweeze. It does not look like a cheap mirror product. It's actually quite elegant, solid and well made. The finish is wonderful and doesn't show fingerprints. This mirror will be a great addition to your dresser/vanity space. The normal side is clear and has good proportion.Other then that this mirror is just the right weight and height, and the image is crystal clear by Mirrorvana along with it’s great price. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This is adorable, I place this in my study and its makes my office smell nice. The design and outlook of this oil diffuser is pretty. I feel that it will do well in small size rooms. It's certainly easy to use and powers off of a USB port. I've used lavender oil and rosemary oil with this diffuser. The mist does a great job at filling the room with relaxing scents. Furthermore it’s better to have your celling fan off to get a better affect of the essential oils.What I also like about this unit is that it helps with your immune system, since I catch colds very easily during season changes, while providing extra moisture for your body.It’s great that the diffuser has an auto shut off feature when water runs out. This is especially nice to have when the run is unattended. Overall the Bella Home International Diffuser works y well in my eyes. It’s easy to set up and fills my area with a refreshing scent. Highly Recommended. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I got these shorts for my son's school uniform. My son wears a 14, because they run a little big the 12 works fine, using the waist adjuster for difference. Perfect fit with room to grow. Shorts don't gather and bunch up with use of the adjusters, so no one knows the shorts are a size and 1/2 larger than needed. Really nice as quickly as children grow! Little ironing required, especially if line dried! So far these are the best school shorts I have purchased in 4 years and will continue to get them as long as they make them and find them.

Our  5-year-old daughter has dropped her tablet  many times and it's just fine. This case is very durable and easy to clean. So far everywhere she goes people want to know where I got it from because its so kid friendly and easy for her to handle.The handles itself makes it interesting versus others because it turns into a  kickstand. She drags her tablet everywhere so the handles are super useful. I have small hands and fingers so don't have a problem reaching the power and volume buttons, but my husbands' hands are large so he has more of a problem reaching them. Bulkier than the smart folio covers, but it has to be if you want it to be protected against a toddler and its actually lightweight. Again it's easy to handle and worth the price on protecting your expensive device.

I got this for my 14-year son who rides his bike everywhere. I fine this to be the perfect size to attach to his bike - it doesn't take up too much room and get the job done efficiently and quickly I wanted him to have something that was small and he could carry in his backpack in case of emergencies.This pump is extremely lightweight which is an important feature when dealing with bikes and balance. It has an easy to attach harness that keeps it locked in place, and it's also easy to get it in and out of the harness during use.Other then that this bike pump by Kitbest is very simple pump that's easy to use, and if you're out and about this will be able to give you enough air to get back. But I would also recommend having a full size pump at home to get up to your full PSI. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This went above and beyond my expectations. I have used similar zester/graters in the past and had horrible results because the quality was poor and would bend. Not with this zester. It is very sturdy and worked great. Made just the right size zest that I needed. I like that it is so simple to use.It has fine edges to make grating cheese or fruits easy. I like the fact that it is long and comes with a thick handle. It makes the grating process much faster than what I was use to doing. The handle grip is very comfortable which is important because you don't want your hand to accidentally slip. It's long so you zest more in less strokes.One thing I really like about this particular grater by Erayco is that it is flat, so it doesn't take up much room in a drawer at all, just as much as a kitchen knife would. So far I have tried parmesan, garlic, ginger, lemon, lime, jalapeno and orange on this grater .......... It works amazingly for each one. I highly recommend this zester/grater to anyone that needs it. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This waterproof cell phone case by Mengo is effective. Once received it came in a nice secured clear plastic box. I wanted to see how it would travel with my sister’s iPhone 6 plus and it worked perfectly! This teal case is well designed and secure the phone nice and snug. It’s been a rainy week and yesterday she took it with her and notice that the case got wet, but the phone stayed dry! At the same time, she can take photos and videos without taking it out of the case, as it's clear on the front.This is a nice protective case for anyone to have for a moments notice - it will come in handy when you are going to a lake, the beach, waterpark, even out for a walk on a hot day - you never really know when Mother Nature will open the skies! And with this little waterproof case you are always prepared! Plus we both love that this case comes with a few goodies like spare main seal ring, extra plug, and headphone extension, along with cleaning cloths.Loved the size and quality of this case as well. So far she has no nervousness putting her expensive phone inside this case while encountering water. Definitely recommend it! Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I have wood floors throughout my entire house except for the bedrooms. I currently use Old English Scratch Cover on a few different items and it has worked well for me over the years. I learnt that products like this does not repair damage to the finish coat. It simply stains the raw wood that is exposed when it is scratched. At the same time we get scratches all the time with a household of 6. I also buy markers that are exactly a marker of the color of my floor as well. They work for a while but then they seem to vanish and the scratches come back which is a tad bit annoying.Now a couple of days ago, I used Wearmax in several spots some that are really bad. It worked really well. At first, I use it on the sample wood provided and it work great. So I decided to use it first underneath the kitchen table and it took the white mark away nicely.  I went back to it a day later and tried to rub it off and it stayed. I believe this will last a long time if not permanent but will see. I also know that on deep scratches you cannot take away how deep it is but you can improve it drastically with Wearmax. Other then that this product is great on mild scratches. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

In my household I decided that every room in the house needs a flashlight that you can have easy access to. This seemed like the perfect solution. This silver LED light is really lightweight and takes 3 AAA batteries. It’s very bright and turns on with a simple click to the black button on the end.This doesn’t come with a wrist strap, which I like but that’s all right. I guess that is nice to those who don't use them but I indent to hang them from a nail on the wall so I had to install all of the wrist straps, which was a bit of a pain in the butt. Plus I fine this also well for kids, since they are perfect for little hands.Other then that, this flashlight by XFIL is good quality for the asking price. I would recommend this light to anyone who enjoys being outside or anyone who want to be safe and stash on in the car. The flashlight would also be wonderful to have in an emergency storm kit that we have at our house in case of hurricane or what have. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This KitKat tablet is awesome for our 5-year-old daughter. This 7" tablet downloads quickly & has ample amount of memory for our child’s games. This is however, great for kids who are getting their first tablet. What I love about this tablet is that you can create customized profiles for users. You can password protect your account. You can turn on and off the apps you want your user to have access to. For example, you can turn off the browser, but leave the Wi-Fi on for something like YouTube Kids. You can turn off everything that children should not have access to and not have to worry! These are great! She can play them non-stop for about half they time they are awake in a day. The picture on this tablet is pretty nice for this price for sure. I have seen some that cost more and do far less.Furthermore I love the case with the white keyboard. So often there is an extra button or something that gets covered when you get a generic cover. This one fit nicely into the case. I really like the quality of the case as well along with the durability of it. The color was spot on. Right now she doesn’t use the keyboard but very impressed with the case itself and the fit. The quality of this case is very sturdy and is not cheap silicone. It is a high quality cover and I personally like it.This tablet has been perfect for her, so far. She can watch her online videos, play her preschool apps, and she loves taking pictures with the camera. The camera isn't the highest quality, but she doesn't care. She just loves the fact that she has a tablet just like her older siblings. Aside from that the shipment was very prompt. Plus the use of tablet was fairly easy and downloading was fine, everything seemed to be in working order and I am pleased with the quality for the price. Overall, I really like this product by iRulu. I would highly recommend it! Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

Our 5-year-old daughter has enjoyed listening to music and audiobooks with these pink lightweight stereo headphones. She can wear these for a long period of time without them irritating her ears. They fold nicely into a lower profile configuration, which makes it easy to pack on trips.What she likes about this headset:· Very comfortable to wear· Vibrant color· High-quality sound with great noise-cancellation· Answer incoming calls without the need to unplug· Sound quality· Foldable configuration for easy packing· Adjustable for different head sizesPlus I fine the bass quality to be excellent. Earbuds cannot compare to the quality of sound that these provide. The Kidwavz KV-100 will connect to any device that support Bluetooth transmission, this includes iPad, iPhones, Android phones and tablets, computers with Bluetooth etc. so you can use the phone hands-free. Most importantly, the sound quality is great. Overall, I really like this product. I would highly recommend it! Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I have many pairs earphones in my possession. I keep them in the car, in the house, in my purse, gym bag, etc. Basically, I don't like to be anywhere without earphones or headphones. One of the reasons I have so many is because our family goes through them so quickly. I don't know if we're extremely hard on them or what, but we have to replace them frequently.The Brainwavz earphones look and feel like they are made out of  high quality materials. They do not feel flimsy or cheap. Only time will tell if these develop a short due to a kinked wire or something similar. However, you are provided with it's own carrying bag to help keep it safe. Extra ear tips are also included which is very nice.These earphones performed well. I listened to quite a few different genres of music on them. You can hear the bass notes very well. There is some distortion with just regular music play. It sounds good, but it's not as clear and sharp as I think it should be. The volume is good and there is ample adjustment for the desired level.The microphone works very well for me. There was no problem with anyone hearing me during phone calls; even while working out. This is a great value; especially considering that these earphones include a microphone. They are not top of the line or perfect; but for the price range, they are at the top. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

This is a great economical pink 16G Mp3/4 by Elecmall. I know there is a number of MP players similar throughout this website but you do need to be careful of the provided quality of these devices. The metal hardware construction is well made and put together for the price point as well (even better than the flimsy plastic on another "clip" based competitor). Broken down here is my view of this player.Pros:+ Cheap price point for the amount of Gig.+ A vivid colorful display/ wide screen.+ A wide menu variety.+ Includes Micro SD Card+ Sound quality is greatCons:- Button layout can be confusing for most.- Extremely lightweight so be careful were you place and handle itPlus I love the fact that they provide 1 earphone, USB Cable along with a manual. Like I said before, for the price it’s pretty reasonable. I was not expecting a whole lot from this product, but it did impress me. As far as the charge, I had no issues with this player holding a charge. I was able to use it around 8 hours straight with no problems.  Beside that it’s a nice MP3/4 player. Received this item in exchange for an honest review. My views and opinions are from a customer/end user’s standpoint.

I've been using this particular toothbrush for several years now. I have a habit of pressing too hard when brushing and have done so for years. That coupled with using more firm bristles have worn down my gum line a bit over time. These extra soft bristles coupled with Sensodyne toothpaste have helped minimize discomfort for me and ensure that I'm not causing further damage to my gums. Also important to note that my experience has been that the softer bristles are no less effective at cleaning teeth or preventing cavities than firmer options I've used in the past.  Rubber grips are well placed and the smaller brush head makes it easy to get everywhere that you need to.

I've had nothing but positive experiences with Outdoor Research products, so when I decided that I wanted to look into getting a trapper hat for what has been a cold winter, this one made sense.It's important to note that this particular hat is not for everyone. I have what I would consider a pretty average sized head.  Ordered a L after considering the reviews on here and still had to send it back for an XL. That one fits perfectly. If you find yourself wearing larger sized hats, there's a good chance you're out of luck here.The hat is comfortable, warm, and well constructed.  Ear flaps have strong magnets in place to flip them up or down as needed (though I generally just keep them down).  Buttons are available to secure it under the chin if desired.Ear coverage is effective for quick walks on the go, commute, etc.  Even more so if it is secured in place with the chin strap or tucked away in a jacket and/or scarf.  I tend to just throw it on when I'm going to and from work or to walk the dog. But if the wind is whipping or the temp has really dropped they're only so helpful. Wouldn't depend on it to keep your ears warm if you'll be outside for several hours on a windy day.Overall very happy with the hat.

The Benebone MINI Rotisserie Chicken flavor is their 3rd offering.  I received our first chicken Benebone along with a replacement bacon one I had ordered.  I held them both out, our dog gave them both a careful sniff and then she ran away with the bacon one. Can't say I blame her.  She hasn't entirely ignored the chicken, but it's not getting nearly as much love as the bacon.  That one remains her undisputed favorite.  She is an aggressive chewer, so we try and keep a handful of different chew toys in rotation at any given time. It is not dissimilar to a nylabone in terms of the consistency of the material or the effect that aggressive chewing has upon it. Over the span of several nonstop hours of committed chewing, she is able to do some damage. What I have noted is that Benebones seems to be a bit less inclined to develop harsh corners or sharp edges than nylabones. Areas of wear are a bit more flaky and softer to the touch. There is always a concern about very small pieces begin eaten during the course of a good chew session (which is inevitable), but if she must, I'd rather they be smooth and pose less of a risk for her intestines and tummy. If I took away each chew toy that exhibited signs of "damage", she'd have no toys left. Even with close supervision, she inevitably eats rice sized pieces while she chews. Having gone through 6-8 Benebones now, I can say that they have held up as well if not better than a nylabone and she always goes for a Benebone first when she has a choice!

Always wanted a Thermapen, but just couldn't warrant the expense for the modest amount of cooking and grilling that I do. The ThermoPop was a great compromise and it comes in handy all the time in my kitchen. On the simplest level, it has been a trusted way to ensure that meats are cooked thoroughly and to the desired temperature.  But it has also been incredibly helpful for brewing beer at home and loose leaf tea. It's fast, consistent, backlit, and splash-proof. When temperature matters and being a few degrees off can make a big difference, I definitely trust this thermometer over the shoddy plastic one I was using before.  Barring a clumsy dunk in a batch of home brew (I've come close), I expect to get a number of years out of this thing.

Bought this long sleeve t-shirt for layering in the fall and winter months.  I was actually pleasantly surprised with how warm it is for a thin tee. It's a polyester/wool blend with an athletic/slim fit to it.  Just enough wool to add a little warmth without the itch and stuffiness. The neck coverage it provides has been appreciated when I throw on a jacket in the evening to walk the dog.  Dries quickly.  Will be packing it for future camping and backpacking trips as a versatile option.

I have nothing but good things to say about my Gregory Baltoro 75 backpack, but my wife was tired of seeing me use it for our regular weekend trips.  When I finally caved and started looking for a weekend duffle bag option, this one was a no brainer.It has the same rugged and durable feel of the Baltoro.  Nylon, straps, zippers, buckles, and stitching are all solid.What sold me was the straps and the versatility.  Straps can be velcroed securely together for a traditional bag handle, adjusted longer to sling over the shoulder, or kept separate for padded backpack straps.  I personally haven't had much of a need for that last option, but I enjoy that it's there if I do.  Usually I'm just moving it from the apartment to the car and from the car to my destination.  Shoulder sling usually works just fine for that purpose.It can also be cinched down on the sides to compress the bag a bit when you're not carrying a full load.  I find myself doing that a lot as it's a pretty spacious bag.  I would call the 65L a weekend+ bag if you're a modest packer.  At least for me, this could easily accommodate stuff for a 4-5 day trip.If you're in the market for a duffle, appreciate versatility, and want it to last, this is worth the extra $.

Necessary?  Nope.  Fun novelty?  Yep.  Worth the price to change things up a bit for your next batch of home brew?  I think so.  I will grant that they can be helpful when you take a few bottles from room temperature storage and put them into the fridge.  The bottles can be cold to the touch a few hours later even if the beer isn't anywhere near cold enough yet.  I've found that the caps don't hit their darker blue shade until the beer has done so.  These can also help you distinguish between different batches if you will have a few that are aging.  Plus when you're using brown bottles with no labels it can't hurt to have a little color on there.  Will buy again.

Great way to safely and easily remove some home brew from a 5 gallon batch to test it with a hydrometer.  Gives you a good long reach into the carboy and it does a great job grabbing enough for testing purposes.  Using mine with a 5 gallon glass carboy with a top that accommodates a size 7 stopper.  Sanitize it beforehand to prevent contamination and if you're careful you can pour it back when you're done.  Dripping is truly minimal.  Might find a drop or two from point A to B.  Not a necessity for every home brewer but for me it's come in handy.

First off, this thing is huge.  It rests on top of my 5 gallon food grade bucket perfectly.  The double mesh does a good job removing even smaller unwanted particles.  Be prepared to have to rinse hops off of it partway through and potentially re-sanatize during a typical 5 gallon batch. It can clog up to the point where the beer flow stops entirely. If you're not using a sack to steep your grains be ready for a decent amount of weight to this thing when it's full.  You can get by with a smaller one, but I personally felt this was one of those purchases that made brewing my batches notably easier.  Solid, well crafted, and I have no doubt that I will be using this for many long years of home brewing.

Picked up this item for home brewing.  50' was way more than I needed, but I wanted food grade and didn't feel like hunting around for it locally.  Works perfectly with my auto siphon.  Having flexibility as far as the length of the tubing is concerned is a big plus.  Lets me work with different set ups as needed and reduces spills.  Having 40' tucked away in the basement means I'm set for a good long while.

Hard not to be a little nervous when you're ordering a glass product on-line.  Once it arrived though it was pretty clear that my worry wasn't warranted.  Well packaged and a thick solid item. No chips, cracks, etc. Stopper size listed is accurate. Recommend a good long carboy or decanter brush for cleaning if you will be using it for home brewing. Carboy carrier has been helpful too when it's full.  It has taken the daily knocks associated with home brewing just fine.
