Tina has been keeping a secret....a whopper. Cole has a four year old son by Tina and he is somewhat resistant to being a dad. In fact, he has definitely sworn off becoming involved with Tina and tells her way too many times to count that he will never marry and he will not be a good dad. Yeah...same old story: horrible childhood, crappy parents so he lets it ruin his life. Not only was he a player but he was arrogant, cocky, purposely hurtful and a real son of a jerk. He ranked right up there on my top five list of Heroes that I cannot stand.Oh my...I had so much more written but it vanished. Probably not a bad thing. I just don't know what it is about books these days that they seem so unbalanced. This book presented me with 215 pages of pain, anxiety, broken-heartedness, misery and an ignorant man who was an unfeeling, uncaring jerk of a coward. His younger sister had been through a whole lot as well but she let it shape her in a positive way. He just used it as crutch to check out of having a meaningful, responsible life. He was a rolling stone playboy and that's how he wanted it to remain. Then we were given 4 whole pages of the hero coming to his senses and deciding he loved Tina. Big Whoop! It was certainly too little to earn himself any redemption from this reader. If we suffer through 215 pages of agony and heartbreak do we not deserve more than 4 pages of happiness and love. Geesh!I'm sorry but there is no way I can recommend this book. What a downer. Not even warm and fuzzies at the end. Left me sad and angry.

I had such high hopes for this book as I waited patiently for its release but I was definitely disappointed. The story moved at a snail's pace and was so very redundant.Rachel and Leo had very difficult childhoods but it took the whole book for them to finally work through their own fears. I do understand how childhood and teen issues can have a negative impact on your life....been there done that! It's all about how you choose (or not choose) to deal with it, work through the torment. Both of them lived their lives in a very detrimental way. They could only function if their world was just how they ordered it, unable to compromise on anything, come out on the other side stronger than you ever believed possible. Nope...they just wallowed in the muck making no forward progress. Rachel had to have ORDER, constant order with every minute of every day accounted for, everything scheduled to the inth degree. Leo, on the other hand, could only survive if there was no order or planning whatsoever. What an opposite end of the spectrum these two were and it got old and boring because I felt neither of them really looked inward to evaluate their emotional problems and they certainly never sought help. These two had no business bringing a child into the world with all of their emotional obstacles. They needed professional help or a good minister.It was such a let down to me and even though there was a HEA, it was just too little too late. I won't say that I do not recommend it. To each his own. But I will say that if I had known more about this book I would have never read it. I believe that books should have a balance. Happy-Sad, Good-Bad, Joy- Heartache etc. But, there simply wasn't any balance in this story.This was a very negative book in my opinion and it did not leave me with warm gooey feelings. It left me feeling disappointment, sad, angry, and scratching my head wondering how two adults could not manage some sort of compromise until the last couple of pages. There was a lot of lust on both sides but mostly not acted upon. Very unrealistic.

Rebecca Stewart and Ben McFarlane were best friends and had been for most of their lives. Ben left her and their hometown to play polo throughout Europe and was gone for years. Rebecca has kept a huge secret from Ben but she did so because she loved him so much and wanted him to have his dream...even if that meant she had to give him up. Bec knew him well enough to understand that if she shared her secret he would give up his plans but would resent her in the end for stealing his lifelong dream from him, knowing he would do the honorable thing. She was a loving and selfless young woman and when Ben returns home all he can think about is her.In my opinion this book was a decent read, however, I was disappointed by the repetition of the heroine's negative thought process and the slow movement of the story. I think it is worth the read but it is not one I would read a second time.

Well it was good while it lasted, three seasons. We use this for three months a year and my first one lasted for ten years and was purchased used. This one has already bitten the dust. Oh, it still runs but there's a crack in a seam of the housing and water just sprays out constantly. We cannot afford a new Power Flo because of extensive medical bills and we can't afford to replace the water the pool loses through the cracked housing seam on a daily basis. Just heart-sick about this. This is our only recreational activity for me and the kids since a sudden and unexpected illness hit our family. This is the first problem I have had with a Hayward except for replacing the lid and seal every few years.

This is the final book in this series for me. Loved book one but not two or three.This book is about Colton and Lucy. There is simply nothing positive I can say. I disliked it greatly!! Here are just a couple of glimpses that troubled me. If you don't want anything spoiled..don't read below.1. Not until about half way in do we find out that Colton was a semi man-whore who had a string of friends with benefits to visit his mountain home when he was in need and they did not wait to be invited. At the beginning I somewhat thought he wasn't that type of man and was so pleased but I was wrong. He had a female visitor while Lucy was there who came knocking for sex and I hated it. Lucy made it sound as though Colton had an injury to his privates and she was his nurse...trying to let the other woman know he would not be available to her ever and he would be out of commission permanently. The rumor mill had gone rampant in less than a day and about a dozen baskets of food with perfume-filled love notes with lipstick kisses on them were lined up on his porch. Having that many F-buddies must have kept him quite busy and I was immediately disappointed in his character and didn't think too much of him after that. I was so disappointed because I didn't get the impression he was like that. Apparently his F-buddies wanted to come and care for his fictitious wound to his man parts. Again, Lucy was with him when he received all of the baskets lined up on his porch and she was truly, deeply bothered by that...as she should be. It really hurt her and made her distrust their relationship, which was not solid at all, for a good while.2. I find it difficult to tolerate weak women who are so unsure of themselves and Lucy was one of them. She didn't think she deserved a life of her own because she was so involved in her sister's and niece's life that she felt she had to be there for them 24/7 as well as her father. She even felt that way about her dear friend. No way could she move to be with the man she loved and leave her family and her best friend. Everyone's happiness came before her own and she was willing to live a life without love and happiness because she felt she owed it to them to constantly be there. I think her need she felt they had for her was so exaggerated. She was so positive they couldn't get along without her. YUCK! GAG!3. And last but certainly not least. This book dragged on relentlessly. I could barely make it through. It never did move at a reasonable pace but I sucked it up and kept going. Wish i would have stopped earlier.I completely understand that I am one of a handful in the minority.I cannot in good conscience recommend this book. I am finished with this series. Book one was good...books 2 and 3 IMO not so much.

I really do not like leaving negative reviews but there was not one single thing I like about this book. There are very few books I regret reading but this is one of them.Erin has agreed to take her five-year-old son, Joey, to see his father in Australia as she has been taking him to therapy at the request of his school because he constantly makes up fantasies about the dad who deserted him. Her and her ex husband had been deeply in love and she had given up everything and moved to the outback to be with him. They lived in a deserted area where the only medical care had to be flown to you and only if they deemed the condition serious enough. Luke was so involved in building his ranch that he didn't have much time for his new wife after she moved to the Outback and she would go days and even weeks without seeing him. The stupid man thought he was toughening her up for their living conditions but he, instead, was abandoning her. Their baby son was having a health issue and cried 24/7 but there was no way to get him to medical care and the plane doctors refused to fly out to check him. Her jerk of a husband just made jokes about the boy not really being sick and that she was making something out of nothing so he ignored his son's health. She felt deeply betrayed, depressed and deserted. How could he go weeks without seeing her and his son? What was so much more important than they were? So when she was close to a break down and worried sick about her infant son she finally packed up and had a man who worked on the ranch drive her six or so hours to catch a plane back to Manhattan so her son could receive medical attention. As she pulled away from their home all her husband could do was scream and curse at her. She never went back feeling as though her husband cared nothing about her or their child. He never went after her...never once called to check on his sick baby son and this went on for five years. He just ignored it all and went on with his life. Eventually he figured out what he had done to her and their son but still continued to make no contact at all.Now let me tell you something. In my opinion there is no excuse in this world for abandoning your own child, to go five years without a word to them or even knowing if they were still amongst the living. When Erin tried to contact him or send a picture she never heard back from him...only from his attorney. He was an ass and I despised him. No reason could be good enough to exit your child's life unless you were afraid you would harm them. But exit he did while he went on with his life, became very successful and of course having involvement with other women.By the time I finished this book I was spitting mad. I lived this story except he didn't ignore his child for 5 years, it was more like 33 and counting. A man is simply not a man when he chooses to abandon his family..period! No excuses!The heroine was ok and I felt sorry for her because of the heartache she endured. She had been so broken...her heart smashed to pieces and it is only right that she was leery of Luke.I am sorry but I cannot recommend this book. I don't like reading about a parent abandoning their child and spouse. It is one thing to separate from your spouse but to also have nothing to do with your own flesh and blood is unthinkable although I know it happens.

I really enjoyed this book and couldn't put it down until I completed it. I considered a 5-star review but I am put off with men and women pushing away the one they love because they think they know what is best for the other person without any discussion, any questions and most of the time they are wrong. Who has the right to make choices for someone else?What I loved...pretty much everything but what I mentioned above. Colt was a gorgeous cowboy who is stepping in to manage the ranch his parents have run for many years after the death of his father. He is a bit of a jerk and is quite upset when the new chef shows up.They butt heads from the get go and he has plans to rid the ranch of her and her highfaluting ways with food. There is no compromise because it is his way or else... for a while that is.Emma is tired of the noise and busyness of NYC where she is a chef, second in command. She works horribly long hours and doesn't have much time to spend with her four-year-old daughter. She has just accepted a job at the Circle P Ranch so that she can have her child with her and live in peace, quiet and harmony...until she runs into the now ranch manager, Colt. Sparks fly but they each deny it...until they can't. The daughter is precious and steels the cowboy's heart right along with her mother.This is a great read and was well-written. I definitely recommend it.

It appears I am a minority reviewer. I really didn't care for this book and my reaction to it was left me with sadness, anger and disbelief. I had a real problem with the hero, Hank. He seems like an alright kind of guy...maybe, but he has been a man that has shirked his responsibilities and abandoned his child/children. I am sorry to say that in my view he was not an honorable man. When Hank was a teen he let his pregnant girlfriend think he had abandoned her and the child...the child he did not want. He now has a daughter he has seen a handful of times and the only responsibility he has taken is sending financial support to the ex. He probably would have continued to avoid his child if his ex-wife had not planned a three month vacation and sent her to him at the ranch. The man had a ten year old daughter he had seen a handful of times in the past nine or ten years. His so-called excuses were worse than lame, they bordered on ridiculous. He was and is one who gives up much too quickly, lacking in strength of character. He did not fight for what he wanted years ago.When he was a teen he and the love of his life, Kelly, got pregnant and he reacted horribly. He left her in a very bad situation and she lost the child. He now tells her he was trying to earn money and he was going to marry her and they would raise the child. That is true, however, It's a shame he forgot to fill her in on the plan. She lived next door, it wasn't like he didn't know how to find her. She lost the babe and left, unable to live next door to the man she so desperately loved. He deserted her and had not gotten in touch with or tried to find her after she was kicked out of her home. She was shattered and destroyed beyond belief because young or not he was her world and she deeply loved him. He said she was his world, as well, but said horrible, almost unforgivable, things to her yelling accusations and leaving her to believe he had abandoned her. After she left he did not try and find her but instead left for the rodeo and jumped right into another woman's arms, married her and to top it off had a child with her when he didn't want a child with Kelly. If that is what love is I want no part of it.  He completely shattered the only woman he says he has ever loved. As the book said Hank moved from stunned disbelief to anger (about her pregnancy.) The book also says, The long line of mistakes he'd made with Kelly stretched clear back to the day she'd given him the wonderful, awful news she was pregnant.It was not like our hero learned much from his mistakes as he kept making them in the present like not listening to Kelly and getting them caught out in a bad storm, being ok with just letting her walk away again and not going after her, yelling at her and once again saying heartbreaking things. He was also keeping secrets from her, pretending to be a big hot shot realtor when, in fact, he actually lost his business due to the economy (or poor management which the book does not say. With all of his other lousy decisions and lame excuses it makes me wonder if it was really the economy.) That caused her to feel used because she had hired him to sell her grandfather's ranch and he certainly needed the money. All he owned fit in his truck. and when she told him how she felt (being used for the money) he turns it around and claims she used him. He let her down many years ago and he continued to let her down. He let his daughter down, as well. What is it with some men who have children and rarely see them, completely absent from their lives and he knew it was not a life he wanted his daughter to live but did nothing. There is no excuse that would ever be good enough to warrant what he did to Kelly and to his daughter he had with the ex-wife that he never loved. At one point the ex had so many flings he didn't know if the child was his. The list of errors and mistakes just continued to grow throughout the book and for this reader those outshone the relationships and the HEA. Kelly really deserved better than Hank and after all the mistakes he continued to make I would think she would be leery of trusting him. I sure would be. His history of abandonment should have scared her to death. How did she know he wouldn't do it again, especially towards the end when he stopped fighting for her.I know you all will rant and rave about my review and I am truly sorry that I did not like the book. For me, it was a stretch to give this book two-stars but maybe this will help you understand why I feel this way. This is only my opinion because, unfortunately, I have lived most of this story. My now ex-husband has refused to meet his son since he left when I was pregnant and had another child with someone else shortly after our child was born. Thirty-three years later and he continues to be absent while having other kids by various women. My feelings are not sour grapes but they are from someone who has felt and lived the pain, known the devastating heartache first hand. I knew exactly how broken and destroyed Kelly felt. I could feel in my gut the things she felt when she felt abandoned by the one person she loved most and the agonizing pain she felt when he moved on so quickly, married and had another child when he really didn't want the one she was pregnant with....not at first anyway. It is a soul-shattering brokenness that no one should ever have to feel and live with and I identified with her greatly. If you have not lived it then you have no idea how horrific it feels, like you are going to die from the brokenness and immense pain. I have felt what she felt. That is why I feel as strongly as I do on this subject matter and I understand that everyone thinks Hank is great...but I don't. I just didn't think much of the guy for all his mistakes and choices. He was weak in my opinion, at least that is how I saw him. I was so bothered by this book that I was up almost all night feeling frustrated...even angry for his behavior. It has certainly not caused other people to feel this way but if you have lived this pain and abandonment and been so broken you didn't know if you would survive it maybe you will understand why this book affected me so strongly in a negative way. It is one thing to read this book and enjoy it if you haven't lived the devastation, but totally another if you have and all the old wounds crack open a little bit.

Beautiful pediatric surgeon Naomi Horton has a strong desire to have a baby of her own but her marriage failed and she has not had much success with the dating scene. She is strongly considering having a child on her own by artificial insemination but she just might have second thoughts when she meets the new Chief of Pediatric Trauma Surgery.Gorgeous Rick Weber (makes me think of the good old days on General Hospital) and Naomi Horton have an undeniable connection from the second they lay eyes on one another and the air sizzles between them. A wife and family are nowhere on Dr. Rick's wish list. He doesn't feel or do emotions, period! His emotional walls were erected years ago and he is not about to let them tumble down.When they travel together for a medical conference in Chicago the sizzles burst into flames and they have a wonderful, sweet, sensual love affair but before they can return home he tells her he doesn't want her. He viewed it as a no-strings-attached weekend. Too bad he didn't fill Naomi in on that bit of info. She had already told him she would not have a fling so when he continued to pursue her she thought he wanted more.Several weeks after the convention Naomi discovers she's pregnant and she is doing her best to ignore the good doctor. Her heart is broken because she loves him like crazy and he has made no effort to contact her. She's already lost one pregnancy and decides to wait until she has passed the three-month mark before she tells him. That admission doesn't go too well.A great book. I loved it. There is not a lot of angst, not the kind that has everyone all tore up for long periods of time. It is sweet and lovely and it will definitely go on my re-read list. The writing and medical understanding was very good. I highly recommend this book!!

This Calculus book is exactly what my son was required to purchase for his university class. It appears to be in like new condition. A better condition than we can buy used at the university bookstore at only half the price. We are very pleased with it.As far as the calculus itself is concerned, he has not learned enough yet to review the actual lessons and problems but I do know that it was a highly rated textbook. I highly recommend this product.

**4.5 Stars**I truly enjoyed this book and what a great surprise that the Hero was NOT a man-whore. You don't find that very often anymore. I'm fed up with reading about men and their bedroom-hopping antics.Nate Longmire is a very good looking, somewhat awkward, totally brilliant, and a tad nerdy billionaire in the app industry. He is a sweetheart of a guy who is suffering the loss of his brother and sister-in-law due to a horrific vehicle accident that claimed their lives. He was awarded guardianship of their six-month-old daughter and he is totally perplexed, knowing absolutely nothing about babies and children.Trisha shows up at his home, sent there accidentally by his assistant who thought she was applying for the nanny job. She was actually supposed to meet Nate at his office to discuss his possible donation for her charity.Trish is completing her masters and began a charitable organization for the Lakota American Indian kids to help with school supplies, lunches, a healthy afternoon snack program, and eventually computers. She works alone and almost lives in abject poverty herself as she tries to find aid for the Lakota children. She was one of those children years ago and is desperate to make their lives a little better. She has a plan and it includes one gorgeous billionaire who she believes may be willing to help her organization.I totally loved this book from the very beginning. It did not take any time at all to get into the story, it moved at a pleasant pace and did not drag.I deducted half a star because of the redundancy of Trish's thoughts and explanations about being so determined to be unlike her mother. I do find it a bit odd that she seemed to be clueless about the depth of her and Nate's relationship and that it didn't resemble her mothers dependency on men in any way. I also understand she was 25 and had absolutely no experience with men or dating but she was a little out there in this area and we heard it many times. Other than that it was a great read! I highly recommend it. It's low on angst, no violence, some hot sexcapades and a man and woman who made each other a better version of themselves just by being together. They fit like puzzle pieces and their love story is quite lovely. I read where another reviewer thought it was too insta-love but I did not feel that way in the least. People can and do fall in love in a month's time. Sometimes you just meet someone and you know...you just know...like it grabs you and nothing you can do can pull you away from that force. You also have to realize that she was a live-in nanny and he worked from home so if you consider all the hours they spent together every day...and night, It would be equivalent to going on a 4-hour date approx. 90 times.

I truly enjoyed this book. It was a light, fun read with little angst. In today's books that is a pretty big deal as the story lines usually seem to be mired in angst and 'happy' comes along in the last two pages. 'Disorderly Lady' was a pleasant surprise. A huge plus for me was a totally hot and faithful man from the moment he met 'the one.' I was a bit worried because of his reputation that he may have dalliances but he did not. He was faithful to his heart even when he assumed she was not. Bless you for that Ms Conn.I won't go into the details of the story as many others have already done so. It was well written and the editing was spot on!

I am so sorry to say that I did not like this book any whatsoever. The story line was okay and it had the potential to be a very good story, but it sorely missed the mark.Darcy Penn is a very sensible waitress in Vegas and this is her final night at her job. Jeff Norton is at one of her tables and it seems she gets to him and he doesn't want the night to end. Unfortunately it does...with Darcy in his bed. When he excuses himself to go to the restroom to dispose of the latex he discovers a very serious malfunction. Before he can get back to Darcy, who is supposed to be waiting in bed, she quickly and quietly escapes before he can break (pardon the pun) the bad news. She is regretting what she has done because sensible Darcy does not do one night stands. She wants it to be more.Jeff heads home the next day not wanting to end his brief relationship with Darcy but instead within a few weeks he gets involved with another woman, the perfect love interest for him, one, he feels, is a super great fit for him and his life. He has already planned to propose to her in approx 6-months...but they have only been together 5-weeks. That does it for me right there. Why in the world didn't he try and find or contact Darcy if he wanted more from their relationship. He was a very wealthy man and he could have had her found if he really wanted her. Instead, typical man, he thinks he has found his perfect match in just a very short time.I simply despise this type of situations with the other woman, all the misunderstandings, and the stupid game of trying to guess how the other one feels. Ugh! I looked so forward to this book and I am so disappointed.I am sorry that I cannot recommend this book, but you may want to try it for yourself. The situation in this book is one that is hard for me to tolerate. Maybe it isn't the same for you.

I found this story interesting at first and was enjoying the read but after getting into it a little ways it quickly became very redundant. The same feelings and emotions over and over again: wash, rinse, repeat. She wants him...won't let herself have him and we hear/read this continually throughout the book. The only reason for giving this two stars instead of one is because of the HEA...finally.Alex Ryan lost his wife, the love of his life, to cancer four years ago. He has been merely existing, certainly not living. His in-laws, especially the mother-in-law, makes sure to keep him living in the past, scared to death that he may move on. She is one wacky woman, mentally unstable, and the bane to his existence in my  opinion...not his. It was quite sick and sad that she wanted Alex to remain living in the past spending all his time keeping his dead wife's memory alive 24/7. The really aggravating point here is that Alex allowed this. He went to spend the day once a week with the in-laws still, just as he and his wife had throughout their marriage. Instead of speaking his mind and beginning a new life, he did whatever she suggested, giving into her every whim, and he was constantly concerned about her and that fed into her instability. I was so disappointed in him for going along with this craziness until close to the end. They loved him, no doubt, but she was determined to keep her daughter alive in her life as well as Alex's so he would refuse to move on. She thought of him as a son since his parents were dead and was scared out of her wits that she would lose him.Paige Kenner is a single woman who decides to have a child on her own, no help from a man thank you very much. Using a local sperm bank she had a lovely daughter. She had made quite a few bad choices in earlier years, mostly due to her horrific parents. They are the absolute worst book parents I have ever read about. Disgustingly cruel. She can do no right. For me it was over the top for her parents to be so awful and for Alex's in-laws (who he looked to as parents) to be so controlling of him and his life. Just too much for one book. It discolored this story and just made it unbelievable.Alex and his wife had used IVF to get pregnant but it never happened and then she was diagnosed with cancer and died, Alex having the eggs and sperm destroyed. One day he gets a call from the sperm bank informing him that his specimen had been mistakenly used and as a result he was the biological father of a daughter. He goes to meet his daughter's mother and begins to visit regularly to get to know them. They fall in love and life is finally, after much angst and struggle, very good and love abounds. Then...another heartbreaking tragedy around 80%. A cruel twist of fate that nearly destroys Alex and their relationship. That is when my opinion changed dramatically from a pretty fair book to one I was sorry I read. It ruined the story for me and it failed to redeem itself in my eyes. I am a firm believer that there needs to be a balance in books. It is disturbing when most of the book is angst filled, sad and heartbreaking. How much did this author want Alex to suffer through? Wasn't losing his wife enough? Was it really necessary to have this major twist happen to this family unit that was just beginning? No...for me it was not necessary to add any more heartache. It tipped the book over the edge. The story was much too long and drawn out, frustratingly so.This is my honest opinion and I am still upset a day after completing the book. It actually left me feeling sick to my stomach and just writing this review is causing more upset. I am sorry to say that I, personally, cannot recommend this book. I see by the few reviews that I am definitely in the minority but this is simply how the book made me feel. I don't like to feel sad, heartbroken and frustrated after completing a book...even taken into consideration that the ending was okay. The last 20% was the ruination of 'The Daughter He Wants.'

4.5 Star ReviewJuly 16, 2015--Update RereadI love this book and thought it was just as great the second time through...maybe even better. A book I highly recommend!!!Daisy Huntingdon-Cross is a photographer and she loves to shoot weddings among other things. On Valentines day she had finished up shooting a wedding that had been held at a castle. It began to snow and her car was stuck in the car park. Seb, an employee of the castle-she thinks, saves her that night and she ends up spending it in his arms. They were both very taken with each other but she never heard from him so she didn't try to reach him either...until six weeks later when her pregnancy test gave up with a positive result.She knows the right thing to do is tell Seb he is going to be a father so she heads to the castle and manages to see and talk to him. He offers her marriage but with certain limitations she needed to understand and abide by like...there could be no love or emotion between them but they could bestow it on the baby, just not each other. Seb had horrible parents and he wanted to avoid the turmoil his parents were in his whole life. But can a wedding photog who has planned her very own wedding since she was a young girl give up on her own longings and ideas of love, raw emotion, romance, and a marriage as beautiful as her parents have? Will living together in a monogamous marriage without love and emotional involvement between spouses be enough?This was a great read and I could not put it down until I was finished with it. I highly recommend this read. I really like both main characters and it was sweet to watch the ups and downs of their relationship.

I have to be honest and say that I was not fond of this book at all and it left me feeling frustrated and wanting desperately to strangle the goody-two- shoes heroine.Shanal is set to marry Burton but she doesn't love him. It is a financial arrangement and she decided during the ceremony that she objects to living a life in a loveless marriage. She turns and escapes.Burton has wanted Shanal for a good while and took every advantage possible to bully her into marrying him. But there is no love at all, he just wants ownership, possession.Raif has been enthralled with Shanal since they were teens but she never had anything to do with him. As she rushes away from the church, he leaves the church to follow and help her. After a passionate few days together things begin to implode as Burton hunts for her, determined to make her marry him.Let me tell you something that was horribly irritating to me. This girl's family let her agree to tie herself to this awful man just for financial reasons. Her father was a surgeon and he knowingly kept his disease a secret from the hospital where he performed surgery and was the cause of a patient's death. Now her father is terminally ill but would rather risk his daughter's future because he is too prideful to take responsibility for his actions. He is basically broke because of paying off the grieving family. What parent in their right mind would let their beloved daughter marry a mean, emotional and mentally abusive worm of a man just so the ill father can save face and not admit his illness and the wrongful death? Just blew me away and not in a good way. Could a parent actually expect this of their child, their daughter, to live a miserable existence all for the purpose of hiding her father's shame? Good grief.To make matters even worse she is pregnant with Raif's baby, this is a good thing, but the ex fiance is once again forcing her to marry him and she is ignorant enough to go along with him even though she is in love with Raif. And let's not forget that Burton demands she abort Raif's baby. He drives her himself to a private clinic and....wow what a cowardly woman. Over and over and over again she refused to tell Raif why she had to marry this creep. Now, Raif was a billionaire, yes, you read it right. Not millionaire but Billionaire and heaven knows he could have fixed most anything. He wanted both her and the baby desperately and she treated him horribly to keep him away from her because Burton had warned her away from Raif. She is one of those heroines that is simply to stupid to be allowed a place in any book. No self respecting woman would do what she did. I despised her and the way her character was written. If she explained in her thoughts or out loud once, she repetitiously said it a hundred times why she had to marry this man. I was ready to chuck my Kindle through the family room window...it was for her father blah! blah! blah!...gag gag gag!!!  Now this father and mother lived in a very expensive mansion that could have been sold and they could have downsized. But no, daughter promised he would never have to sell his family home because they had already started making it wheel chair accessible, yet, he had no income. She was trying to support the family. Can we say doormat to the inth degree.As opposed to the other reviewers I thought this was a very poor ending to this series and I, in good conscious, cannot recommend this book. I wish I had not read it. The only saving grace was Raif.

I love all of Lee Binz's informational books on homeschooling. She is concise and to the point and explains things excellently. I will continue to purchase her books as long as I am homeschooling. I highly recommend them.

Grace Preston, perfectly beautiful with a sky high IQ headed home to Crystal Point for her sister's wedding. She also carries with her a life altering secret that she refuses to share with anyone...and no, she is not dying. At her sister's wedding she is paired with Cameron, the only man she has ever loved but ran away from because of unrealistic fears and expectations. Grace feels she doesn't fit in or belong anywhere. When she was a young teen she was sent to a boarding school while her three other siblings remained at home in their tight-knit little family unit as they continued to be very close and Grace felt horribly left out and unwanted. She was extremely gifted so her parents decided that for her to be challenged they would need to send her away to school. It came very close to destroying her life. She had skipped a grade and was bullied because she was young and naive. Her parents didn't hold back on what they expected of her and there was no question she was absolutely expected her to follow the path they had set out for her, including what kind of career she would have and where she would live. She had her own dreams but didn't dare follow them and did exactly what her parents wanted. She was too frightened not to. What parent in their right mind would send a young teen away to boarding school while they kept their three other children at home? They reside in Australia so what were they thinking went they sent their eighteen-year-old to New York City alone to live and take more schooling then begin her career in the field they had chosen for her. Excuse me, but what the heck?? Are they nuts? Talk about isolation.Of course Grace was laden with major emotional problems that kept her from really living life. She merely worked constantly and existed. So very sad. This is the second book I've read in the Preston Family from Crystal Point Series. The First one was 'The CEO's Baby Surprise.' There were  lots of similarities in these two books. Both Grace and MJ were messed up emotionally. They had the same kind of negative thought patterns and they hardly ever thought before they spoke, not caring how rude and nasty they sounded. It also didn't seem to bother them that their words hurt people they loved. They were, simply put, shallow, self-serving, and selfish beyond what is believable and realistic. If these two sisters behavior is so much alike in a blatantly negative way then we can assume that there is only one place to look...the parents. It is obvious they were both affected by their upbringing since their insecurities and poor emotional health were in the pits it is only logical that our fingers would point to the parents. Or possibly the author followed the same formula for the sisters which made them appear to be so alike. Not sure.Again, like in 'The CEO's Baby Surprise' the repetitiveness of thoughts, words, phrases and complete conversations was beyond all reason and annoyingly did not encourage me to move forward but I did finish the book. The ending was sweet but the book became tiresome.Now I must mention Cameron (not my son Cameron but the book hottie Cameron--good name BTW.)  I believe he was a good guy and did many things to help others and the community. I also believe he truly loved Grace. He teased her unmercifully, ruthlessly with snide comments, addressing her with condescending names and said purposely hurtful things even when he realized she was hurting and something was wrong with her. I did not appreciate that part of his character and even with the HEA it still bothered me at the end of the book.So, I think I'm done with this series. The two books I have read are just barely okay, in my opinion. But you should certainly try them for yourself. Obviously my opinion is quite different from the majority.

Mark Dennison was on a mission to save the life of his beloved daughter (who deserved a good bit of discipline if you ask me.) If she didn't receive a transplant she was not going to make it. Mark knew just who he needed to go to for help. Catherine, the twin sister of his dead wife, whom he blamed for his wife's death and banished from his and his niece's lives, not allowing her to see her own niece in ten years. She was his best chance at restoring his daughter's health.Mark had secretly had strong feeling for Catherine since the day he met her when he went to pick up her sister for their fourth date. He broke it off with the sister because of his strong feelings for Catherine but the ex-girlfriend/sister conveniently comes up pregnant and he did what he thought was the right thing...by marrying her although there was no love involved. Big mistake! Ruined Lives! I had to wonder if the child was even his. Had she gone behind his back to get pregnant so she could trap him? I guess that was not the case but I was still left with that thought strongly in my mind.This is a story that clearly shows things are not always as they seem and Mark Dennison made a terrible mistake by denying his daughter the honor of having an aunt for the ten years his wife has been dead. The things he said to Catherine were shameful and nearly destroyed her. I really disliked him for a while because of this but he redeemed himself somewhat later on.My rating: As I was reading through this book there was a lot of one step forward, two steps back...that kind of thing with a bratty sick little girl who was given too much power and say so for a child. It actually caused me to dislike the child somewhat though I know it was not her fault. That blame lies directly on her father's shoulders. So up until the last two chapters my rating was going to be 3-stars but the story had such a beautiful conclusion that I raised that rating to 4-stars.I recommend this book and did enjoy most of it.

In this book we meet Mary-Jane who is subbing for her good friend who owns and operates a boutique in an upscale resort while the friend heads home to care for her sick mother. It is supposed to be a three-week gig that morphed into six months. While running the store she runs into Daniel, a beautiful, cocky, arrogant, full-of-himself, CEO of the resort and they have this undeniable monstrous sexual pull. Daniel travels between all of his family-owned resorts keeping tabs on everything and everyone so he is not around much at all but he does come to town to celebrate his grandmother's birthday. MJ, as she is called by friends, has also become close friends with his grandmother and attends her birthday gala.Now a little about the swoon-worthy Daniel. Other than the descriptions listed above he is also a sad, lonely, grief-filled man who lost his pregnant wife to an auto accident four years earlier and has sworn that he will never love again. Losing is too painful and he associates love with loss and brokenness. He is also thrilled to see Mary-Jane at his grandmother's birthday party and before long they are back in his bedroom and a month or so later she realizes she is pregnant with his child.MJ is an honest woman and knows she must tell him he is soon to be a father. He has been calling her since their night together and he feels so drawn to her that he wants to continue seeing her until he gets her out of his system. She is indignant and tells him to go to hell. Wow!Unfortunately this book is mostly about their battles, their stubbornness and Mary-Jane's continual whining. In her warped mind Daniel can do nothing right and she is determined to keep him out of her life and is not to keen on letting him be a father as well although she says she is. Her actions speak louder than words and her dialog is so repetitive that I was ready to lay the book to rest numerous times but I trudged on for Daniel's sake. I was curious to see if she would ever treat him as a human being. She was terribly bitchy and I longed to reach through my Kindle and strangle her. We hear the same thing from her throughout the whole book, minus the last few pages and I had every whiny, stupid line memorized and somewhat lost interest. It was a shame since the storyline was a very good one. I just didn't care for Mary-Jane and she was her own worst enemy. She was not likeable in the least and if the protagonists are not likeable then it is difficult for me to like and enjoy a book. Her words hurt Daniel at every turn and hadn't he already been through enough?I like my books more balanced. We all are aware there will be angst  and heartache but also love and devotion as well as a HEA (well, most of the time) but it is my opinion that there needs to be some happiness as well and there just wasn't much of it to speak of until the last few pages. That is just not enough for meMy favorite part of this book: Once Daniel has been intimate with Mary-Jane no other woman is enough and he remains celibate during their time apart. He had one date and was so miserable that he had her home by 9pm and only kissed her hand goodnight! That is a good thing for this reader who detests man-whores. The sleeping around stuff just doesn't get it for this gal. Daniel had class.My least favorite: MJ's repetitiveness and unwillingness to look beyond her own self and insecurities to see the man that Daniel was and understand the horribleness that he lived through losing his wife and unborn child.Would I recommend this book? Probably yes, but I will say that it is not a re-read for me. I am interested in the connecting stories from the other characters in this book and will give them a try.

This was a good book and one of the better ones in the 'One Night Series.' I highly recommend this read!In this story you will meet 25-year-old, Claire, who is painfully shy and overwhelmed by chatter and people. She prefers to remain quiet and in her own company. Claire's father received a threat against her and she now has her own personal bodyguard, Michael, who is a dark-haired Adonis. He is also a quiet guy who has secretly been in love with Claire for years. You will definitely want to read this to find out more about their relationship and how they both try to work through their issues and which one of them runs away.

I have really liked the Uni-Ball Pens since they were first introduced and they are all I use when I need a pen. These are very classy looking with a subtle design on each pen, however, the writing is not as good as other Uni-Balls I have purchased. The smoothness is missing and when writing a word there are little blank spaces where the ink skips. Personally, I don't like going back over what I have written to correct the missing ink because I usually make a mess of it. I also had the pleasure of filling out some very important forms that were front and back. The ink bled through so badly that you could hardly read what I wrote. Unfortunately, there was not an option to get another blank copy to redo the forms with a non-bleeding pen so I had to send them in as they were and they were difficult to read.My 2-star rating is a reflection of the pen's ability to get the job done. If I have to go back over every word I write to fill in skipping ink, it is simply not worth it and I would not re-purchase.

This is a nice basic MP3 Player but confusing to use at first! I am unsure though why its labeled as a MP4 player but I might be doing something wrong when transferring.. So when I first got this MP3 player I was a little put off by the controls but that is because I was trying to use it as a iPod.. Total learning curve and I wanted to throw it away.. But after learning the controls and after using now for a month I am totally in love with this little player. When you unpackage it don't even try to work the controls after charging- Just plug into our computer and transfer music onto it. I have a Mac and it was a flawless transfer process after I learned how to convert to MP3. Just drag and drop my songs from ITunes ( that I purchased and own ) on to this drive in which your computer will recognize.. ( also if you contact the seller they will send you some converting software and tips FYI )One thing I want to add is it says MP4 but when transferring songs from iTunes, iTunes for the most part is MP4.. For some reason even though this player says MP4 it WON'T read them.. So you have to convert the songs from MP4 to MP3 ( easy process in iTunes search Youtube for the process ) Once you have the songs transferred in MP3 format they will play.. Videos transferred don't play for me.. My downloaded movies are in MP4 and I haven't followed the instructions emailed to me by the seller for converting that, too much work , but the screen is a little small for that or reading books )After your music is transferred that is it! I walk daily and was bringing my phone with me ( which is nice ) but my phone is bulky and I love having a lightweight music player, and I don't have to worry about dropping my phone ! The controls are a little hard to get used to. The middle button will prompt volume and you can use the arrows to adjust. To get back to the main menu when in a category like Music press and hold the Menu button.. If you forget to turn it off after a few minutes of inactivity it will turn off ..Another negative for me is the charger.. It's a USB charger that is old school so you have to remember to keep it charged as the newer micro charging ports won't fit.. II did receive at no cost for this honest review from the seller but I am happy with this player for what I am using it for. Its basic, no thrills but works great now that my music is converted to MP3 !!

The Lenovo Tab 2 A10 10.1 inch tablet is a great tablet with great performance. I have 8 apps running as well as some other services and everything is very fast.  It has a full HD 1920x1200 resolution screen, which is very nice with a quick touch response.  The CPU is a "lightening speed" 1.5 GHz 64-bit ARM MT8165 with 4 cores.  It has 2GB LPDDR3 memory and 16 GB of internal storage.  The tablet also accepts a MicroSD card for up to 64 GB of additional storage.  I'm using a SanDisk Ultra 32GB UHS-I/Class 10 Micro SDHC Memory Card Up to 48MB/s With Adapter- SDSDQUAN-032G-G4A [Newest Version], but there is a 64 GB version.  The tablet came with Android 4.4.4 (KitKat) but was upgraded in mid-July to Lollipop 5.0.1,  The wi-fi is fast (Dual Band Wi-Fi (2.4GHz 802.11 b/g/n + 5GHz 802.11a)).  The rear camera is 8 megapixels (with 4x digital zoom and movies) and the front camera is 5 megapixels. It does have GPS for using maps and other apps that use your location.  Lenovo states the 7000mAh Li-ion battery life is 15.5 hours of mixed use. Over 3 hours I played a movie, a game, and used some apps and the battery went from 100% to 78%.  An optional Bluetooth keyboard is available.I deducted one star for audio performance.  Reportedly it has a multi-speaker Dolby Atmos Cinematic Moving Audio system.  Lenovo states "This unique technology delivers a profound audio experience that seemingly wraps itself around you."  However I can't tell that the Dolby Atmos audio is doing anything. The Dolby app doesn't respond. The speakers are in the back and it certainly doesn't project the sound to the front of the tablet. The headset volume seems OK, but the speaker volume on some Youtube videos and my personal movie collection is so low at maximum volume that I had to install the Speaker Boost app to increase the volume.Wow, the AnTuTu Benchmark general performance test results indicate that the Lenovo Tab 2 10-inch tablet has "rather high performance, surpasses 95% of other devices."  For gaming performance the benchmark indicates that it has "high game performance, surpasses 60% of other devices." (These benchmarks were for both KitKat and Lollipop.) The flight simulators that I've played run great.I don't know if the tablets currently being shipped are running KitKat or Lollipop.  But my upgrade experience was very good and I have not noticed any performance degradation on the Lenovo tablet with Lollipop.  I can't say that for my old Nexus 7 tablet.The performance is great and the price is very competitive.  I'm going to buy one for my wife.

I compared these Scott Choose-A-Sheet paper towels to the Bounty Paper Towels, 12 Select A Size Big Rolls.  The individual sheets are very similar in size:  the Scott towel is 7 inches by 11 inches wide and the Bounty is 6 inches by 11 inches wide.  The Bounty paper towel feels thicker.  The Scott towel weighs 0.07 ounces and the Bounty towel weighs 0.08 ounces.For a test I placed each towel in a bowl of water and let it totally soak up as much water as possible.  Then I pulled the towel out of the water and held it by one corner for 30 seconds.  Both towels had only a slow drip after 30 seconds.  I then weighed it again and deducted the original weight of the paper towel.  The Scott paper towel held 0.4 ounces of water by weight.  The Bounty paper towel held 0.65 ounces of water by weight. So the Bounty Select-A-Size paper towel held 62 percent more water by weight than the Scott Choose-A-Size paper towel.

I put this netting up and it's about 2 inches from the window glass.  So now the cardinal can't get to the glass and has left.  One of the best things is that if you're standing in the house about 6 to 8 feet from the window you can't even see that there is any netting on the windows.

The Fintie Lenovo Tab 2 A10 Case fits the Lenovo tablet very well.  There are holes in the right places for the controls, speakers, camera, etc.  It automatically turns on the display when you lift the flap and turns off the display when you close the flap.  The flap has 3 sections and you can fold them into a triangle and prop up the tablet for viewing movies,etc.  There is a magnet in the last section of the flap and when you fold it into a triangle it snaps into place to keep it locked in position.  Also when you rotate the tablet vertically you can hold onto that triangle and it gives you something to hold onto.The only thing I didn't like is that when I first got it it had a rather bad odor.  So I left it out in the garage for a couple days and after that the odor was gone.

The Shark Rocket Hand Vac has really good power.  It weighs about 4 pounds with the power vacuum attachment and has a 15 foot cord.  There is not a cord holder so I end up just wrapping the cord around the handle.  There is a filter in the top of the Shark and It is easy to dump the contents in the bottom.  Because of the smoke colored plastic you can easily see when it needs to be dumped. The power vacuum attachment has a 4.5 inch wide brush that spins.  The head of the power attachment will also rotate to vacuum a vertical surface which is convenient if you want to vacuum the front side of carpeted stairs.  The other two attachments are a brush (non-powered) and a pointed crevice tool.  There is also a flexible hose that can stretch from 17 inches to about 5 feet.  However this hose is not powered so it won't spin the power attachment if you were to connect it.  The Shark Rocket was pretty good for jobs like furniture and the comforter.  But for floors you'll have to bend over to use it and I found that the 15 foot cord was too short for the whole room.  For the car the Shark had a lot of power for the carpets and mats but I had to get out an extension cord, which I don't have to do with a cordless vacuum.  I used the power vacuum attachment for the carpets as much as I could and it did a great job, but I kept having to switch out the attachments again and again  With the power vacuum attachment the Shark is 21 inches long, so there were places in the car that I couldn't get to because of the Shark being too long.  It's also 21 inches long with the non-powered brush, so I had put on the flexible hose to reach some places.  The Shark is a lot more powerful than my cordless vac but it can be a bit more of a hassle to use.

This Hoover Commercial CH53010 Bagless vacuum has a lot going for it.  I would give it 4.5 stars.  It has a HEPA filter and an indicator when it is time to clean it.  It's bagless and it is easy to dump the contents.  It cleans well on both carpets and hard surfaces.  The cleaning path is 13 inches, which may be about average.  It is pretty easy to push around.  It weighs about 15.5 pounds when the electric cord is unwound.  The cord is extra long (about 40 feet) so you don't have to change where you have it plugged in quite so often.  It doesn't have an automatic cord winder if that is what you are looking for.  It also does not have a motorized attachment for vacuuming furniture if you need that accessory.  It just has the standard 2 attachments, one with a brush and one with a narrow tip, plus a plastic extension tube.  It is easy to access the belt and belt roller if they need to be serviced.  There is also a window to view the belt.  Overall it's a nice vacuum.

The Black & Decker 5 Minute Pizza Oven was provided to me by Amazon for my evaluation of it.  I also received a letter that "testing samples" had unfortunately been sent to reviewers rather than the production models. So hopefully Black & Decker has fixed the problems.  The letter states that the heat distribution and flimsy crumb pan have been improved.In my test I baked a Digiorno rising crust pizza in the oven.  I followed the instructions for a rising crust pizza, which stated to preheat the oven and then bake the pizza for 10 to 14 minutes at 600 degrees.  After 12 minutes the front of the pizza looked like it needed additional cooking time but the oven was smoking, so I pulled the pizza out.  The front of the pizza needed another minute or two, while the back of the pizza, which I could not see while it was baking, was burned and smoking.  (See the photo I uploaded.)You may not want to select this as your primary oven.  It is not very versatile. The controls only give you options for temperatures of 350 and 600 degrees.  If your recipe calls for 425 degrees, you'll have to experiment with baking times. There is no light in the top of the oven to watch the baking progress. The timer is not very loud.  The timer only goes to 30 minutes.  The internal dimensions are approximately 12.25" x 12.75" by 2.5" so anything larger than that is going to be an issue.  And the metal crumb tray is easy to bend when you wash it and difficult to slide back into place.

Personal is Lee Child's version of The Day of the Jackal.  While there wasn't always a lot of action there was the suspense of possibly being shot by a sniper with a grudge from more than 1,000 yards away.  I actually thought it was pretty well written and better than his 2013 book Never Go Back (Jack Reacher). Or at least I was thinking that for the first two-thirds of Personal, and then things changed.  I don't know if Lee had to meet a publication deadline or what, but the quality just dropped off in some respects.There was one scene (Chapter 46) where it seemed like Lee must have been smoking something.  It must be the worst scene in all of his books.  I don't want to make this a spoiler, so I won't give many details, but the scene goes like this: Reacher and his lady friend's plan is to kidnap a VIP who is in a car leaving his house. The front car has the VIP, his driver, and 2 armed bodyguards.  There is another car right behind it with 4 armed bodyguards, so a total of 6 armed bodyguards, maybe 7 if the chauffeur is armed.  Reacher figures he has 3 seconds to do the job before the 4 armed bodyguards in the second car can jump out and react.  Reacher's car pulls in front of the VIP car to make it stop before pulling into the street.  Then Reacher's internal stopwatch starts. Reacher jumps out of his car, runs to the VIP car, opens the front and back doors, holds a gun to the VIP's head, has a linoleum knife in his other hand and makes 2 cuts to the seatbelt of the armed bodyguard sitting beside the VIP, leans into the car and gives a backhand elbow to the far side of the bodyguard's head which knocked him out of the car, then shuffles sideways and reaches up into the front seat and makes 2 cuts to the seatbelt of the bodyguard in the front seat, leans into the front seat and gives a backhand elbow to the far side of the bodyguard's head which knocked him out of the car, then turns and kicks the first bodyguard in the head, and then kicks the second bodyguard in the head.  Reacher now runs back to his car, jumps into the drivers seat, puts the car in gear, moves his car out of the way, then jumps out of his car and runs back to the VIP car. Now 4 seconds have elapsed and the 4 bodyguards have just jumped out of their car.  Not even Tom Cruise could do that in 4 seconds.  If reality were not suspended, Reacher would have been filled with multiple bullet holes.  End of the Jack Reacher series.  All I can think of is that it must have been Superman.  Is there any other explanation?I would say that I did like the ending, so the last third of the book wasn't totally FUBAR.

Stuart Wilde's Little Money Bible includes the ten laws of abundance.  Money is just a form of energy and Stuart includes a quantum approach to manifesting money.Don't pay $77 or more for this title.  You can find the same title on this Amazon page for about $11 Little Money Bible: The Ten Laws of Abundance

Stuart Wilde was a visionary who wrote about shamanism, the mirror-world, the 26 dimensions, the zero point, the etheric doorway, the grays, etc at least as far back as 2000 in Sixth Sense. Then in The Art of Redemption, Stuart wrote about the Morph and the Matrix, and the doorways to the celestial dimensions. In Grace, Stuart updated these issues and revealed that grace can offer us hope, healing, protection, and clemency during the end times.The Amazon page indicates that this title is only available from 3rd party sellers, which is incorrect.  Don't get ripped off by paying nearly $400 for this book.  You can purchase this title for less than the retail price:  Grace, Gaia, and the End of Days: An Alternative Way for the Advanced Soul

This is a great book which helps you to learn dowsing.  Dowsing is not just about finding water.  There is far more than can be done with dowsing beyond finding water or lost objects. Raymon Grace explains how you can also use dowsing and the alpha state to change the frequencies of energies and therefore change your health, wealth, and the future.While this is a 5 star book, I would point out that this webpage is incorrect when it states that this book is only available from 3rd party sellers.  You can find the book here for about $10 or so:  The Future Is Yours: Do Something About It!.  It is a bit difficult to find new copies of this title at a reasonable price because there is a revised edition that sells for about $12:  The Future Is Yours: True Stories about Dowsing, Spontaneous Healing, Ghost Busting, and the Incredible Power of the Mind.  Don't let the ghost busting topic scare you off.  (It's also a topic in the original book.)  The author explains that to heal some people or to clear the houses that they lived in, some ghost busting was required.  One of the first books that I read on that topic was The Unquiet Dead: A Psychologist Treats Spirit Possession.  I've have to say that I believe that Raymon Grace has a more powerful way of dealing with the issue.

I found the battery to be excellent.  For example, we went out on a catamaran and I manually updated my Panasonic camera's GPS position and then took over 125 pictures and about 5 minutes of video.  My camera showed that the battery still had 3 bars (which is the maximum).  On my old battery if I updated the GPS and took a few pictures it would go down to 2 bars.The charger works by USB only.  You can't plug the charger directly into a 110 volt wall outlet.  When I first got the battery and charger I plugged it into my computer's USB port to charge the battery.  Then I noticed that my computer was totally frozen up.  I tried Ctrl+Alt+Del several times and finally had to turn off the power.  So I suspect the charger in this case because my computer had been working fine and it has never locked up like that before.  Since then I've just plugged the charger's USB cable into my cellphone charger and it has worked fine.

The Click Megabrands puzzle was very low quality.  The cardboard was thin. Many of the pieces were warped. When the pieces are warped they don't stay together well.  Eight pieces were missing, and there was no dog that got onto the table to eat them.  Also, some of the pieces had dark grease stains on them like either the cutting machine was greasy or the puzzle had fallen onto the shop floor and was then picked up and put into the box--except for the 8 missing pieces.  The puzzle was made in China.  It's the first and last Click puzzle that I'll buy.Maybe your experience will be better.

These Avery 5881 color business cards are very nice and they're easy to create.  When you go to the Avery website to create your business card design there are over 800 designs that you can choose from, or you can choose a blank card and create your own design by importing your graphic image(s).  You can then save your design and import it later if you want to modify your card or print more cards.  I found the entire process to be quite easy and the business cards that I printed look very professional.  It was easy to fold the perforated edges and remove the excess paper and you can't tell that it was printed on perforated stock.Note that this product states that it is for color laser printers but I tried it on my Epson XP-860 color ink jet printer and the results were great.

These Anchor Hocking glass jars are pretty nice one gallon jars. The tag on the bottom indicates that the glass jars are made in the US.  However the lids are made in China.  We keep liquids in the jars and the lids have rusted, so we're not real pleased about the Chinese lids.It's a difficult decision to purchase these on Amazon when the shipping costs more than the jar itself.  We found them at a big box store for about this price but didn't have to pay shipping.

This first generation Google Nexus 7 tablet was a very nice tablet.  I would have given it 4 or 5 stars.  I never really had any problems with it.  But recently I received the notice that Android 5 Lollipop was available, so I installed it.  After the installation it has been like a different tablet.  It may take 30 minutes to do something that I could do in 5 minutes previously.  Sometimes it spontaneously reboots.  Sometimes the screen just goes black 3 seconds after touching the screen.  Frequently it is non-responsive.  Other times it is just really slow.  Dragging your finger(s) across the screen to scroll or zoom may not change the screen.  The Chrome browser crashes a lot.  The new email app in Lollipop frequently says there is no connection although the wi-fi icon at the top of the screen indicates that there is a good connection  and Chrome is connected.  So it has been very frustrating.  Sometimes it will work OK for a bit, and sometimes I think it would be best to try doing a factory reset to remove Lollipop.But for now I've started shopping for a new Samsung tablet.
Nice speaker. Good sound.  Easy to use.  Lasted two months before it died.  I didn't drop it or abuse it.  It still lights up but there is no sound.  Bummer.

The Black and Decker LSW20 box indicates that this is a "hard surface sweeper."  It does a fairly good job on patios, sidewalks, and driveways.  It is not as good at blowing leaves in the yard into a pile.  It seems to have a tendency to blow some of the leaves straight up into the air rather than away from you.  Battery life on a fully charged new battery is poor at only 10 minutes.  Hopefully in 10 minutes you can clear your patio and sidewalk.

This 3M car care kit has 7 products plus 5 microfiber detail cloths. It includes a car wash soap, quick wax spray, a wax protectant, leather & vinyl restorer, wheel & tire cleaner, lens & hard plastic cleaner, and a scratch remover. I used the lens cleaner on 10 year old headlight lenses and it worked good. 3M says it will remove minor scratches but it didn't remove some scuffs on the lenses.  The leather restorer didn't do any restoration and I didn't think it worked as well as Armor All. I sprayed on the wheel & tire cleaner, left it on for a few minutes and then washed it off at the car wash. I couldn't tell that it did anything, but then the instructions say that you have to use a brush (not included).Also not included are safety glasses, rubber gloves, and a respirator mask. There are warning labels on all 7 of the products regarding their health hazards. Some may cause cancer, birth defects or other reproductive harm, dizziness, headaches, & nausea. Avoid eye and skin contact and breathing vapors. Some vapors are combustible, so it is not advised to smoke while using them. Do not intentionally concentrate and inhale the contents, may be fatal. The scratch remover states: "Do not get on skin. Skin contact: remove contaminated clothing and shoes. Immediately flush skin with large amounts of water. Get medical attention...." It also states the product VOC (volatile organic compounds) is less than 17%, which means it may be 16.9%. I decided not to use it. Some other reviewers have commented that Amazon does not allow returns of these automotive products because they are "hazardous materials". There are other car care products on the market that do not have these health warnings, such as Armor All 25178 Ultra Shine Wash and Wax - 16 oz. Nu Finish Liquid Car Polish, Meguiar's A1616 Quik Wax - 16 oz., MOTHERS 05924 Foaming Wheel & Tire Cleaner - 24 oz, Nu Finish Scratch Doctor, and Turtle Wax T-240KT Headlight Lens Restorer Kit.My recommendation would be to consider the other car care kits that are more user-friendly such as possibly the Meguiar's G55032 Complete Car Care Kit. I haven't read the labels on all of their products but for the ones that I did check the warning was generally to avoid eye contact and/or prolonged skin contact.

I didn't get the impression that the Kobi LED bulb is as bright as a 100 watt bulb.  I put the Kobi bulb into a lamp on an end table which has four light levels.  Using a light meter app on my Android phone, the following four light levels were reported:  40, 76, 115, and 159 lumens.  The color seems a little weird too--which another reviewer indicated was a blue color.  I had been using a GE cool white (made in Mexico) 90 watt incandescent bulb in the lamp.  The light meter app gave me the following four light levels for the 90 watt bulb:  11, 64, 159, and 265 lumens.  So the brightest level on the KOBI bulb was shown as only 60% of the 90 watt bulb.  I'm not saying that the light meter app has the highest accuracy, but I believe that it did give a good comparison of the two bulbs.  One reason that the light meter app wasn't showing anything like the 1600 rated lumens for the Kobi bulb can be attributed to the design of the LED bulb.  The lower half of the bulb is pretty much solid plastic.  The vanes or fins on the lower half of the bulb are apparently for cooling.  So all of the light is directed upward.  Using the light in a table lamp, most of the light is directed towards the ceiling rather than down onto what you are reading.  I had my phone lying on the table surface for the 4 readings so that it was consistent for all of the readings.  When I held my phone up at the top of the lamp it was hard to get consistent readings.  I got readings in the 1000 to 1400 range near the top of the lamp depending on exactly where I held my phone.  If I had held my phone closer to the bulb the readings would have been higher.Be advised that if you're using the Kobi bulb in a table lamp and you're trying to read something, you may find that the level of light is insufficient.  .

Shane Ellison, also known as the People's Chemist, gives you the no BS scientific approach to nutritional health. Shane is an award winning chemist and drug designer. He is the author of Over the Counter Natural Cures: Take Charge of Your Health in 30 Days with 10 Lifesaving Supplements for under $10. In that book he's telling the dirty secrets of the pharmaceutical companies. Shane says, "My keen interest in nutrient logic helped me become an award-winning scientist and a medicinal chemist for one of the world's largest pharmaceutical companies. My studies and experience confirmed what I always knew: proper nutrient intake is the biggest determinant of overall health, longevity, and athletic performance. Nutrient logic has been saving lives throughout history." Nutrient logic states that humans can thrive with proper nutrients and will not thrive without these key nutrients. Shane quit his career as a drug designer because he was disgusted with Big Pharma's willingness to ignore nutrient logic as a viable and inexpensive alternative to drugs.Shane says, "A growing body of research revealed that soy protein contains plant estrogens such as genistein and daidzein, causing feminizing effects in the male body. A Harvard study published in the journal Human Reproduction also found a strong association between men's consumption of soy foods and decreased sperm counts. In total, studies show that soy increases inflammation, depletes the body of nutrients and disrupts thyroid function."Dr. Russell Blaylock is the author of Excitotoxins: The Taste That Kills. He states, "people who consumed the most soybean products had the greatest incidence of dementia and brain atrophy. These people are destroying their nervous system.... people ought to avoid soy products as if they were poison."Dr. Frank Lipman is an internationally recognized expert in the fields of Integrative and Functional Medicine. His website has an article entitled, "Soy is Not a Health Food: 6 Things to Know About Soy's Big Downside." He states, "While soy may not kill you outright, soy's ability to undermine health is significant, and as a Wellness Practitioner I always advise my patients to remove it from their diets. Why? Because soy plays a role in the development of a number of debilitating conditions, which can morph into far larger problems down the line. For starters, soy disrupts thyroid and endocrine function. It interferes with leptin sensitivity, which can set you up for metabolic syndrome. Soy screws with your sex hormones by throwing off the estrogen and testosterone balance. It also helps block your body's ability to access key minerals like iron, zinc, calcium and magnesium. If that weren't enough, soy is a potentially lethal allergen to a segment of the population and an inflammation-triggering irritant to millions of people who may not even be aware that they're sensitive to it." He also states that "it's estimated that well over 95% of all soy is genetically modified. It's also known to be one of the most pesticide drenched crops on the market."Dr. Lipman also said, "Factory-farmed soy crops are amazingly destructive to just about everything they come in contact with, stripping the soil of nutrients, sickening the livestock who are fed it, inflaming the bodies of the people who eat it, and polluting the bodies of those who till the land. Who wants to contribute to that man-made mess?" When I read that I felt a wave of sadness.If you want more information see the books The Whole Soy Story: The Dark Side of America's Favorite Health Food and The Hidden Dangers of Soy.
