It was so easy to get sucked in. I truly love these kinds of stories the Victorian gothic style.

Star Crossed Lovers by Clifford J Hearn is a  love story. But it has so much more to it taking in account it is set in WWII Britain. I read love stories occasionally, but they aren't always my first choices, but the fact this book had a historical backdrop I was drawn to it. The story is of two star-crossed lovers Hughes and Cotta who find each other in a war-torn Britain.This is book one in the Hepsom Abbey Saga. There is a plethora of twists and turns in this story. A story of love, loss and more. The characters are well developed. And the historical background is just the icing on the cake for me. I am looking forward to what is to come next in this saga.

I love this splitter. There are limited spigots in my yard. Coolife Garden Hose Spitter has made things so much easier. Now I can use two hoses at the same time if needed. Each side has its' on shut off valve. I was worried about connecting it to the spigot. I always have problems with getting things to connect to the spigot properly. I had no problems getting it attached and using it. It worked just fine. It hasn't leaked or caused any problems. I use it regularly for yard work and little cleaning things around the house. I am pleased.Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

Drachen: A Thriller (A Matthys Rossouw Pursuit Book 1) by Brenden Le Grange is a fast paced, action packed, thrill ride of a book. Brett Rivera has been searching for a shipwreck the Drachen for some time. It is said to hold  treasure. But when the ship is found there is no treasure to be found. From there the hunt is on. Brett is not only hunting treasure but being chased by a dangerous killer.I have never been to Europe, but after reading this I fee like I have been there. The author is  very detailed and descriptive. The characters are well written and developed for such a fast paced book. You never knew what was coming next. It kept me on the edge of my seat from beginning to end. I absolutely can't wait for the next in the series.

Sucker (Para-noir-mal Detectives Book 1) by Mark Lingane is a book I was instantly attracted to just from looking at the cover. And I love the name and the mixture of supernatural and noir. Van H. Avram is a PI who is sucked into a case he didn't particularly want to take on, but everything about it is drawing him in. A missing person case brings him face to face with an ancient evil that is set to destroy the world. Sometimes people become heroes even if they didn't ask for it.I thought this was a really good book. It kept me interested. I love anything dealing supernatural, fantasy, sci-fi and mysteries. So I found this book very appealing. I think this book is unique because it has so many different elements. I think that made it that much more enjoyable. I would definitely recommend.

When Water Flows Uphill by Beryl Shaw it is a thriller, that could potentially not be far from the truth in today's society in correlation to our water supplies or lack thereof. The story follows Dr. Armand Croft a scientist and amnesia victim who takes work importing water to Vegas. He is met with resistance by a man Gary Wixx who has put together a rancher's alliance to keep Croft from getting the job done. In order to get Croft to back down, threats are sent against people he cares about. It turns into all out war.It was an intriguing and thrilling book. I liked the characters. They were well developed, and you could connect with them. It held my attention and kept me on my toes as to what was to come next. If you like an interesting and suspenseful thriller. I would definitely recommend this as a good one to read.

Straight Talk About Franchising: What I Learned and You Need to Know: A Comprehensive Guide to Making a Choice and Putting It Into Action by Cynthia Readnower is filled with so much information. I have always been curious about franchising the ins and outs, and how it worked overall. I borrowed this book from a friend who had the same interest. I thought it was awesome the author had two franchise business for 6 years, and one was a top 10 performer.  This says to me this person know what they are talking about.I thought this book was well written. It is written so anyone could understand it. I loved the infographics and visuals. I am a very visual person. I comprehend better so this worked in my favor. She not only talks about picking a successful franchise but also the pitfalls. After reading this, I feel well informed. This book gives you a wealth of must-know information.

Words To Die By (Allison Taylor series Book 2) by Jeanne Lamb-Carlin was a great story. I never get bored with a good murder mystery with a dash of humor. I found myself engrossed, and the book was hard to put down. The main character Allison Taylor is a great character. I was able to connect to her immediately. She is living in a small town she used to summer at as a kid with her daughter after a messy divorce. She is working in a cafe as a barista. She reconnects with old friends and an old flame, and just to add that something extra serial killer is thrown into the mix. There is a great mix of mystery, murder and even a little humor here and there.This is the second book in the series. You can read the second as a standalone without feeling you are missing something. I enjoy series where it isn't absolutely necessary to read them in order. I do hope to read more from this author.

Experiencing God (Volume III): A Collection of Poems by Clare McNeill is a wonderful collection of poems written by the author at various points in her life and her connection with God. Some were written in extreme struggles and illness while others were written in more enjoyable moments in life. I am not surprised her first her first book Experiencing God Volume 1 was a best seller  on Amazon. She has a great way with her words that make her poems flow and you can feel what she is feeling through her words. I really enjoyed this book. Some of my favorite poems were The Great Silence, My Great Infallibility, A Psalm of Great Glee, A Psalm: A Prayer for Restoration and The Great Reflection. It is a well-crafted book of poems that really touch the heart.

I love the Coolife Garden Hose Nozzle/Hand Sprayer. I have been using it a couple of weeks now and got a good feel for it. And I think it is a wonderful item. I love the grip. It doesn't slip or slide or make my hand sore from spraying. It hasn't leaked on me. I love the choice in spray options. I have used it with yard work, cleaning and washing vehicles. It is an awesome price and works very well. I am very impressed to found such a great quality item at a reasonable price.Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

If you are looking for an emotional rollercoaster of a book The Cry of the Butterfly by Rajeev Roy is a much read. As I read the book occasionally I had to set it down because it just made me so emotional. It is a touching story that will let the tears come. It is a love story that is all so immersed in tragedy.The characters in this book are very intense and well written. The story follows main characters Wolf Butcher, Savannah Burns, and Robin. It is a story of losing someone you love, and being able to find love again. The book is filled with plot twist and turns that keeps you gripped page after page.Author Rajeev Roy has a way with words and I hope to read more from this author in the future.

Doomed Soul by Robert Boomsliter was an interesting and unique read. The book is based on the authors thoughts on religion, morality and death. I was very curious on what the author had to say. I grew up in an African American deep south Baptist church. As soon as I turned 18 and was given the choice to give up church I did. I saw nothing there, but fire and brimstone and hate. All these things in the name of God. While sitting there in a church filled with hypocrites.I felt for a long time like a doomed soul. You see all these horrible acts being committed all in the name of religion. So I could see where the author was coming from in some aspects. Some things I agreed with other things not so much. But I felt like he was sharing something of himself, not forcing his views. And I could appreciate that because there is nothing worse than someone forcing their views on you. It is a well-written book, short, sweet and to the point.

My first word after finishing Paine Time of Anarchy (The Paine Saga Book 1) by J Durbin was Wow! I love these types of books to begin with, but this book was just so gripping. Trying to rid the world of cocaine the CIA concocts a bioengineered plague to attack the cocoa plant. From there it is downhill from there. Goes to show the best intentions can yield the worst results. One thing I loved about this story is it could be a very real possibility something of this nature happening now.The story is about Michael Paine Martin who happens to be the son of a mercenary, and he is trying to protect his family from what is going on in the aftermath of the plague that has wiped out almost all of the food plants.  This causes the government to collapse and billions dead. Leaving those left to have to fend for themselves.The book is very fast-paced, and the characters are well written. I literally had to force myself to put it down when I had things to do. I cannot wait to read the next book in the series. A true thrill ride of a book.

ift of Sydney: An Epic Novel of the Struggle to Forge the Multicultural, World-Class City of Sydney, Australia (A Sydney, Australia, Series Novel Book 2) by Manning Richard was an epic read. I have always been curious about Sydney, Australia. It has for as long as I can remember been my number 1 travel destination. I have always been curious about Australia from a historical standpoint.The author did an amazing job. There was so much history, and it was obvious that they took time do a very thorough research.  The story centers around 3 families from different classes and background. You got to read of a European family, Aboriginal family, and Chinese family and their struggles at that time. I thought this was a really well-written historical novel that is fast paced, emotional and filled with adventure. I will be reading the prequel to this book very soon.

I must say this is not one of Big Brothers better seasons. I usually connect with at least one person or a couple of people in the house. It took a long time for that happen this time, and even then it just doesn't seem as good as previous seasons. I kind of  think the BOTB has played out. And it also kind of sucks on more than one occasion I had to wait hours to watch an episode. I usually get them first thing the next morning after airing, and a few times I had to wait until late afternoon. Sometimes I find that annoying.

Dom's Guide To BDSM Vol. 1 by Matthew Lorraco is a very knowledge filled guide in the world of BDSM dealing with Doms and Masters. I already knew some about this world, because I have dabbled in it here and there.This book was written by an author who obviously has great information in the subject. It was great to read a book that dispelled all the rumors and myths surrounding BDSM. It gave well-written information on the role of both Dom and submissive. It was a very informative book.I am not a novice in this area. And I still learned something. I recommend this to newcomers and even seasoned individuals in the BDSM world.

I have been having relationship trouble as of late. My latest relationship fiasco though not an epic fail. I was definitely stuck in the friend zone. And I had no idea why. I keep thinking something is wrong with me. Got a Bad Picker? By Jesse Carr has been quite the enlightening read.While it is a short read it definitely leaves and impression about yourself and relationships. Reading this book helped me realize the cause of my bad picker. The consequences of having a bad picker. How to fix a bad picker. I particularly love the wellness exercises to enhance your picker.I know it may take time, but I feel after reading this I have better understanding of myself as well as relationships in general. I love this book was easy to read and written so anyone could understand it. I can see myself reading it again.

The Hippity Dippity Witch (Jenny's Adventures in Willow Grove Book 1) by Lorraine O'Byrne is a very well written children's book. I purchased this book for my Goddaughter. She loved it. She loves anything deal with supernatural, magic, witches etc. etc. Of course, I read it first to make sure it was age appropriate. I was very impressed.The story follows two little girls Jenny and Marigold who are both doing poorly in their studies. Jenny is missing her spelling test by not going to class and Marigold is a failing at the Magic Academy. The story is well written with a great message. The characters are totally lovable, and the animals bring in some added entertainment.This is the first in a series, and my Goddaughter has already asked me to be  on the look out for the rest in the series.

I was super psyched to receive this yoga mat bag. I have recently started doing yoga, and while my mat has the strappy things sometimes it can be inconvenient to carry with everything else. This yoga mat bag fits my yoga mat with room to spare. It is spacious and roomy. When I go to class it is not necessary for me to bring a purse it has compartments to hold stuff like keys, id, cell phone...etc etc. It has nice vents and the material is of good quality. I wasn't sure I really needed one, but since I have started using it I can say I needed it. I have gotten many compliments on it. Oh, and I almost forgot it comes with a yoga ecourse which I thought was cool. I love it!!Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

Well, this is my second book by author Carla Prince the first being Love in a Boat which I really enjoyed reading. Love in a Cala was no different. Once again I got so absorbed I lost time and read the whole book when I should have been finishing chores around the house.The author's characters were well developed and likable. Her description of their Mediterrian location is vivid and pops out in your mind as you read. The story is about Luke and Tessa. Tessa is so over men and doesn't trust them at all. Luke is rather casual and non-committal. They are pretty much opposites. And you know what they say? Opposites attract. It was an adorable and engaging romance.I am happy to have read Love in a Cala. It was very enjoyable. You can never go wrong with a good romance. I really look forward to more from this author in the future.

Love in a Boat: A Mediterranean Romance novel by Carla Prince was a real delight. I was able to read this cute little romance novel in one sitting. If it is a good romance I can plow right through it, and this is a very good romance.Kate is a boat, lover. She prefers older boats with character. She hasn't had much experience with men when she and her lovable pooch meets Flynn and his luxury yacht. Flynn who is definitely an alpha is not really in the market for love. But the more he gets to know her the more the chemistry ignites between them.This a really sweet romance novel that is a quick read. I enjoyed it thoroughly. I can't wait to read more from this author.

The Billionaire's Hidden Heart: A Contemporary Billionaire Romance by Georgina Sand was pleasantly wonderful read. There is nothing like steamy hot romance, and a billionaire to brings a book to life. I loved the characters. The author did an outstanding job bringing them to life. Jon Baxter the billionaire who is smoking hot, sophisticated and obviously good at business. But he guards his heart. Demmie is small town girl who is vulnerable, innocent and shy.When Demmie wins a photography contest for Jon's Baxter's company things change. She leaves her small town for Miami. Jon and Demmie make an instant connection that is fire. But Demmie believes in love while Jon is all about sex. Can she change his mind?I really enjoyed this book. I thought it was fun read. I got through it in one sitting. There was lots betrayal, intrigue, deceit and, of course, hot sex!!

Birth of an Assasin is the second book I have read by Rik Stone, the first being The Turkish Connection. Rik Stone has a gift for telling a story. The words jump right off the pages as you are reading. You can sometimes feel as though you are right there in the action. And I love that about his books.Birth of an Assassin is an action-packed thriller set in Moscow, Russia. The story follows Jez Kornfeld who runs away to become a part of the Russian military. He has wanted this for  a long time. He ends up being taking in by a high ranking officer and becomes a trained assassin.I really enjoyed the book. It was filled with action, drama, suspense, intrigue and more. The author really seemed to know what he was writing about. You really felt like you were right there in the thick of it with the characters.

A friend recommended and loan this book to me One Before Bedtime by N.S. Johnson. My friend is well aware how much I like odd and out of the ordinary stories. I wasn't sold initially because  it was a collection of short stories. But the author did a wonderful series of short stories. Stories from various genres such as ghost, fantasy, mystery, suspense and fantasy.The title One Before Bedtime was spot on. I look forward to coming home reading one, or sometimes two or three before bedtime. But if you are not one for this type subject matter. You may want to read it way before going to bed.I really enjoyed each story. I was happy this book was recommended. If author N.S. Johnson's goal was to keep me up half the night. All I have to say is a job well done.

Floyd Merrell author of Looking Glass Killer: Volume II: The Matthew-Matt Trilogy was good but not exactly what I was expected. I was intrigued immediately after reading the synopsis. I thought I would give it a chance. I love anything dealing with serial killers or crime.The book is about a psychopathic serial killer, and the two cops Detectives Mike and Lucia who are devoted to bringing him in. The killer is fond of leaving puzzles, clues and riddles for the officers. But is it enough to catch the killer?I did finish the book, and for the most part I enjoyed it. However, it did seem to drag in certain areas. If I really like a book I will breeze right through it, but this one I would point it down for a day or so before picking it up again. But overall, I liked it. The ending was stellar.

Occasionally I have problems with acne and blackheads. And I never really knew how to handle it outside of popping and squeezing them which most times only make the problem worse. I did a little research and had heard these kits were very useful. I received this product as a promotion in exchange for an unbiased review. When I received it I was very excited to try it. Upon opening I realized there were no instructions and that was kind of a bummer. But it wasn't hard to find information and videos online on how to use the tools in the kit properly. Overall I am pleased instructions would have been nice, but it wasn't that big of a deal. I love the case. You have one spot for everything and it can be tucked away nice and neat.

I actually really love this kit. I was impressed with the quality of the kit, and all it had to offer. It had a wide array of threads in various colors, a measuring tape, scissors, needles and more. I love the fact is lightweight and easy to transport. I can stick in my purse or suitcase to take with me where ever. I love that I can find everything I need all in one place no matter where I am.Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

I borrowed this book from a friend. She recommended it. I really love this book. It is a total thriller. Send Flowers by Mike Crowley kept me on the edge of my seat from the beginning. I noticed a lot of reviewers referred to this book as John Grishamish, and I couldn't agree more. I guess that is why my friend recommended it. She knows I am a big John Grisham fan.The story is about a man named John Griffin who manages a pharmaceutical lab. His lab goes is set on fire because company executives realize the disease they are creating a cure for is more profitable with without the cure. So the executives have the lab set on fire. Griffin and a few from his lab end up on the run because they have been placed on a terrorist kill list by the company they once worked for. They find themselves on the run from military, CIA and other US agencies. And while on the run they are still trying to develop the cure.I love how fast paced this book is. It was so hard to put down. The plot and characters are well developed. This book is such an action thriller I can imagine it being something adapted to the big screen. I look forward to more from this author.

Talk about saving the best for last. I can say this author definitely ended this series on a high note. This book was the sixth and final installment in the Dragoneer series: Blood and Royalty by M.R. Mathias. I thought this book like the others in the series were adventurous and exciting. It was a real page turner.  The characters and the plot are so well developed that you feel like you are right there.It is definitely for those who like fantasy. And what I really loved about this book is it suitable for all ages. Plus, I love Dragons. If you are looking for a good fantasy series that will keep engrossed from beginning to end this series is a good place to start. I look forward to reading more of this authors works.

The Bishop, Comedians, Professor, Brothel, Prison and Eels by Clifford J. Hearn was an enjoyable, fun read. At first I was a little skeptical but I was intrigued at the same time after reading the synopsis. I read it and really found it enjoyable. There were numerous characters each chapter giving a day in the life of that person. I was slightly confused because I couldn't figure out where the book was going at first, but the author tied everything up nicely.This book will make you laugh out loud. It is very funny and entertaining. It has a huge cast of characters so close attention must be paid. If you are looking for a good book with a great cast of character and humor this is definitely one to consider reading.

I wasn't quite sure what to expect from Everybody Calls My Father, Father by Tim Anders. What I found was a captivating page-turner of a book. It is based on a true story of the authors life. The author's mother is a success on Broadway in New York. She meets Hughie Hewit charming guy, but an alcoholic. And he is hiding a really big secret. He is a Catholic Priest.The author wrote this book in such a way that the word just jump off the page. It is rare to find humor, romance, suspense, intrigue and more all wrapped in one book. I found myself laughing out loud, shedding tears, and being kept on the edge of my seat. I would definitely recommend. As other reviewers have mentioned I could see this becoming a motion picture.

I was very impressed with The Art of Going Down by Elizabeth Cramer. It is a very helpful and informative book. I found the book to address a multitude of issues including myths about cunnilingus, communication during cunnilingus, factors that inhibit the enjoyment of cunnilingus, receiving, positions and more.Initially, I thought this book was for men but after reading I knew it was for both men and women. I learned a lot about myself and my body such how to take care of my body and how to get the most enjoyment from the act. I would recommend this book to men and women if you want to know how to make cunnilingus a pleasurable experience for all parties involved.

I wasn't sure initially what to expect from a book called Tuna Life. I would have to say all kinds of things flashed in my head. I read the synopsis and thought it was intriguing. I found Erik Hamre's Tuna Life engrossing from beginning to end.The book is about a new app called Tuna Life. The book follows Andrew Engels an account who is bored with his job, and wants more. He and a friend create the Tuna Life app. The app becomes so popular so quickly Andrew soon realizes has no idea what the people he is working with is capable of. He starts having suspicions one of them is could be tied to a number of missing girls. I honestly don't want to give too much away.This book is filled with so many twists and turns it will make your head spin..in a good way of course. I definitely recommend. It is a really great who done it.

When I received this I couldn't wait to go on a picnic or get near the water. We ended up using the blanket at the beach. And I love it. I don't particularly like going to the beach because I don't like getting sandy, and it seems like you get the most sand from sitting on the beach blanket. I was impressed with the size of the blanket 3 of us fit on it easily.The pouch it came in is awesome. I couldn't believe how big it was when I took it out of the little carrier pouch. There are loops on the ends for stakes or hanging depending on what you want to do with it. I think this is probably the most versatile blanket I have come across. I have nothing but good things to say about this product. It dries quick, sand doesn't stick to it, it is versatile, it is a nice size and comes with a carrier pouch where you can fold it up and take it where ever easily. Recommended!!!!Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

That's My Love Story by Santosh Kalwor is a unique story not what I expected. But I tend to enjoy books that aren't what I expect at first glance. I thought it was a beautifully written story of one man's personal journey. It was like taking a glimpse into his soul. The story is about Prem a young boy from Nepal who has gone through a lot. He was bullied relentlessly growing up. He has gone through many failed relationships leaving him lonely and depressed to the point of being borderline suicidal. Prem decided to climb the mountain cliff to jump off. On the way going up, he meets a wise old man who walks and talks to Prem. From there it is a journey of discovery for Prem.I found this book to more of a motivational type of thing. I enjoyed it very much, and I felt for Prem. Because I understood a lot he was going through. I would recommend this book if you like something that has is positive and motivating. If you like something that leaves you feeling good at by the end.

The Turkish Connection by Rik Stone is a wonderfully written story. I was caught up from the start. I found myself intrigued and immersed in the story. The story is about a boy name Mehmet who went through more in his life than any person should have to. The story follows Mehmet beginning at childhood through adulthood and his battle to find his way. He was orphaned at a very young age and went through so much. He was forced to steal. He was eventually found and taken in. And from there it was a quest to find out what truly happened to his father.This book is filled with nonstop action. And it has so much emotion. I love the way the author writes. You feel the words as well as visualize them as you read them. I know nothing about Istanbul, but after reading this book I feel like I have been there. I really enjoyed this book.

I love this coconut oil. I love the way it makes my skin feel. I apply it right after the shower. Being African American I get ashy easily. And typically I have to keep applying lotions and other moisturizers throughout the day to keep my skin hydrated. I can put this on and it lasts all day. The bottle is huge. I wasn't expecting it to be as big as it was, and the price is very reasonable. I am looking forward to trying some of the recipes in the ebook. I am very pleased with the product.Disclaimer: *I received this product for free in return for my honest, unbiased opinion* My review is my own personal opinion of the item.

Different Leagues by Matthew Groce is a book that really blew me away.  I was a little sketchy because of the title and cover. I thought the book was going to be all about baseball. But it was something so much more. I literally couldn't put it down once I started.The story takes places in the early 1920s with Charles a 13-year-old boy who loves baseballs and wants to learn to play. Charles father who is a member of the KKK doesn't have time to teach his son. Charles is a friend with a little black boy named Otis whose father starts teaching him the game of baseball. Charles father is not happy about the relationship. Measures are taken. I don't want to give too much more away.This was a wonderfully written book. The author had great character and plot development. This book was so deep on so many levels. I definitely recommend.

Beyond A Darkened Sky, (Three Keys Series Book 1) by Dana Alexander was a very different read for me. It was a mix of action, sci-fi, fantasy and even some romance. The story follows New York psychiatrist Dr. Sara Forrester who has unusual dreams mixed with reality that take her on an journey to finding her destiny which are three keys that are found by unlocking the gateway to each one. Of course, there is lots of action adventure along the way.I enjoyed the book. It took a bit for me to get into it. Because I got a little lost here and there in the beginning. But it eventually pulled together nicely. I love the characters, and the plot. I look forward to reading the rest in the series.

The Dead Bank Diary by Anna Schlegel was a unique thriller. I think it maybe more suspense than a thriller. I thought it was very smart the author wrote would she knew. This is a finance thriller, and Anna Schlegel has worked in finance. So the story was written with insider knowledge.The book really grabbed me, and it was hard to put down. I will say there were some issues with translation and/or editing. It would throw me once in a while. But nonetheless, I kept reading and becoming more and more intrigued. I could tell a lot of heart went into this book.I loved the characters, they were well fleshed out which I think made the book much better. This is the first in a series, and I am definitely looking forward to seeing what is to come next from Anna Schlegel.

She's All Caught Up by Jamila T. Davis is a thought provoking memoir. I read this book in one sitting. It resonated so much with me. Jamila grew up in a good home with hardworking parents who would do anything for her. She was intelligent and creative. Everything changed when Jamila hit 16 as a lot of us do from the pressures of still being a child, and wanting desperately to be looked at as an adult.Jamila's memoir gives us a detailed account of her rise and fall. And when she came crashing down she crashed hard. The memoir is written from a prison cell where she was sentenced to 12.5 years for bank fraud. She was so caught up in having materialistic things, power, independence, and notoriety. She acquired all those things for a while but making poor choices caused her to lose it all.I found this book to be a wonderful read. It gripped me from beginning to end. I may not have gotten as far out of control as Jamila, but I could have easily been her. Because I made some extremely poor choices in my life. And I can appreciate anyone who uses their life experiences to inspire and empower.

A Punctual Paymaster by Dan Groat is a one of a kind read. The book is masterfully written over a period of decades and told by well-written characters with different life experiences during the same period. It takes a look at people during various periods wealthy, poor, black and white. I have to note the use of the N-word but keep in mind that this was a common occurrence during certain time frames in the book. I love books that take you back in history presenting a realistic vision of it.The characters are well developed. Groat is very good at writing to make the words on the page come to life. I was fully immersed into this book from the first chapter. Groat has a style if writing that sucks you until the very end. Highly recommend.

The Mask of Zeus, a novel written by Desmond Cory was a true treat to read. The story follows the main character strange and eccentric John Dobie. Professor John Dobie is a mathematical genius who can seem quite self-absorbed. He is not really one I would picture as a main character, but the author makes it work. It actually made the book more interesting in my opinion.Professor Dobie is sent to Cyprus where he is to guide new students into Higher Mathematics which is a distinguished group of mathematicians. From there the story takes a turn the professor soon finds himself apart of a murder investigation of a past student.I thought this was a great murder mystery. The characters were very well written and entertaining. I do believe this is the first I am reading from this author, and I am certainly look forward to more.

A Chasing After The Wind by Jim Carson was a book I found hard to put down. The author was able to write so you could visualize everything like a movie playing out in your head. You couldn't help but feel everything the characters felt. And I find that to be one of the strongest qualities an author could have. The book chronicles the life Mack Shannon an orphaned boy who goes through a hard life but still comes out a survivor.I could hardly put the book down. I am very excited to read the upcoming books in this trilogy. The book is well written, and characters well developed. When a book can pull emotions out of me it is a definite read. I can't wait for book two.

Apocalypse Beach Party: Stories by Warrington Jeffreys is an interesting ensemble of stories. I was able to read it in one sitting. I thought this would be an interesting read, and it was. It is a collection of very short stories that deal with the apocalypse in some form or fashion. I enjoyed that the stories were relatively quick to read. However, it seems a couple of the stories ended too quickly like almost in mid thought. But there were a couple of stories enjoyed very much. My two favorite stories were The Peter Brady Story and The River Phoenix Fan Club. If you want a quick read, and something a little out of the ordinary. I would recommend this collection of short stories.

After reading the first in the series, I was excited for the second book in the series.  Untouchable (Elite Doms of Washington Book 2) by Elizabeth SaFleur was just as good as the first book. I was enthralled within the first few chapters.Untouchable (Elite Doms of Washington Book 2) follows Carson Drake a D.C. corporate attorney and London Chantelle.  London works for Carson Drake's in public relations. They have a chance encounter at a BDSM club, and from there it is an opportunity for Drake to make London his. London commits to 48 hours of sensual pleasure with Carson. What was supposed to be a weekend of sexual lust and exploration appears it could be something more.I love these books so much. You will find a few characters pop up from book one in this book. However, these books can be read as a standalone. And I like that fact.

It is my belief that crock pot cooking is one of the most underrated ways to make healthy, easy, virtually hands free cooking. I've always loved just tossing the ingredients in and going about my day, then when I get home, a warm meal is waiting for me! I wanted to increase my pallet so I got this book and tried out about 50 recipes so far and my god are they delicious! The pork pockets stuffed with corn are do die for. I really can't say enough good things about this recipe book. Five stars!

This book is wonderfully unique and adventurous in its story line. Taking place on a cruise ship, Marsha and Danny are hired by the cruise line to provide security. But troubles they face aren't merely rowdy passengers; the cruise is a magnet for pirates and terrorists alike, throwing the two ex-secret service agents. I found the vivid descriptions and knowledge about the ports of call and cruise ship procedures fascinating and added a great layer of depth to the story. The action was intense, and the two main characters did some serious damage to the pirates and terrorists. The president even gets involved, which just shows how serious the plot becomes. This is a great maritime detective/thriller/action novel.

I've read pretty much every HGW book. The Sherlock books were the first to get me into this mysterious authors fantastic alt-history writing. After those, I started in on the Monte Cristo ones (which had been published first) and immediately dove into this one. This one had a healthy dose of action, especially the Battle of Bull Run chapter!  That's what I love about HGW's books; he/she weaves historical moments into a memorable moment that humanizes history far more acutely than an history book (though liberties are taken obviously). There was some nice romance sprinkled in the book to when WW2 hits. If you love history, and an engrossing character making his way through history's most significant moments, then this book was written for you.

This was a detective mystery that was unique from the usual chain smoking sleuth that are in novels. This one boasted a tough female detective that got results and did everything in her power to solve her cases and catch the bad guys, even against her bosses orders. It was refreshing and a thrilling ride of a cold case suddenly becoming hot again when she is transferred to her home town on probation. The plot had me guessing the whole time. Really loved this mystery. Five stars!

I just can't get enough of this author and brutish investigator Garvey Fields! Like Chandler's other books, this one doesn't disappoint. Lots of action, lots of suspense, pretty ladies, and an initial job assignment that spirals out of control. His body guarding gig turns into a whirlwind of bullets and bras. Couldn't as for a better mystery thriller.

This is the second book I've blazed through (the first being Waiting Game.) I've come to love RA Chandler's fast paced writing and head strong main character Garvey Fields. This book keeps the same thrilling pace as the first story, but involves gangsters and dirty cops. Super great read!

This was a really good read. Great action and suspense. The main character Garvey Fields is a crass dude who gets the ladies but also gets results. It's nail-biting the situations he gets in (and gets out of) while trying to find the murderer of a woman he was responsible for. If you like mystery thrillers, this is a fantastic pick.

I've been feeling very fatigued lately and have tried everything to boost my energy levels. It never occurred to me that I may have a slight for of fatty liver disease! Upon buying this book it hit me that I had all the symptoms and immediately took action by following the direction for a liver detox/cleanse. This is a great read that explains the condition, how a person can get it, and how to cure it. Good recipes. Really worked. Can't recommend this book enough!

I think this book can be read by the religious and those who haven't decided yet what to believe. The keys that the author lays out are decisive and uplifting as he connects multiple facets of living a fulfilling life with understanding the nature of a higher power. God is with us and with you in every moment. I think this book would help people realize that and to put faith in God and his plan. I found this book uplifting and comforting, just the tonic my mind needed after becoming more and more cynical. I've advocated this book to my friends and highly recommend it!

My mom is still pretty skeptical about buying a kindle, even when I've told  her she can get free books, so I let her borrow my kindle and read this book. I found it HIGHLY convincing and provided really great resources to get free books, many I'd never known before, such as which people to follow on twitter that promote free book days! Really, you could own a kindle and never have to pay for a book again if you follow the resources in this ebook. A great read. Highly recommend for people who love to read!

I have to say right off that this light shows way too much dirt and grime all over the house. I know our house isn't anywhere close to being spic and span, but this little UV light really showed me how dirty it is. :-(  We don't have pets so that would have made it even worse. I hadn't realized how many things actually glow using a UV light (see photo of my slippers). It's kinda fun going around the house with the light. It does need to be pretty dark for the light to show up; you won't be able to see near as much in the daylight (and that might be a good thing; lol).The main reason I wanted this UV light is because we live in scorpion country and over the summer I have killed two scorpions in my bathroom and both times were at night when I wasn't really sure what I was seeing. Fortunately both times I was smart enough not to bend down and try picking up what I thought was a dust bunny; yikes! So I have been keeping this little light in my bathroom for those trips during the night when most of the lights are off and I think I see something on the floor. Unfortunately, or fortunately however you look at it, I don't have a photo of a scorpion showing up in this light, but if I do find one I'll definitely post a photo (after killing the scorpion of course).One thing to make you aware of is that this light takes 3 AAA batteries that are not included. I had not realized that and when the light arrived I had to order batteries for it. The batteries go inside the light and to turn on or off the light you press the button on the end.Product provided for my honest review.

My hubby has been wanting a car charger that also shows the car battery voltage, so when I was contacted by HAWEEL to evaluate their product for my honest review I jumped at the opportunity. The car we use this on has the cigarette lighter/power port in the middle console so it's easy to see the battery voltage, especially since the plug is flexible. With the car running the voltage was 14.2 and when the car sits it shows just the battery voltage, which is now 12.0 (see photo).The charger shows to plug in iPad/Tablets on the left port and a Phone on the right port so there's no guesswork (you can see on my photo that the ports are named; the USB cord is covering up the "Phone"). Definitely recommended for someone who wants to know what the voltage is of their car battery, plus as an extra bonus you get a 2-port USB charger.  :-) So happy to have this nifty little device!

I have other cable management sleeves, but this is one has a unique design that I hadn't seen before. There were no instructions included. The thread guide looks a little confusing at first, but looking at the "how to operate" photos on the web page and also watching a video on how to use it cleared up any confusion.My first thought in getting this was to wrap my battery cables going to the battery and the winch on my Jeep. But after receiving it, I felt the plastic was too thin to withstand the heat of the engine compartment. :-(So I set out to clean up the mess of wires behind the TV. After unplugging wires and using the guide to insert them in the tube, the area looks much better. The thing I found out, is the more electrical cords you try to insert in the tube, the tougher it gets. The guide rubs on the insulation of the cords and makes it harder to push the guide forward. If you can bundle the cords together it should work better. It is easy to use once you have figured out how to do it.I have to give this 5 stars, mostly because of the guide; it's well thought out.Product provided at a substantial discount for my honest review.

Let's see, what can you say about a spray nozzle besides the fact that it works. There are 10 settings to spray water out of this nozzle. There is also a brass knob to regulate the amount of water the nozzle puts out. Being made of metal, this nozzle should last a long time if proper care is taken. I like the feel of the metal handle in my hand rather than the plastic ones I have had in the past. Plus the rubber handle makes it more comfortable and so far it hasn't dripped. It comes complete with a rubber gasket, so all you need to do is screw it on the hose. Having the different settings gives the option of using it as a pressure washer, or to water the flowers.Until it's on its last leg, which may be many seasons to come, I have to give it 5 stars.Product provided for my honest review.

I took 5HTP years ago and somehow stopped taking it; I imagine because I didn't know if it was helping. When ZenWise Labs offered be a bottle of 120 capsules to try for my honest review I thought I would give it another try.I mostly am taking it for a sleep aid, along with Magnesium and Melatonin. I have been taking one capsule at night for about a month now and I do think, along with the other products, that it may be helping me get to sleep sooner and stay asleep longer (I'm still up a few times every night though). I still have a couple months worth in the bottle and am hoping it will help my sleep even more; I'm a zombie when I don't get enough sleep.I plan to keep taking 5HTP not only as a sleep aid, but hopefully for stress relief also (of course if I slept better I wouldn't be stressed or moody).

This candy box arrived unmelted and undamaged, which is a little surprising since we live in the desert. They were not all scrunched together and no wrappers were coming apart like some reviewers have mentioned. The display box with the pull-out "drawer" is neat especially if, well, you're gonna display it. I'm keeping the box in our pantry.I don't like anything peanut butter; fortunately my hubby does so he eats the Reese's Peanut Butter Cups and the first time he had one he said he thought it was full size. The rest (Almond Joy, Kit Kat and Hershey's milk chocolate bar) are snack size; each one is good for a couple bites.I think this candy box would be good for Halloween; there's 90 little individual wrapped candies and that would be enough to treat a lot of little goblins. They're also good for when I need a chocolate fix; of course I can't eat just one. It's a nice idea when you want some candy for a group; other than that it seems pretty expensive buying it this way when you could buy the individual bars for less.The Hershey's chocolate bar in the box reminds me of the time we toured the Hershey factory in Hershey, Pennsylvania. When we got through with the tour we were all given a full size Hershey's chocolate bar.  :-)

Wow, 10 colorful 6 foot long USB 2.0 charging and data cables! I love all the different bright colors. I charge my Samsung Galaxy S3 so often that I actually wear out cables. I have some cables that have become loose and won't stay connected. For example, when I try to plug my phone into the laptop to upload photos some of my cables connect then when I'm trying to upload photos disconnect on me; grrr! These cables are not doing that; yay!  I also like the fact that these cables are so long; I can put a charger on a desk or table and actually have a long enough cable to use the phone on my lap without pulling out the cable or having to keep the charger right beside me.What a great deal for 10 cables; you can't have too many of them. Love the light pink (see photo) and rose colors.  :-)Product provided at a substantial discount for my honest review.

I am using three of these AAA batteries in a UV light. At first I couldn't get them to work but after taking them out and putting them back in a couple times I got the light to turn on.They advertise being made with 3.8% recycled batteries; not much but a start but their goal is increasing the amount to 40% eventually; now that would be something to write home about. They also are supposed to hold power up to 12 years in storage but I won't find that out; I'm already using 3 out of an 8 pack.Years back we bought so many Energizer batteries we ended up getting that stuffed Bunny with a drum that keeps going and going. Wish we still had it cuz it was so cute!I have to give Energizer kudos for at least trying to make something better for the planet.

My husband and I have different hearing levels, so watching TV can be a little loud for me, or a little low for him. A BrighPlay Live HD Bluetooth Transmitter made our TV Bluetooth capable so he would able to listen through Bluetooth headphones.  By pressing the power button on the headphones until they flashed red and blue they paired with the Bluetooth transmitter, but it did take a few tries.  Now that it's paired it has always connected when he presses the button and they have stayed paired longer than the last headset he had.The headphone audio is very clear, and there is no lag in the audio from the TV to the headphones. They are adjustable and fit well over his ears; the headband is a little narrow and puts a little pressure on the top of his head and he adjusts that once in a while. He wears them for maybe an hour or so, takes a short break, then puts them back on. There's a blue light that blinks every once in a while to let you know they're still working. When the headset it turned on you get the message "Power on" and the "Power off" message when you turn them off so you definitely know they're off. As far as the life of the battery, it looks like about 15 hours before they need to be charged, which is a lot of TV listening. If there's a message saying "Low battery" he doesn't know because he charges them sooner than that.His intent for this headset is only to listen to TV shows and the sound is great. The headphones are now the only way he will watch TV. He does have another headset but since receiving this Sentey he has only used it; he prefers it over the other.  What a difference a headset has made; he keeps saying he can now hear everything!  :-)Product provided for my honest review, and my hubby is really glad to have them!

This meat thermometer is not only a thermometer but can also be used as a timer and is also a fork that can be used to remove your meat. First you need to install the 2 enclosed batteries on the back (the battery cover also has a cooking chart on it so you know what temps your different meats are supposed to be). The thermometer I had been using was a simple dial thermometer with a single probe and it worked but I was always wondering whether I was going to stick myself with it. This ThermoPro has a digital readout that not only gives you the temperature, but also lets you know when the meat is rare, medium or well done. It also has a backlight. It does take a few seconds to come up with the final reading after you put the probe into the meat.What I did find out the first time though is that's it is not waterproof; somehow it ended up in the sink with the rest of the dishes and got all wet. Fortunately it dried out but now I know not to do that anymore.George Foreman and I do a lot of inside grilling and I'm pleased with my new digital thermometer.  :-)Product provided for my honest review.

This is a set of 3 interchangeable handheld magnifiers. I was surprised to see how large they were when I received it. The handle itself is 4" long and 4 1/2" around. The large lens is 3 3/4" around. For the light to work you need to install 3 AAA batteries (not included). The three lenses are pretty easy to interchange by pressing in on the button on each side of the the handle that releases the lens.The one I use the most is the smallest one and I actually thought at first that the images were upside down. I even wrote the company and received a very nice reply with the following explanation: "the object distance should be less than one focal length, then you can see an enlarged upright image (virtual image). If Object distance is more than one focal length less than twice the focal length, it will show an enlarged inverted real image."  I tried it again and realized I was holding the magnifier too far away; the small one needs to be almost on top of the print or just slightly above; if it's any higher than that the image is inverted. I wanted to be sure and write that so others wouldn't make the same mistake I did.I do a lot of knitting and crocheting an am using the smaller one for patterns. Plus most of the instruction booklets for products nowadays come with teeny print so now I'm covered, and having the light also is even better!Product provided for my honest review.

This pink massaging brush comes with 7 attachments heads and has two massaging speeds. First you need to install 2 AA batteries (not included) in the back compartment. The heads are easy to attach and pull off. It comes in a box with a plastic insert that holds the massager and all the massaging heads. I do wish it had come with something to keep all the massaging heads in; I ended up putting them in a pink bag to keep them all together.I've been using different massaging heads to put on face serum, mud mask, night cream and to just plain wash my face. It feels so good with the little massaging brush on my face. This has a long exfoliating brush, a short soft brush, a rolling massager, a couple sponges, polish accessory and pumice applicator. They really have your face covered. The heads are easy to clean in water. Did I mention it's pink (my favorite color)?  :-)Product provided for my honest review.

I'm constantly charging my Samsung Galaxy S3 and also charging portable chargers for the phone. I also charge Bluetooth headphones, Bluetooth speakers, my Kindles or my Samsung Galaxy Tab. I do the charging in the bathroom and there are only two outlets so having a unit with 6 ports and a cord that can be plugged into one outlet is really a plus. It's nice to be able to charge all my devices in the same charging station, plus this also auto detects what charging speed is needed; up to 2.4 amps per port or a total of 10 amps for the 6 ports. It's pretty lightweight and doesn't take up much room being about 4" x 2 3/4" and a little over 1" thick (I stand it up against the wall).It comes with a separate power cord and with 6 ports this charging station has the most ports I've seen in one device. Plus I really like the sky-blue color.  :-)Product received for my honest review.

This kit has everything needed for whitening teeth. It comes with 6 mouth trays and 9 syringes of whitening gel. Even included is the whitening light, which I see in some kits is extra. Plus this is the least expensive kit I have seen!First you need to form the mouth trays to your teeth by putting them in hot water for a few seconds and then putting them in your mouth (make sure they're not too hot!). They recommend you try wearing the trays first before putting in the whitening gel; I did that once and that was enough. The first time I put the trays in my mouth with the whitening gel I still had the handle on the mouth trays and couldn't figure out how to put the whitening light in my teeth. Well duh, that's because the handles are for when you heat up the trays to form them to your teeth and then you're supposed to cut off the handles when you use the whitening gel (a step that was missing in the instructions); then you can use the whitening light (you first need to open the battery compartment and pull out the strip so the light will work).It recommends 5 to 15 minutes at a time using the light and possibly leaving in the mouth trays for longer. I've been using the gel and light for about 15 minutes each time and then removing everything. Whether or not the light really helps bleach the teeth faster and whether or not it's beneficial is a controversial subject. Make sure you brush all the gel out of your mouth when you remove the trays. The web page states to NOT brush your teeth before the treatment; the instruction booklet that came with the kit states to brush your teeth well beforehand. I'll go with the brushing first.I'm not doing it every day, but I have used a couple of the syringes full of whitening gel so far and I'm on the third one. I did take before and after pictures; I think I can tell a little more sparkle on my top teeth. I need to work more on the bottom teeth. I still have almost 7 syringes left to go, so should definitely be able to tell a big difference.For this price of this kit for all you get it's a bargain. Even teeth whitening strips cost more than this kit. Plus it's really not that difficult to do once I finally stopped procrastinating and did it. :-)Product provided at a substantial discount for my honest review.

Theses silicone gloves are huge!  They come in one size; large (that's what "free size" must mean). I received a red pair. They don't bend much like traditional gloves, and because of that they're a little tough to put on and it's hard to feel comfortable holding something hot because the mitts are so thick and stiff that you may not really feel you have control of the hot dish you're holding. There are little nibs all over the outside that do help with gripping though. Cleaning them is easy enough; just wash them in the sink.Although they're called BBQ gloves, we've used them inside with our grill and to remove hot soup bowls from the microwave. My hubby did say he noticed heat in his thumb while using them to remove a hot soup bowl.Where I'm finding these to really shine is opening jars. I usually have to get my hubby to open the yeast jar the first time. I put one of these mitts on and opening the jar was a cinch!Product provided at a substantial discount for my honest review.

I've been putting this on my face at night and it only takes a few drops so a 1 fl. oz. bottle (with a dropper) lasts a long while. I could definitely stand to look younger, since I'm now 64 and have plenty of wrinkles; sigh. I'm no sun worshipper, but I do swim in a membership pool that is outside a few times a week, so my skin could definitely use some help.After using it for a few weeks I'm either seeing a somewhat brighter smoother face or it's a figment of my imagination.  My husband said my cheeks are looking more radiant and smoother, so it must be working.  :-)  I feel like I'm pampering myself when I use this.Product provided for my honest review.

The first thing I noticed about this headset is how large the earpieces are. They really do stick out of the ears quite a ways also. A short flat charging cable was provided; I charged it via my laptop and it only took a few minutes so it was already mostly charged. Also provided is a couple different sizes of earbuds and 2 extra earhooks, plus a clip to make the earphone cable shorter if you need to. The cord is flat so doesn't get tangled. The earhooks help the earphones stay in the ears better, which to me is really nice because I have one ear that is hard to fit. It paired with my Samsung Galaxy S3 easily.The sound is awesome; I've been listening to Amazon Prime Music. The separation of sound is great and I can definitely hear the highs and lows; I'd give the sound quality 5 stars. Something I don't like is whenever I receive a text or email the notification in the headphones is louder than the music I'm listening to.  I do wish it had separate controls for volume instead of one that controls both the volume and the tracks, so because of that I'm using my phone to control the volume and not the headset.Product provided for my honest review

Last year a gal in my knitting/crochet group was extolling the virtues of coconut oil, so since then I have been taking coconut oil supplements. So when I was contacted by Island Fresh Coconut Oil for my honest review I took them up on it. I hadn't realized what a large jar 54oz. is! When I first opened the jar and took a sniff I had to take another; it smells so good, exactly like coconut.The jar states this on the label:  "Store in a cool, dry place protected from heat and light. Refrigeration not required." Since our house is not cool or protected from heat here in the desert, I decided to refrigerate it. After all it said "Refrigeration not required"; not "Do Not Refrigerate". When I took out the jar a few days later to use the oil in a brownie recipe the whole container of oil had solidified; oops! I couldn't even get a spoon in it. So, I left it out and put it in the pantry hoping it would stay cool enough in there and the next day it had liquified again. So, in the pantry it will stay; it tends to leak somehow so I put the container in a plastic bag. I think the label should read not to refrigerate it.I have used this a couple times in my bread machine recipe and the only difference we could tell is that the crust was a little harder; my hubby said he liked it though because it kinda tasted like French bread. I have put some of this in a container to use in the bathroom to apply to my face and my face looked more radiant. I have put a small amount on my hair after shampooing, but my hair looked greasy. I also have used it as a massage oil on my neck and it works very well. There are many more uses for coconut oil that I have yet to try.

This is the first time I've spread mud all over my face on purpose. Playing in the mud as a kid doesn't count. ;-) The instructions say to avoid the eye area and leave it on only 2 minutes, so the first time I put some on I left on my glasses and spread some on my cheeks and chin. After a couple minutes I washed it off and my skin felt as soft as a baby's, well it was so soft that I kept rubbing my skin. My forehead  felt rough so I dabbed a little there and after a couple minutes washed it off and it also felt softer.I have a face massager that I've been using to apply this mud mask. This 3.4 fl.oz. tube is lasting me quite a while since I've only been using it a couple times a week, and my face seems to be softer and more radiant. I feel like I'm pampering myself.

I had a callus on the side of my big toe that hurt when I wore shoes (which fortunately here in the desert is not very often; I normally wear flip-flops). I tried this foot file on it and it really did file it down, pretty much so it looks like normal. As a matter of fact, I just looked at the toe that I filed and while doing so noticed there's a callus on the opposite big toe I hadn't even realized was there. So now I have to go to work on that one. I'm back and now that one's gone too; awesome. Now both my big toes look more normal. Normally I have cracked skin on my heels and this also works on that.I'd say these foot files are perfect! They give you one for each foot too. :-)I'm posting before and after photos of the callus on the first toe.Product received for my honest review.

I feel like I'm squeezing Vitamin C all over my face when I use this. It smells deliciously like oranges, is orange in color and makes my face a little orangish when I use it. I've been putting a few drops of this on my face at night and it only takes a few drops so a 1 fl. oz. bottle (with a dropper) lasts a long while. I feel like I'm pampering myself when I use this.I also put on InstaNatural night cream after this serum, so the two may be working together. After using both a few weeks I'm either seeing a somewhat brighter smoother face or it's a figment of my imagination.  My husband even said my cheeks look flush, radiant (kind of a glow) and smoother.  :-)Product received for my honest review.

I received the green corded headset (oenbopo Universal 3.5mm In-Ear Stereo Headset Headphone Earbuds Earphone Remote Mic For Smartphone Tablet); I see all the headset reviews are posted on the same page.Sometimes I just want a set of earphones that aren't Bluetooth and don't have all the controls on them to figure out. That's what I like about these earphones. They are corded, but not Bluetooth, and only have one control. They are almost neon green and they come with 3 different sizes of earbuds. I had no clue how to wear them because the enclosed flyer didn't show how; I had to go the webpage to look at the photos. There is a bendable black cable connecting the earphones and you actually bend that so it curves around your ear (see photo) and the earphone fits inside your ear. I was wearing them wrong at first and they were uncomfortable; no wonder.I've been listening to my audio books with these and I find the sound to be extremely good. I tried them with Amazon Music and I was really impressed; I definitely heard separation of sound in each earbud. For this price you can't beat 'em!Product received for my honest review.

I'm really liking this Aloe Vera Gel. I was a little apprehensive because I recently tried coconut oil and I found it really greasy so I wondered if this would be. I'm pleased to write that it is not greasy at all. I'm not a sun worshiper but I do swim at a membership park and unfortunately the pool is out in the sun, and it's a hot desert sun. So I end up sometimes reddish on my face and back just from swimming laps. I've been using this gel with the enclosed pump to put a little on my face and back and it dissolves into the skin pretty quickly without being greasy.I have also put some of this in my hair after shampooing. Once again I was apprehensive because I put coconut oil in my hair ONCE and it was so greasy that it looked like my hair was wet. This Aloe Vera Gel is not greasy even on my hair and seems to give it a little more body.This 16oz. bottle is huge and you only need to use a small amount. I plan to keep using it; I'm very impressed!Product received for my honest review.

This is a very well designed microwave plate cover. The handle does not come attached; the round end of the handle pops into a little hole in the cover and the other end slides into a slot on the side of the cover. We really like the handle; the previous cover we used had no handle and was hot to the touch when we removed the cover; this one isn't. The fact that it's dome shaped is also so much better than the flat microwave covers that we did use that always splashed soup through the hole on the top and got soup on the top of the microwave. We use this cover when we microwave soup and there's no splashing!  There's an adjustable vented hole on the top of the cover that you can experiment with to see how it works best for what you're cooking. We left the vent hole open to cook soup.Old cover: no handleNew cover: has a handleOld cover: hot to the touchNew cover: not hot because of the handleOld cover: splashed through holeNew cover: no splashingOld cover: flat designNew cover: dome designCan you tell we're impressed with this product?  And did I mention we really like the handle?  ;-) I looked up the price of the old cover we have and this one is a few bucks more; but so worth it!I'm posting a couple photos; the first one before cooking the soup, the second one after cooking and you can see condensation but no splashed soup.Product received for my honest review.

I have never slept on a cloud, but I'm thinking it would feel soft and silky like this pillowcase. :-)  It's cotton on the underside so it doesn't slip and slide around on the bed like silk tends to. It has an invisible zipper which is so much better than an open end.It comes in a very nice gift box with a little pack of silk swatches and a "thimble" (see photo). I took the swatches out of the little bag, put on the thimble and rubbed my finger on the swatches; I'm guessing to show that the silk doesn't snag but that IS definitely just a guess.Because it is so nicely presented it would definitely make a good gift.  I definitely recommend sleeping on it...  ;-)Product received for my honest review.

I recently read that most people are low in magnesium, so when I was contacted by Viva Labs to try this product for my honest review I went for it. This is a large 240 tablet bottle and each tablet is 100mg. The recommended dosage is 2 tablet 2X a day; supposedly that gives you 100% of your RDA. I have had no ill effects; no stomach discomfort.I have trouble getting to sleep and staying asleep and according to info I've read that may be a sign of low magnesium. Magnesium is also depleted by eating refined sugar (guilty). I also have painful muscle spasms that sometimes wake me up at night and make me jump out of bed. I have taken these magnesium tablets for a few weeks now and lately I have not had any muscle spasms, so I'm hoping this magnesium is the reason why. I can't say I've been able to tell any difference so far in getting to sleep or staying asleep, but I will continue taking this Viva Labs Magnesium and sleep on it...  ;-)

This LED bulb fits a normal size light socket. A bulb in the lamp in the computer room had just burnt out so it was the perfect place to test out this bulb. After the bulb being on over an hour it was still barely warm to the touch, not like the incandescent bulbs that generate a lot of heat. Having a bulb that doesn't heat up the room (especially in the summer) is a good thing. It also puts out quite a bit of light. I think we have a winner here!Product received for my honest review.

I received the pink and blue portable charger for my honest review. Pink is my color; it's light pink on one side and light blue on the other. It also has a hard rubber feel instead of steel. It measures 5 3/4" x 2 3/4" and is less than 1/2" thick. It's also lightweight so it's easy to carry around or stick in your bag to take with you for those charging emergencies.I first charged the charger via the flat micro USB/USB cable and it took about 6 entire hours. It first blinked green so I thought it was charged, but kept blinking. Then I read the booklet that showed it first blinked green then blue and then red and when it was completely charged it would stay a solid red.I can charge my Samsung Galaxy S3 multiple times using it. The battery on the phone sucks and I need to charge it more than once during the day, so I've been carrying this little charger around with me. It works great, fits in my pocket and is cute too!

I have a neck injury that at times causes debilitating headaches so when I was offered this massager for my honest review I planned on using it on my neck muscles. I'm often massaging the knots in my neck muscles but my fingers don't have a lot of strength.This needed to be assembled first, but it was a simple matter of screwing the parts into each other and screwing the two balls in one of four holes on either side of the bendable middle section (the balls can easily be removing and screwed into different holes). The balls are soft with a hard inside. It also came with a long rope to fasten on one end of the massager.So far I have used it on my neck muscles a few times and that ball really "hits the spot". I can position the ball or balls so they're right on a knot in my muscle and then squeeze the ends together so the ball really pushes down on the knot to try and relax it. I can press as hard or as soft as I want and it helps save my fingers. It may not get into the exact spot I need, but it's a good starting point and then I can finish the massage with my fingers.

I haven't used any teeth whitening strips for years, so when I was contacted by this company to try their product for my honest review I went for it. I brush my teeth with hydrogen peroxide daily, which is the main ingredient in teeth whitening strips, so I thought my teeth were pretty white already. But I notice one tooth in front that's darker than the others, so I was hoping these strips would lighten it up.I procrastinated for a few days 'cuz I never like putting these things on; seems whenever I apply whitening strips I want to swallow all the time. They were easy to apply and I didn't end up swallowing too much of the gel. After keeping these on for half an hour my teeth ended up being sensitive the rest of the evening. I looked at my teeth after the first time and thought they actually looked a little whiter, but I figured that was a figment of my imagination. The second day I tried them I had very little sensitivity afterward and still thought my teeth looked a little whiter; hmmm. By the third day I put the strips on I *almost* forgot I was wearing them, and there has been no sensitivity afterward since.In less than a week I could tell that my one darker tooth in the front had actually lightened up and the other teeth also seem a little whiter. I'm really amazed that these strips did make a difference. I would definitely recommend these; they do work!

Rage by Elizabeth ReyesFate Series Book FiveAJ Romero “Rage” has hit the big times, the Major League. Thankfully the man who is not only his coach but also his mentor is helping him to control his temper that earned him his nickname. That very same coach's daughter may cause him to lose that control.Addison Lara has one important rule in her life; her daughter Clair always comes first. She has to remember that when she's around the handsome catcher.As always Elizabeth Reyes takes her readers on quite the ride. The story takes you on that emotional roller coaster with it's highs and lows and through a few dark tunnels where you don't know what might be around the next corner. In other words, another fantastic story.**Sexual content and language

Royal Regard by Mariana GabrielleBella Clewes, Baroness of Holsworthy was never considered a pretty woman and people enjoyed telling her so. She hated Society and the one good thing about being sold as a bride to a much older man was that she got to sail away from all of it. Now after fifteen years away, Bella and Myron return to London due to his failing health. The strong woman she had become while away...was once again quiet and unsure.Adolphe Fouret, Duc de Malbourne and Nicholas Northope, Duke of Wellbridge...both started to try and charm Bella. Only one of them cares more for the true woman she is. The other knows she is soon to be a very rich widow. Bella just wants to remain a good wife and caretaker to Myron.This was a very unique story and I found it to be a definite page turner. Grabbing you and holding you from beginning to end. Bella is still a married woman and yet many around here seem to forget...or just ignore...that. Myron knows he is not long on this earth and wants to find Bella a protector.The prequels are to follow: Shipmate is Bella and Myron's story. 'Tis Her Season is Charlotte's story, Bella's cousin. A Rose Renamed is John's story, Bella's brother.**Sexual content and language

Now You See Her by Dale MayerPsychic Visions Series Book EightTia Hanniger is different. Her psychic abilities scared her parents, intrigued a scientist, and caused her to have to live her life on the run. She's tired of running. She's tired of being alone. But she also doesn't know who to trust.Dean Walker's life changed from the moment he met the beautiful woman. She was definitely different and alone. He chose to help her and that came with risks. Risks he decided she was worth. As a cop, he is determined to protect her and his loved ones from this unseen danger.Characters from the previous books join in to help Tia on her journey. She has strong abilities, she just needs to learn what they are and how to use them. This story pulled me in and carried me along at a fast pace from beginning to end.**Sexual content & language

Weather the Storm by Lisa MondelloRising Storm Series Episode SevenBryce Douglas is struggling with some personal issues. Instead of facing them, he buries himself deeper in his work. As a pastor he can help everyone else and ignore his own issues. And he does.Tara Douglas is doing the best she can. Their son was just diagnoses as having autism. Her daughter is acting out because of the attention to their son. And her husband? He's absent. Maybe the town of Storm does need his pastoral help...but she needs her husband's help.I've only read Lisa's episode so far but you will definitely want to start with book one in this series. The town of Storm has a storm brewing in the lives of it's residents. Each book focuses on certain people but they also include continuing issues with those from the previous book.**Sensual content and Language

First Impressions by Elizabeth JohnsGeoffrey Bryant, Earl of Rutherford, was quite content being considered the Elusive Earl, as he preferred staying at his home by the sea with his young daughter, instead of London. His mother insisted he find a wife or she would find one for him. So he went to London, but this time he wouldn't look for a beautiful woman like he did with his first wife.Helena Foster made a bargain with her mother. She would go through one Season and not speak her mind, then she wouldn't be forced into another Season, ever. Only a few more weeks and she could go back home to the country and live her life.Two people who disliked the formalities of the Marriage Mart. And first impressions that judged a person before getting to know them. I really enjoyed this story as I've enjoyed all the books by this author. This was a short but complete story.

To Wed His Christmas Lady by Christi CaldwellTo Love a Duke Series Book 7William Hargrove, the Marquess of Grafton has been avoiding the inevitable for eight years now. He made a deal with his father...travel for eight years before marrying the harridan he was promised to. Eight years was not long enough.Clarisse Falcot built a wall of ice around her. She was the perfect daughter of duke. Haughty, prideful, and could cower anyone with one look. She was also friendless and even if she wouldn't admit it...lonely.Since her mother died, Clarisse, or Cara as she preferred, had not known love. And now she is once again ignored and forgotten by her father. As it ends up, it may have been the best thing that ever happened to her.

A Very Matchmaking ChristmasFour enjoyable stories that take place at a Christmas house party. Four friends have decided it's time for their four eldest daughters to marry. The girls have been through several unsuccessful Seasons and so the mama's are going to take over and push their daughters towards the men they think are right for their girls.Her Christmas Rogue by Christi CaldwellLady Winifred Grisham has been in love with her brother's best friend for years. As the Christmas season closes in and she fears her mother is matchmaking for her, it's time to see if her feelings are returned.Lord Trent Ballantine is a second son. Living a roguish lifestyle never bothered him until now. And it was too late to change his past. Is it too late to change his future.**Slightly sensual contentA Little Scandal by Danelle HarmonMiss Letitia Ponsonby thought she was headed to spend Christmastide with her three friends. While staying at a friend of her mother's on the way, she finds out her mother has other plans. Plans that Lettie must stop.Tristan St. Aubyn, the Early of Weybourne is working to make up for an error of his youth. To restore the Norfolk Thoroughbreds to what they once were. He has not time to find a wife. Or does he?A Quiet Man by Renee BernardArthur Nicodemus Phineas Chesterfield, the Fourth Earl of Athmore is a quiet sort of man. When he gets invited to a Christmastide house party, he forces himself to go in hopes that by some rare occurrence, he'll be brave enough to speak and find a wife.Jane Pemberly seems to always get herself into trouble.
