It dissolves really quickly and doesn't clump like other creatine powders I've used in the past. I found that taking half the amount during my workout and the full amount after worked best for me. I felt I had more strength and stamina. I also noticed it seems to help me recover much quicker from soreness. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase. I purchased this product during a promotion at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review

Unless your mirrors are spotless and you're really just wiping off steam. . . and even if it's just steam for that matter you're going to need a few paper towels or an old terrycloth towel around to clean up the drips and wipe of the blade and mirror as you go.What I've found, because my car lacks a rear wiper and has a spoiler the combined shapes coat the rear window with dust and water drops faster than you can believe. Also requiring an old towel I've found keeping this inside the garage to wipe off the back, side and side-view mirrors quickly after being out in the rain or with a spray or three of glass cleaner if it'd been dusty a far handier tool than in the bathroom.I think this works far better on the car than the bathroom mirrors where it did a fair, if somewhat messy job.

Okay, it's a complete kit, you get the trimmer handle which comes with the beard cutter mounted on it. A slim trimming head for shaping and getting into small spaces and there's also a 'stubble' head I assume is for that scruffy look. Along with the three cutters comes a somewhat wimpy cleaning brush, a small tube of mineral oil to lubricate the blades with and a length comb that adjusts longer and shorter via a dial you spin on the trimmer body. Everything comes packed in a huge plastic case that has a military finish and feel to it. According to the product description; 'Each piece of the kit stores securely in the durable plastic storage case.' but they really don't. There's non place to lock down or 'secure' any of the parts at all. The inside of the case holds a fitted cardboard box with two sides that you can put the different bits but, again, there's nothing secure about how the parts are stored and I have doubts that the cardboard is going to last long in a damp bathroom environment.That being said the trimmers, once lubricated, do a great job of giving you a close trim. I hate to blade shave and have used trimmers for decades. Once I ensured the adjustable comb was solidly in place (my first attempt, not so well) the trimmer mows through long beard hair like crazy. Granted my goatee is a bit shorter than I intended I chalk it up to a learning experience. I got things in place and set right and it did a great getting my cheeks smooth and my goatee (albeit a bit shorter than expected) trimmed evenly. It was even quieter than most other trimmers I've used over the years. The case is a bit of a disappointment and the adjustable comb is thin and brittle feeling but it feels good in my hand and does it's job well.

The concept is fairly sound and for skinny folk it's probably pretty comfortable. You wear the strap over you shoulder instead of across or around your neck. This rigs like a messenger bag with the camera being across your body. A smaller strap rides under the armpit on the side you have the shoulder pad on to keep things in place. I'm a big guy and found this secondary strap, that isn't designed to be removed, to bite into my body and cause some discomfort even after wearing it for a short time. The camera mounts to a single butterfly-like threaded nut that threads into the camera's tripod mount. There's a quick release at one end of the shoulder strap that releases VERY easily. I was just shrugging things into place to get a feel for the rig when I bumped both sides of the release and luckily caught my camera a foot from the floor.I tried this with three cameras. All three have threaded onto my tripod numerous times. The threads for this strap are rather shallow and poorly machined. One not cheap camera with metal threading refuse to take more than half a turn of the threading. I wasn't about to trust my camera to that little hold.. The next camera, also not inexpensive and also with metal tripod threading took the mount but it had to have some force behind it to get it to thread in. The third camera, far less expensive, with plastic tripod threads, easily mounted to the nut.I also needed a pair of pliers to open the threaded nut on the carabiner ever time I wanted to open it. The threads would just get crossed up and jam and I'd need the pliers to get it to turn.While the concept is there and if you're skinny it might be comfortable there's some serious quality control issues. It's just not great. If I had to choose between this and the giveaway straps manufacturers throw in the box I'd take the NEOpine hands down but there are just far better camera straps out there for a similar price. Some quality control checks and a bit better machining of threaded parts and this could be a contender but as it stands I wouldn't recommend this.I received this item in exchange for my review.

I don't care what anyone says, these are my favorite flavor M&M on the planet and I' glad they're only available once a year otherwise I'd have pails full of these in every corner around the house all year long. Plus, if they were available all the time they wouldn't be special anymore and I'd probably get tired of them. So, once a year as a special treat these things knock my socks off.

This is a review of the black set of headphones. The blue accent lighting is very cool. I understand why there's an on/off switch for the lighting. It could become somewhat distracting at a LAN party (do they still have those?) but I have no intention of ever turning the lights off when I'm using these headphones even if I can't see the light while I'm wearing them.Speaking of wearing them they're quite comfortable. The extendable headband will expand to fit any size head. I think you could wear these over a helmet they expand so much. The volume dial I found a little hard to control but that's just because I have some nerve damage in my hands.The headphones have a 'hidden' microphone which is quite easy to extract and retract and put back. I have yet to use this option as I just don't chat while gaming. The headphones also purport to have a vibration function but I also have no ability to test that function.Sound quality is pretty good  it says there's an integrated subwoofer but the description only lists two 40mm drivers and I'm not about to take these apart to find out what's going on inside. As mentioned the sound is good, not quite exceptional but crisp and clear. The bass is boomy and a little muddy but not bad for headphone in this price range.These are not wireless headphones. They connect via a heavy, a gigantically heavy, USB cable. I've seen vacuum cleaners from the 1950's that had thinner cables. I know we want isolation and to avoid interference but this is just overkill and adds significant, needless weight to these headphones.I received these headphones in exchange for my review.

I wanted to give this at least four stars but there's really enough drawbacks that it honestly deserves three. A solid "It's Okay", as Amazon puts a three-star review.What I liked. By the way the unit I received is significantly different in design from the product images provided on Amazon, see my photos once they post. The design is very unique. A semi-opaque case with the single speaker mounted to appear to float on the face of the unit. The electronics and display are enclosed in a box inside the smoke colored case. This extends out of the top of the unit and had the controls mounted on top. A very nice feature is separate next/back track controls and volume up/down buttons. This is missing from SO many Bluetooth speakers. The design is retro. Being old it reminds me of a mod clock radio out of the 60's or 70's. The sound quality is good, tone is okay. The unit also supports micro-SD cards, USB memory sticks, 3.5mm plugs from MP3 players and such and surprisingly an FM radio receiver.What I don't like; the FM radio function makes no sense. I've read the instructions several times and it still confuses me. Still. I ,as able to get clear FM reception from the one station I was able to pull in. The display is also retro. Simple red LED lights that could be bigger. The clock only displays 24hour military time. If there's any way to change to normal time I was unable to find it. The single speaker, as mentioned above, has good tone but NO volume. My antiquated flip-phone is as loud, maybe louder, than this speaker. If you wanted to listen to music at night in bed I guess this would do. It's honestly useless for any party type application. On the box I received it clearly states "Transparent Alarm Clock Speaker." It is not an alarm clock. You cannot set an alarm. I really dislike this type of dishonesty.Bluetooth pairing went without a problem but anytime I so much as nudged the speaker the sound would quit for a second. Range was good I was able to have my tablet twenty feet away and the connection was solid.In the end? This looks really neat. Like something I (or your grandparents) would have had in the 70's but volume (yes I fully charged it) wasn't impressive. FM radio function was utterly confusing and what I consider the worst sin, right on the box they say this is an alarm clock and it's not. There's nothing in the instruction about setting an alarm. Heck, I couldn't get it out of military/24hr time. I just wasn't happy or impressed with it.I received this item in exchange for my review.

My mother absolutely loves this navy blue scarf. It's oversized enough to be used/wrapped in so many different ways. It's incredibly warm but it's also light enough to be worn decoratively. The weave is incredibly attractive with silvery sparkling thread throughout the fabric The blue is a very deep color. The softness of this scarf is beyond incredible. With all honestly this is one of the softest items we've ever handled. This is great for going out on chilly nights or just sitting around on the couch at night watching the TV.I received this item in exchange for my review.

This thing puts out an incredible amount of cool steam. Special effects, horror movie, levels of fogging and the steam is as cool as cool could be. I filled the tank perhaps  full and ran it for several hours. There was no problem with the output the entire time it ran. Everything was steady and calm. Several times during the evening I changed the output level between high and then down to the lowest setting available, When I turned it off at bedtime the humidifier had run for hours and still had plenty of water left in the tank. They claim eight to ten hours of continuous operation time and I have no problem believing that, on medium or low, it will easily run that long on a single tank.Cleaning was a breeze. You use no detergent. I've got an old toothbrush set aside for spring when we need to clean the internal parts before storing it for the summer, with the recommended light bleach solution, until next winter rolls around. The forced air heating here in Florida makes the house feel like the middle of an incredibly dry desert. I think this is going to be just enough to moisten up the atmosphere and make it feel somewhat more comfortable. A whole lot easier than having a coffeepot or pan full of water boiling on the stove all night and day long.I received this item in exchange for my review.

Charged both my Kindle Paperwhite and cell phone simultaneously. Had no problem charging one or two devices. Charger fit snugly into the 12v. plug on the car and exhibited no heating or other problems while it charged both devices. Knurled edge made insertion and removal of charger quite easily. The blue LED is bright enough to see but not so bright that it becomes a distraction. Unit is reasonably attractive black and silver, light weight and easy to carry around. Packaging seems to imply that at some time a cable was included with this charger but none was included with the unit I received. Charger worked well enough that I've added it and two micro-USB cables to my traveling gear.I received this item in exchange for my review..

This is  a review of the single chain strand purple and chrome heavy-duty stainless bracelet with a seriously well holding fold-over clasp. Although this bracelet more than eight inches the light purple color looks better on a woman's arm than on a man's/ Although if you're mixing more than one of these bracelets the purple goes better as part as a mixture of colors instead of a single light purple, layer. The materials are seriously high quality and this feels like once you latch it on your wrist you won't be removing it until you're passing it along to the next generation.It comes incredibly well packaged in a quilted black box while the bracelet itself is double wrapped in clear which it took me more than ten minutes to get off the bracelet. The gift box was a bit short for the whole bracelet but id did sit nicely in the box once unwrapped from all the plastic it was in. Something I suggest you remove before giving this as a gift to someone. I still think the color's a bit more feminine than masculine but it's a well made bracelet whoever wears it.I received this item in exchange for my review,

One small change and this would be a five-star device. It's opaque enough to cover a fairly large area with even the low setting picked. This would be great for marking a trail-head, an out house or the central area of a campsite for evening meals, clean-up or games. It weighs next to nothing and can be deflated into an easily packable unit or small enough to strap to your pack and hope it pick up some sun and catch a charge.Now we run face first into the 3-star wall review. The ONLY way this charges is via solar power. It takes quite a bit of light, 'lumens', to cause this to charge. It didn't charge just sitting out in the living room. If I put it directly under the 100 watt light bulb the unit goes into charge mode. My regular headlamp can, at just the right angle, get a little charge going. You have to have this outside, in good view of direct sun when it's not cloudy to get this to charge. It would take pennies per unit to put a USB charging plug onto this device. It would add next to no weight and you could recharge it from battery packs, car chargers, home wall chargers, anywhere. It would honestly add next to nothing to the production cost, you don't even have to include a cable, everyone has at least one already sitting around. As it its you HAVE to rely on sun or bright indoor lights to produce a charge. I honestly think this design choice was patently ridiculous. This thing is fun. It inflates. You could lay catch across your campsite and probably do no real damage to it. It could be banged around while hanging in a heavy wind. I managed to get six solid hours on  of a charge with the light set to the lower of the two settings. If you're camping and it's cloudy or storming and you used the light the night before you are out of luck the next light. This is something you just cannot rely upon.But it's that one stupid, single charging source, flaw takes a great area camping light from five star greatness to three star mediocrity.I received this item in exchange for my review.

You'd really need several of these to kick up a party to full blast but a single bulb is a fun addition to a small den or bedroom. When set to white which is more of bluish color than straight white I'd compare it to a 40 watt bulb, maybe a little dimmer. The numerous colors you can select from on the remote don't quite match between the bulb and the remote but there is quite a variety. Along with the static light colors you can also cycle through the lights in several modes; flash, strobe, fade and smooth. Oddly enough flash changes the light colors faster than strobe which I just don't understand. I'd consider 'strobe' to be the faster cycle between colors but that's the designer's choice. Fade and Smooth seem to be about the same thing with just a longer and slower change of the color. To be honest I have black lampshades on my bedrooms lights and the lamp I've put this bulb in I tend to keep the bulb on red and almost, not quite, as dim as it will go in the settings. It's incredibly eerie and great for reading horror stories on my Kindle PaperWhite. I was happily impressed that the rather large white bulb of this unit fit quite well in the smallish harp of my floor lamp. This is fun and for now I'm going to use it to set the mood for reading and sleeping in my bedroom.I received this item in exchange for my review.

This is a review of the bright orange speaker. I'm torn between three and four stars for this speaker. It's okay, all the way around pretty much okay. The sound is okay. Less bass than some so you can actually hear the mids and highs. Volume doesn't get crazy loud but it's loud enough for a group sitting at a table or hanging out in a small camp site. It's not going to blast your next kegger. I like the orange color as it will be much easier to find if it's dropped in the dark.The bottom of the speaker is one large old style (non-latching) suction cup that holds to smooth surfaces fairly well. Mine's a bit, maybe a bit more, lopsided so it doesn't sit level but that's no real big deal. Controls are a bit hard to see as they're the same color and in the design of the speaker. Also, like lots of speakers I've run into the volume up and down buttons are also the next/previous track buttons. Function depends on how long you hold down the buttons. Forget and go to raise the volume just a touch and you've changed songs instead of the volume. Separate volume and song buttons would be a nice idea. The carabiner the system comes with is a bit small and hard to attach to the small handle but you could put a larger one on that to hang the speaker from a tree, backpack, fence, etc.It's a good speaker. Nothing stands out as great but I do like the idea of the big suction cup and the sound's nice. In a nutshell this is pleasant to listen to and reasonably easy to use.I received this speaker in exchange for my review.

This is a fairly comfortable  headlamp that's reasonably well made. It takes three AAA batteries and produces a decently bright light that has some focus ability and three light modes. Bright, not quite so bright and the ubiquitous flashing feature that every single light manufacturer thinks we need. I've been camping for four decades. I was a scouting leader for more than ten years and I think there was one time a flashing flashlight would have been a useful t draw attention and I accomplished this by using my hand. But the lamp can zoom in and out has to decently bright settings that I wouldn't be afraid to hike easy to moderate trails with in the dark. The straps are comfortably adjustable for most head sizes and will easily fit over a cap or hard-hat. The casing is rubberized for a good grip. All in all it's a decent headlamp that's not that front heavy, stays in place well and comfortably and provides a fairly good amount of light.I received this item in exchange for my review.

This this is awesome. For something that easily sits on the palm of your hand the detail is pretty sharp. It honestly looks like a World War ][ Tiger tank with tons of details. I received the standard, mostly green, camouflage there's also a darker camouflage and a blue tank available. Colors appear to ship randomly. Remote control device coloring also seem to match the tank you get.This little thing really zips around. I was surprised at how quick it gets up and goes. There's also a super speed button on the controller that adds fifty percent to the speed of the tank. There's also engine noises and what I'm guessing are 'track' sounds are this races around. The turret will turn 360° in one direction, I found going one way the barrel would hang up on the antenna but the turret rotation switches back and forth as you rotate. The barrel also raises and lowers as the turret turns. When you press the fire button there's the sound of a cannon firing and the entire tank body recoils backwards.The remote control takes four double A batteries and the tank itself charges from a cable attached to the side of the remote. Charging time is fairly quick and I've already gotten several hours of fun out of the tank and it's still going strong. The only reason I can't give it four stars is the tank just won't drive in a straight line. You can someone adjust for the tendency to turn by steering left or right as you go but it would have been just that much cooler if it had driven in a straight line. Still, I'm a fully grown adult and this is one of my favorite things. It's just such a gas to play with.I received this item in exchange for my review.

It felt like some really horrible writers went on a week long binge drinking while watching rubbish 90's television and incessant reruns of 'Revenge of the Nerds.' Booger? Really? Did he bribe his way onto the show? How hard up are the celebrity guests going to be if the pilot featured Flea who can't act and Shaq who'll shill for any product that hands him a pail of money. I don't watch much television and shows like this are the reason.

The wrist fits a little looser than I'd like but having switched to large gloves from 'one size fits most' other than the slightly too loose wrist cuff the gloves fit SO much better than the one-fits-most that I have been using for the last several years. Finger, palm, knuckles, all fit great without being too loose or too tight. I'm so much happier with gloves that fit right and are comfortable. They're also incredibly stronger and more durable than vinyl gloves which, after getting this box of nitrile I just threw out. These are great.

Another collection of dot-to-dot fun by David Kalvitis. Book Two is just as fun and challenging as book one was. I don't think it will be long before we're ordering books three and four. This is quick, sometimes, and easy, also sometimes, fun o while away a few minutes here and there when you've got spare time to spend.

This is a great, fast to react and accurate pulse oximeter that's very easy to read. A free hint, use a dime or small flat screwdriver to pop open the battery compartment. It's not really rocketry science to pop the door off, insert the batteries and snap the cover back on.From start-up it takes approximately ten seconds to get the reading started. I took this to one of my doctor's offices during a visit on Friday and compared it to the one, a different brand, they use. The oxygen level was spot on and the pulse was off by two beats per minute which isn't any big deal.You can set different alert/alarm levels for too low/high pulse and too low oxygen levels as well as adjust the brightness of the display. The display can be rotated while in use so it can easily be read from the left, right or head on which I found to be an exceptionally handy function.I know the product description and literature state 'For Sports and Aviation Use Only' I'm absolutely certain this is exactly the same oximeter several nurses were using the last time I was in the hospital as well as the visiting nurses who regularly came after I was released. I think the disclaimer 'For Sports and Aviation Use Only' is there just to cover their behinds and while no one should rely on home diagnostics knowing your pulse and oxygen as well as other medical parameters is not a bad thing and can help you decided between a 911 call, a drive to the ER or waiting to see the doctor in the morning. The more information you can provide over the phone the better idea the medical professional you're calling the better idea they can have of your health. If I had one complaint it would be the lanyard. Now I know why none of these I see in offices or being carried by visiting nurses never have the lanyard attached. I spent fifteen minutes, ruined two pins and finally ended up running a length of fishing line through the miniscule holes provided for the lanyard, tied it off and popped it through. . . then I spent a few more minutes getting the fishing line untied.I received this item at a substantial discount from the regular price in exchange for my review.

sThis is a decent, if small for the US market, thermos bottle. The blue color I received was a bit light but was still attractive. At best this holds 17 to 18 ounces of fluid and while it comes with a cup that doubles as a cap it holds less than ½ a cup when filled to the very rim. It reminds me of the cups that are used to serve espresso in. Still, it does fit nicely in the cup holder of our car and it's nice to have along on longer birding trips when you need a quick sip of cold water to wet the whistle.I've tested this with both cold and hot fluids. Both times I filled the thermos prior with cold or hot water to avoid temperature shock and extend the time the insulation would work.* Using cold water I put a few, three or four, small ice cubes in the bottle after tempering it with cool water for a while. I then filled the thermos from a water bottle kept in the 'fridge. After twelve hours although the ice cubes has melted the water was as cold as the moment it was poured from the 'fridge. Twenty-four hour later the water was still noticeably cooler than anything from the faucet and was still quite refreshing,*Using hot water. I again tempered the thermos for a while with the hottest water the faucet could produce. I allowed boiling water to cool for ten minutes or so to avoid melting the plastic parts. After six hours the water was nearly still hot enough to scald. Nine hours later and the water in the thermos was, were it tea or coffee, quite a good temperature for drinking. After twelve hours the water was still warm enough to be drinkable.I was happy with the performance of this thermos bottle with both cold and hot fluids, though I predict cold will be it's main use for me.Of note; there may be important care, maintenance or use instructions on the box. But none were printed in English.First and foremost should be the removal of the desiccate packet shipped in the thermos bottle. I almost overlooked the packet when I went to wash the thermos before it's first use.Secondly I've discovered that if you overfill the bottle the 'Open' button on the plug will not function. At least it would not for me. The cap displaced the water in the neck but created enough pressure when completely full I was utterly unable to operate the open/pour button built into the cap. Some fluid had to be drained out for this to become properly operational. I also noticed that although the bottle did not leak at all under normal use that if you closed the pour spout while still pouring it would tend to leak a small amount caught in the sealing mechanism.All in all I think I'll get a good deal of use out of this thermos. The build quality seems good although I wonder at the longevity of the open/pour function. Only time will tell there. I am pleased with this productI received this thermos at a substantial discount off the regular price in exchange for my review.

Bought the size always worn. These are not standardized sizes. Size 8 in several brand fit just fine. In the Hanes the size 8 felt two maybe even three sizes too small. Elastic was also very tight and binding. Returned for refund. Not recommended.

Well, we don't have a lot to compare with but this is, at the very least, a fun and entertaining dot-to-dot book. Not sure it's the greatest and we're still waiting to hear from the publisher as to what one of the images actually is as the do not include an index or solution at the end of the book if you just can't figure out what something is. It's also been a week since I used the email address included in the book to ask for help and we've heard nothing back. It's a good time break and quite a bit of fun even for adults such as ourselves. Greatest? That may be reaching a bit but it's been well worth the money.

I'm about halfway through the 2ns season of 'Gortimer Gibbon's Life on Normal Street' and I have to say I'm as hooked as I was on season one. Maybe even more so, The writing is head and shoulders above the typical teen/tween offering from Disney or Nickelodeon. It's not insulting and doesn't talk down to the target audience, Yes, there's a moral or lesson to each episode but it doesn't feel forced into the show it feels natural. The main cast Sloane Morgan Siegel, Ashley Boettcher and Drew Justice have been slightly expanded with several reoccurring characters. Sloane, Ashley and Drew continue to feel, act and sound like real kids. I hope this show continues. It doesn't insult the intelligence of their target audience of tweens and teens and I can admit, even an adult like myself can find it entertaining, well done and worth watching.

Uses easy to replace and AAA batteries (rechargeable ones also save money and waste). Lights an 8.5" x 11" sheet of paper, coloring book perfectly and evenly. Light isn't harsh or glaring. Unit stands on its own on the table so can be used to light crafts and meals without having to be clamped to anything. Clamp works equally well on books and clipboards. Gooseneck, even though the wire seems thin, holds it's place well with no slipping or flopping around. A little heavier than the lights that use button batteries but I really like keeping a handful of charged batteries around for whenever they need to be replaced.

This is a review of the blue desk organizer. The construction is quite sturdy and there's plenty of storage spaces for pencils, pens, Post-It notes, stamps etc. It's great for organizing your desk. This would also be good in the kitchen or bathroom although I'm unsure of the metal it's made from, the product page just says 'metal' so it may rust in a damp bathroom environment. The blue is very attractive. The storage is useful and holds quite a lot. The rubber/plastic feet keep it from scratching your desk or counters. My only problem was the unit I received wasn't quite level but I found a thin piece of cardboard that I was able to double over and level out the unit. The wobbling was a bit annoying until I was able to get it leveled.I received this item in exchange for my review.

The design is nice. With a single speaker pointing upward it's not blaring into your face and you can use the ceiling or shelves above it to help disperse the sound around the room. Sound quality is good, a little more bass than high end but a good speaker for parties and hanging out and the volume level is loud enough to be heard easily from across the yard.Pairing with my ancient cell phone and Samsung tablet went flawlessly. The speaker comes with a carabiner (mine, unlike the blue one in the product images, was black) to hang or secure the speaker in place, a short dual 3.5mm ended cable for connecting MP3 players and such as well as a micro-USB cable for charging. There's also a micro-SD card slot so you can load the speaker with hours of your favorite music and go. Do note the water resistant properties are not functional when the cover over the charging or 3.5mm jack connectors is open. Speaking of water resistance; The product description here on Amazon claims this speaker complies with IPX5 water resistance specifications while the documentation included with the speaker states in two places that it's IPX4 certified. For those of you wondering about the IPX specifications are:* IPX4 - Protected against splashing water. 'Water splashing against the enclosure from any direction shall have no harmful effect.'* IPX5 - Protected against Water jets. 'Water projected by a nozzle (6.3 mm) against enclosure from any direction shall have no harmful effects.'Test durations and other IPX information is freely available online. I honestly don't know which to believe if this complies with IPX 4 or 5 standards. Personally I don't think I'd use it in the rain or shower but wouldn't worry about it getting wet with drips sitting pool side.The speaker has a decently attractive blue light ring around the bottom. I had hoped it might change color on a cycle but it stayed blue except when charging, then the light ring is red.The controls are. . . funky. The volume up/down buttons and the next/previous buttons are the same. You have to long press either to change the volume even a little. I repeatedly found myself tapping the buttons for a little more/less volume and switching songs instead. It's something of an annoyance you just have to deal with if you're using the speaker itself to control things (especially true if using a micro-SD card).In the end. . . Good sound. Decent looking. Handy carabiner. At least IPX4 level water resistance. A little hard to use. Okay battery life of about four hours. A little slow to charge, instructions state four hours to full charge. Not a bad speaker at all.I received this item in exchange for my review.

This is a review of the black version of this saw. The four ounce saw comes in a decently sturdy nylon pouch that securely clasps shut and has a belt loop so you can carry it on your belt or, as I di, on one of the multiple straps on my backpack. Sure, I'd rather have a nice, heavy axe or gas powered chain-saw for that matter but this ultra light weight saw is crazy sharp and something that doesn't add huge weight or bulk to your gear. It's only a few ounces, why not carry it with you as an emergency backup? The handles are big enough for even the biggest of hands. The twenty-four inch cutting blade is very much like an actual chain-saw blade unlike the 'diamond' impregnated wire saws that rarely, if ever, work. This is going t be part of my bug out gear from now on.I received this saw in exchange for my review.

I like that this charges via a USB cable and can charge from your computer or just about any Kindle, tablet or cell phone wall charger. That makes it pretty handy. But. . . there's always a but, and that comes along with the twelve dollar price for this charger and including a spare battery, I paid more than that for a better known brand replacement battery alone when I got my Fujifilm X-E2.The charger works, about three to four hours for a full charge from my laptop's USB port. But the but is here. The quality of the charger body is light, thin plastic that feels like I could easily snap it. The charging contacts are very thin and light metal that could easily be bent out of place. It's really like you're paying for a replacement NP-W126 battery and they're throwing in a freebie USB charger. It's more inexpensive than cheap but in total it's not high quality but you're not paying a high quality premium here. You honestly get what you pay for with this charger and battery. It's going in my gear bag where it' going to get bounced around for charging on the road.The battery itself that's included fit my Fujifilm X-E2 perfectly. I didn't have a chance to get it out in the field for a solid test but I was able to sit here in the house using my 18-55 lens. I changed focus and zoom repeatedly. I used the flash for at least twenty shot. The battery was still going strong after over two hundred shots. It seems to be a good quality replacement NP-W126 battery.Charging couldn't be simpler. The unit's single LED light is red while the battery is charging and once fully charged the light turns blue. I tested this with the included battery, an actual Fuji brand NP-W126 battery and another replacement brand cell. All appeared to charge well.I received this kit in exchange for my review.

This is a review of the blue version of this credit card wallet. The blue at first seems much darker in person than shown on Amazon. But once you get it in brighter light (and realize the photographs, mine included, were taken with a flash)  it seems closer to the color displayed on the product information page. The wallet is nicely light with plenty of room for credit cards, IDs and we keep lists of family medications handy in it as well. The only thing I wouldn't keep in this is cash, except maybe for an emergency $20 or so, since cash has to be folded so many times it becomes difficult to count out and can really annoy a cashier trying to get it into their register. Of note, in one of the product pictures on Amazon 'Shell-D' is displayed prominently on the outside of the case. On the one I received the external case had no markings and the 'Shell-D' was printed on the inside.The only reason I'm not giving this five stars is the hinge and latch are somewhat cheap. The latch opens very easily. Even my 84 year old mother with bad arthritis has no problem opening this and I hope with care the case gives a few years of service but the quality, especially of the hinges, could have been better.I recommend this more for front pocket or jacket carrying as it's a bit uncomfortable in the back pocket.I received this item in exchange for my review.

I chose the bronze credit card  wallet over the gold (a little gaudy) and the silver (a little old fashioned) and I couldn't be happier with my choice. The bronze tone is subtle yet distinctive enough to b eye catching. The embossed pattern on the case really is beautiful and well done. Lines were even weight and thickness and there's just enough room left in the center medallion for a small initial engraving. Thought I don't know if engraving could negatively effect the RFID blocking. The wallet, even though it's metal is not that heavy and weighs in a little less than my quality all leather wallet.I like this for credit cards, they stay in place fairly well and can be removed and replaced SO much easier than those old style plastic sleeves that entirely cover your cards. Just make sure you open it upright and with care as cards can fall out when opened upside down. This is slightly less useful for cash which needs to be folded three or four times over to fit which makes it a pain to count bills out, limits the amount you can carry and  will really annoy cashiers trying to get the money into their registers (having been a cashier I can attest to this). I would recommend carrying this in a jacket or the front pants pocket. There's no give like a leather wallet and carrying this in your back pocket could be a little uncomfortable.The catch is fairly easy to open but I found, due to some disability issues, I had to stop and really pay attention to what I was doing.I received this item in exchange for my review.

Now that's different. The flavor definitely, sorta, somewhat remind you of Cherry Cola. The flavor makes a decided change about half-way through the mint.While it really isn't exactly Cherry Cola flavored it does have a distinct and interesting flavor. Comparatively we've tried several different flavors and these are far better than the Strawberry Fields, Orange and Apple flavors though we still prefer the Wild Cherry flavor best though those appear hard to come by lately. Still these are quite enjoyable.

So far so good. I've only had these a short while. They're far heavier than the last two pair of skis I've had on my walker (the last set lasting less than four months) these are also a lot quieter on the hard floors in the house and garage. I haven't had them outside on tarmac and concrete where the majority of the wear will eventually come from. As they stand I like the way they glide and feel indoors we'll just have to see how well and long they last and wear. I'll update the review as time goes on.

I checked this against a different kitchen scale and the weights were spot on. This scale has a single monolithic top where you can place just about anything you want to weigh. Even though it's easy to clean you might want to put a sheet of plastic wrap over it when measuring wet, messy products that may cross contaminate.The scale has two buttons mounted just under the front edge. One being a power button that also doubles as a tare (labeled 'zero' here) function. You can continually add products while removing the weight of the item(s) you've already weighed. This is great for baking, you don't have to pre-weigh items, just put down a bowl on the scale, hit the tare/zero button and add each ingredient repeating the process. The second button switches between Imperial weight & fluids and metric weight and fluids.This runs on two, included, AAA batteries that are easy to replace in a compartment on the bottom of the unit. About the only thing I really don't  care for about this scale is the red LED style display. It's very. . . 1980's feeling though it is quite readable. All in all this is a nicely usable scale that's quite accurate, easy to clean and stable on the counter.I received this item in exchange for my review.
Unplayable. Menus appear as blocks of black with no readable text. I've tried a dozen times and I can't see where I'm going or what I'm doing. Never got any part of the game to play. I quit.

First off the ear bud/ear pieces are huge and made of metal. They're uncomfortable to wear and no matter which plug combinations you use they tend to easily fall right out of your ears. Secondly the controls are just off one of the ear pieces. They're impossible to see that close to your ear and it takes a while to memorize the controls so in the meantime you're yanking a bud out of your ear to see what you're doing. Also the cord isn't quite long enough so these have a tendency to slide completely off your neck when an ear bud pops out while exercising and you're hands are busy.Sound quality was mediocre with flat heavy bass that managed to lack punch and the high ends are muddy and confused. I also noted one side sounded much worse than the other. Not only myself but two other people I showed these to said one side had worse sound.While they call these 'sport' and sweatproof, the charging plug opening has no cover. One seems to be shown in a couple of the product pictures but the set I received have the USB plug completely wide open for sweat or rain to easily get in. I wouldn't recommend these headphones. There's a sea of cheap Bluetooth headphones flooding the Amazon market. The only difference is whose name is silkscreened on the product.I received these headphones in exchange for my review.

The wallet is very nicely made with even and straight stitching it appears to be real leather. The product description here on Amazon says Napa leather but I did noticed that other than 'Leopardd' there was nothing else stamped or printed in or on the wallet. The black color I received (a chocolate brown is also available.) has a nice finish. It's not overly glossy, much more of a satin finish which I really appreciate.There are two bill pockets each more than big enough for US money. There are six credit card slots divided into two sections one on either side of the wallet. Under each of the credit card sections there's a small 'extra' pocket. I keep my list of medications and doctor's in one. On the left side (inside, opening the wallet) is a flip-up pocket with a clear cover suitable for an ID or driver's license. This pocket is tight enough to hold your ID in place but not so tight you'll fight with it if you're asked to remove it. With four cards, my ID/licenses and some cash this wallet wasn't any thicker than the other two I own. This is an overall nice product.I received this item in exchange for my review.

Torn between three and four stars. The flower designs themselves are four star work all day long. They're well drawn, very pretty and complex enough to present a challenge. Then you come to the border that's added to each image. They seem to have been made deliberately complex. Far more so than the flower designs they surround. Those I feel deserve three stars, Deliberately done to confuse and humble the colorist. Not the best collection of work. One saving grace is they're single sided and with a provided spacer page you can use markers to color these images. All in all, worthy of three and a half stars.

There's a happy medium to be found in adult coloring books. On one side are designs so complex they take hours to decipher let alone color. The creators revel in complexities that confound the normal eye to see. Where one mistake can ruin hours of work. On the other hand there are adult coloring books whose designs look as if they're children's drawings from the back of the 'fridge with the color removed or, worse (I've been there) the barely legible scribbles of adults in long term care facilities to color. I find both ends of this spectrum, and lets not pretend they don't exist, to be insulting and a waste of money. Images so simple; cat, broom, bucket, table or so complex they were likely computer generated are ridiculous. Sitting down to color, to relax, let off some stress and express a little creativity are sometimes hard to find. This book 'Simply Circular Designs Coloring Book' by Dover Press is the perfect middle ground between complexity and simplicity. You can put as much or as little as you like into the work and still enjoy the process. We've bought adult coloring books for years and will certainly be looking for more right along these lines. This is one of the best design books put together. Highly recommended!

Good cherry flavor and luckily there was a cool front that cam through as it shipped so none melted on the trip here. This had been the lip balm we've used for many decades and we're quite content with this product. It does the job and doesn't leave the lips sticky or greasy. Life long fans.

Sure, I could have gone with a remote control wall plug but that would have added another remote control to the pile in my bedroom and I'd likely turn on the TV or stereo. I could also have gone with one of those clappy devices but they've been around forever and anytime I think of those things I picture the old lady from the original TV commercials from the 80's. No, I have an Amazon Echo and I want to be able to say "Alexa, turn off 'The Light.'" when I'm ready for bed. Yes, I named the device 'The Light' my imagination was bored. Feel free to post better names in the comment if you can think of any.Set-up was honestly as easy as the pictographs on the card that comes with the device and the instructions you scroll through after installing the WeMo app. Even being disabled and working from a walker plus having to go hunt down the router's password it took maybe ten minutes to get up and working with my Echo and the switch did a firmware update while I was in the shower. I'm in nerd heaven being able to tell my Echo to turn on and off my bedroom light. That's just too cool.

We've used Swiffer products for a while now and this 360 is somewhat more useful especially getting into tight spaces but I really find myself just flipping the handle over and keeping on dusting with the top/back side after the face becomes filthy. This new 360° unit has a redesigned handle from one we purchased a few years ago. It's firmer and thinner which I don't have any problem with but for my older mother it's much nicer for her small hands than the previous bigger, bulbous handle on our previous 360° Swiffer.You get the handle and two scentless (we prefer the scented honestly) duster heads. They call this a 'value'. I guess it's been a while since I got a starter kit, we still have several of the original blue loop handled dusters from ages ago. Maybe getting two duster heads is a bargain to get when you buy a handle these days.

This is a review of the 2-Indicators model of carbon monoxide detector. Set-up was incredibly easy; remove the back plate, install three Double-A batteries which on my model fit very tight and snapped firmly, loudly into place. You then drill two small holes and insert the plastic anchors into the wall, tighten the back plate onto the anchors then snap the body onto the back plate. Total time from unpacking to hanging was less than half an hour and I'm disabled.There's a test button which verifies the device and batteries are functional as well as a single green LED that flashes every thirty seconds to show the batteries are functioning. Each time I've pressed the test button I received 000 ppm. I don't know if I stuck this behind the tailpipe of my car if this would change but it's there on the wall and I feel safer in my own home. The alarm is more than loud enough to wake me from out in the hall.I received this item in exchange for my review.

Three stars here, in the end, it's Hershey's chocolate and if you were raised on it and never tasted a quality chocolate you'll likely be happy with these. I had hopes that Hershey's had changed and/or improved their recipe in the twenty or so years since I last ate some but they haven't.  These are edible, don't get me wrong. They won't make you sick but the milk chocolate is a bit oily and bland. The dark chocolate is a little better but it lacks the bite of a true dark chocolate. The caramel isn't chewy like what I expect from a chocolate covered caramel. It's very. . . smooth, it melts very easily with a slightly oily feel. I really wasn't very impressed with my return to Hershey's chocolates. In the parlance of Amazon's rating system. I'm giving this three stars 'It's okay' and that's the best I can really say about it.

My review is of the 5-liter version of the LifeStraw mission water purifier.Assembly and set up are unbelievably easy. Fill the roll-bag with the cleanest water you have access to. Roll, seal and hang the bag using the handy nylon strap they include. Attach the hose (which also easily detaches) and let the water begin to flow. Purge the red valve which is bad water and then wait for the water to begin flowing from the blue valve which is the good water. Detailed instructions are included and printed on the roll-bag. The kit also comes with a handy stuff sack and a couple extra primary filters which mount inside the roll-bag.The 5-liter size is good enough for two people, perhaps two adults and a child. For more people you're going to want the higher capacity bag or more than one of these 5-liter kits. I wanted to give this an honest trial. I almost went with the pool water but the chlorine and other chemicals worried me and after an email from the company I'm glad I didn't. Under no circumstances should you attempt to filter pool water. Luckily we received a good amount of rain. Water drains out of our neighborhood through a system of swales and where it runs across our yard we have a good grass base for it to flow across. We took our bag full of water from the front yard and followed all the instructions very carefully. After purging the red valve and bulb I filled a cup from the blue valve side and. . .  it tasted as good as the filtered water from our refrigerator. 24 hours later and no adverse effects. This has earned my trust and we'll happily be adding it to our hurricane supplies.I received this item in exchange for my review

These are the best LifeSavers flavor I've ever had and the best quick, more or less low calorie full sugar treat we've found. There's only approx. 15 calories per piece of candy. Buying them in bulk bag is even more economical than buying boxes of rolled Lifesavers candies and they'll last a whole lot longer.

I was torn between three and four stars for this review. The holder is cute and a quick glance can make you think of a leaking bucket and a puddle of water. It's a fun addition to the desk. That's four-stars worthy. On the other hand the plastic 'water' is fragile and cheap and the falling section feels like it could easily snap under moderate pressure. Where it attaches to the bucket there's nothing keeping it in place. I wouldn't put a lot in the bucket, a few pencils, a couple pens, maybe some hard candy but not much else. That's the three-star part, the quality is pretty poor. But it's still cute so it gets the four for now. That can always change if it suddenly breaks.I received this item in exchange for my review.

We've only tried one package out of this bucket a beef stroganoff just to see how preparation and the flavor was. Preparation couldn't be easier, add boiling water, wait a bit then eat. we got two decent sized servings out of the pouch and were satisfactorily filled and the flavor was surprisingly good. The rest of the bucket is in going into our hurricane supplies.

I liked it until they changed it and added more areas and. . .  I don't know why but the beta, unfinished version just felt more fun. When the polished it the fun went down. Plus it really taxed the capabilities of my Samsung Galaxy Tab2 10.1. Still fun but now that there's more to me it's less.

It's been awhile since I played this and all I remember was grind, grind, grind. You just hammer at levels to open more. It was more like a job I'd quit after less than a week than a game I would ever enjoy playing.

This was a fun game that seriously pushed the capabilities of my Samsung Galaxy Tab2 10.1 tablet. In a very rare fit of enjoyment I made in app purchases to aid my playing of the game. Graphics are rather nice as are the sound effects. I've spent quite a few hours playing this game.
The app works okay but I only really downloaded it so I could set up an account to work with my Amazon Echo.

It works, sort of. The timer doesn't add preceding zeros and sometimes as the numbers change they pop back and forth, Timer is accurate though not really attractive. Font and background can't be changed. It also functions only in portrait mode and will not rotate to landscape. I needed it for a project. Will probably never run it again.

Granted I've only had these for a short while but I've had positive experiences with other sizes of AmazonBasics alkaline batteries and after price shopping for a while I just could not beat the price of .31 per unit for the 36-pack I purchased. I've already used six of these in devices around the house and all worked well. I couldn't be happier with the purchase.

One look at the product images and the ones I'll upload with my review and you'll be asking yourself the same thing I did. "How come what was delivered looks nothing like what's advertised?" The advertised product shows large chunks of salt much closer to the 6mm size of the 3 - 6mm advertised. The salt I received is far closer to 1 - 3mm with very, very few larger pieces and maybe a scant handful that come close to 6mm in size. It still works in my grinder but it's not what I expected when I ordered this bag of salt. I understand this is a natural product and there are vagaries in size with such products but what I received looks nothing like what I ordered. I like the flavor of the product, it's a bit wetter than I'd like so it clumps in the grinder but my complaint is not being sold what I expected. I doubt I'll order from this brand again.

Well, the timers are pretty colors. That's about all the good I can say about them as a whole. Once I got these I broke out a stopwatch app for Windows that I also tested for accuracy. Once I knew the stopwatch was accurate I tested these timers several times from each side.The results were as follows:The 30 second timer - AccurateThe 01 minute timer - AccurateThe 02 minute timer - one side of the timer was repeatedly 01 second fast. Flipping the timer it repeatedly was 09 seconds slow.The 03 minute timer - was +/- 01 second on either side.The 05 minute timer - repeatedly 25/26 seconds slow on one side. Repeatedly a full minute slow on the other side.The 10 minute timer - repeatedly 1:35 seconds from one side. Over two minutes slow from the other.You could use the 30 second, 01 minute and 03 minute timers. The other three range from bad to ridiculously bad for keeping time. They're kinda cute. Kids could play with them with some supervision to get an idea about time. The caps appear well glued on. They're just lacking quality control in production. For the current price of more than ten dollars these are way overpriced for what you get. These are Dollar Store quality at best.I received these timers in exchange for my review.

This interchangeable magnifying glass set is quite handy. My mother enjoys doing crafts and some of the instructions and labels are just too small for her to read. She had been using an antique glass that has been in the family for years but it lacked a light. The light on this handle, powered by three AAA batteries, is very bright and perfectly placed for using these lenses. This set comes with three detachable lenses; 2.5x, 5x and 16x. To be honest the 16x lens is a little too small and so thick very little of it is usable for focus. We put that lens aside and have kept the 5x lens mounted on the handle. It's perfect for reading small labels on colored pencils and directions from hobby kits. This set is very handy to have around.I received this set in exchange for my review.

This is a differently shaped set of salt and pepper grinders. Modern yet understated. The brushed metal tops even though they're brushed do pick up fingerprints like crazy so be ready to either live with it or polish them frequently. we've voted to just live with it as polishing salt and pepper shakers over and over seems to be a silly practice. The set comes with no salt or pepper. I had peppercorns on hand but had to order some coarse salt to test the grinder with. I went with some 3-6mm coarse Himalayan pink salt which we've come to like even more than our previous, Diamond Crystal Natural Sea Salt, product. The grinders have some adjustability. finer or coarser output by turning the butterfly nut on the end of the grind assembly. Both seem to work well and be reasonably well made. I won't be throwing our previous salt & pepper set away but we're going to give these center stage for now.I received these items in exchange for my review.

These washcloths, at about ten by ten inches are somewhat larger but a bit thinner than your usual washcloths are unbelievably, unimaginably soft. I was floored when I opened the box and pulled the first one out. These are made from what? Bamboo? No way, seriously? Bamboo? I've had bamboo in my meals. I've walked on floors and used cutting boards made from bamboo but washcloths? The softest washcloths we've ever felt? It's absolutely astounding. We both threw away our nylon shower poufs and hung these washcloths in the shower in their place. Yes, they'd be fantastic for babies and small children but they're great for adults as well.I received these washcloths in exchange for my review.

Pretty copper mugs. A little on the thin side and they're copper plated (they say coated) stainless steel. They're not double walled so don't expect any insulating properties but these are nice, though they do sweat and condense so use a coaster if you use ice. Do note, these are metal, metal conducts heat well and rapidly. Use caution if you use these or any other metal vessel for hot drinks. Another thing to note is these will pick up oily or greasy finger prints quite easily. To the very rim they hold 16 Oz. leaving a little room so you don't spill your drink everywhere you're looking at more like 14 Oz. of capacity. In the end these are an attractive, somewhat pricy copper plate traditional mug shaped style. They see reasonably durable though only time will tell how well they hold their shine.I received these mugs in exchange for this review.

This is a review of the blue and grey Lasergrip 1022 digital laser infrared thermometer. This was super easy to get up and working. The hardest part was, for me, was getting the plastic wrapped 9v. battery out of the handle. Once unwrapped, connected and put back in the handle all I had to do was choose between Fahrenheit or Celsius and if I wanted the laser pointer on or not and I was off taking the temperature of things. This thing is a blast. Yes, it's useful. I checked the 'fridge and freezer to see what they were at. I also checked the oven to see how accurate it is (good enough for me!) But the real fun was just seeing what the temperature of. . . stuff was; our plasma TV was over 100°, A/C register on the ceiling 65°, the large burner on the glass-top stove over 900°. We roamed all over the house having a blast. I do want to see how hot my car gets, inside and out, the next time I have it out in the sun for a few hours.I received this item in exchange for my review.

The shape and style of this diffuser is a bit. . . bland. In reality is a squat white plastic tower with two buttons on the back and a vent on the top for the vapor. But then you turn the light on and it fills the room with a captivating light show as it slowly cycles through a multitude of colors. The diffuser can be set to run for 60, 180, 360 minutes or continually until the water reservoir runs low. You can also run the light show with the misting feature off. One other light setting, pure white in high, warm and low is also available.I use a good grade Sandalwood oil with ours. With the diffuser full to just above half full the output isn't strong, a stream about four to six inches can be seen and the scent is light in  large room. But once you get don below the halfway full point the output greatly increases as does the potency and reach of the scent. I've found I can easily get two or more hours of strong output when filling the tank slightly less than half way. We truly enjoy the lightshow as much as the oil diffusion feature.I received this item in exchange for my review.

We burn these several times a day often lighting more than one stick at a time here in the living room and I also burn one stick at night to help me drift off to sleep. The scent is light and a little sweet with woodsy undertones. We find the scent incredibly relaxing and pleasant. Each stick burns for approximately twenty to twenty-five minutes and the scent lingers a half hour afterwards. Each box comes with a small blue ceramic tile to stand the incense sticks up, we have a small brass candy dish we use to collect the ash and using the tiles does leave a small unburned stub which I collect, save, and occasionally burn on a charcoal plug for use in a brazier. I discovered Morning Star Sandalwood incense in the 1980's and have been buying them ever since. This is our favorite incense brand and favorite scent from them. These ship surprisingly well. I've bought them through Amazon many times and rarely find as many as two broken sticks.

I absolutely love these Febreze vent clips and the Meadows & Rain scent is the best of those I've tried. It's never overpowering even when the car sits in the sun and bakes for hours. You can adjust the amount of scent released with a slider on top of the unit. The clip fits the vents on our car perfectly. It's out of the way in the corner and doesn't interfere with aiming the airflow at all. I get approximately three weeks in the summer with the clips set to the middle scent flow setting. In the winter when it's cooler down here in Florida I can easily get five weeks from a vent clip. I buy these in quantity to save some money.

This review is of the ten (10) foot IBRA® HDMI Cable. The cable annoyingly came packaged in a very hard to open clamshell package. This cable, unlike two others I received from the company used twist-ties to keep the cable coiled in shipment. Much easier to remove these than zip-ties used on other cables. Build quality is quite nice and the ten foot cord lets you put your devices where you want. The cable is a bit pricy but the quality seems worth it.I received this cable in exchange for my review.

This review is for the six (6) foot blue HDMI cable. This cable is actually woven of plastic not cloth. Caps are provided to keep dust and debris from the cable connectors. The cable I received came in a plain grey Mylar bag with an identifying label. One thing I honestly cannot understand was the use of zip-ties to keep the cable coiled in transit. Twist-ties would make much better sense. Now I have to get in close to the cable with a knife or scissors and risk damaging the cable itself removing the ties. I had no functionality issues with the cable but also saw no remarkable improvement compared to the cable we had been using. The build quality is quite nice and at the time of this review the price, under six dollars, is quite nice.I received this item in exchange for my review.

This is a review of the ten (10) foot 3.5mm to 3.5mm (male to male) audio cable. The cable I selected has a light blue band on each of the cable ends. The cable had the appearance of a woven cord cable when I saw the product listing but slightly disappointing the woven effect is just appears to be molded into a stiff plastic outer covering. I don't understand the use of zip-ties to coil the cable, they were very hard to remove.  When used to connect two devices to one another it's fine. I use the cable to connect a pair of dual use, wireless and wired, headphones to my laptop which lacks Bluetooth connectivity. Using this way I have to take care to keep the cable from rubbing on my neck while I'm sitting here listening to music or watching videos. The cord is rather. . . scratchy, rough and uncomfortable against my bare skin. The audio quality is fantastic the only other thing you have to watch out for is the cable rubbing against itself especially the couple feet closest to the headphones. The sound of rubbing transmits readily through the hard plastic coating. So, okay, the cable is scratchy and sound is transmitted if the cable rubs. Even with those small flaws the audio quality is great and the extra range is a great plus. I can move around the room and keep the headphones on.I received this item in exchange for my review.

I can't give this five stars, I just can't. Most importantly because this is goodbye. What a long strange trip it's been folks. I still remember looking at the cover of 'The Colour of Magic' in the bookstore and thinking what the heck am I in for. I vividly remember telling my friends that they had to read this insane book I'd found and trying to describe it to them. Now here we are, it's over. In the past it never felt like Terry was milking the popularity to rake in more cash. Every book felt fresh and new, until now, here at the end of all things Discworld.I understand Terry Pratchett was ill and not at the top of his game while writing Shepherd's Crown but I just couldn't love this book like I have the past dozens. The dialog seems wrong. The ending felt all too easy. At the halfway point I fairly accurately predicted the ending. It just happened, poof, it's over. Nowhere did the conflict feel like conflict. No one was in any real danger. . . well, okay, one person was but I guessed that part too.I finished the book. Now I'm sad. I'm sad that this last Discworld book wasn't all that great. In fact, as I've been writing this review I've lowered it from four stars to three. According to Amazon three stars means "It's okay" and that all I really can say about it and that makes me even sadder. The last Discworld novel should have left me laughing and crying and the Luggage should have made a cameo!The Shepherd's Crown should not have been Terry Pratchett's last book. It's not worthy.

We're no strangers to Hefty Odor Block tall kitchen trash bags. We've been using the Lavender & Vanilla scent bags forever, we very much enjoy the scent. Those and the Unscented varieties were all our local grocery store carried. When the Clean Apple became available for review I jumped at the chance to try a different scent. Using the Lavender & Vanilla when you 'pop' the bag open before putting it in the can that area of the kitchen fills with the scent. While not overpowering that scent is present upwards of two days. when you throw something out you get a little waft of the perfume. Imagine my surprise when opening the box of Clean Apple scent bags and barely being able to smell anything with my nose up against the brand new package of bags. It was time to take the trash out anyhow so I brought one of the Clean Apple bags into the kitchen and shook it open and there was barely any scent when I'm used to a much more potent perfume.These bags perform as well as the Lavender & Vanilla and Unscented varieties. They're very durable and will hold a lot of trash without failing. The drawstrings are long enough where I can make a neck at the top of the bag and tie it off tightly so no smells can escape while the bags sit in the town's collection bin for up to a week waiting for collection in the Florida summer heat. We've tried other brands when there have been sales and were not happy with them. The Hefty Odor Block Drawstring bags are the ones we keep coming back to. The Clean Apple are a strong bag and they do appear to keep odor in they just don't have enough of a scent for us. We'll use these since they're just as strong but will be going back to the Lavender & Vanilla when they're gone.

Berry flavored evil is what this is. I know it's a 'thing' down here in the South, I don't know how they do it. The first time I tried it the powder coated the inside of my mouth and took forever to get the taste out. The fruit 'flavor' tastes like the cheapest dollar store punch crossed with the bitter acidic tang of aspirin. It was absolutely horrible and it lingers forever.Each powder packet contains 325mg of Acetaminophen, 500mg of Aspirin, and 65mg of Caffeine. An okay mixture for mild to maybe slightly moderate pain or headaches. It did seem to take effect a little quicker than taking tablets or capsules but the few extra minutes shaved off taking the powder is offset by its horrible flavor and grainy mouth feel. I think I'd rather have a headache than ever take this again.

This is a nice pair of 18650 2600mAh rechargeable batteries. They came in a sturdy well fitting plastic case. Out of the box they had some charge in them but I put them in my charger to top them off. It took a few hours to bring the batteries up to full charge. I tested these in two devices; a headlamp rig that's designed for 18650 batteries. Performance was great. Light output was as good as with any other cells. I used the light for a couple hours and noticed no change in the light intensity. I topped the batteries off again and using an adapter put one cell in a flashlight that normally uses the much larger 26650 6800mAh battery and the light was just as bright. I am quite pleased with the performance as well as the included storage box.I received this item in exchange for my review.
This is a fine radio with quality sound for a small radio.  I live in Providence, RI and I picked up 2 HD radio stations.  It also picks up primarily FM stations, but no AM stations.

This Sony charger charges 4 AA or 4 AAA rechargeable batteries.  Plus, it comes with 4 pre-charged AA batteries.You may charge one, two, three, or four batteries, AA or AAA, in any configuration, such as one AA and three AAA batteries or just one battery.  There are four separate light indicators for each of the four batteries.  The light indicator is orange when charging and when a battery is charged, the light turns off for that  battery.It has an easy and simple plug, which pops out, to put into the electrical outlet.The charger automatically turns off in a few hours when all charges are complete.

Please note that this review contains spoilers.Can even Superman survive when the power of the atom is released?In this alternate reality of a world gone mad, it seems as if everyone dies, including Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg, Lex Luther, and many other "heroes and villains".This is all caused by the Flash when he travels back in time to change an important event in his life.  This change goes horribly wrong by creating major ripples in time, leading to an all out and devasting war between the underwater people of Atlantis and the warrior Amazon women.How does this war start?  Picture the somewhat graphic image of Queen Diana (Wonder Woman) of the Amazons holding in her hand the lifeless head of Queen Mera, wife of King Aquaman of Atlantis....  By the end of this saga, the war becomes all consuming and horrific in its nature.Please note that there are many graphic images, including the usual guns and bullets, arrows and swords, blood and gore, people pounding with no mercy on people, and of people being blown to bits.  There are sea monsters, helping Atlantis, and land monsters from Greek mythology, helping the Amazons.  I don't want to overstate the violence, but you may want to preview this animated war film.  For many, it may not be appropriate for young children.  This is not your usual Saturday children's animated hero show.However, there is one graphic scene with Queen Diana (Wonder Woman) that really shocked me.  In this segment, Queen Diana battles a Captain Marvel like character and subdues him with her magic lasso.  Queen Diana forces him to say Shazam,  reverting him back to 6 children.  Off camera, Queen Diana puts one of the kids to the sword (and presumably the other 5 kids as well!).  Wow, that really stunned me.Furthermore, wonder what happens when Queen Diana meets Steve Trevor?  Well, their first meeting is his last meeting.Aquaman is equally evil and without mercy.  He thrusts his trident into Lex Luther and rips Cyborg apart, piece by piece, revealing Cyborg's beating heart.  And Aquaman plays a pivotal part in starting the war when he commits a major indiscretion, showing a great lapse in moral judgement.By the decisions made by Aquaman and Queen Diana, parts of the earth are laid waste.The main characters in this film are Flash, Batman, and Cyborg, along with Aquaman and Wonder Woman.  Superman's character and Hal Jordan play minor roles.  There are quite a few supporting characters including versions of Aqualad, Black Manta, Ocean Master, and assorted villains and heroes.Finally, on an emotional note, there is Barry Allen (Flash) and his relationship with his mother and there is an unusual twist involving Bruce Wayne and his father, Dr. Wayne.  There is also a tragic and not so funny implied twist regarding Bruce Wayne's mother....  She's quite mad, just like this twisted alternate world.

These are 9 hard plastic battery holders which store AA or AAA batteries.  As noted in the description, there are 9 plastic boxes which hold 4 batteries each, for a total storage of 36 batteries.Here is what I received.  The 9 plastic boxes are actually not individually separated boxes.  Rather, 3 boxes are attached to each other, so you get 3 rows of 3 plastic boxes, with each row containing 12 storage units, for a total of 36 storage units.You may also link or snap together all 3 rows and create a long and narrow storage unit with 36 units.It also comes with blue velcro which you may use to bundle the 3 rows together.

I use this product to treat my Clivia seeds.  It dramatically improves the rate of germination by preventing the seeds from turning into mush.  It helps prevent the seeds from being eaten by some kind of mold.  When I do not use this product, a lot of the seeds get mushy.The plastic container contains a light yellow powder which you mix with water.  You have to be careful and make sure the dust doesn't fly everywhere.  A small amount of it will get in the air, but it doesn't seem to cause a problem for me.  Obviously, try not to breathe it into your lungs.  If you want, you may wear an air mask.Here are directions which include information from other websites for growing Clivia seeds.  This is what you do with your Bonide Captan solution.1. Use the solution to soak the Clivia seeds overnight.  If the seeds are older, soak longer.  If fresh, overnight soaking is fine.  I also sometimes put in soluble seaweed as a light and natural fertilizer with the Bonide Captan solution.2. Treat the soil with the Bonide Captan solution.3. Clivia seeds have a tiny dark spot.  Plant with the dark spot facing up.  Plant about half the seed and leave the other half exposed to the air and bright light.  I noticed that seeds exposed to light germinate, while the seeds which I buried more deeply with no light may not germinate so you may even expose more of the seed to the air and light.4. Cover the seeds with plastic or other cover to keep the seeds moist.5. Every so often, check your seeds and spray or water the seeds with the Bonide Captan solution to keep the seeds moist.6. Keep the seeds warm.7. I also water occasionally with a strong solution of soluble seaweed. Pour a little bit of this fertilizer over each seed.  For example, once, when three of the four seeds had leaf growth and the fourth one did not, I poured the soluble seaweed on the fourth one and I saw leaf growth on that seed.  It doesn't always work, but it does seem to help.The most important thing is to get fresh seeds which tend to be large and white and firm.  They germinate fast.  Older seeds are wrinkled and more shriveled looking and may not germinate.

This seaweed fertilizer is soluble like other fertilizers in which you put a small amount into a container and mix it with water to use.What I got was 10 pounds of soluble kelp or seaweed in a large heavy-duty plastic bag, shipped in a cardboard box.It's a bit messy to separate the large mix into smaller containers, but it's worth it because the price is lower when purchased in bulk.  The price is less than half and it looks similar to (or it may actually be the same) high quality Norwegian kelp which is sold on the market.This kelp or seaweed is an excellent and natural source of fertilizer for your plants.  It is not too strong, so it will not burn your plants.  (Chemical fertilizers may burn your plants.) The only thing you have to be aware is that the kelp may leave a brown stain on white or light-colored shirts.

I ordered a few plants on March 12, 2013 and they arrived four days later on March 16, so delivery was prompt.The Clivia plants have between 4 to 7 smaller leaves.  Clivias need about 13 large leaves before they flower so I am guessing that these plants may bloom in 3 to 5 years.  Keeping the young plants growing year round should help speed leaf development.The plants are already in 4 inch green plastic containers filled with soil so it's probably best to leave them in their pots to grow.Here's the only thing which I changed. I took the plant and the soil out of the container and threw in 3 or 4 styrofoam peanuts (not the biodegradable ones) into the bottom of the container and then I put the plant and the soil back into the pot.  Hopefully, this should help keep the roots from sitting in water and prevent root rot, a too common Clivia problem.I wish that they had a few more leaves but they are nice plants.  You just have to be patient for a few years before you see the yellow blooms.

Brooke's "30-Day Slim Down" DVD contains 2 workouts (about 30 minutes each) which I enjoyed doing.  Ms. Burke works with four other ladies in both workouts.  Workouts are beginning to intermediate.Here are the breakdowns.1. Cardio Burn (29.23)2. Tone & Sculpt (31.03)1.  Cardio Burn:  You need some room to move and it includes high impact moves which one may modify.Warm up with aerobics and stretches.Kick comboKnee hopT-skaterRepeat the above three moves.Triple jackMountain climberMogulRepeat the above three moves.Bear plieTap plankBody skipRepeat the above three moves.BurpeeBooty jackFast feetRepeat the above three moves.End with cool down by stretching.2.  Tone & Sculpt:  You need a pair of very light dumbbells (about 2 pounds) so this, especially in regard to the arms, is a light toning workout.
