This includes balance work and abdominal training, along with a few stretches and easy yoga.Warm up with aerobics and stretching.Pendulum squatCurtsey combo with bicep and tricep workBoat swimmerMJ squatPower push upKnee flyCheerleader squatStraight legged dead lift with bicep curlStork liftTriple BBooty burnFire hydrantHollow manBallet reachSlow scoopBicycle passCool down with stretching.

This DVD contains three workouts, of about 20 minutes each, for beginners to intermediate.  A light dumbbell or two are used occasionally.Here are the breakdowns.Cardio Crunch (0:20.01)Classic Core (0:19.28)Sweet 16 (0:20.07)1. Cardio Crunch:  This is the easiest of the three and the cardio, in general, is light and minimal.  The plie hop and the cardio can can are probably the two most intense cardio segments which you can easily modify.Warm up with stretches and light cardio(Standing work)Twisting pushRock punchStanding knee tuck, walkWaist carver to sideToe tapPlie hopCardio can canOblique twist(Floor work)Tap out plankPlank holdSwimmingTable top bridgeDolphinCool down with stretches2. Classic core (based on Pilates mat exercises)Warm up with stretches(Floor work)Rope climbTriple jacksOblique sweepLeg circleBridge kick(Standing work)3-count reach(Floor work)See saw crunchKnee tuckTriangle crunchBike SqueezeCool down with stretches3. Sweet 16: I liked (or hated) the Sweet 16 the most since it was the hardest or most intense of the three workouts.Warm up with light aerobics and stretchesAccordion crunchDead bugFull body rollClassic bicycleDumbbell twistAnkle crossRight triangleLeft triangleBridge toe tapSee saw obliqueBent knee windshieldCheek to cheekAb slamRight kick crunchLeft kick crunchOpen and closeCooldown with stretches

This DVD contains a black and white concert performed in Australia, from 1972.The audio and video are O.K., if you remember that this was filmed using early 1970's technology.The concert is under 46 minutes (not 60 minutes).Total time (0:45.45)Here are the songs and other parts of the concert.1. Help2. Love Is Surrender3. (Richard explains harmonies)4. Ticket To Ride5. For All We Know6. Close To You7. Cinderella Rockefella8. Superstar9. (Band introduction)10. Medley - Any Day Now/Baby It's You/Knowing When To Leave/Make It Easy On Yourself/There's Always Something There To Remind Me/I'll Never Fall In Love Again/Walk On By/Do You Know The Way To San Jose11. Hurting Each Other12. We've Only Just Begun

This is a nice and compact radio, small enough for your desk or bedroom.  It measures 7" by 4 3/4", about the size of a thick paperback novel.What I like is that the display names the artist and the song, along with the radio station.  The display is bright enough for most people to see, but for people with visual issues, the light may appear dim.The audio sounds good for a small radio with one speaker.Here's what comes in the package.1. Radio (which has clock, AM/FM, and weather alert)2. AC Power and cord3. Manual, warranty, and quick start guideThe radio is also portable and it uses 4 AA batteries (not included).October 26, 2012 UpdateThe radio came just in time for Hurricane Sandy which is projected to hitDelaware Bay on the East Coast before Halloween.October 29, 2012 UpdateI was listening to the weather when the alert sounded.  The "alert" (actually an "alarm") for coastal flooding is LOUD!November 2, 2012 UpdateSo, on October 29, the eye of Hurricane Sandy passed through southern New Jersey, causing damage to New Jersey's shoreline and the New York City area.Here, in Rhode Island, which is located just under Massachusetts, Sandy caused minimal damage.  Newport and the capital city, Providence, are fine.  There was damage to part of the southern coastal areas where beachhouses were destroyed and power was out for a few days.~~~This product is intuitive to use.  Just play with the controls and it's easy to figure it out how it works.  Of course, for the more sophisticated features, you have to read the directions.

I have had the Triceptor for quite a few years now.  I use it for pushups and triceps dips.The machine comes with  2 handle bars which you insert into 2 holes on various top and bottom positions.Here's what you can do with it.1. Pushups in various easier positions from narrow to wide, along with increasing resistance levels.2. Dips which is the first internet image (actually showing an intense or harder version), along with easier versions.3. Inverted rows which is an easier version of pullups.Please look at the 5 internet images which show the above 3 exercises.In general, pushups work your chest, dips work your triceps, and inverted rows work your back.Basically, it lets you to do easier versions of pushups, dips, and pullups which you may have difficulty doing.  It's a good machine for anyone who can't do full versions of upper body exercises and want to get back in shape gradually.  After you build up, you can play with it a little by increasing reps and moving faster.For example, it's good if you have issues doing regular full body pushups on the floor.  I started doing a few pushups with the bars on the top positions.  Gradually, I increased the number of reps and increased rep speed.  You may move the 2 handle bars into different positions and work the chest slightly differently each time.  Moving the hands close together puts more emphasis on the triceps and inner chest.  A wide pushup with hands further apart works the outer chest.It may also be useful for more experienced exercisers.  The first dip image shown is actually an advanced exercise.  Plus, having your hand and body in different positions adds variety and works your body in different ways.  You may also lower the handle bars closer to the floor which increases resistance or weight.  Finally, moving your feet further away or elevating your feet adds intensity.

I ordered 2 of the green Thera-Band October 16, 2012 and they arrived 3 days later on October 19.Green is labeled as heavy, but I think it is more like a medium resistance (for men anyway).  This feels nice and comfortable to use and it looks and works exactly the same as other thera-bands which you may get in a DVD package.The band comes in a 18 feet roll (6 yards) and you just cut it to fit your needs.  This flat band measures 4" across in width which is the same as other bands.  (This is not rubber tubing, the round band, but it is used in the same way.)I think that this green resistance level is a good starter band for beginners or regular exercises since you can cut it shorter to increase resistance or longer to decrease resistance.

I previously reviewed the Supreme 90 Day System (DVD) and this one ("as seen on TV") has the same cover and the same 10 DVDs so I will repeat my previous review here.First, here are the 10 DVDs, with a brief summary and their time outlines.1. Chest & Back (32:30)Warmup (4:19): The warmup includes ab work (the core) & is (at first) like a mini-workout. At over 4 minutes, all of the DVDs except Tabatha Inferno has this warmup.Workout (22:14): At over 22 minutes, they move fast on this first DVD.Cool-down (5:57): These are stretches. All of the 10 DVDs have the same cool-down.2. Ultimate Ball (40:49)Warmup (4:19):Workout (30:33): This uses the large Swiss ball. I just did it without the ball.Cool-down (5:57):3. Tabata Inferno (43:42)Warmup: It is only on this DVD that the warmup is included in the main workout.Workout (37:45): I hate this one. This is long and tough. This includes moderate and tough aerobics, with some weight training. The exercises include jumping variations, core work, and the circuits never seem to end.Cool-down (5:57):4. Shoulders & Arms (43:05)Warmup (4:19):Workout (32:49):Cool-down (5:57):5. Cardio Challenge (41:22)Warmup (4:19):Workout (31:06): This is my favorite. Moderate weights are used to boost calorie burn. In general, you alternate 30 seconds of aerobics, followed by 30 seconds of rest, followed by 30 seconds of using moderate weights in an aerobic fashion, followed by 30 seconds of rest, and then repeat the same pattern.Cool-down (5:57):6. Legs (33:17)Warmup (4:19):Workout (22:51): This is not only leg work. There is ab (core) work.Cool-down (5:57):7. Total Body (33:33)Warmup (4:19):Workout (23:17):Cool-down (5:57):8. Core Dynamics (28:22)WarmUp (4:19):Workout (18:06): At just over 18 minutes, this is the shortest workout.Cool-down (5:57):9. Back & Bi's (56:38)Warmup (4:19):Workout (46:22): This is the longest workout, at over 46 minutes.Cool-down (5:57):10. Chest, Shoulders, & Tri's (45:18)Warmup (4:19):Workout (34:52):Cool-down (5:57):The main workouts (excluding the warmups and the cool-downs) vary from about 18 minutes to about 46 minutes, with many close to 30 minutes, so these are relatively short workouts.The workouts use dumb-bells and a large Swiss ball. You need moderate to medium weight dumb-bells, but you can do the exercises without the ball. I did not use the ball, although I do have a bench.~~~~~This 10 DVD set provides excellent instruction on using dumb-bells in a programmed and well structured sequence. This program is fairly intense and it might take a little while to build up, especially if you are a beginner. This may be better suited for someone with exercise experience or it may considered an intermediate DVD.All the talent, (men and women demonstrators), are extremely fit and sometimes go fast, on many of the exercises, especially push-ups. After quite a few months, I find that I can go fast on push-ups too. On the jumping (plyometrics), I walked in place (slow or fast) or stepped side to side, instead of doing the jumping. Walking is a lot easier if you have knee or feet issues.Tom Holland is the instructor and he is pleasant, affable and knowledgeable

I ordered 10 Hawaiian peacock Jasmine plants from Rush Gardening on September 14, 2012 and they arrived on October 11, 2012.  They arrived in good condition, sealed in 2 hard plastic containers.  Each plastic container contains 5 live plants or soil plugs.2 plants are 9" tall.3 plants are 8" tall.1 plant is 7 1/2" tall.2 plants are 7" tall.2 plants are 6" tall.Plants have about 6 to 10 green leaves.  These starter plants are vining plants.~~~I have had these plants previously and they are easy to grow.  Basically, keep them warm, in a sunny window, with the soil on the moist side, just as if they were in Hawaii.  In about a little more than a month, buds or little fragrant white flowers may appear, especially if you keep them warm and sunny.  Flowers last only a day or so.Here are quick directions.1. In the North, put them in a sunny window with warm temperatures.2. Keep the soil on the moist side or the plant will dry up.3. Fertilize lightly to increase flower production.  Strong fertilizer may burn and kill the plants.4. Keep the plants above 55 degrees.  Plants may not survive lower temperatures.5. Prune because the flowers come at the tips of new growth.~~~Here are the instructions from Rush Gardening."Place in a sunny window, keeping the soil evenly moist. Avoid very high temperatures, but also at a minimum of 55 degrees F. Feed every three weeks with liquid fertilizer, except in fall when growth appears to have slowed."

I ordered 2 of the Frost Proof Gardenia Shrubs  (Starter Plants) from New Life Nursery & Garden on October 6, 2011 and they arrived 5 days later on October 11. They arrived in their soil plugs, wrapped in wet newspaper, all put together in a plastic bag, with foam peanuts for protection.Plants have healthy green leaves which are slightly glossy and they are little starter plants.The first plant is about 10" tall as measured from the base of the stem.  It has 3 stems coming out of the soil.  It has about 70 small green leaves.  Larger leaves measure about 3" in length and about 3/4" in width so the leaves have an elongated shape, roughly shaped like a feather.The second plant is about 8" tall.  There are 2 stems coming out of the soil.  It has about 63 leaves.Again, please be reminded that they are little starter plants.October 16, 2012I planted them outside in the ground today.  They are hardy to zone 7 and I live in zone 6, so I will see if they survive the colder weather.

I ordered 3 of the Kleims Hardy Gardenia Shrub (Starter Plants) from New Life Nursery & Garden on October 6, 2011 and they arrived 5 days later on October 11.  They arrived in their soil plugs, wrapped in wet newspaper, all put together in a plastic bag, with foam peanuts for protection.Plants have healthy semi-glossy dark green leaves and are little starter plants.One plant measures 7" tall and about 7" wide.  It has about 47 small leaves.  Leaves are 2" or a little more in length, and about 3/4" in width.The second plant is under 9" tall and about 5" wide.  It has about 46 small leaves.The third plant is 7" tall and about 5" wide.  It has about 42 small leaves.Please keep in mind that these are small starter plants.October 16, 2011 UpdateProduct description indicates that they are hardy in Zones 7-10.  I live in zone 6 and today, I planted them outside in the ground in the office.  I will try to update if they survive the colder weather of zone 6.

I ordered a Cinnamon Scented Wax Hoya Plant with porcelain flowers - 6" Hanging Pot from Hirt's Gardens on October 6, 2012 and it came 4 days later on October 10. The plant arrived healthy in a 6" plastic hanging pot, wrapped in plastic for protection, with the recyclable peanuts.The plant hangs over 24" and I see a little cluster of flower buds at the end of one stem.  There are many leaves and stems.  Leaves are usually a medium green with a touch or a frosting of red brown edgings.  It is a very nice medium-sized plant.

I ordered a Sweet Scented Mini Wax Plant - Hoya - 6" Hanging Pot from Hirt's Gardens on October 6, 2012 and it came 4 days later on October 10.  The plant arrived healthy in a 6" plastic hanging pot, with the stems and leaves wrapped in plastic for protection, with the recyclable peanuts in the box.This hanging plants hangs down to 24" so it is a huge plant.  It has numerous hanging stems covering the whole pot so it is a full plant.  It is such a large plant that it could probably be moved up to fit comfortably in an 8" pot.The many leaves are dark green.  Leaves may measure up to an inch to under 1 and 1/2 inches in length.I recommend this plant for its sheer size and for its many healthy leaves and stems.October 17, 2012 UpdatePlant was really overcrowded, so I divided it into 2 large pots and 1 smaller pot.  I also stuck the broken pieces into another pot.

I ordered a Hawaiian Pink Quill Plant (Tillandsia cyanea) 4" Pot from Hirt's Gardens on September 24, 2012 and it arrived 3 days later on September 27.  It came protected by foam peanuts.What you see on the internet is similar to what I received in the mail.  The plant is about 8" tall and 13" across.  It has about 50 thin straplike green leaves and one large "pink quill".  The pink quill is about 6" long and 2 1/2" wide.  It actually came with 2 pink quills.  A smaller one apparently broke, probably due to rough handling by the carrier.  There are some remains of what appears to be spent flowers on the pink quill.  Overall, the plant looks in good condition and the soil is moist.September 29, 2012 UpdateIt has been 5 days since I received the plant so I was pleasantly surprised to see a purple flower popping out from the top of the pink quill.  The flower measures 1" one way and 1 1/4" the other way.October 1, 2012 UpdateIt has been 7 days since receiving the plant, and there is second purple flower or bud, while the first flower is still in bloom.October 2, 2012 UpdateThe first flower is limping, so flowers may last about 4 days.October 3, 2012 UpdateI see a third purple flower or bud coming from the pink quill.Here's how to grow it with info. coming from the product website.1. Grow in bright indirect sunlight like in a bright window.2. Provide night temperatures of 50 to 65 degrees and day temperatures of 68 degrees or higher.3. Keep soil on the moist side.  Water once or twice a week depending on conditions.4. Fertilize at 1/4 strength each month.

I ordered this plant June 22, 2012 and it arrived three days later on June 25. It came wrapped in a 4 inch round plastic container with the leaves wrapped in paper, with recyclable peanuts for protection.What you see on the internet image is somewhat similar to what I got in the mail.  It is a regular-sized plant with about 11 leaves, appropriate for a 4 inch pot.  Leaves are about 6 inches in length and about 3 inches in width. Newer leaves have a lemon color, while the older leaves have a lime color.There is one differnce.  This plant has two separate growing stems growing very closely to each other, instead of just one stem.  So I guess, I got a double plant.(I actually ordered this plant under a different item name, but Hirt's sent me this plant.  Since I have this plant, I decided to review this product, here, as it is the same plant.)September 17, 2012 UpdateI have been giving the plant a little filtered sun from the window and I water only occasionally. It is doing great and it is growing healthy new leaves.September 26, 2012 UpdateI increased by a little the amount of sun it was getting.  The sun is still filtered through the window so it is a "light" sun, rather than a strong noon day sun.  The plant is still doing great and it continues to produce new leaves.The plant has 20 leaves as of September, while it had 11 leaves in June.  So it grew 9 leaves in about 3 months.

I ordered 2 of the Pink Jasmine Plant - (Jasminum polyanthum) from Hirt's Gardens  on September 18, 2012 and they arrived 3 days later on September 21.  The two plants arrived in good condition with foam peanuts for protection.The 2 plants are quite small in their 4" plastic containers.  (But at least, I paid $4.29 for each of them, plus the shipping and handling.  In the Fall, it seems that nurseries sometimes drop their prices.)The first plant is 4" high and 5" wide and it has a bunch of tiny little leaves.  .The second plant is both 6" high and wide.Plants appear to be just out of their starter packs.  Plants will probably take a while to mature and flower.~~~Here's how to grow it.  It includes information from the webpage here.1. Give sun to partial shade.2. Needs regular watering.3. Plant is hardy to Zones 8-11. It can tolerate temperatures as low as 20 F.  In the warmer zones, this grows fast and may be invasive.4. This plant needs cool night temperatures to flower.  (Other jasmines are the opposite.  Other jasmines need warm temperatures to flower and they do not tolerate cool/cold temperatures.)

I ordered Jasmine sambac - Belle of India - 6" Pot from Hirt's Gardens on September 18, 2012 and it arrived 3 days later on September 21.  It arrived in excellent condition in a 6" plastic green pot, packed with foam peanuts for protection.This is the largest jasmine I have received of all the various jasmines I have ordered through the mail.It is about 20 inches tall and 16 1/2 inches across the width.  It has 13 white buds or nickle-sized flowers.  It has a multitude of healthy green leaves.  This is a "full plant" with about 9 woody stems coming out of the soil.  (I ordered the same Jasmine from another place and it only had one woody stem, with leaves and no flowers, coming out of the soil.)  Again, this is a most impressive plant.Please note that this plant requires full sun (not partial) and warm temperatures to bloom.~~~Here are directions which I pulled from the internet.1. In general, jasmines flower on new wood so prune to encourage new growth.2. Minimum temperature for "Belle of India" is 60 degrees F.3. Plant enjoys full sun and warm temperatures. Provide as much sun as you can for optimal flowering.4. Fertilize lightly for more flowers. Do not over fertilize.~~~Separately, if you want a most floriferous scented Jasmine, try "Poet's Jasmine 6 inch Pot (Jasminum officinale)" from Hirt's Gardens.I ordered it late September of 2012 and it has the most flowers of any and all Jasmines which I have ordered through the internet.  Make sure you get the large plant in the 6" pot, not the tiny little one in a 4" pot.~~~Here is a comparison between the two Jasmines.Belle of India1. Needs full sun (not partial sun) to encourage blooms.2. Needs warm temperatures to bloom.  It does not tolerate cool/cold temperatures. (Website indicates that 60 degree F is the minimum temperature.  Keep it above 60 at night or plant may not survive.)3. Since the plant likes full sun and warm temperatures, you may have to water this plant more often than other regular houseplants.4. It is supposed to bloom throughout the year, if you give it the required warm temperatures and full sun.Poet's Jasmine1. Partial sun and bright light is ideal.2. Give cool nights (like an outside porch in the cool Spring or cool Fall) to encourage blooms.3. In September, when I got it, it had the most flowers of any of the Jasmines which I have ordered through the internet.  It is October now and it is still blooming in the porch which has cool nights.

I ordered variegated Solomone Salmon Clivia miniata seeds (4 seeds per packet) from Hirt's Gardens on September 17, 2012 and they arrived 2 days later on September 19.The seeds look heatlhy, clean, and firm.Here are the sowing directions included in the packet from Hirt's Gardens.Sow seeds immediately on receipt in a very high quality seeding mix. Cover the seeds with 1/2" of the mix. Water & place in the dark with a temp of 65-70 F. Germination can take 16 weeks.This is how I plant Clivia seeds.1. Plant seeds with the brown spot pointing up.2. Cover seeds just barely with soil or let the top just barely show.3. Keep the soil moist, but make sure your container has good drainage.4. Keep the temperature warm to speed germination.5. The root emerges first from the area opposite the brown mark, followed later by the leaf which comes out of the top root area.I read somewhere that you may put your seeds and soil in a clear plastic bag and put it on the refridgerator where the warm air blows. The warm air flow results in faster germination.~~~I will try to update later regarding germination.~~~It takes about 13 mature leaves for your Cliva to flower. Be patient. This may take 3 to 7 years. Hopefully, it will be the former rather than the latter. The newer ones are bred to mature and flower faster.

Croton Mammy # 1I placed a few plant orders from Emerald Goddess Gardens around September of 2012 and they sent me a free bonus plant.The plant appears to be a "Croton Dwarf Corkscrew Mammy Fire 4 inch Pot" or a plant similar to it.This Croton is a woody stem and is about 16" high as measured from the base of the plant with the measurement not including the root ball.  The root ball is wrapped securely in plastic.  It has 24 glossy leaves.  In general, leaves are about 4 inches across the length and 1 inch in width. Leaves are richly multicolored and include the following colors: green red dark brown, yellow, red, and green.  The new leaves are green with a yellow stripe in the middle, along with yellow edgings.  When older, the leaves appear to turn green red dark brown.This is a very nice free plant.Croton Mammy # 2On September 28, 2012, I received another free Croton which came with another purchase I made with Emerald Goddess Gardens.This one measures 13" tall and has about 15 leaves.  Leaf coloration wise, it is a variation of the first plant I received.So, this is another nice free plant.Croton Mammy # 3On October 19, 2012, I received another free Croton from Emerald Goddess.The third Croton is over 13" tall and has about 23 leaves.  It has a similar pattern to the other 2 Crotons.It is another nice Croton.~~~Here is some general information which includes info. edited from a fact sheet from Emerald Goddess.1. The Croton is favored for its bright and richly colored leaves.2. Plant is hardy to zones 9 or 10.  In the North, bring indoors before the night temperatures dip to 32 degrees.3. Give a little sun, bright light, or light shade.  Shade is o.k., but it reduces leaf color and plant may become spindly.4. You may prune 1/4 of the top in mid-Summer.5. Keep a regular water schedule.  Allow soil to drain well.

I ordered a "red Christmas Cactus - Zygocactus - 6" Hanging Basket" from Hirt's Nurseries on September 17, 2012 and it arrived 3 days later on September 20.  It was packed with recyclable peanuts and wrapped in a plastic bag so it came in excellent condition.The plant is contained in a white 6" hanging basket.  It could easily be put into a 7" pot so the plant is well-sized.  It is 8" tall and 12" wide and it is tightly jam packed with healthy green stems so it can be divided right now.~~~I plan to put this plant in the enclosed porch.  I live in the North, so when the night temperatures dip in the Fall, Christmas cactus automatically produces flower buds.  Just remember to bring it indoors before the night temperatures hit 32 degrees or the plant will die.It may also be possible to get it to bloom in the Spring.  Put it back outside after Winter when the night temperatures are above 32 degrees.  The only concern is to avoid a late frost or freeze in the Spring.  You have to bring the plant back inside whenever the night temperatures start to dip to the danger zone of 32 degrees.  After the danger of freezing has passed, put it back outside to let it enjoy the cool nights which help provide the conditions needed for flower buds.For me, this worked on one very large, healthy, and mature Christmas cactus, but it did not work on the smaller Christmas cactus.  The larger Christmas cactus was located next to an open window so the cool air circulated to it, while the smaller one was in a warmer location away from the open window's cool air.It is also easy to grow new plants.  Whenever a few pieces break off, just put them in soil.  You could also break off a few sections (make sure the section contains 3 or more segments), let it dry for a couple of days, and pop it in the soil.Give plants some filtered sun, but not too much.  Water like regular houseplants.  Remember that these plants originate from Brazil where it rains a lot so they need more water than regular cacti.  As with most plants, drain excess water from the saucer.

Plant #1 Sheryl's ShopI ordered a HeavenScent Double Tahitian Gardenia from Sheryl's Shop on September 10, 2012 and it arrived 9 days later on September 19.  It arrived in good condition.The plant is supposed to come in a 4" pot, but it came in a 6" pot, so it came larger than I expected.The plant is healthy and is about 17 inches tall.  It is a woody plant which splits into 3 main woody branches, along with a few smaller woody branches or twigs.  It is a bushy plant with about 300 leaves, with many of the leaves about 2 1/2 inches in length.  I liked that it was large and that it had heft (weight).~~~Plant #2 Hirt's GardensSeparately, I ordered another HeavenScent Double Tahitian Gardenia from another nursery, namely Hirt's Gardens, on September 19, 2012 and it arrived 2 days later on September 21.  It came packed with foam peanuts and arrived in healthy condition.This plant from Hirt's Gardens looks different from the one from Sheryl's Shop.The plant from Hirt's Gardens has a woody stem which separates into 2 distinct woody branches.  One branch is about 12" tall and has 12 large glossy green leaves, and it has 1 flower bud.  The second branch is about 16" tall and has 11 large glossy green leaves.I did some research and it appears that Sheryl's Shop sent me a different plant -  Sheryl's Shop sent me a different type of gardenia.Hirt's sent me the correct gardenia.  So, get your Tahitian Gardenia from Hirt's Gardens, because it sent me the correct plant and because it has a flower bud.October 9, 2012 Update - "Spicy" gardenia scentA flower bud started to open yesterday.  I measured it today and it has a diameter of about 4 1/2".  The white (or light cream) flower has a spicy gardenia scent which, while being fairly strong, is not as heavy as other gardenias.  The scent may drift several feet in a room and from a short distance I can catch a whiff of it sometimes.  One co-worker thought that the scent was strong enough to give him a headache.  This flower has almost a sort of a whirly shape to its form.October 12, 2012 UpdateThe flower fell off today so flowers may last about 3 or 4 days.~~~Here are some info. gathered from around the internet which includes facts from this website.1. Plant is hardy in zones 7-9 and may tolerate a light frost.2. In the North, pot it for the patio or grow it as a bonsai or a houseplant.3. Loves sun.4. As a houseplant, temperatures above 50 degrees are ideal for better growth.5. It is sensitive to overwatering.6. It has the largest flowers of the gardenias and it has notable large and glossy green leaves.

I ordered the Pinwheel Jasmine Plant (Tabernaemontana divaricata) from Emerald Goddess on September 15, 2012 and it arrived 4 days later on September 19.  It came in healthy condition with newspaper wrapped around the leaves for protection.There are two separate main woody stems or plants emerging from the soil in the plastic pot.  Each main woody stem separates into two woody branches and each woody branch further splits into smaller woody twigs.  The overall height is about 20 inches. There are over 75 leaves so this is a good sized plant (or plants because of the two separate main woody stems).  Leaves look somewhat similar to gardenia leaves, but the plant looks a little like a miniature tree or small shrub, but with less branches and less leaves.~~~Here are general directions which include info. edited from Emerald Goddess.1. Provide light shade/partial sun.2. It is Zone 10-11, with the minimum winter temperature being about 35 degrees.3. Flowers early Summer to Fall.4. Root cuttings.

I ordered Stephanotis (Madagascar Jasmine) from Emerald Goddess on September 15, 2012 and it arrived 4 days on September 19 in good condition.The plant is a woody vine attached to a bamboo stake.  It is about 19" tall and has 23 glossy dark green leaves.  Leaves are about 2 to 2 1/2 inches long.  It is a good sized plant so I am pleased.(Previously, I had purchased one from a different place and the one from Emerald Goddess is appreciably larger.  So if you want a big plant, get your Stephanotis from Emerald Goddess.)~~~Here are general directions for growing as a houseplant in the North.1. Give bright light. Avoid strong sun. The light of early morning sun is fine.2. Minimum temperature is 40 degrees.3. Let the soil dry between waterings.4. Flowers from May to September.5. Avoid sudden temperature changes and cold drafts.6. During winter, keep the soil on the dry side as the plant rests.  Keep temperatures cooler.

I ordered two Kleim's Hardy Gardenia (daisy gardenia) from Hirt's on September 14, 2012 and they arrived 5 days later on September 19.  They were wrapped in brown paper and shipped with biodegradable peanuts.The two plants are small which is what the website indicated.One measures 3 1/2" tall, with about 35 leaves.The other measures about 4" tall, with about 50 leaves.The leaves are very small which is apparently normal for this plant which is a mounding type.  When mature, the plant is about 2 to 3 feet wide and high.According to directions, they are hardy to 0 degrees, which is zone 6.  I live in Rhode Island (below Massachusetts), with RI being in zone 6.  I read somewhere else that they are hardy to zone 7 (rather than 6), so I plan to update regarding if the plants survive the winter.September 29, 2012 UpdateI left the two plants in their plastic pots and gave it water and some sun.  It has only been about 10 days, and the plants are growing.October 15, 2012 UpdateYesterday, I planted the 2 plants into the ground.  (Incidentally, the leaves from the trees are starting to fall here in RI.)

I ordered Jasmine Sambac "Belle of India" from Thai Greenhouse on September 14, 2012 and it arrived 4 days later on September 18.The jasmine arrived in good condition, with the soil and rootball bound in plastic wrap and the leaves wrapped in newspaper, along with foam peanuts.The receipt indicates that I am to get a plant of blooming age, at 6"-8" tall.My plant is actually about 14" tall.  It has one woody stem with a few branches, holding about 36 leaves and showing new growth, but no flower buds.  It is a fine and healthy plant.~~~As of this writing in September of 2012, Hirt's Gardens also offers the same plant at about the same price.  However, Hirt's "Belle of India" is larger and has flowers.  The one I received from Hirt's is a "full" plant, with many more leaves and stems.  Plus, it has 13 buds or little white scented flowers.  It comes in a 6" plastic container.  So Hirt's has "more plant" for about the same price.  For more details, please see "Arabian Tea Jasmine Plant - Belle of India - Sambac - 6" Pot" from Hirt's Gardens.~~~Here are directions which I pulled from the internet.1. Jasmines flower on new wood so prune to encourage new growth.2. Minimum temperature for "Belle of India" is 60 degrees F.3. Loves warm temperatures and needs full sun (not partial) for flowering.4. Fertilize lightly for more flowers. Do not over fertilize.

I ordered two of the "Gardenia Veitchii 4 inch pot" from 9GreenBox Nursery on September 13, 2012 and they arrived 4 days later on September 17.  The order was packed in foam peanuts and they arrived healthy and in good condition.These are very small plants.  One is 4 1/2 inches tall and the other is 5 inches tall.  I expected them to be a little bigger and their small size seems to indicate that they may have just come out of the starter growing packs.  On a more positive note, both have healthy and nice looking green leaves.September 25, 2012 UpdateI live in Rhode Island, a Northern state, located below Massachusetts.  This plant is not hardy up North so I left the plants in their original plastic containers in the enclosed sunny porch.  With some sun, I have seen new leafy green growth.

I ordered the Red Brazilian Jasmine Plant on Trellis - Mandevilla - 5" Pot from 9GreenBox Nursery on September 13, 2012 and it arrived four days later on September 17.The plant arrived in good condition.  However, it was supposed to come with a trellis and in a 5" pot.  But it came neither with a trellis nor in a 5" pot.  It came in a 4" pot with no trellis which meant that the plant is a little smaller than I had expected.  While it is a nice looking and healthy plant, it is about two thirds the size of the plant imaged on the internet.The plant is a single woody stem which measures 14 and a half inches tall.  It has thirty leaves and is a vining plant to which I attached a bamboo stick.  It has no blooms, but that is expected as the blooming season is ending now in the Fall.October 12, 2012 UpdateAlthought it is Fall here in the state of Rhode Island (located in New England), this Jasmine is actually growing, despite the cooler weather and lower temperatures.November 12, 2012 UpdateThe plant has 2 red flower buds and continues to grow, despite the cool/cold weather here.  It is in the enclosed porch where it receives partial light and the night temperatures are kept above 32 degrees.

I ordered this on September 12, 2012 from Hirt's and it arrived 3 days later on September 15.It is a small plant and is in good condition and costs $3.99 plus postage.This starter plant has two green shoots.  One shoot is 6 inches tall and the other is 2 inches tall.September 24, 2012 updateI live in Rhode Island, a northern state. Since I live in the North and the plant is not hardy in the ground, I just left the plant in its original plastic pot in the enclosed porch.  With partial sun and a little water, the little plant has grown surprisingly fast since I got it 9 days ago.

I ordered this Jasmine Sambac "Grand Duke Supreme" from Thai Greenhouse on September 12, 2012 and it arrived in good condition 3 days later on September 15.The soil ball is wrapped in plastic saran wrap.  The plant is like a young vine and it is 9 inches tall.  It has 15 green leaves.I thought it was going to be a larger plant, but, again, it looks healthy.

This African variety seems a lot easier to grow than other types of gardenias.  I have it in a container, here, in the North.  It just needs some sun and water.The fragrance is light, sweet, and clear.  I find the scent pleasant and not "heavy" or heady.  Its scent does not seem to fill the whole room which is in contrast to other gardenias which have stronger and heavier scents.~~~I ordered this plant on September 12, 2012 and it arrived 3 days later on September 15 from Hirt's.  The gardenia arrived healthy and looks like a tiny bush.  It came in a 4" plastic pot and I easily repotted it to a 6" plastic pot.It has a woody main stem which splits into three woody branches.  The height is about 11 inches.  The habit is upright with the shape similar to a tea rose bush.There is an explosion of green leaves emerging from the woody stems.  The plant has about 36 medium to dark green leaves.  The largest leaves measure about 6 inches across the length.  Many of the rest of the leaves measure about 2 to 3 inches.At the ends of the stems, it has two flower buds and two spent flower remains.  The product description indicates that this plant blooms intermittently throughout the year, so I am happy to see the two flower buds.Overall, this is a very nice plant.September 25, 2012 UpdateThe two buds are flowering.  Flowers are white, at 3 1/2" in diameter, with a light scent.  You have to be close to the flowers to enjoy the light fragrance.The plant has been in an enclosed porch which has partial sun.  It has warm or moderate day temperatues, along with generally cool nights since it is Fall here in Rhode Island.If the plant does not get enough water, it wilts, that is, the newer growth limps or bends.  Just water it and it plumps back into a healthy and straight condition.It appears that the plant is a type which grows fast if it is in a warm and sunny area which receives plenty of water.October 12, 2012 UpdateThe two flowers went about 5 or 6 days ago.  So, under cool weather or temperatures, these 2 flowers lasted about 12 days which is fairly long.October 22, 2012 UpdateA third flower opened 2 days ago.~~~Here's how to grow it which includes info. from this website.1. Plant is hardy in zones 9-10, meaning minimum winter temps. of around 25 to 30 degrees or make it a houseplant in the North.2. Give full or partial sun.  (My plant is doing well with just partial sun.)3. Keep the plant well-watered or buds will dry up and not flower.

I ordered this on September 10, 2012 and it arrived three days later on September 13 from Sandy's Nursery.  The item was secured to the cardboard box and it arrived in good condition.This item is 6 jasmines in a 6 pack black plastic starter plant kit.The 6 jasmines (Jasminum sambac Maid of Orleans) looked healthy, both in regard to the leaves and the root system.Here are the physical descriptions of the 6 jasmines.  All the jasmines have a woody main stem.One is 13" tall and has 16 leaves and 1 tiny flower bud.Four are about 11" tall.  One has 7 leaves.  The second has has 11 leaves.  The third has 9 leaves. And the fourth has 20 leaves and 3 flower buds.The last jasmine is 12" tall and has 11 leaves and 2 flower buds.I repotted the jasmines and put them in sunny areas.

I was very disappointed is these cutters.  This is the first GearWrench tool that I've not thoroughly enjoyed.They will cut a 16 penny nail with a little more ease than my 8" Cresent and Klein cutters.  The problem being because of the compound leverage design the GearWrench cutter has to be opened a full 1.5" wider at the end of the handles which makes is almost impossible to get full strength with one hand, being that wide.  In fact I had to use 2 hands to cut the 16 penny nail.  If the GearWrench were 8" long with handles that were more curved they would function closer to what is advertised.Plus when I cut the 16 penny nail the GearWrench cutters would bind up until I actuated them 2 or 3 times to loosen them up.  Very annoying when trying to make multiple cuts in succession.  In addition after making a dozen cuts or so the cutters had developed considerable play in the pivot points which in time will only decrease the effectiveness.  I have used my Cresent & Klein 8" cutters for years and they are still very tight.The design looks very impressive but falls incredibly short on function.Update 9-24-14:I purchased these and they cut so easily it's almost beyond belief. They are about 3 times the price of these GearWrench pliers but they are worth every cent.  Since I'm retired I finally decided I needed cutters that were much easier on my hands and wrist and these fit the bill and then some.KNIPEX 71 12 200 Comfort Grip High Leverage Cobolt Cutters with Springkd

These GearWrench 84T ratchets are just awesome at any price.  Once all the bugs were corrected in these 84T ratchets they have proven to be extraordinary tools.  My only wish is that they had been availalble 45 years ago when I started wrenching.kd

The new 1/2" 84T ratchet is flawless with no binding or jamming whatsoever.  GearWrench has corrected the problem so the ones made in 2014 are problem free.  So go ahead and buy one and be the proud owner of the finest 1/2" flex ratchet for the money...GearWrench 81306F 1/2-Inch Drive Full Polish Flex Head Ratchet with 84Tkd

I can appreciate the frustrating with the users who purchased ratchets that jammed or failed in other ways, but GearWrench has corrected these QC issues so the ones manufactured in 2014 are awesome.  They are smooth, crisp and tight. Apply some light 20w air tool oil or equivalent oil and you're good to go.kd

This GearWrench ratchet has a quality that is second to none compared to my other Craftsman, S&K and older Proto ratchets.  in 2013 it seems these ratchets were plagued QC issues that caused jamming.  The machining issues have been corrected so the ratchets being sold in 2014 are problem free and just awesome.  Nice smooth and crisp action.  I have torqued them down repeatedly to 60 ft. lbs with no issues and definitely no jamming.  I believe that 60 ft. lbs. is plenty for a 3/8" ratchet.  Anymore and a 1/2" should be used.  So I oiled them when purchased, tested them severely and they still function flawlessly.  Not much else to say, other than go buy one and try for yourself.kd

The set I received has the newer 84 tooth ratchets, not the older 60 tooth ones shown in the picture.  This is a tremendous upgrade.  When the 84 tooth first came out they had some machining errors along with a lacking quality control but now the problems have been corrected.  I have torqued down to 60 ft. lbs with the 3/8" ratchet and 30 ft. lbs. with the 1/4" and not a single ratchet lock up with a dozen tries.  Locking up under tourque was the problem that people were complaining about with these 84 tooth ratchets. This appears to have been corrected but if this changes in the future I will surely upgrade my review.All of the sockets are well made and the finish and lettering is pro quality.  The only issue I noticed was the machining indent in the sockets for the ratchet ball were left rough in many cases.  After a few uses of on/off though the slight roughness disappeared.Since these are very fine tooth ratchets I would only use a light 20w or less air tool oil as a higher viscosity oil might induce tooth skipping.I see that GearWrench has some new 120 position 60 tooth ratchets available.  To me the double pawl setup looks a little low on the durability scale, with the normal size pawl effectively being split in two.  The concept is brilliant but will it produce uneven wear is my question.I could go on and on about the excellent quality.  The only other negative issue I have is about the manufacturer packaging.  They should have included some 1/2" thick flexible foam between the lid and set so that when closed all of the components are secure.  As it was it came with about 80% of the sockets that were scattered all around at random inside the case.  Even the ratchets had dislodged.  About 10 minutes of putting them back in their positions and all is well.  But I plan on lightly attaching some foam to the lid for the future.Overall, this is a very high quality set for a reasonable price that any mechanic should find appealing.kd
A good auto tranny fluid that works fine for a decent price.  Fills in all the checks mark.

Very nice dispenser for the price.  I wasn't sure I would like the tall/slim design of this Pur over the more square like shape of the Brita's, but this one fits in my large fridge better and the Brita in my smaller one.  Each has its place.  PUR-fect...Also, the dispensing valve seems a little more sturdy on the Pur over the Brita.  Even though my Brita is over 5 years old with a couple thousand gallons having gone through it so I can't really complain.  If the PUR equals this I'll be more than happy.kd

This DB Power scale is truly quite remarkable in all areas, especially accuracy.I previously owned an AWS Gemini 20g .001mg scale, but it quit working.  The readout was dead. I spent about an hour changing batteries, taking apart to check connections, inspected circuit board, etc.  I couldn't find anything obvious so I chucked it as time is valuable to me.Since I had tried several other scales before the AWS and all were bad I tried the AWS again.  After 2 dud AWS units I tried a Smart Weigh JDS20, both of them were very erractic and to say the least not very accurate.  So I found the DBPower scale and so far its been the best of the bunch.Under 50mg it's almost always is dead on or .001g high or low.  Over 50mg up to the 30g it maintains a .002g accuracy.  I know some may not believe this, but this unit is accurate.  I plan on buying another for backup and comparison.I also like the ability to use a 250mA converter for power instead of batteries.I guess it was fate that led me to the DBPower scale.  Whatever, I'll take it as it's a wonderfully accurate scale for under $25.kd

Didn't work at all...Plus before and after I purchased the product I emailed the company a couple questions, (twice), and they never responded...Non effective product and terrible customer service gets a definite non repurchase for me.kd

I use scissors frequently for work and personal projects and need something that's sharp, versatile and comfortable to use and hold, even for longer periods of time. These scissors fit the bill all the things I use them for. The handles are cushioned which makes them comfortable to hold without slipping. They're not too heavy, yet solid enough that they can cut through thicker materials without tearing what I'm cutting. They're perfect for arts and crafts projects, general office purposes, opening boxes, trimming fabric or gift wrap. I can't think of anything I don't like about them and for the price, they're a steal.

I bought this sunscreen after having to return the Cotz Face tinted sunscreen because it was a little too dark for my ivory complexion. It goes on very smooth and blends well. It mattifies my complexion instead of leaving it shiny like most other sunscreens I've tried tend to do. It also has a primer-like effect: makeup goes on more smoothly and pores are diminished. Though it blends well, it gives my skin a slightly lighter look because of the zinc oxide and/or titanium dioxide. Wearing foundation over it mutes that a bit, but I'd imagine it might be more obvious on skin tones darker than mine. The tinted version of this product is called 'Natural Skin Tone'. That sunscreen has the same consistency and primer effect as this one, but some tan color is added so it's a little like wearing a foundation or tinted primer. The manufacturer told me the two versions can be mixed together if someone finds one too light and the other too dark. I don't mind the lighter look because it's very subtle and since I like to apply sunscreen to my neck, I don't want to have to worry about color transferring to my clothing. As far as sun protection, this sunscreen works great and I love that it's chemical-free. When I wear regular chemical-based sunscreens, they end up sliding down my face, especially in warm weather and leaves my eyes red and burny. I never have that problem with Cotz sunscreens which is one of the reasons I buy this brand. It's unscented, doesn't break out my skin or irritate it even though I have sensitive skin. I'm happy to have found a sunscreen that has natural protection and makes my complexion look better at the same time.

This is a great little car charger that does the job. My new smartphone is a major battery drainer, so I'd often be without a phone without this charger. It's affordable, works well, is small and portable. It has a red light so you know when it's still charging. It doesn't charge my phone quite as quickly as my phone's a/c charger and a standard outlet, but for a car charger, it's not bad at all. Very happy with this purchase!

This cartridge has a rich black ink that produces professional quality printing that I've been very happy with so far, but I'm disappointed in how fast the cartridge seemed to go this time. The cartridge that came with my printer seemed to last a reasonable amount of time, but I just bought this replacement cartridge a few weeks ago, and I'm already getting low ink warnings for black ink on my printer and computer. I did print some graphics, but still, I was expecting it to last a long time like the other one. I love my Epson printer, so I'll have to deal with it, but I took a star off because it seems like either there should be more ink in a cartridge or the price should be lower.

I love the solid construction and user-friendly design of this entire car seat. It's heavy, stable and stays where you put it in your car without shifting around. The base is smooth, so it doesn't damage your car's seats. The interior fabric is soft and padded on every side. It has various shades of gray that's nice looking with my car's interior.There's an infant insert that can be taken out once the baby's over 11 pounds. The car seat has a comfortable, reclining position and good head support for the baby. Also, there's a canopy shade that can be adjusted up or down, which is good for keeping sun off the baby/child during the day.The numerous safety features and product testing makes me feel comfortable about using this for my baby. The user manual is helpful to make sure the car seat is properly installed and used. There's also a toll-free customer service hotline if you have any questions about using it.My car's fairly small, but I'm still able to fit this car seat without having to move the front seats forward.Overall, I've found this car seat to be easy to use, everything buckles in securely and the high-quality materials make me feel safer putting my baby in it. In my opinion, this car seat's worth the price for the safety features and all-around ease of use.---------------Baby/child height and weight limit: 4 to 35 pounds, 32" tall.

I ordered this assuming it was basic white sunscreen and received a tube labeled 'Natural Skin Tone' which I found out has a tint to it. It says it blends to a translucent shade, but my skin is light-to-medium ivory color and this is just a shade too dark for my skin color. Maybe in the summer when I get some tan it might be okay, but it just makes my face look more tan than my neck. I found out the Cotz Face sunscreen comes in white which is labeled as 'Cotz Face Lighter Skin Tone'. I'm not sure why I received the one with tint because it doesn't mention that in this product listing, but I returned it and ordered the white version. Customer service for Cotz says some people mix the tint and the white version together for a better match, but since I want something I can use on my neck too without worrying about getting tan stuff on my white clothing, the white one is better for me. It's a good product though which is why I gave it 4 stars. Very mattifying, doesn't leave the skin greasy like many sunscreens do. It blends well. Makes the skin look nice and smooth like a primer. Most people can probably get away with wearing less or maybe even no foundation when wearing this tinted sunscreen. The protection comes from Zinc Oxide and Titanium Dioxide instead of chemical sunscreens, so it's healthier and more natural. It's water-resistant too, which is nice. The tinted version is fine if that's what you want, but if you have a light/ivory shade of skin, you might want to consider the white version for lighter skin or possibly getting both versions and mixing them together.

I purchased these to wear in my new shearling boots which are so comfortable, but don't have much arch support. They fit into the boot perfectly and feel like they're part of them. They add some cushioning and some arch support. I'd like if they had a little more arch support than they have, but it's hard to find wool insoles which is what I prefer in the style of boots I have. So they're good for now, but if there was more arch support I'd give them 5 stars.

I never wore this brand or style of boot before, so I ordered it in my normal shoe size of 9, which ended up being a little too small. I returned them and got a 10 which is much better. Quality and style-wise, I like them better than Uggs. I tried on some various Uggs and liked the way the Bearpaws look and feel much better. I tried on a $200 pair of Uggs and still like these more. They're super warm and cozy to wear, almost like slippers. Today it's 10 degrees out, but my feet were nice and warm. This style of boots doesn't have that much arch support and feels kind of flat to walk on despite the fleece lining, so I purchased Superfeet Merino White Insoles and they fit so well into the boot that it's like they're part of them. The insoles add a little more cushioning and support so if you walk alot, they're more comfortable. It's still not lots of arch support, but it's definitely better than without them. It also a good idea to spray these boots with a water repellent spray for suede products prior to wearing them so they're easier to clean and repel dirt. I want to keep my boots clean so I try to avoid wearing them on extremely wet or slushy wet-snow days. Once I got the correct size, I'm extremely happy with these boots and am so glad I got Bearpaw instead of another brand. They're a good value for comfortable, high-quality boots. 4.5 stars.

This book will definitely make you stop and contemplate how you live your life, how you spend your time, your money and your energy. It's a subtle wake-up call and reminder about what changes anyone can easily make every day to improve themselves, which will in turn improve the quality and experience of their life. There's such a broad range of topics covered in this book, that I think just about everyone will find relevant lessons and learn ways to cut out anything that's weighing them down in one way or another. It's a fairly quick read, yet so valuable for anyone who wants to get more out of their life, their work, their relationships and most importantly, free up the time and energy to focus on what matters most to them.

I found this book to be a very enjoyable and inspiring read. It's somewhat of an autobiography of author Christina Stevens rather than just a book about meeting Mother Theresa. Stevens takes us along on a journey that began with a vision about meeting Mother Theresa. The quest isn't easy and the route is filled with setbacks and obstacles, but Stevens doesn't give up hope. The chapters are filled with interesting stories and unique and colorful people that the author knows, works with or encounters during this time. It's a book about following the dream in your heart despite naysayers and the powerful transformation that can come from that. Very worthwhile read.
